Walkthrough:
The quest automatically initiates as you approach the Desert Film Set, located at Jeff's Dirt Track to the east-northeast of Rocky Ridge town in the region of the same name in the Badlands. Upon arrival, an Trauma Team Atlus can be seen flying away, leaving behind a scene of carnage: Multiple dead bodies, some wearing the uniforms of the Wraiths, and others, oddly enough, sporting very out-of-place high end clothing, something more likely to be seen on a Media; also present is an admittedly nice-looking Thorton Colby CX410 "Gran Butte".
After a little searching, V finds a shard on one of the apparent victims which tells the story: Evidently, the executive of some high-end clothing business got it in his head to do a photoshoot out here, as a way of demonstrating the versatility and comfort of their clothing line and appealing to a more "rustic" sense of fashion, with the Butte being the centerpiece as a stand-in for an executive limo or sports car. Such activity attracted the Wraiths, who decided that they'd rather shoot bullets than pictures at the unfortunate models. Said models, however, were savvy enough to bring their own iron for just such an occasion, and a firefight ensued between the two sides. What was left of the photoshoot team fled in the AV, leaving their set, and their prized Thorton Colby, behind for the taking-and better for it to be in V's capable hands than the Raffen Shiv.
Objectives:
Search the area.
Get in the car.

Walkthrough:
When you go to Brendan's usual location outside Megabuilding H8, you will find an upset Theo Price is standing where his unit used to be. She'll explain that Brendan's owners had him taken away to "re-evaluate" his code, dismissing her pleas that he was a true friend and more than a simple S.C.S.M. unit.
At the SoftSys shop in Heywood, you can either bribe or convince (requires Technical Ability) the clerk to receive access to the room where Brendan is receiving a firmware update. Once in the room, Brendan notes he's being updated because he mentioned someone's marital troubles and the person didn't like that very much (you can also see this message on the computer next to him confirming it). With sufficient Technical Ability, you can deduce that Brendan is not a true AI, but instead possessed an exceptional convo-emulating algorithm to facilitate his interactions with visitors. He'll then ask you to tell Theo a message from him and give you one last joke if you wish.
Return to Theo to pass along Brendan's message to conclude the job.
Objectives:
Go to the service point.
Talk to the clerk. [Optional]
Find Brendan.
Talk to Brendan.
Talk to Theo.

Walkthrough:
The gig can be unlocked by finishing The Beast In Me and waiting several days. V receives a message text from Jim Jarry, the organizer of the street races. After agreeing to his offer, there will be four new gigs on the map, marked with crossed flags. Going to one of the flags, V needs to sit on the marked bench and pay ‚Ç¨$ 2,000 as entry fee to join the race.
Locations[]
There are 4 different races and tracks which represent the tracks from the Side Jobs:
The Beast in Me: City Center
The Beast in Me: Badlands
The Beast in Me: Santo Domingo
The Beast in Me: The Big Race

Upon returning to Jinguji some time after a previous visit, Zane welcomes V and asks what he can do for you today. After browsing the shop's selection, suddenly a cyberpsycho enters and kills the store's guards. Zane activates the alarm, and V must defeat the cyberpsycho. Once this is done, talk to the MaxTac officer, Melissa Rory, and then sit on the couch. On the way out, there is an option to talk to the MaxTac lieutenant and discuss her mantis blades and the cyberpsycho attack.
Objectives:
Defeat cyberpsycho.
Talk to the MaxTac officer.
Sit next to Zane.

Walkthrough:
This quest starts after purchasing the Porsche 911 Turbo Cabriolet (930) from the Autofixer website for ‚Ç¨$74,000.
Santo Domingo Fixer Muamar Reyes will send V a message that his Autofixer service normally delivers the cars, but that somehow the seller vanished into thin air.
After replying to the text, Muamar sends V the coordinates of the vehicle last known location, the abandoned parking lot on the outskirts of Arroyo, Santo Domingo.
Once arrived at the scene, there is no sign of the car. Only the body of a man can be found. As you approach the body, Johnny Silverhand will appear and comment on the appearance of the man, as it appears to be an impersonator by the name of Johnny Silverman.
Inspecting the body for clues, you find a pair of shards on the man, a conversation between him and Muamar Reyes and a set of GPS coordinates, which will be uploaded to your navigation system.
Following the coordinates not far from the body, near a makeshift garage south of the EBM Petrochem Stadium, you find encounter several Wraiths surrounding the car. After neutralizing the Wraiths, you can find the Car Keys on one of them and unlock the vehicle by entering it.
After entering the vehicle, a message can be sent to Muamar Reyes about recovering the vehicle. After sending the message Muamar will deposit half of the original purchase price back to your balance.
Objectives:
Read and reply to the message from Muamar.
Go to the car's last known location.
Inspect the body for clues.
Find the car.
Defeat the Wraiths and recover the key.
Get in the car.
Text Muamar about recovering the car.

Walkthrough:
After a set amount of time (can be approximately eight in-game days) after Skippy has changed firing modes, he will reveal that he has found data on its previous owner, Regina Jones. The gun will then ask you to return him to her. The mission will be added to you journal even if you decline to follow Skippy's request.
If you ask Regina about Skippy, she will remark that he was stolen, and asks you to set him down so she can run a diagnostics test. After she runs the test, Regina says that either a deeper test is required (if Skippy is set to Stone Cold Killer mode) or she will reset Skippy to his default factory settings and rename him "Daisy" (if Skippy is set to Puppy-Loving Pacifist mode).
You can then ask her where she got Skippy (won in a poker game), or whether V is going to be compensated for their trouble. If Skippy was reset, there is also the option to accuse Regina of killing Skippy. She will dismiss the accusation because the gun has no consciousness. After receiving the reward, the quest ends.
Objectives:
Take Skippy to Regina Jones.
Set Skippy down.
Talk to Regina.

Go to the fight in Kabuki.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite from V's perspective, use of conditions]
Head to the Afterlife where you'll find a man, Dennis, looking for a solo to take on a job, but rather than use a fixer, he wants to cut out the middleman and have you work directly for him.
If you agree, he'll ask you to go find a marked fridge in Kabuki and once you gather the contents inside, contact him for further steps.
Head out there and it should be the fridge in the last shack out on the pier. As you might have guessed though, something is off about this: as soon as you open the fridge a rather fatigued man falls out. Call Dennis but he won't tell you the specifics about the guy, only that you need to get him to a nearby car to take him to Northside, and that Tyger Claws will try to kill him and therefore, you.
Tyger members are going to be patrolling the area and standing at the stairs, so you'll have to take them out carefully as, if your companion is killed, the job will fail. You cannot draw a weapon while carrying the man, but you are safely able to put him down on the ground and then move a certain distance to fight.
Once you get to the car, put him in the trunk, then drive to the location in Northside and talk to Dennis. Shortly after he reveals the man's name, Haruyoshi Nishikata, who you can then talk to and who'll then tell you his story: he's the world's best surgeon but the Tyger Claws' boss died on his operating table and the gang became angry at this, so Dennis helped him flee from Japan to Night City. That said, the gang doesn't know that Haruyoshi actually killed the boss on purpose.
For payment, while you'll get some eddies, make sure to also pick up the Scalpel katana that Dennis notes is your reward and is leaning against the barrels.
Objectives:
Go to the slum on the outskirts of Kabuki.
Find and open the container with "No Future" graffiti'd on it.
Talk to Dennis.
Pick up the body.
Carry the body to the car.
Get in Dennis' car.
Deliver the body to the specified coordinates.
Leave the car.
Talk to Dennis.

Walkthrough: V talks with a strange monk, goes through the meditative braindance and leaves.
Objectives:
Approach the stranger.
Talk to the stranger.

Walkthrough: In a Northside warehouse in the northeastern part of Watson, Johnny Silverhand will appear near a Quadra Type-66 "Hoon", a weaponized vehicle. Behind this car is a metal shelf that has collapsed, covering a small container. The key to the Quadra is inside this container.
Objectives:
Search the warehouse.
Get in the car.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Wrong format]
When V arrives in the area, they will hear the sounds of partying nearby. As they approach the nearby rooftops, they encounter multiple 6th Street gang members and their leader, Captain Sherman, sitting on a couch with Walker standing next to him.
If V draws their weapon, the job will end and all of the surrounding 6th Street gangers will turn hostile. As long as one remains polite, the captain will speak up and suppress any hostilities, allowing V to stay and participate.
One can then ask if they're doing a "lead-spitting" competition and he'll confirm they are and will allow V to enter if they wish, just a few rules:
You have to take a shot of alcohol before each round
You have to use the revolver on the table near the captain for the shots to count
Do not cross the yellow marquee line at each station, otherwise you will be disqualified
Take the revolver from the table, then head to the first station to begin. Note the player won't be able to save manually during these 4 stations, but can load auto saves if needed. The revolver holds 6 shots and the stations are timed. One can also allow the effects of alcohol to wear off between each station to avoid stacking penalties.
To win the prize, V needs to earn at least 44 points (of a maximum 46 possible) to beat Walker.
If V beats Walker, the captain will be impressed and offer membership into 6th Street, which will be rejected. He will warn V that any encounter in the future will likely be hostile. V can then collect their reward, Divided We Stand. V also has the option to insult Sherman, which results in the gang attacking V.
If Gig: Life's Work was completed prior to this job:
A gang member at the first station will make a remark about knowing V from somewhere. After finishing all stations, he will recognize you, causing the others to become hostile, in which case there's no way to end this quest without a fight breaking out. You can collect Divided We Stand after the fight.
Objectives:
See what's going on.
Talk to the 6th Street leader.
Take the gun.
Get as many points as possible. [46]
Go to the first station.
Drink the shot.
Hit as many targets as you can in 12 seconds. [12]
Go to the second station.
Drink the shot.
Hit as many targets as you can in 12 seconds. [12]
Go to the third station.
Drink the shot.
Hit as many targets as you can in 12 seconds. [11]
Go to the final station.
Drink the shot.
Hit as many targets as you can in 12 seconds. [11]
Return to the 6th Street leader.
Ask about your results.
Collect your reward.

Walkthrough:
V meets Garry the Prophet right outside Misty's Esoterica in Urmland Street. He has have five separate ramblings that V listens to and engages in a conversation with him on.[N 1]
During the last rambling where Garry is talking about nomads, two Aldecaldos approach and take issue with Garry calling them werewolves.
If V is a Nomad or completed Queen of the Highway prior to the final rambling, and chooses to acknowledge the Aldecados as allies:
V gets them to walk away without any fighting.
If V is not a Nomad or has not completed Queen of the Highway prior to the final rambling, or chooses not to acknowledge them as allies:
V helps Garry fight the Aldecados off.
Once done, Garry tells V about having heard that a mysterious meeting would take place somewhere in Kabuki.
Once at the marked location, Johnny talks with V, then both head over to the hiding spot marked by the quest and wait.[T 2] After some time passes, a group of Maelstrom gang members show up and talk to two corpos named Jane and John Doe before handing over a mysterious chip.[N 2][N 3]
If V prevents the corpos from leaving:
V obtains the Mysterious Chip off of Jane Doe's corpse, and returns to Garry the Prophet.[N 4] However, once V gets to his usual spot, Garry is nowhere to be found, replaced by his disciple who informs V he was taken away.[N 5]
If V donated enough to Garry earlier:
V can ask them about the chip and they will tell you what they know.
If V didn't donate enough earlier:
V can donate to them now to get them to talk.
If V lets the corpos escape:
The side job fails.
Objectives:
Go to the old factory.
Talk to Johnny.
Find somewhere to hide.
Keep a lookout.
Seize the conspirators' chip.
Search the corpse.
Show the mystery chip to the prophet.
Talk to the prophet's disciple.
Ask the prophet's disciple about the chip.
Talk to Johnny.

Walkthrough:
To begin this side job, first, head over to Woodhaven Street in Rancho Coronado East and travel up the street to the Gun-O-Rama gun shop. Around the back you'll find an accessible garage with a decal of a ghost horse to the left of it.
Alternatively, the quest can be started by finding Josie's body and reading the shard, "Bad news". In this case, the first objective will be to find the garage.
Once inside, V and Johnny will comment on the scrapped Brennan found inside. To officially start the side job, access the terminal on the opposite side of the garage. After reading the data stored, exit the terminal and V will pick up the photo of James Ito and Josie Alcazar resting next to it. This prompts V and Johnny to look for James to find out more about their situation.
To find James, travel to Japantown West and head south along the waterfront four lane road. There will be a plaza on the east side of the road after Holly Street with a 24/7 stand. James is sitting on the same bench in the photo, in front of the 24/7 stand. Talking to him will begin your investigation into what happened to Josie.
James and Josie's bench in front of the 24/7 stand
To find out what happened to Josie, head to Metro: Ebunike on the map. From the metro, with your scanner active, you will pick up a dried blood splatter on the ground. Following the blood splatters, past the Drop Point, on your right is an alleyway; and behind a dumpster, Josie's body.
There will be a shard labelled "Bad news" which details Josie's cause of death as well as information on the location of the bike she stole from a Tyger Claw boss. After having an exchange with Johnny, it's time to return to James in Japantown and confront him about what you've discovered. What happens to James after confronting him is up to you. After the confrontation, you will need to find the Tyger Claw boss's bike in order to complete the job.
The shard found on Josie's body mentions it being stowed on Maelstrom turf by All Foods. This will send you to the All Foods Factory in the Northside of Watson. Across street from the travel point, you'll see the "ghost horse" that Josie also mentioned in the shard. The bike is in the nearby garage. Punch in the date that James and Josie met (0214) into the keypad next to the garage and it will open.
James' location.Josie's location.Location of the Tyger Claw bike.
Objectives:
Find the garage Josie mentioned.
Pick up the still.
Find James.
Find out what happened to Josie.
Find James and confront him.
Find the stolen Tyger Claw bike.

Walkthrough:
A partially hidden S.C.S.M. was being installed and configured at Megabuilding H8.[1] Something seems off about the machine, as it appears to be calling V over. The machine turns out to be an AI by the name of Brendan, and would like you to move over the dumpster that is blocking his view. Moving the dumpster can be completed by passing a Body check (it scales depending on the player level).
After moving the dumpster, Brendan will thank you by dispensing a NiCola and consider V a friend.
Objectives:
Move the dumpster.
Talk to Brendan.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
At The Manufactory on Brandon street in Arroyo, Santo Domingo, V approaches one of the drink stands and sits down to talk with Darrell Zhou, the vendor.
To Darrell's annoyance, two kids from the block are messing with his bike, and asks V for their help in solving the matter.
If V agrees to help Darrell:
Darrel and V approach the two kids, and they exchange words. V soon learns that Darrell's sister, Shenna, used to run with them but that he convinced her work for Zetatech to earn more money. Brad and Vance viewed this as a betrayal and want to steal Darrell's bike as revenge.
If V interferes:
V attempts to intimidate Brad and Vance.
If V has completed several gigs for Muamar Reyes:
Vance recognizes V, and the two of them run off.
If V has not yet completed several gigs for Muamar Reyes:
Brad and Vance attack V.
If V doesn't interfere:[N 1]
Brad and Vance attack Darrell and kill him.
If V refuses to help Darrell:[N 1]
Darrell approached the two kids on his own, who proceeded to kill him.
Objectives:
Talk to the thugs.
Defeat the thugs.
Talk to the vendor.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite confirm wiki guidelines]
After helping the Aldecaldos seize the Militech Basilisk, look around the camp to find Bob checking in on an injured Nomad's condition to learn it's not looking good: Jake Scooter needs a special kidney implant for sickle cell anemia. He'll eventually point V to a pickup location Dakota Smith fixed up to get it, a hospital in Little China.[N 1]
Once near the hospital, head to the back cargo area. There an employee will be waiting with the implant. As soon as you pick it up, he runs off as police suddenly charge in and attack you. You have to defeat them all rather than run away to continue the quest. Once they're all dead, confront the employee who'll reveal the police learned of the deal and stepped in to eliminate you, as they believed Dakota was helping out Raffen Shiv and couldn't tell the difference between them and nomads.
After passing an Intelligence attribute check, V asks if anyone else touched the implant and he'll reveal the police put a virus on the firmware as he hands you the original, and that you'll need to swap the unaffected one to remove the virus. You can then decide to let him go or kill him. If V doesn't qualify for the Intelligence attribute check and lets the contact go, then the contact will call out to V as they're leaving. The contact explains that the NCPD put malware on the kidney, and offers V a shard to remove the malware.
Once done, head back to the camp to give Bob the implant.[N 2]
If V gave Bob the kidney while knowing about the malware:[N 3]
V receives a text message from Bob, asking them to return to the camp. It is revealed that Jake's body accepted the organ, and is recovering steadily from the transplant. Bob will thank V for a job well done and for helping Jake.[N 4]
If V gave Bob the kidney without knowing about the malware:
V receives a text message from Bob, asking them to return to the camp. It is revealed that Jake's body rejected the organ, and has passed away. Bob is sympathetic and does not blame V.
Objectives:
Go to the meeting with the hospital employee.
Meet with the hospital employee.
Take the briefcase with the implant.
Meet with the hospital employee.
Defeat the police.
Confront the hospital employee.
Return to the Aldecaldos camp.
Talk to Bob.
Wait eight hours for the results.
Read Bob's message.
Talk to Bob.

Objectives: Pay off your debt to Viktor ‚Äì 21000 ‚Ç¨$

Walkthrough:
V gets invited for an exclusive event organized by Yaiba on Kiroshi Campus, where their new motorcycle, ASM-R250 Muramasa, can be bought.
It is possible to connect to the showroom via Yaiba's netpage or by going to the Kiroshi Campus directly. At the event V can customize and order their own Muramasa for ‚Ç¨$95,000.[N 2]
Next day, the bike is ready for pickup at the Corpo Plaza Docks.
Objectives:
Go to the Yaiba showroom at Kiroshi.
Wait until evening for the Yaiba showroom event to start.
Connect to the Kiroshi bot at the Yaiba showroom event.
Leave the showroom area.
Place a custom order for a Yaiba Muramasa.
Return the bot to its charging station and disconnect.
Read the message from Yaiba Customer Service.
Wait for the custom Yaiba Muramasa to be delivered.
Read the message from Yaiba Customer Service.

Walkthrough:
After visiting Rogue Amendiares at the Afterlife during Ghost Town, V will get a message from their old car Thorton Galena 80845, revealing its geolocation in the Badlands, due south of the Medeski Fuel Station, within the landfill.
V heads out there and checks under the hood to see if someone has been tinkering with it, and they realize the engine is still warm - someone clearly drove the vehicle recently. As they finish checking it over though they'll be approached by a woman, Lana Prince, who's both surprised and annoyed V's messing with "her" car.
Upon asking, Lana reveals that she is desperate to leave the city and has had enough of the wastelands and sees the car as her only hope to start a new life.
V tells Lana they can keep the car:
V told Lana that she can keep the car and gives Lana some suggestions of what she should be doing in order to repair the car before leaving Night City.
V buys the car from Lana:
V offered Lana a large sum of eurodollars in order to buy the car out of sentimental value, so that she can buy something different instead and leave NC. This decision allowed V to reclaim the vehicle as their own.
V threatens Lana to leave:
V threatened Lana to leave, even willing to put her under gunpoint. This decision allowed V to reclaim the vehicle as their own.
Objectives:
Go to the indicated location.
Scan your old car. [Optional]
Look under the hood.
Check the engine.
Talk to the stranger.
Get in your old car.
Talk to Johnny.

Walkthrough:
V must scan or interact with the 20 tarot cards in Night City. (Two of the Major Arcana, The Devil and Judgement, are only found in certain endings and are not required for this job. The four King cards of Phantom Liberty are also not required for this job.)
Misty mentions these missing cards and discusses The Fool's Journey in reaching The World. To reach it, there are four paths V can take to obtain them, foreshadowing the various endings, being The Sun, The Star, Temperance, and The Devil. V becomes bitter, saying they could die instead, also foreshadowing the suicide ending. After talking with her, Misty gifts V her dreamcatcher, which will appear in V's apartment above the bed.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Remove bullet points]
A short time after completing Search and Destroy, V receives a text message from an unknown caller seeking their help. They are told to meet at the No-Tell Motel.
Inside the motel room, V finds a woman in shining chrome with her back to them. Once she starts talking, V learns that she is Lizzy Wizzy, the renowned celebrity musician. She'll eventually reveal that she suspects that her manager and new boyfriend, Liam Northom, is cheating on her. Given her privacy concerns and highly public profile, she wants V to discreetly investigate the matter at the Riot nightclub, which Liam frequents.
V can only enter the club after 8pm. There are several different ways to enter:
The front door, guarded by a bouncer (requires Body to intimidate the bouncer or sufficient Street Cred).
The fire escape in the alley to the left of the building. Ladder can be lowered by hitting or shooting it.
The door to the security room just inside the garage on the right side of the building (requires Intelligence to hack the keypad). An employee badge can also be found on the desk with the computer.
The garage door, to the right of the security room door inside the garage (requires Body to lift the metal shutters).
V does not need to find Liam, but instead find a computer with surveillance feed. To do so, if V acquires the employee badge, go to the door opposite the male bartender and follow the marker to the elevator and head down to street level. The computer can also be reached directly by hacking the door to the security room from the exterior garage (see above). Use the computer and access the surveillance cameras to find Liam talking with a woman in the VIP lounge. V quickly learns it is actually not a romantic affair: Liam is with an Arasaka employee, discussing about making a backup of Lizzy. After listening to the full conversation, Johnny Silverhand appears briefly, where he suggests acquiring the video footage as proof. Interact with the computer again to obtain the video footage. After this, V can call Lizzy to complete the mission, or optionally confront Liam. Note that V cannot confront Liam after calling Lizzy.
Liam can be found in the VIP lounge on the third floor. The male bartender on the second floor can be convinced to reveal his location with either a bribe or a threat (requires Body). V can access the VIP lounge from a second elevator in the security room aforementioned.
If V decides to confront Liam, he will demand to know why they are there:
V claims they went to the wrong room:
Liam demands that V leaves. If V takes too long, the security guards will become hostile, and V will not be able to interact with Liam again.
V threatens to expose Liam's misdeeds:
V can extort Liam for a very substantial payout (30,000 ‚Ç¨$) in exchange for the promise of not telling anyone what he is up to. Even if V promised Liam that they wouldn't tell their employer what happened, V can still tell Lizzy the truth.
Upon calling Lizzy, V can lie or tell the truth.
Tell Lizzy it was just an affair:
This ends the job. Lizzy is somewhat satisfied with V's work, even though they don't have proof of the affair. Within an hour or so, Lizzy will send a 1,900 ‚Ç¨$ payment as thanks. Part 2 will not trigger if V tells Lizzy that Liam was having an affair, even if they downloaded the security footage.
Tell Lizzy about the secret plot:
This temporarily ends the job. Lizzy is distraught and abruptly hangs up. Within an hour or two, Lizzy sends a 2,800 ‚Ç¨$ payment as thanks. If V overheard Liam's conversation and captured the security footage, Part 2 of this job will trigger within a few days.
Part 2[]
If V has told Lizzy the truth, she will call them several days later and ask to meet again at the No-Tell Motel. When V returns, they see that Liam is lying dead on the floor, with Lizzy standing over him. She explains that she pushed him and without realizing the strength of her chrome arms. If V scans Liam, they can note to Lizzy that she strangled him. After some dialogue, she will panic briefly about the possibility of the media finding out before considering her audience's titillating reaction. Eventually, she will ask V to dispose of the body.
Refuse to dispose of Liam's body:
V refuses, telling Lizzy that something isn't right. Lizzy says, "On the contrary, everything is falling into place. Go, V. And shut the door."
Agree to dispose of Liam's body:
V says they'll take care of the body and tell Lizzy to sleep soundly. Lizzy responds that she doesn't need to sleep, then thanks Liam's body for a beautiful gift. V asks what she's talking about, but Lizzy dismisses V, telling them to go and take the body and dispose of it.
Afterwards, Lizzy will send eddies and a messaging of thanks. A few days later, Lizzy will send another message saying that their "adventure" was very inspirational and she put out her new BD thanks to V.
Objectives:
Meet with the mysterious client at No-Tell Motel.
Talk to the client.
Sit down.
Talk to the client.
Go to Riot in the evening and ask for Liam.
Find proof of Liam's betrayal.
Ask about Liam. [Optional]
Go to the VIP area.
Confront Liam. [Optional]
Leave the VIP area.
If you fail to confront Liam and do not leave the area.
Escape the VIP area.
If you choose to use the cameras:
Check the security computer.
Check the cameras linked to the computer.
Talk to Johnny.
If you listen while standing close:
Break into Riot's security room.
Steal the club's surveillance data.
Call Lizzy.
If told the truth:
Answer Lizzy.
Go to the motel room.

Walkthrough:
Some time after after dealing with the Voodoo Boys, V will be sent a message to check their personal computer in their apartment regarding the Bartmoss Collective. After heading up to their apartment and checking out Nancy's post on the Bartmoss website, V give Bess a call.[N 1]
After contacting Nancy on the holo, V is directed towards the source of a signal coming from an apartment building on an unnamed street in Rancho Coronado, Santo Domingo.[N 2] After hacking the device, V receives a message from an unknown sender, directing V to another location in the Badlands.
V navigates to the second location in the Jackson Plains. They find another router can be found atop a trailer, which is guarded by Wraiths. After hacking this router, they will receive another message directing them to a third location.
They navigate to the third location in the Biotechnica Flats. They find another router at the top of one of the large Biotechnica installations. Once again, after hacking the router, they are sent a text message directing them to a fourth location.
V navigates to the fourth location at the West Wind Estates in Pacifica. They find a router next to a hacked Fortune Teller Machine, which appears to be the original source of the signal.[N 3]
If V decides to keep the Fortune Teller:
The fortune teller will remain active, and will keep misleading people on the net by spreading rumors and citations, satisfying Johnny in the process.
If V decides to hack the Fortune Teller:
V is able to choose to either disable the fortune teller machine or to hack the machine.
If V decides to disable the Fortune Teller:
V disabled the machine and with it also the website, to the dismay of Johnny. A niche commemorating Swedenborg is placed at the Columbarium in North Oak.
IF V decides to make the Fortune Teller produce more nonsense:
V hacked the Fortune Teller machine using their Intelligence, to make it produce even more nonsense, satisfying Johnny in the process.
Afterwards, V calls Nancy to update them on the current status of the mystery, concluding the gig.
Objectives:
Investigate the site from the Bartmoss Collective message.
Complete other jobs until Bes Isis, aka Nancy, is available to call.
Call Bes Isis and ask about Swedenborg.
Go to Nancy's coordinates.
Scan the area for clues.
Hack the router.
Read the message you received.
Talk to Johnny.
Go to the signal's source.
Scan the area for clues.
Hack the router.
Read the message you received.
Talk to Johnny.
Go to the signal's source.
Scan the area for clues.
Hack the router.
Read the message you received.
Talk to Johnny.
Search the area.
Approach the fortuneteller bot.
Listen to the fortuneteller bot.
Pay to hear your fortune. [Optional]
Talk to Johnny.
Scan the fortuneteller bot to see if it's been manipulated.
Hack the router.
Read the message you received.
Tell Johnny you'll leave the fortuneteller bot alone.
Connect to the fortuneteller bot to modify the algorithm. [Optional]
Talk to Johnny.
Call Nancy.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Sometime after Gig: Last Login has become active (whether it has been completed or not), Sandra Dorsett will contact V about obtaining her missing databank, which is located in the same building as the aforementioned gig. if the player has already obtained the databank, Sandra will simply ask that you return it to her. V has the option to decrypt the databank as well, revealing information on Sandra's activities.
Sandra can be found at her apartment in Watson and will nervously open the door to let the player in. Inside Sandra's apartment, V can find Entry 36, Entry 37, and Entry 38, which tell the story of how Sandra uncovered Operation Carpe Noctem, and indicates that she's on the run from Night Corp.
Depending on whether the shard is read, there are different levels of reward or consequence for V.
If V does not decrypt the shard:
Sandra is thankful for the discretion and reliability, and finalizes the transaction with the agreed sum of 830‚Ç¨$.
If V decrypts the shard:
If V denies reading the contents:
Sandra becomes upset and instead pays less than the agreed amount.
If V admits to reading the contents:
If V informs they will do nothing:
Sandra rewards V with the agreed sum as if the shard was not decrypted.
If V congratulates Sandra:
V acknowledges that anyone who can hack Night Corp deserves respect. Sandra says that she'll use the databank to fight against Night Corp, and she rewards V's honesty with additional eurodollars.
If V additionally passes an Intelligence Check:
Sandra reveals the nature of her pursuit as well as the root of her fears, and expresses her gratitude to have a fellow runner to talk with. Relieved, she rewards V with an even larger sum of 3800‚Ç¨$.
If V blackmails Sandra:
Sandra becomes hostile and will need to be neutralised, along with her security turret.
Objectives:
Find Sandra's databank.
Call Sandra Dorsett.
Meet with Sandra.

Walkthrough: The Zen Master can be found underneath the statue resembling a phoenix in the middle of the traffic roundabout below the North Oak sign, same location one of Delamain's cabs loiters around. After V briefly converses with the Zen Master expressing interest in continuing meditations, they are again offered the choice to pay what they feel is fair, this time being either nothing or 377 eddies. The BD meditation is themed after the element of fire this time. After it ends, the Zen Master is nowhere to be found, just as before.
Objectives: Talk to the Zen master.

Walkthrough:
Shortly after completing Transmission, you will receive a text message from Ozob Bozo saying that he got your number from a friend and that they have a gig for you and that he will await your call.
After calling Ozob, he requests of you that you pick him up at the Cherry Blossom Market in Japantown, Westbrook. After picking up Ozob, he will instruct you to drive towards Urmland Street in Little China, Watson.
On arrival, Ozob will step out of the car to pick up "takeout" at a Chinese restaurant next to Misty's Esoterica. However, you will hear an explosion going off in the restaurant and Ozob stepping outside with several Tyger Claws on his tail. Help him neutralize the Tygers and speak to him for a reward and conclusions of the job.
Objectives:
Read the text from Ozob Bozo.
Call Ozob Bozo.
Park your car at the indicated location.
Honk.
Wait for Ozob.
Talk to Ozob.
Drive Ozob to Little China.
Wait for Ozob.
Defeat all enemies.
Talk to Ozob.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite from V's perspective]
Just outside Cherry Blossom Market, you will find a man named Stefan proclaiming he has one insane braindance for sale. You can pay him to receive the Unlabeled Braindance; however, you will have to make an additional payment to use a compatible wreath that Stefan has in the building behind him. If you insist on using your own wreath, they can try to run the BD from their inventory but, as Stefan mentioned, the data will be in a older format unreadable the BD set.
Talk to Stefan again where you can either ask for a refund or pay him the additional eddies to use his wreath. If you pay to use his, follow him into the building nearby and activate his rig. Once the braindance starts, you will rapidly lose consciousness. Upon awakening, you will find yourself in a rather familiar location: the bathroom where you found Sandra Dorsett, though this time you're the intended victim. Johnny will waste no time in mocking you for falling for such an obvious trick. You will have no clothes or weapons, although you still have access to your quickhacks and cyberware.
There are about 15 Scavengers scattered throughout the area. Once you've dealt with them as you see fit and retrieved your equipment, which can be found in a locker in the main room, it's time to pay Stefan a visit again. Head back to the market to confront him, and Stefan will try to give a fake excuse while returning the money you paid him. Both dialogue options result in you sparing his life. However, drawing and aiming your weapon at Stefan will trigger another dialogue between V and Stefan, with Stefan begging for his life.
Objectives:
Talk to Stefan.
Play Stefan's BD.
If you try to use your own wreath first:
Ask Stefan about the corrupted BD.
Follow Stefan.
Use Stefan's BD player.
Escape the scav hideout.
Find and retrieve the equipment. [Optional]
Retrieve the equipment.
Confront Stefan.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìùReason: Needs more information on what happens if specific dialog was chosen during The Corpo-Rat
Some time after meeting with Alt Cunningham and dealing with the Voodoo Boys, V is contacted by Frank Nostra, a former colleague of them who also worked at the Arasaka Corporation's Counter Intelligence Division, who has recorded a message for them.
In the recorded message, Nostra tells V that Susan Abernathy, the director of Arasaka's North American Special Operations division, is purging the department of anybody who is not one-hundred percent on her side, and that he himself is one of the people that appeared on her radar. Not intending to wait around until the proverbial executioner would come around, he informs V that he started to put together a file on Abernathy, and that he has hidden the documents in question in a safe location. The message ends with Nostra informing V that the reason they are receiving the message is because Nostra himself was unable to make use of the documents, and expects that V will know how to handle the situation, and that they can find the documents at the attached coordinates.[N 1]
The attached coordinates lead V to a dumpster in an alley on Allen street in the Kabuki sub-district of Watson. When V approaches the dumpster, Johnny Silverhand projects himself in front of them and starts mocking V about their continued interest in the Corporate lifestyle.
If V decides to interact with Johnny:
V tells Johnny that they've still got a few scores to settle, to which Johnny will respond that he knew all along they were still into the Corporate "rat race," after which V mocks Johnny for not having something more important to do.
After V moves the dumpster, they find the mentioned briefcase, which upon opening appears to be empty. V is then confronted by a disheveled and bitter, but still very much alive Frank Nostra, who currently finds himself in a similar situation that V found themselves not too long ago. In his desperation to prove Abernathy wrong, Nostra is convinced that turning over V to her will get him back into her good graces and employed at Arasaka again.
If V tells Frank that they're a nobody to Abernathy [Combat]:
V tells Nostra that Abernathy probably doesn't even know that they exist or that she even ever knew of their existence, and explains to Nostra that they were just a tool used by Arthur Jenkins in an attempt to get rid of Abernathy. V also tells Nostra that if they were both to return to the Arasaka headquarters, they would probably both be shot at on sight. Nostra replies with that he has nothing to lose, and engages combat with V.
If V tells Frank that they're pathetic:
V tells Nostra the story about another former colleague of theirs, Joey Livani, who pissed himself the day he got fired, and that they saw him as the most pathetic guy to have ever worked at Arasaka. However, V informs Nostra that they have now taken over the title of most pathetic Arasaka employee.
If V tells Frank to open his eyes [Non-Combat]:
V mocks Nostra for being a fool and trying to get back into Arasaka after they fired him without any mercy. They tell him that his time at Arasaka should be considered complete and that they should try and refigure out their life, and that Nostra has the means start a new career path in Night City if he properly uses the tools‚Äîa gun, ammunition and a little initiative‚Äîat his disposal.[N 2]
If V defeats Nostra [Combat]:
Not intending on being taken in by Nostra, V puts up a fight, resulting in Nostra's neutralization. Upon inspecting his body, V is able to snag his Iconic JKE-X2 Kenshin, the Apparition.
After dealing with Frank, Johnny appears once more to passive aggressively crack wise about meeting old friends.
Objectives:
Go to the indicated location.
Talk to Johnny. [Optional]
Move the dumpster.
Open the briefcase.
Talk to the stranger.
Confront Frank.
Talk to Johnny.

Walkthrough:
Some time after a romantic relationship has been established, V is contacted by their partner expressing an interest in meeting up. V and their date agree to meet up at one of V's apartments except Kress Street Hideout due to safety concerns in Dogtown.
During the date, a number of activities can be engaged in.
Conversation - V will be able to engage in a selection of small talk with their date.
Cuddling - V will be able to cuddle with their date. When cuddling V can kiss their date as well as engage in another selection of dialogue. This can be done on sofas, and in some of V's apartments there will be additional areas (such as by a window) in which an embrace or kiss is possible.
Showering - If V takes a shower while their date is in the apartment, their date will join them.
Mirror - If V uses the bathroom mirror during the date, there's a chance their date will briefly join them at the mirror.
Dancing - Many of V's apartments have an area where V can dance, and their date will join in and dance with them.
Sleeping - If V decides to sleep their date will join them in bed.
The date will end when either V or their partner leaves the apartment.

Walkthrough:
This quest begins when you enter the Coyote Cojo. Two Valentinos, Juan and Pedro, will be harassing a drunk corpo, Joseph Odman, who is passed out at one of the tables. Pepe tells them to stop, and asks you to intervene. The Streetkid background has an additional dialogue option to convince them that Mama Welles wouldn't take kindly to blood in her bar.
After dealing with the gangoons, either by convincing them to back off or engaging in combat with them, the corpo will pay you for defending him before passing out again. Pepe offers you a free drink and a job: to find out with whom his wife is cheating on him. Leave the bar and head right (northeast) down the road; as soon as you leave the bar, Johnny begins his narration.
Identify Cynthia, but do not follow too close, as doing so will alert her and the quest will fail (15m will trigger a warning from Johnny). She will head down the road and enter a building where, upon entering, she can be heard arguing with a man. Confront Cynthia and the occupant, and you will have the option to say "Doesn't matter. I've seen enough", which ends the dialogue and quest.
Alternatively, you have the option to hear Cynthia out. She will reveal that the man is not a lover but her ripperdoc. She elaborates that her entire physical appearance is artificial, being the result of implants.
At this point, you must leave the building and call Pepe. There are two options: tell him the truth or that he must talk to Cynthia himself. If you tell the truth, Pepe will be shocked and upset over his wife lying to him for so long. You can either tell him that he has a right to feel cheated, or that Cynthia loves him and that he shouldn't give up on their marriage. Either way, Pepe will pay you and the quest will end.
If the player told Pepe to save their marriage, Cynthia will contact you by holo a day or two after the quest, thanking you and sending you another 2210‚Ç¨$ beyond the payment from Pepe. Otherwise, Cynthia will be disappointed in your actions, telling you that Pepe threw her out and she's now living on the streets.
Objectives:
Find out what's going on.
Decide whether to intervene.
If you fight the thugs:
Defeat the gangoons.
Talk to the corpo. (Optional)
Talk to Pepe.
Go to the area where Pepe's wife works during the day.
Scan and identify Pepe's wife.
Follow Pepe's wife from a safe distance.
Follow Pepe's wife into the building.
Find Pepe's wife.
Talk to Cynthia.
Leave the building.
Call Pepe.
Inform Pepe of your findings.

Walkthrough:
As V approaches Megabuilding H4‚Äîin the south of Arroyo, Santo Domingo‚Äîthey find a green tag next to the entrance and a braindance recording in a nearby trash can. As V puts on the Braindance Wreath and slots in the braindance, they experience the death of cyberpsycho Lt. Col. James Norris and receive a warning about the fate of David Martinez.
After the braindance ends, V finds themselves on the ground. They text Muamar Reyes to inquire about David Martinez. Muamar relates some of David's story, and promises to be in touch when he has found out more about the whereabouts of his companions.
After about 24 in-game hours, V receives a text message from Falco. In it, Falco will explain that he used to run with David, although they have fallen out of the spotlight. Mentioning that V and David have much in common, and that while their 15 minutes of fame may be over, it is not yet too late for V. Falco instructs V to visit Muamar, as he has left behind a gift.
When V arrives at Muamar Reyes's location at the Dam Viewpoint, they find a cache on the balustrade. Approaching the cache reveals that the package left for them was David's Jacket. Looting the jacket will conclude the quest.
Objectives:
Play the braindance.
Text Muamar "El Capitan" Reyes and ask about David Martinez.
Wait a day for Muamar "El Capitan" Reyes to respond about David Martinez.
Reply to Falco's message.
Collect the gift from Martinez's crew left with Muamar "El Capitan" Reyes.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite from V's perspective using 3rd person]
From the beginning of Act 2, on the floor below your apartment, you can find two police officers knocking on the door of Barry Lewis's apartment. Barry, an ex-cop who's so distraught over his friend's death that he left the force, has holed up in his apartment due to severe depression. Nadia Petrova and Juan Mendez will eventually see you and ask if you can see what's going on with Barry as he's refusing to answer them. You can try to knock on his door now, but Barry will refuse to answer, so come back in a few hours to try again.
This time Barry will answer and eventually let you in, talking about a really bad case he had to work that got swept under the rug and losing his close friend, Andrew, made it worse for him.
At this point you can either talk to his friends who are nearby, or go visit the columbarium in North Oak to learn more. If you choose to not visit the grave and talk to the cops, Barry will end up losing his life to suicide and you'll later find a distraught Mendez outside his apartment.
If you don't want to fail the quest, head out to the grave to learn Andrew wasn't a person, but actually a pet turtle. You can then confront the police officers with this information, in which case Mendez will open up to Barry about his own tough cases and talk to Barry.
Objectives:
Talk to the cops.
Talk to Barry.
Try talking to Barry in a few hours.
Try talking to Barry.
Find Andrew's niche before talking to the cops. [Optional]
Talk to Johnny. [Optional]
Talk to the cops.
Check on Barry.

Walkthrough: Head behind the Grand Imperial Mall to find a group of locals hanging out at the rollercoaster, which they're trying to get working again. Offer to help, then scan the ride's car to locate the control panel nearby. Go fix it and let Jean know it's done, but the group will have second thoughts about actually riding the old thing. Johnny, on the other hand, is all for it. If you agree to do the first test run, don't worry as it'll go fine, and you can do a few interactions during the ride.
Objectives:
Scan to find the control panel.
Use the control panel to activate the roller coaster.
Inform Jean the roller coaster is working.
Talk to Jean.
Get on the roller coaster.
Enjoy the ride.

Walkthrough: The Zen master can be found just south of Muamar Reyes's usual location, overlooking a westward facing cliff just off the paved road in Jackson Plains. V can open conversation with different questions, though the Zen Master will only answer one, and may indicate he is aware of V's predicament with Johnny. He will then offer a meditation BD, with his usual payment condition. V can pay either nothing, or around 600 eddies for the practice. The final meditation is on the element of air, and like the previous sessions, the Zen Master will disappear after it ends. A shard, his robes, and his altar-necklace are left behind, and V can take his altar as an apartment decoration. Johnny will be seated next to the Zen Master's robes and through conversation, implies he did not see the Zen Master at all, and suggests V speak with Misty about the experience.
Objectives:
Approach the Zen master.
Talk to the Zen master.
Talk to Johnny.

Walkthrough:
When V is on Farrier street, behind Megabuilding H10, they hear a moaning man with no pants on holding his crotch. When inquired about what is wrong, the man, Jesse Johnson, will tell V that their Mr. Studd implant is having a malfunction and that they need to visit a ripperdoc as soon as possible.
If V decides to help Jesse:
Jesse instructs V to drive him to the nearest ripperdoc clinic operated by Cassius Ryder in Northside. While on their way there, there are several roadblocks that hinder their travel.
If V manages to get to the clinic in time:
V was able to drive Jesse to Cassius's clinic in time, ensuring Jesse's survival. Jesse called V some time after the operation, letting them know the operation was successful and that they are thankful for V's help. As a reward, he transfer them a payment of 1940 eurodollars.
If V fails to get to the clinic in time:
V was unable to drive Jesse to Cassius's clinic in time, as the implant exploded during travel, causing the man to die from his injuries. A niche dedicated to Jesse was installed at the Columbarium in North Oak, Westbrook.
If V leaves Jesse:
Jesse will die from the implant's malfunction. A niche dedicated to Jesse was installed at the Columbarium in North Oak, Westbrook.
Objectives:
Find out what's wrong with the distressed man.
Decide whether or not to help.
Grab a car and pick up the distressed man.
Take the distressed man to a ripperdoc.
Stop in front of the ripperdoc clinic.
Wait for a call from the distressed man.
Talk to the distressed man.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite from V's perspective while using {{Condition}}. See our quest guide.]
Talk to the BuryGer diner owner and select a drink, but as you do and look around, 3 gangers show up to rob the place.
If you have enough money ($2900‚Äî$8400), you can hand over the money.
If you have at least 7‚Äî10 Body points, can scare them off.
If you have the Streetkid Lifepath, you can warn them that they're on foreign turf, scaring them off.
If you don't choose a timed reaction, you'll have to fight the 3 instead.
If you scared them off, the diner owner will be happy, saying the drinks are free. If you don't make either the Body or Streetkid Lifepath dialogue choices and end up killing the 3 gangers, the owner will demand you leave the place for taking lives just to save a few eddies.
If you got into a fight but didn't kill the gangers (e.g. using lethal weapons or lethal quickhacks), the diner owner will be glad and say that the drinks are on the house (just like if you had made the Body or Streetkid Lifepath dialogue choices).
Objectives: Talk to the diner owner.

Walkthrough:
Shortly after V and Panam Palmer rescued Saul Bright from the Wraiths Camp, the other Aldecaldos‚ÄîCassidy, Carol, and Teddy‚Äîwent into Night City to deliver cyberware to a group of Scavengers.
Upon approaching the location at an industrial complex on Martin Luther King Boulevard and Valley street in Arroyo, Santo Domingo, V is stopped by Aldecaldo Taco and informed about the situation.
Intent on helping the Aldecaldos, V goes to see what is going on and interrupts the conversation between the Aldecaldos and the leader of the Scavengers, who is complaining that the delivery of cyberware was three days later than intended. The Aldecaldos reason that this was due to the dust storm that passed a few days ago.
As V talks with them, the Scavenger leader will agree to a percentage cut, but realizes that V participated in shooting up the Scavenger Den. With sufficient Body, you can intimidate the scavengers to resolve the deal peacefully and pay the Aldecaldos. Otherwise a gunfight will break out; Carol will be displeased by this outcome.
If V has high a enough Body attribute:
V was able to intimidate the Scavengers and have them make the deal with the Aldecaldos. The Aldecaldos thank V for their help before returning to the Mobile Camp.
If V started a fight:
A gunfight broke out during the conversation, causing the Scavengers to engage V and the Aldecaldos. After the gunfight, Carol will be angry with V, but Cassidiy will reason with her. The Aldecaldos thank V for helping before returning to the Mobile Camp.
Objectives:
See what's going on.
If a gunfight breaks out:
Neutralize the Scavengers.
Talk to Carol.
If V is able to intimidate the Scavengers:

Help the nomads negotiate a deal.
Talk to Carol.
Notes[]
If V is male and initiated this side job before Queen of the Highway, Cassidy will write him a text message concerning Panam some time after completing the job.[1]
V can covertly kill the entire Scavenger team except Roman before the negotiation dialogue has even ended. The leader will act as if they are still alive.
Taco and his twin brother Jeff can be approached at the Mobile Camp after this job, where they will both thank V for their help.
If With a Little Help from My Friends is started while Gun Music is available but not yet started, Gun Music will temporarily disappear until the former is completed.
