Walkthrough:
In the south side of Santo Domingo, you will come across a group of homeless men crowded around a corpo briefcase, unable to open it. You can convince them to hand it over before they get hurt, either by threatening them (requires Body) or paying them off.
Once the briefcase is V's, you will be tasked to find the body of its former owner, who can be found by following a scannable blood trail to the nearby dumpsters. From the corpse of the hapless corpo, you will retrieve an access card that can be used to open the locked briefcase. Alternatively, you can hack it open (requires Intelligence). Either way, open the file launch.exe on the computer; this will send a signal triggering something to drop from orbit. You will be directed to a new objective about two kilometers to the south, in the Badlands.
Go to the new marker, but be wary of a Militech response team that was also dispatched to the area. All seven soldiers will need to be taken out before the pod can be accessed. Once done, open the pod, and Johnny will comment it is a valuable painting, likely from a wealthy highrider on the moon.
Once looted, the Untitled 18 ‚Äì Brancesi, 2021 will be on display in V's Apartment.
Objectives:
Talk to the bums.
Find the body of the suitcase's owner.
Examine the suitcase. [Optional]
If the body was found:
Slot the access shard into the suitcase.
Browse the files on the computer.
Go to the drop point.
Defeat all enemies. [0/7]
Open the package.
Talk to Johnny.

Walkthrough:
After Jackie's ofrenda, Kirk Sawyer will reach out to V about a new gig and wants you to meet with him at the El Coyote Cojo. When meeting with Kirk, he will tell V about having heard about experimental Militech cyberware straight from a lab in Shanghai is up for grabs, and flick you the coordinates on where you'll meet.
Make your way to the Tirempire Auto Shop autoshop in Arroyo, Santo Domingo and meet up with Kirk Sawyer and Big Joe. Kirk will instruct you to retrieve the Militech cyberware from the back of the delivery van. He will also guarantee that the location is all clear. The rewards will be split evenly.
When you reach the auto shop, you will see several Valentinos Thugs there, making the location far from clear. After taking out the thugs, go to the delivery van and open its back doors. In the back you'll find no experimental Militech cyberware, and only a fake SEMURAI jacket.
While making your way back to Kirk and Big Joe, you hear gunshots in the distance. Arriving at the meeting point, you'll encounter a Valentino by the name of Thomas Hays and two of his thugs. They appear to have shot down Kirk and Big Joe, and explain to V that they lured Kirk into a trap in order to kill him. V will be given the option to walk away or be able to strike down the Valentinos, both leading into the completion of the gig.
Objectives: This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù

Walkthrough: This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Objectives:
Check the highway in Watson for a red Semimaru.
Search for the Red Semimaru that River described.
Pursue and stop the Semimaru.
Defeat the drivers.
Investigate the Semimaru.
Send the info to River.

Walkthrough:
About a day after returning Jake Estevez's pickup truck, V is contacted by Jake and instructed to go to a garage at the cargo station in Rancho Coronado, Santo Domingo.
Once at the garage, V can get behind the wheel of their new Quadra Turbo-R V-Tech.
Objectives:
Go to the garage near the cargo station.
Get in the car.
Leave the area.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite, missing details, choices, steps]
V comes across a street musician playing on a guitar, and Johnny Silverhand will ask if V likes his music. After a brief exchange, Johnny will note that bootlegs of Samurai concerts might still exist. He'll then note that an old club they used to play at, Rainbow Cadenza, is nearby, if they want to check for those bootlegs.
V heads over only to find it is now a food joint, which Johnny will remark on. V head inside and speaks to the staff, who points V to an old vendor nearby who keeps bugging them about the old club. The vendor, Karim Noel, located at a stall nearby, and he'll talk a lot about Samurai and Johnny before V is able ask him about the bootlegs. You'll have to convince him that you're a true Samurai fan before he would even entertain the idea of selling the records to you.
Karim will quiz you. When you call on Johnny for assistance, he'll give you an answer, but when you tell the vendor, it's actually wrong. You can then ask Johnny for the correct one and he'll give it. This time Karim will be impressed and will give you the bootleg for free.
Once V has the SAMURAI Concert Recording, Johnny will discuss the vendor, noting Karim may be a big fan and knows all his lyrics, but never took the time to understand that Johnny was calling for change, and instead Karim remains stuck in the 2020s. Answer Johnny how you wish and the quest will conclude.
If V is a Corpo:
V will then tell a story to the vendor about how if a corpo newbie from Arasaka doesn't make their deadline, the ghost of a man will split him into two, telling the vendor more that the ghost is Johnny Silverhand, impressing him.
If V has a Cool Attribute of 9 or higher:
V can say they have been listening to "Chipping in" since they were a kid, further impressing the vendor and giving you the recording.
Objectives:
Talk to Johnny.
Go to the Rainbow Cadenza club.
Talk to Johnny.
Ask the staff about the club.
Talk to the cook.
Find the vendor selling the tapes.
Talk to the vendor.
Persuade the vendor to give you the tapes.
Talk to Johnny.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìùReason: Rewrite from V's perspective
After completing Ghost Town and reaching 40 Street Cred, an undiscovered quest will appear some time after on your map, in the same tunnels where Nash's Raffen Shiv hideout was. The quest starts automatically once you visit the location, where you come across an odd sight: among the darkness and crags of the unfinished tunnel, in an old shipping container, is a jet black Rayfield Caliburn "Murkmobile", along with several containers and amenities that imply someone set up shop here or at least intended to do so. A quick search in a nearby container reveals the story. A young man, orphaned by the murder of his parents, resolved himself to become a vigilante, a creature of the night dedicated to fighting the darkness of the city from within the darkness: Murk Man. Unfortunately, Murk Man seems to have abandoned his hideout or, possibly, was killed by the very criminals he had hoped to fight. Still, every vigilante needs a nice ride--hence the Caliburn. And if Murk Man isn't around to make good use of it, you may as well in his stead.
Objectives:
Search the container.
Get in the car.

Walkthrough: Approach Brendan and talk to him. V can remark on Theo Price, who just talked to the machine, whether or not they actually saw her or not. After some time (can be a day or more), the job marker on the map will reappear. Return to Brendan and a vandal can be caught spray painting the poor machine. Take care of the vandal however you wish and Brendan will thank you and talk a bit before suddenly makes a rather startling comment about you dying. He will then note that he can't read minds, he just picks up on everything he hears and is able to deduce what's going on with various individuals.
Objectives:
Stop the vandal.
Talk to Brendan.

Walkthrough:
Shortly after saving Saul Bright from the Wraiths Camp, Mitch Anderson will reach out to V with the request to help him organize Scorpion's funeral at the Mobile Camp.[N 1][N 2]
Upon agreeing to help, Mitch asks V if they can drive his car and follow him, while he drives in Scorpion's car to one of Scorpion's favorite spots.
Arriving at the spot‚Äîa collapsed bridge that borders the ravine of the northern Badlands‚ÄîMitch reveals that Scorpion's body is in the trunk of the car. V, freaked out by this, asks what Mitch is doing, who responds that Scorpion's final wish was to "sent off with a bang."
Mitch instructs V to grab a nearby gas canister filled with CHOOH2 and place it in the passenger seat of the car, as Mitch places Scorpion's body in the driver's seat. After that, Mitch asks V to light the rag he put in the car's gas tank on fire, while he starts the car remotely.
V and Mitch watch on as the car rides off the ramp into the ravine and explodes. Mitch explains to V that it felt right to include them as they are still alive because of them, and gives them Scorpion's Stinger and his beloved good luck charm, an Action Figure, as thanks.[N 3]
Objectives:
Talk to Mitch.
Follow Mitch.
Talk to Mitch.
Get in Mitch's car.
Follow Mitch.
Talk to Mitch.
Take the gas container.
Put the gas container in the passenger seat of Scorpion's car.
Talk to Mitch.
Light the rag on fire.
Follow Mitch.
Talk to Mitch.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite from V's perspective. Usage of {{Condition}}]
Upon approaching the Afterlife after being directed by Rogue to talk to Panam during Ghost Town or completing KOLD MIRAGE, Netrunner Nix messages V and asks them to stop by the Afterlife to discuss a job, which involves purchasing a rare "The Book of Spells" from the netrunner R3n0. As simple as the errand appears to be, Nix wants V to buy The Book of Spells in his stead just in case the exchange unexpectedly goes wrong, and he intends to compensate V for both the expense and the pickup. Nix sends R3n0's contact into to V. Call her to set up a meeting.
Travel to the restaurant Au Cabanon in Charter Hill, next to the Lele Park fast travel point. R3n0 is waiting by the bar with a laptop. At this point, V has two ways to get The Book of Spells. The first way is to speak with R3n0 and buy The Book of Spells for 5500 eurodollars, which concludes the deal without violence despite V's misgivings that R3n0 is a scammer. The second way is to avoid paying R3n0 at all by attacking her (scanning her laptop will also immediately turn her hostile), then jacking into her laptop after she is unconscious or dead. The Book of Spells's coordinates are in the laptop's messages, which also reveal how R3n0 came into possession of The Book of Spells: she is an employee of Hard Wire Ltd. named Clarity, and her boss asked her to review the data on an old cyberdeck that had been found in storage in one of their warehouses. Clarity could not get past The Book of Spells's malware, but recognized its value to a more skilled netrunner and decided to sell it without her boss's knowledge.
V is then directed to a shopping plaza across the street. Open the suitcase, tucked away next to a vending machine, to reveal The Book of Spells: a genuine Zetatech XPR tablet. Johnny Silverhand will comment that it was cutting edge tech back in 2020 and he used to own one. Take The Book of Spells. V can optionally crack The Book of Spells themselves before returning to Nix, which can potentially reward cash and some quickhacks.
Return to Nix to hand over The Book of Spells and receive payment. If V has high enough Intelligence, they can point out that The Book of Spells is worth much more than Nix is paying, and he will reluctantly give V a bonus.
Alternatively, V may access the "Smuggler's Cache" netpage after receiving Nix's message to see R3n0's post, which will change the objective to call R3n0. V will no longer be able to ask Nix what gig he is offering, and Nix will pretend he is not very interested in The Book of Spells and will not offer to compensate V for the price of purchasing it. But V will now have access to two Cool dialogue options to make Nix pay double or triple his original price. If V does not bargain with Nix, he will pay the same as if he had offered V the gig directly, but if he pays double he will offer 37.5% more and 75% more if he pays triple. V will still have access to the Intelligence option to point out The Book of Spells is worth more, in which case the cool dialogue options cannot be used.[verification needed]
Objectives:
Talk to Nix.
Call R3n0.
Go to the coordinates given by R3n0.
Talk to R3n0.
Defeat R3n0. [Optional]
Steal data from R3n0's computer. [Optional]
Collect the goods from the stash.
Open the stash.
Talk to Johnny.
Take the Book of Spells.
Open your Shards menu and decrypt the Book of Spells. [Optional]
Return to Nix.

Walkthrough:
After obtaining the high-score in Trauma Drama, you are contacted by Macroware, the developers of the arcade game.
Macroware instructs you to visit the Trauma Team netpage from your computer and navigate to the "We want YOU!" tab, and apply for an unpaid internship with Trauma Team. This can be done after logging in under "Trauma Drama Member Access" and signing in. On the "We want YOU!" page you can apply.
After applying, go to MedCenter to collect your rewards, a Trauma Team uniform and a Mini Trauma Team AV that can be displayed in your apartment
Objectives:
Read the message from Macroware.
Go to the Trauma Team netpage on your computer.
Go to the MedCenter to collect your consolation prize.
Scan your hand to confirm your identity.
Collect your consolation prize.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Turn bullet points into actual events]
V stumbles across three NCPD patrolmen, Corey Aldwyn, Keegan Kelly, and William Becker, beating up a man in an alley, but the situation is not all that it appears. V can intervene by speaking with Officer Aldwyn. V can choose to demand that the officers leave the man alone, which turns them hostile, or turn a blind eye and walk away.
If V has a Streetkid background, they have an additional dialogue option to learn more about the beaten man's circumstances. The man, Nigel Hamilton, is a wealthy corpo who showed an XBD to a girl that put her into a coma. That woman happened to be the daughter of one of Aldwyn's friends, and Aldwyn was taking justice into his own hands since Hamilton's status meant he was going to avoid being charged with a crime. V can then persuade the officers to leave peacefully by volunteering to deal with Hamilton for them.
However the officers are handled, V must then wake and confront Hamilton, leaving the area at this point causes the job to fail. In addition to immediately letting Hamilton go, V can also dig deeper or force him to pay for the help.
If V has 5 Cool: V can demand payment. Hamilton hands over ‚Ç¨$2280. V then has two more options, either of which will conclude the side job:
Let Hamilton go.
If V has 5 Body, they can demand all of Hamilton's money. Hamilton gives up an extra ‚Ç¨$2660.
If V has 5 Reflexes: V can ask Hamilton to tell the truth about what the cops wanted from him. He will claim to not know and insinuate he was attacked for no reason. V then has two more options, either of which will conclude the side job:
Let Hamilton go.
If V has 13 Cool, they can demand money. Hamilton pays ‚Ç¨$2280.
If V has 5 Body, they can demand all of Hamilton's money. Hamilton gives up an extra ‚Ç¨$2660.
If V is a Streetkid: V can mention that they know Hamilton is showing spiked XBDs to people. Hamilton will confess that he is aware the XBDs are harmful, and he showed one to the girl deliberately. V then has two more options, either of which will conclude the side job:
Let Hamilton go.
If V has 13 Cool, they can demand money. Hamilton pays ‚Ç¨$2280.
If V has 5 Body, they can demand all of Hamilton's money. Hamilton gives up an extra ‚Ç¨$2660.
V can also kill Hamilton which will also result in the job being completed. Looting his corpse after extorting "everything" from him will result in even more money, indicating Hamilton lied about handing over everything he had.
Objectives:
Defeat the cops.
Wake the corpo.
Talk to the corpo.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Add use of {{Condition}}]
To receive this job, V must have resolved amicably the dispute between Kerry Eurodyne and Us Cracks during I Don't Wanna Hear It and completed Off the Leash.
Some time after completing the prerequisite jobs, V will receive a call from Blue Moon, who asks them to help her dealing with a stalker that has sent death threats. If asked, the only clue she can provide is that he signs his letters "GC". Her plan is to go for a stroll around Kabuki Roundabout to lure the stalker out so V can catch him in the act. Then she wants V to teach him a lesson without killing him, because that would be bad for Us Cracks' image. V agrees to the plan and meets Blue Moon at Kabuki Roundabout. She will walk through part of the lower level of the roundabout, turn into an alley to the market and then go up to the footbridge.
Right after starting the operation, V notices a suspicious person on the upper level who starts taking photos of Blue Moon. Confronting him will complete the optional objective "Make sure the stalker isn't lurking on any level of Kabuki Roundabout.". When questioned, he will say he is taking pictures of Blue Moon to sell them. If asked whether he has noticed anything out of the ordinary, he will point out a girl in green who is in every single photo he has taken.
Scanning her reveals that her name is Griselda Martinez. She has a brown ponytail, a green tank top and a pink rabbit backpack. She can be first seen leaning against a wall while Blue Moon is talking to V, then starts following at street level with her head turned towards Blue Moon, who is on the lower level. She will lean against the railing while Blue Moon is confronted by a group of 5 Animals who think they recognize her. After passing them, Blue Moon will stop to browse a magazine display. At this point Griselda will approach her, asking to take a picture together and saying her name is Green Cloud.
If V has been told the stalker's letters were signed GC, they can confront Griselda about her nickname and how she signs her letters, making her hostile. Otherwise, she can still be questioned, but, without any proof, she will just walk away. If followed, she will go to the nearby Weapon Vendor and, if asked what is she doing in a gun shop, she becomes nervous and attacks V.
Alternatively, V can keep following Blue Moon until she reaches the middle of the footbridge, where Green Cloud reappears in front of her, pulling a gun and starting to rant. V should quickly incapacitate Green Cloud before she shoots and kills Blue Moon, failing the job.
In any case, after neutralizing Green Cloud, V can search her body to find a Disturbing Diary and a Marred Still of Blue Moon, a picture with the eyes cut out.
With the stalker revealed and unconscious, Blue Moon asks V what to do. They can either tell her to let the NCPD handle things, or simply kill the stalker. If Green Cloud is killed, Blue Moon will be briefly dismayed. V will justify themselves by saying that stalking is not punished with lifetime imprisonment, and they would have eventually attacked Blue Moon again. If V tells Blue Moon to let the police handle it, she will be worried about the stalker attacking again, with V telling her to simply give them another call in such an event. There are no consequences for either option. Blue Moon leaves and will send V payment soon after.
Objectives:
Go to the meeting spot and wait for Blue Moon.
Make sure the stalker isn't lurking on any level of Kabuki Roundabout. [Optional]
Find the stalker and don't let Blue Moon get hurt.
Defeat the stalker.
Find evidence you got the right person.
Wait for Blue Moon next to the stalker.
Talk to Blue Moon.
Decide the stalker's fate.
Tell Blue Moon that the stalker should go to prison. [Optional]
Kill the stalker. [Optional]
Talk to Blue Moon.

Walkthrough:
Preliminaries[]
After the initial fight with the training robot, it acts as a tracker for the following side jobs:
Beat on the Brat: Arroyo
Beat on the Brat: Kabuki
Beat on the Brat: Rancho Coronado
Beat on the Brat: The Glen
Only the Kabuki fight can be done during Act 1, as the rest of the locations are inaccessible until Act 2 due to Watson being under NCPD lockdown. Completing all four fights will unlock the championship fight against professional boxer Razor Hugh. To unlock this final fight, you must first complete Transmission.
If V has completed the side job Send in the Clowns‚Äîwhich unlocks after completing the main job Transmission‚Äîan optional fifth preliminary fight will be unlocked:
Beat on the Brat: Pacifica
Razor Hugh[]
The championship fight against Razor Hugh is held in the Grand Imperial Mall in Pacifica. The fight starts at 12:01 AM, and if V arrives before that time, they'll be prompted to skip the time on a nearby bench. Before the fight begins, Coach Fred will offer to double V's cash reward if they throw the fight and let Razor win. V can accept, ensuring they will receive the bonus no matter how they lose. If V wins the fight, then regardless of whether they took Fred's offer, they will still receive the standard amount of money as a reward.
Close to where Coach Fred privately speaks to V there is also a child that wants to talk to V. She will mention how her father fought Razor years ago, fell in the third round and despite the referee calling the match, Razor kept attacking, badly injuring him in the process. She says she wants Razor to pay for ruining her family's life.
Among the audience there are all of V's past opponents ‚Äî Esquerdo & Certo, C√©sar Diego Ruiz, Rhino ‚Äî and Viktor Vektor, who will tell V that Razor is weak to hits in the torso because he recently had new abdominal muscles implanted. Punching Razor in the gut will stagger him for a few seconds. Razor is fast and hits hard but can be stun-locked by repeatedly breaking his guard with charged punches using Gorilla Arms. He also badly telegraphs his moves; a well-timed guard will turn into a counter with a brief couple of seconds of slowed-down time, letting V get several key punches into his gut.
If V accepted to throw the fight and lost:
Coach Fred rewards V with the standard ‚Ç¨$50,000 and an extra ‚Ç¨$20,000. Viktor will notice this and criticize V for it.
If V accepted to throw the fight and won:
Fred will be angry, but they will still reward the merc with ‚Ç¨$50,000. Viktor and the other fighters will compliment V for winning the fight.
If V didn't accept to throw the fight and lost:
Fred is happy that V has changed their mind, offering ‚Ç¨$50,000 plus an extra that V can either accept or decline. If accepting, Viktor will notice this and criticize V for it.
If V didn't accept to throw the fight and won:
Coach Fred will reward the standard ‚Ç¨$50,000. Viktor and the other fighters will compliment V for winning the fight.
If V talked to the child and won the fight:
As V is leaving the venue, V will overhear the girl having a phone conversation with someone where it appears she lied about her family's situation in order to motivate V to win the fight so she can win more money betting on Razor losing. When confronted, the child will run away.
If V talked to the child and lost the fight:
She will ignore V.
Objectives:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Talk to the coach.
Defeat the training robot.
Talk to the coach.
Defeat all opponents to get to the final round.
Wait for the final fight.

Walkthrough:
If V reads the shard "Notice of Expiration" in Act II:
V learns about the the job by reading the Notice of Expiration shard.
If V has completed Spellbound:
Some time after completing Spellbound, Nix will text V stating he has decrypted the spellbook, and provides coordinates to a location deep in the Municipal Landfill, down the road past Medeski Fuel Station. Alternatively, the quest may be started by simply coming to this location sometime after completing Ghost Town.
The coordinates lead to an old freezer. Open it to find the corpse of Rache Bartmoss, and, after a short dialogue with Johnny Silverhand, scan the freezer and pick up Bartmoss' Cyberdeck.
Head to the Afterlife and show the deck to Nix, who will tell you that Bartmoss was likely killed by NetWatch. He will offer to decrypt the data on the deck, either now or at a later time.
Although he encounters little resistance when he begins accessing the deck, Nix soon trips a hidden piece of malware, and his cyberware begins to malfunction. Johnny reappears, recognizing the malware as a "brain broiler" and urging V to do something fast. There are two possible ways to save Nix. You can either override the power panel on the wall next to the door or jack into the computer next to Nix's desk to breach the cyberdeck yourself. The latter option will allow Nix full access to the deck's data, and out of gratitude for saving his life he will reward V with five quickhacks he found: Memory Wipe, Reboot Optics, Short Circuit, Sonic Shock, and System Collapse.
Objectives:
See where the coordinates lead.
Open the freezer.
Talk to Johnny.
Scan the freezer.
Take the deck.
Go to the Afterlife and talk to Nix.
If you choose not to let Nix decrypt the data:
Talk to Nix if you change your mind. [Optional]
Place the deck on Nix's desk.
Wait for Nix to finish the decryption.
Find a way to save Nix.
Talk to Nix.

Walkthrough:
The opponent here is C√©sar Diego Ruiz, a member of the Valentinos and boxing champion of the Glen. He has a girlfriend, Micaela, with a baby on the way. In lieu of betting money, Ruiz will stake his ride, the Villefort Alvarado "Vato". In turn, you'll need to stake ‚Ç¨$20,000.
This match may seem difficult at first, especially if challenging him at a lower level. Ruiz has a large health pool, and his signature attack can knock you out in as few as two hits. Fortunately, his signature attack has an extremely obvious tell. Back away from him a good distance, making sure to leave ample room to move on the right. Ruiz will put up his fists and step with a blur effect towards you before jumping and throwing a punch. Simply circle to the right of him when he begins to blur or before he jumps and his attack will be completely avoided, leaving him wide open for a few seconds. Punch Ruiz's head a few times before he turns around, then back off and wait for your stamina to recover. Rinse and repeat until he goes down.
You can also cheat a bit to give you a slight advantage by littering recovery items and non-lethal melee weapons on the court and pick them up during the fight to get around the block usually in place on these items during matches. Furthermore, recovery implants and the Gorilla Arms implant can be freely used if you have them installed.
When Ruiz is defeated, he will concede the money and car as promised, but you have a few options:
Take both the car and the money
Take the car, but leave Ruiz the money
Take the money, but leave Ruiz the car
Decline both the money and car
The options only affect your final reward and the discussion Ruiz and Micaela have afterwards. As long as you didn't take both the car and money, Ruiz and Micaela have the same reaction.
Objectives:
Go to the fight in the Glen.
Talk to the champion of the Glen.
Defeat C√©sar.
Talk to the champion of the Glen.

Walkthrough:
This one requires you to complete the main job Transmission first to then open up the side job Send in the Clowns which needs to be completed for this. As such, you can actually end up doing the championship fight in Beat on the Brat with Razor Hugh before you get this one based on how you completed other quests.
You'll be fighting in the large, dry pool area, so you'll have plenty of room to evade. That said, your major concern is Ozob's nose: it is a live grenade so if you hit it wrong too many times, you could set it off.
Ozob's grenade nose will detonate after accumulating about 75% of his health in damage to his head. This instantly kills Ozob and V wins by "technical knockout" and must talk to the referee standing on the side of the pool to get the reward money and complete the quest.
Objectives:
Go to the fight in Pacifica.
Talk to Ozob.
Defeat Ozob.
If V beats Ozob without detonating his grenade nose:
Talk to Ozob.
If V targets Ozob's face until his nose detonates:
Talk to the referee.

Walkthrough:
Some time after meeting Takemura, Meredith will message V to let them know that everything has worked out following the raid on the All Foods Factory. V then sends a flirtatious reply to Meredith, after which she tells V to meet her at the No-Tell Motel in Kabuki, Watson.
Upon reaching the room at the hotel, V'll be greeted by a provocatively dressed Meredith, who comments that they probably didn't expect to see her there. V will ask what happens next, and a cutscene of the two having a romantic scene will play out. Afterwards, Meredith will bid V farewell, leaving behind a reward, and sending a text message.[N 1]
Objectives:
Go to the First floor of the No-Tell Motel.
Talk to Meredith Stout.
Spend the night at the No-Tell Motel.

Walkthrough:
At Cargo Bay, V can encounter a monk who is fully cybered up and in serious distress because of it. After speaking with him, V discovers that he and his brother were taken captive by Maelstrom and he was forcibly installed with Cyberware, which is against the religion that the monks follow. Maelstrom let him go, but his brother is still in captivity.
The monk asks V for help and directs them to a nearby Abandoned Warehouse surrounded by shipping containers. There are several Maelstrom goons that need to be taken out, but the monk wishes for V to avoid killing them.
When you arrive at the warehouse, you spot several possible ways of entry;
A grate on the south side of the building that can be opened with Technical Ability 7.
Climbing the containers at either the northwest or southeast side of the building to sneak past the enemies.
By simply walking inside through the front gate (this method will instantly alert the enemies).
Once inside, neutralize the enemies and approach the monk to speak with and set him free. Note that the monk is a neutral NPC, so he can die if not careful. To the left of the monk there is an Iconic M221 Saratoga called Fenrir.
Enemies[]
3 Security Cameras
1 Maelstrom Ironstormer
4 Maelstrom Goons
Objectives:
Save the monk.
Defeat the gangoons.
Talk to the monk.

Walkthrough:
After installing Patch 2.0 or newer, V will receive a call from Viktor Vektor that new cyberware software has hit the market, and has become available to them.
V can then proceed to visit any Ripperdoc to install their software update, in the form of a tutorial that informs about all the changes made to the Cyberware interface in Patch 2.0.
At the Ripperdoc, V has to install a Kiroshi "Sentry" Optics, Smart Link, and Subdermal Armor for free. After doing so, the quest will complete.
Objectives:
Talk to Viktor/Read the message from Viktor.
Install the cyberware update at any ripperdoc clinic.

Once all of them have been completed, Regina will call V to have a meeting in person, with her comments based on if you had managed to keep them all alive or not before she gives you your reward. If none are killed, she is very grateful, as she is helping them get therapy to further understand their condition. The reward is given even if some of the cyberpsychos are killed instead of incapacitated.

Walkthrough:
You get a call from Robert Wilson, the owner of the local 2nd Amendment in your megabuilding. He is hosting a shooting competition to drum up some local business. You arrive with five other competitors, although one is kicked out after breaking Wilson's pistol only rule.
Once the competition starts, your objective is simple. Hit as many targets as many times you are able to within the time limit. So it is advised to use a pistol that has a high-rate of fire and a large magazine. You are not restricted to the target in your lane, so make advantage of the fact that you are able to shoot the targets in other lanes.
If V wins the shooting competition:
Robert will give you a Lexington x-MOD2, and some eddies.
If V loses the shooting competition:
If you lose, the winner will complain that the weapon they've won is of low quality.
If you have enough points in Reflexes, Wilson can be asked about his situation, where he will lament that business is down and considers the shooting competition a failure as it did nothing to help boost sales in his shop. Otherwise, V can say their goodbyes to end the quest.
Objectives:
Go to Wilson's shooting range.
Talk to Wilson.
Enter the shooting range.
Listen to Wilson's instructions.
Draw and aim your weapon.
Wait for the competition to begin.
Get into position.
Shoot the targets. [0/100]
Go to Wilson.
If you won the competition:
Collect your reward from Wilson.
Talk to Wilson.

Walkthrough:
You don't need to put up anything for this fist fight, as Rhino notes this is only for fun/making a name for yourself.
That said, Rhino is a hard hitter, where 2-3 punches can knock you out, so make sure to make ample use of dodging techniques to avoid her punches.
Objectives:
Talk to the Animals champion.
Defeat Rhino.
Talk to the Animals champion.

Walkthrough:
This is one of the more difficult fist fights, as Buck can deal a lot of damage in one punch to the point 2-3 hits on you will cause you to lose, so it's best to plan accordingly beforehand, like consuming boosters, food, etc.
When you approach to talk to him, he'll be talking about his unique rifle, O'Five. If you have at least 8 in Body you can comment on this which will then give you the option to have him also put it up for grabs, provided you have ‚Ç¨$ 18,000 to spare to fight him for it. Otherwise, you just need ‚Ç¨$ 6,000 to fight him.
Note that if you got him to put up his sniper rifle, once you win he and his buddies will turn hostile and start shooting at you. At this point you're free to also use your own guns and kill them if you wish. Once they're down, go collect the gun to complete the job. You won't automatically receive your eddies if you select this method, but you can loot the prize money from Buck's body.
The normal bet will end up with Buck telling you to leave if you win. You can just directly leave the area, or talk to him. You can decide whether to provoke him or to calm him down. If you decide to provoke him, Buck and his friends will proceed to attack you, and his rifle O'Five will be immediately be available for you to get.
Once they're down, go collect the gun to complete the job.
Objectives:
Go to the fight in Arroyo.
Talk to the champion of Arroyo.
Defeat Buck.

Walkthrough:

Right after you finish Double Life, you'll need to call Mr. Hands, the fixer for Pacifica, for assistance in getting in touch with the Voodoo Boys. He'll note it'll be almost impossible as they keep to themselves but will check for you. Sometime later he'll call you with an update: as expected they're not interested in whatever you have but incidentally they have a job that needs to be done and so Mr. Hands volunteered you to assist them which, if done right, will then allow you an audience with their leader, Brigitte.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite from V's perspective, use of conditions]
Head to the Afterlife where you'll find a man, Dennis, looking for a solo to take on a job, but rather than use a fixer, he wants to cut out the middleman and have you work directly for him.
If you agree, he'll ask you to go find a marked fridge in Kabuki and once you gather the contents inside, contact him for further steps.
Head out there and it should be the fridge in the last shack out on the pier. As you might have guessed though, something is off about this: as soon as you open the fridge a rather fatigued man falls out. Call Dennis but he won't tell you the specifics about the guy, only that you need to get him to a nearby car to take him to Northside, and that Tyger Claws will try to kill him and therefore, you.
Tyger members are going to be patrolling the area and standing at the stairs, so you'll have to take them out carefully as, if your companion is killed, the job will fail. You cannot draw a weapon while carrying the man, but you are safely able to put him down on the ground and then move a certain distance to fight.
Once you get to the car, put him in the trunk, then drive to the location in Northside and talk to Dennis. Shortly after he reveals the man's name, Haruyoshi Nishikata, who you can then talk to and who'll then tell you his story: he's the world's best surgeon but the Tyger Claws' boss died on his operating table and the gang became angry at this, so Dennis helped him flee from Japan to Night City. That said, the gang doesn't know that Haruyoshi actually killed the boss on purpose.
For payment, while you'll get some eddies, make sure to also pick up the Scalpel katana that Dennis notes is your reward and is leaning against the barrels.
Objectives:
Go to the slum on the outskirts of Kabuki.
Find and open the container with "No Future" graffiti'd on it.
Talk to Dennis.
Pick up the body.
Carry the body to the car.
Get in Dennis' car.
Deliver the body to the specified coordinates.
Leave the car.
Talk to Dennis.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Wrong format]
When V arrives in the area, they will hear the sounds of partying nearby. As they approach the nearby rooftops, they encounter multiple 6th Street gang members and their leader, Captain Sherman, sitting on a couch with Walker standing next to him.
If V draws their weapon, the job will end and all of the surrounding 6th Street gangers will turn hostile. As long as one remains polite, the captain will speak up and suppress any hostilities, allowing V to stay and participate.
One can then ask if they're doing a "lead-spitting" competition and he'll confirm they are and will allow V to enter if they wish, just a few rules:
You have to take a shot of alcohol before each round
You have to use the revolver on the table near the captain for the shots to count
Do not cross the yellow marquee line at each station, otherwise you will be disqualified
Take the revolver from the table, then head to the first station to begin. Note the player won't be able to save manually during these 4 stations, but can load auto saves if needed. The revolver holds 6 shots and the stations are timed. One can also allow the effects of alcohol to wear off between each station to avoid stacking penalties.
To win the prize, V needs to earn at least 44 points (of a maximum 46 possible) to beat Walker.
If V beats Walker, the captain will be impressed and offer membership into 6th Street, which will be rejected. He will warn V that any encounter in the future will likely be hostile. V can then collect their reward, Divided We Stand. V also has the option to insult Sherman, which results in the gang attacking V.
If Gig: Life's Work was completed prior to this job:
A gang member at the first station will make a remark about knowing V from somewhere. After finishing all stations, he will recognize you, causing the others to become hostile, in which case there's no way to end this quest without a fight breaking out. You can collect Divided We Stand after the fight.
Objectives:
See what's going on.
Talk to the 6th Street leader.
Take the gun.
Get as many points as possible. [46]
Go to the first station.
Drink the shot.
Hit as many targets as you can in 12 seconds. [12]
Go to the second station.
Drink the shot.
Hit as many targets as you can in 12 seconds. [12]
Go to the third station.
Drink the shot.
Hit as many targets as you can in 12 seconds. [11]
Go to the final station.
Drink the shot.
Hit as many targets as you can in 12 seconds. [11]
Return to the 6th Street leader.
Ask about your results.
Collect your reward.

Walkthrough:
There are numerous Valentinos stationed throughout the area, including one with a sniper rifle on the main building roof. The side of the building has a ladder, while the interior has a set of stairs, both leading to the roof/second floor. The target in question is inside the second floor and is possible to be hit through the window, though it will make the optional goal harder.
Inside, two Militech vehicles can be scanned, plus several shelves of Militech uniforms, and crates of Militech ammunition, which triggers some choice comments by Johnny. If the target is approached stealthily, a conversation between them and an unknown Arasaka agent can be heard, detailing a plan to have Jos√©'s people attack an Arasaka facility while dressed as Militech. This isn't enough to satisfy the optional goal, which requires examining the computer near where Jos√© is found, and choosing to tell the truth when the Padre calls.
If Jos√© is incapacitated rather than killed, he must be carried out of the facility and deposited in a car trunk near the street. For all the effort this takes, the payment is not any greater.
Objectives:

Find Jos√© Luis.
Find out why the NCPD dropped the investigation. [Optional]

Leave the depot.
(If Neutralized non-lethally): Carry Jos√©'s body outside the depot.
Call Padre.
Talk to Padre.
(If Neutralized non-lethally): Carry Jos√© to the fixer's transport.
Collect your reward.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Write from V's perspective, remove bullet points]
This gig is pretty straightforward, though you'll need to keep in mind the following about the penthouse, especially if you want the stealth reward bonus for this one:
There are 2 drones flying around, one inside and one outside.
There's a robot in a room on the second floor.
There're 3 active security cameras.
There's a couple turrets in the main room, though these only become active if the alarm is triggered.
The red security gateways will set up the alarm if walked through while active.
The drones and robot can be destroyed without triggering the alarm, provided this is done while remaining undetected. The target shard is on the second floor, in the room immediately to the left of the top of the stairs. The computer in the same office as the target shard can be used to trigger an "emergency reset" of the security system, which will permanently disable the drones, turrets, and robot, and shut off the red security gateways for 60 seconds. The exterior porch can also be accessed while the security gates are active via an open window in the dining room, though there is nothing of note on the porch. A bathroom on the 2nd floor can be opened with a Tech attribute check, and contains an unusually lucrative loot box. Computers around the house contain details of Mrs. Gutierrez's often-underhanded attempts to destroy the life of her former husband.
Objectives:
Go to the apartment on Palm Street.
Go to the top floor.
Find Gutierrez's office.
Remain undetected. [Optional]
Steal the shard with the depository receipts.
Escape the building.
Deposit the shard in the Drop Point.

Sometime after Gig: Last Login has become active (whether it has been completed or not), Sandra Dorsett will contact V about obtaining her missing databank, which is located in the same building as the aforementioned gig. if the player has already obtained the databank, Sandra will simply ask that you return it to her. V has the option to decrypt the databank as well, revealing information on Sandra's activities.
Sandra can be found at her apartment in Watson and will nervously open the door to let the player in. Inside Sandra's apartment, V can find Entry 36, Entry 37, and Entry 38, which tell the story of how Sandra uncovered Operation Carpe Noctem, and indicates that she's on the run from Night Corp.
Depending on whether the shard is read, there are different levels of reward or consequence for V.
If V does not decrypt the shard:
Sandra is thankful for the discretion and reliability, and finalizes the transaction with the agreed sum of 830‚Ç¨$.
If V decrypts the shard:
If V denies reading the contents:
Sandra becomes upset and instead pays less than the agreed amount.
If V admits to reading the contents:
If V informs they will do nothing:
Sandra rewards V with the agreed sum as if the shard was not decrypted.
If V congratulates Sandra:
V acknowledges that anyone who can hack Night Corp deserves respect. Sandra says that she'll use the databank to fight against Night Corp, and she rewards V's honesty with additional eurodollars.
If V additionally passes an Intelligence Check:
Sandra reveals the nature of her pursuit as well as the root of her fears, and expresses her gratitude to have a fellow runner to talk with. Relieved, she rewards V with an even larger sum of 3800‚Ç¨$.
If V blackmails Sandra:
Sandra becomes hostile and will need to be neutralised, along with her security turret.
Objectives:
Find Sandra's databank.
Call Sandra Dorsett.
Meet with Sandra.

Walkthrough:
After having recuperated from their injuries in their apartment, V is contacted by Jackie's mother, Guadalupe Alejandra Welles, with the request that V calls her.
If V sent Jackie Welles's body to his family, or asked Delamain to wait for V:
Mama Welles asks that V joins the ofrenda that she is holding at the El Coyote Cojo for Jackie.
After arriving at the Coyoto Cojo, V speaks with Mam√° Welles, who offers them a beer and asks how they are doing. V tells her that they want to take part in the ceremony as well and do it in the right tradition, but that they are unsure about what to place next to his urn. Mam√° tells V not to worry and hands V the the key to Jackie's garage, and assures V that they can find something in there from Jackie's past that will be appropriate.
When V approaches the garage in the alley behind the Coyote Cojo, they find Jackie's girlfriend, Misty, is sitting in front of the garage door. V asks her what she is doing there, and she tells V that she is waiting for Jackie to return, even though she knows that won't happen. After speaking with her a bit more, they both enter the garage.
Inside the garage, V looks for a suitable offering.[N 1][N 2]
If V finds the Key to Jackie's Room:
On the desk, V finds the key that unlocks the door in the garage. Upon opening the door, Misty and V uncovered that Jackie attempted to make a mandala. Seeing the mandala improves Misty's emotional state and tells V that she once told Jackie to remove all the "dark energy" from the place by drawing a mandala. V proceeds to look for other objects that could be used in the ofrenda.
If V talks to Misty before exiting the garage:
V talks with Misty in an attempt to convince her to join in on the ofrenda, before going back to the bar.[N 3]
When back at the Coyote Cojo, V talks with Mam√° Welles before sitting down next to Viktor Vektor on the couch. Several people will tell a short story about Jackie, before V has a chance to say their say.[N 4]
After the ofrenda, V speaks with Mam√° Welles.
If V convinced Misty to join the ofrenda:
Mam√° Welles will mention that she noticed that Misty joined the ofrenda. V will tell Mam√° to be nicer to Misty and to invite her for dinner.[N 3]
Mam√° Welles offers V the the key to her son's ARCH. After talking with Mam√° Welles, V is able to talk with several other people and reminisce on Jackie's life.[N 5]
If V sent Jackie Welles's body to Viktor Vektor:
Three days after the initial message, Mama Welles will send V a follow-up message, telling them that she sent a package to V's apartment. When opening the package at their apartment, they obtain the key to Jackie's ARCH.
If V talks to Viktor Vektor about it:
Viktor will explain that Jackie's body was taken by the Arasaka Corporation, and that that is all he knows.[N 6]

Walkthrough:
Immediately after being given the objective to find Solomon Reed, V can randomly come across vehicles marked by a blue steering wheel icon while exploring Dogtown. Entering a vehicle for the first time will cause Muamar Reyes to make contact, telling V that he's been tracking the vehicle they are currently riding in, after which he will give coordinates to a garage within Santo Domingo, Arroyo with the objective to drive the vehicle there.
Along the way hostile vehicles will drive up and attempt to stop the car by killing V or blocking the car. Eliminate the enemies, or lose them by driving out of their range, before entering the garage.
Upon parking in the garage, V can exit the car and leave the building, where Reyes will be standing outside by a Mizutani Shion MZ2. Reyes will invite V to sit inside the car with him, where Reyes will then discuss with V a new scheme involving taking cars from the street and delivering them to garages owned by Reyes. During the conversation an NCPD vehicle will roll up, and a police officer, Ayden Daniels will approach Reyes. It turns out that Daniels is also in on the scheme, and after Daniels departs Reyes can then ask V whether or not they want to participate.
Completing this side job will grant players access to the Just Another Story repeatable quest.
Objectives:
Talk to El Capitan.
Deliver the vehicle to the indicated location.
Neutralize or lose pursuing enemies.
Leave the vehicle.
Talk to El Capitan.

Walkthrough:
After Jackie's ofrenda, Kirk Sawyer will reach out to V about a new gig and wants you to meet with him at the El Coyote Cojo. When meeting with Kirk, he will tell V about having heard about experimental Militech cyberware straight from a lab in Shanghai is up for grabs, and flick you the coordinates on where you'll meet.
Make your way to the Tirempire Auto Shop autoshop in Arroyo, Santo Domingo and meet up with Kirk Sawyer and Big Joe. Kirk will instruct you to retrieve the Militech cyberware from the back of the delivery van. He will also guarantee that the location is all clear. The rewards will be split evenly.
When you reach the auto shop, you will see several Valentinos Thugs there, making the location far from clear. After taking out the thugs, go to the delivery van and open its back doors. In the back you'll find no experimental Militech cyberware, and only a fake SEMURAI jacket.
While making your way back to Kirk and Big Joe, you hear gunshots in the distance. Arriving at the meeting point, you'll encounter a Valentino by the name of Thomas Hays and two of his thugs. They appear to have shot down Kirk and Big Joe, and explain to V that they lured Kirk into a trap in order to kill him. V will be given the option to walk away or be able to strike down the Valentinos, both leading into the completion of the gig.
Objectives: This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Secure the area. Use of force permitted.

After contacting V, Songbird will direct them towards Dogtown's northern gate. There she will explain that the plane she is flying in, the Space Force One, will land somewhere in Dogtown. V's mission is to access the district and rescue President Myers before BARGHEST captures her. To convince V to do the job, Songbird promises them a cure that will save their lives. More of these are scattered around Dogtown in abandoned Militech terminals.
After finishing the conversation, Songbird leads V to the EBM Petrochem Stadium's underground parking garage, which V can access by either sneaking or fighting their way into it.[S 1]

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Write walkthrough from V's perspective]
There's a mostly a main room with four enemies and a Netrunner, along with three surveillance cameras. If looking to complete the mission stealthily, there are a couple of options to consider:
There is a stairwell to the right with a surveillance camera, which leads into the Server Room. Upon exiting the stairwell at the bottom, there will be a double door to the right that can be opened if one has sufficient points in Body. Apart from some loot, the room will also have a laptop with Network Access which can shut down all the surveillance cameras.
The Server Room has rafters above, which can be accessed if one has either Fortified Ankles or Reinforced Tendons. These rafters can be stealthily accessed from the left of the Server Room, and while there is an enemy sitting in a chair by that area he will be unlikely to see the player unless making sudden movements. The end of the rafters leads into a vent that can be opened with sufficient Technical Ability points, giving access to the inner Server Room without having to go through all the guards.
Access the computer within the inner Server Room to upload the malware, then leave the area to complete the gig.
Objectives:
Get to the main server.
Upload b@d's malware to the system.
Leave the server room.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
This quest starts after receiving the Behavioral Imprint-synced Faceplate from Farida Nazeri, and exiting her clinic.
V calls Reed, who tells them that the connection to Charon Exotics that they made in Birds with Broken Wings was severed and that the plan is now to move to the Dogtown Gate to find a vantage point near the Golden Pacific Data Term and scout out the ride themselves.
After V waits several hours just before midnight, they are instructed by Reed to scan vehicles coming from Night City into Dogtown, as one of them has to be the vehicle that Aurore Cassel and Aymeric Cassel rented during their stay in Night City.
Aurore and Aymeric drive a Quadra Sport R-7 "Charon", that is tracked once tagged. After tagging the vehicle, V intercepts the vehicle at a parking lot below Eden Plaza, and climb inside the vehicle's trunk and connects to its security system.
If V fails to tag the car when it is entering Dogtown:
Reed will instruct V to move to plan C, and sends V coordinates to three different locations where they must go and scan for the car.
The duo eventually returns to their vehicle, ready to depart to the EBM Petrochem Stadium and meet with Kurt Hansen and Songbird.
If V decides to listen to Aurore and Aymeric's conversation:
V overhears a conversation about Slider's death and a possible stash that is hidden.[N 1]
Their vehicle would be taken over by V‚Äîluring them into the FIA trap that was set for them‚Äîand driving them straight to the garage where Solomon Reed and Alena Xenakis are waiting.
Once arrived at the garage, Aurore and Aymeric are killed and V and Alex prepared to take on their identities. In order to do so, V had to link with Aurore's body and download files on Cynosure.
If V overheard Aurore and Aymeric's conversation about Slider's stash:
V can download the file "Blind_n_Dead" from Aurore's body.[N 1]
After taking control of the vehicle V tries to drive to the meeting location while the netrunners try to get back the control and drive back to the stadium every time they do like a rope pull game. When V brings the car to the meeting point garage Reed and Alex will stun and execute the netrunners then V can download the files from Aurore's corpse. Having downloaded the required files, V slips into the netrunner suit and enters the vehicle and activates the behavioral imprint for their faceplate. After performing a small test to see if it is working, Alex and V depart for their meeting with Kurt Hansen and Songbird.
If V does not take over the vehicle until they arrive at the Stadium:
The guards will perform a scan of the car, revealing V's position in the trunk. They will then proceed to fry V's circuits, inevitably leading to V's death.
