Walkthrough:
After getting in the NCPD SUV, Vasquez will drive Joshua Stephenson, Rachel Casich and V to their destination. While riding along, Joshua tells V that he was sentenced to prison twelve years ago for armed robbery amongst other things. He continues that he shot and killed several people in cold blood, but that it didn't do anything to him on the emotional level at the time. During his time in prison, he had the time to think about his actions, and thought of ways on how to correct them. Joshua asks that V sticks with him for the day, promising them payment equal to that they would have been paid for killing him. As they near their destination, Joshua will ask for a moment of time to think.[N 1]
Arriving at the El-Ahmar House, Joshua and V get out of the vehicle. As Joshua approaches the house, a woman named Zuleikha El-Ahmar greets and invites him and V in to talk. While speaking with Zuleikha, V learns that her brother, Ruben El-Ahmar, was killed by Joshua. But instead of despising Joshua for it, she began to write to him while he was in prison, forgiving him for what he did as her Christian faith told her to not judge others. Because of her letters, Joshua became a Christian himself.
Joshua will then reveal what's going on: Rachel is with a braindance recording studio that plans to record Joshua's crucifixion. Joshua hopes that this will inspire people to convert to Christianity by showing them how Jesus suffered for them. Before more can be said though, Zuleikha's mother Gloria arrives, and unlike her daughter, she hasn't forgiven Joshua and demands he and V leave.
If V decides to stay around:
Joshua and V return to the vehicle, and the group will decide to go for a meal, but Rachel would like a word in private with V first. She'll say that she thinks Joshua is nuts, but the fact that he genuinely believes what he says is valuable since it makes for better braindances. Rachel fears that V is jeopardizing this by asking "probing questions" which cause Joshua to doubt himself.[N 2]
Arriving at the PieZ restaurant in Rancho Coronado, Santo Domingo, Rachel  instructs Vasquez to take Stephenson inside and grab a table, so that she is able to talk with V. She offers V double Joshua's payment to walk away.[N 3][T 2]
If V refuses Rachel's bribe:
V heads into the restaurant and takes place at the table to talk more with Joshua and Rachel about the braindance and other topics, until Rachel gets fed up and tells V off before storming out. Joshua says goodbye to V before also leaving with Vasquez. Johnny will reappear and have some thought-provoking comments. This concludes the job, and pay is transferred shortly. A day later, Rachel will call V to attend Joshua's crucifixion.[T 3]
If V accepts Rachel's bribe:
After accepting Rachel's bribe, Rachel heads inside, telling V that they'll say goodbye to Stephenson on their behalf. Some time after completing, Rachel reaches out to V about their payment, and transfers them 4600 eurodollars.[N 4]
If V asks for a bigger bribe (Corpo only):
V demands a bigger cut, as they're familiar with how high the budget for producing braindances can be. Rachel begrudgingly agrees before heading inside, telling V that they'll say goodbye to Stephenson on their behalf. Some time after completing, Rachel reaches out to V about their payment, and transfers them 9300 eurodollars.[N 4]
If V decides to leave:
After talking with Zuleikha, V decided to leave, concluding the job.[N 4]
Objectives:
Talk to Joshua Stephenson.
Ride along with Joshua.
Follow Joshua Stephenson.
Follow Zuleikha.
Talk to Zuleikha.
If V decides to stay around:
Return to the car.
Get in the NCPD vehicle.
If V refuses Rachel's bribe:
Sit down at the table in PieZ.
Talk to Joshua.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìùReason: Needs more information on what happens if specific dialog was chosen during The Corpo-Rat
Some time after meeting with Alt Cunningham and dealing with the Voodoo Boys, V is contacted by Frank Nostra, a former colleague of them who also worked at the Arasaka Corporation's Counter Intelligence Division, who has recorded a message for them.
In the recorded message, Nostra tells V that Susan Abernathy, the director of Arasaka's North American Special Operations division, is purging the department of anybody who is not one-hundred percent on her side, and that he himself is one of the people that appeared on her radar. Not intending to wait around until the proverbial executioner would come around, he informs V that he started to put together a file on Abernathy, and that he has hidden the documents in question in a safe location. The message ends with Nostra informing V that the reason they are receiving the message is because Nostra himself was unable to make use of the documents, and expects that V will know how to handle the situation, and that they can find the documents at the attached coordinates.[N 1]
The attached coordinates lead V to a dumpster in an alley on Allen street in the Kabuki sub-district of Watson. When V approaches the dumpster, Johnny Silverhand projects himself in front of them and starts mocking V about their continued interest in the Corporate lifestyle.
If V decides to interact with Johnny:
V tells Johnny that they've still got a few scores to settle, to which Johnny will respond that he knew all along they were still into the Corporate "rat race," after which V mocks Johnny for not having something more important to do.
After V moves the dumpster, they find the mentioned briefcase, which upon opening appears to be empty. V is then confronted by a disheveled and bitter, but still very much alive Frank Nostra, who currently finds himself in a similar situation that V found themselves not too long ago. In his desperation to prove Abernathy wrong, Nostra is convinced that turning over V to her will get him back into her good graces and employed at Arasaka again.
If V tells Frank that they're a nobody to Abernathy [Combat]:
V tells Nostra that Abernathy probably doesn't even know that they exist or that she even ever knew of their existence, and explains to Nostra that they were just a tool used by Arthur Jenkins in an attempt to get rid of Abernathy. V also tells Nostra that if they were both to return to the Arasaka headquarters, they would probably both be shot at on sight. Nostra replies with that he has nothing to lose, and engages combat with V.
If V tells Frank that they're pathetic:
V tells Nostra the story about another former colleague of theirs, Joey Livani, who pissed himself the day he got fired, and that they saw him as the most pathetic guy to have ever worked at Arasaka. However, V informs Nostra that they have now taken over the title of most pathetic Arasaka employee.
If V tells Frank to open his eyes [Non-Combat]:
V mocks Nostra for being a fool and trying to get back into Arasaka after they fired him without any mercy. They tell him that his time at Arasaka should be considered complete and that they should try and refigure out their life, and that Nostra has the means start a new career path in Night City if he properly uses the tools‚Äîa gun, ammunition and a little initiative‚Äîat his disposal.[N 2]
If V defeats Nostra [Combat]:
Not intending on being taken in by Nostra, V puts up a fight, resulting in Nostra's neutralization. Upon inspecting his body, V is able to snag his Iconic JKE-X2 Kenshin, the Apparition.
After dealing with Frank, Johnny appears once more to passive aggressively crack wise about meeting old friends.
Objectives:
Go to the indicated location.
Talk to Johnny. [Optional]
Move the dumpster.
Open the briefcase.
Talk to the stranger.
Confront Frank.
Talk to Johnny.

Walkthrough:
After agreeing to help Delamain track down his lost vehicles, V is able to encounter one at the roundabout near the North Oak Sign in North Oak, Westbrook. After getting close enough, the divergent Delamain will call V and tell them that they are utterly overwhelmed by Night City, it being too crowded for them and making them anxious and sad. V suggests that they drive them back to the Delamain Corp Headquarters, as it is a safer place. The Delamain agrees and allows V to enter the vehicle and drive them back.[Notes 1]
If V brings back the vehicle unscathed:
After V manages to bring the Delamain back safely to the headquarters in Vista del Rey, Delamain will transfer V a modest sum of 1,640 eurodollars as part of the agreement.
If V damages the Delamain Cab:
After damaging the Delamain Cab too much, Delamain will text V that their contract has been terminated after too much excessive damage to company property.[Notes 2]
Objectives:
Find the Delamain cab in North Oak.
Approach the Delamain cab.
Stay close to the Delamain cab.
Get in the driver's seat.
Drive the cab back to Delamain HQ.
If V drives too fast:
Slowly drive the cab back to Delamain HQ.
Get out of the cab.
Talk to Delamain.

Walkthrough:
Robert Wilson, the Weapon Vendor at the 2nd Amendment in Megabuilding H10, will hail V when they pass by, informing them that their "sweet little forty-five" is waiting for their owner.
Upon approach, V retrieves their gun for free from Robert.
Objectives: Collect your gun from Wilson.

Walkthrough:
V gets a call from Kerry Eurodyne, who invites them to the Dark Matter‚Äîan exclusive club in Japantown. When V arrives at the entrance, there is a bouncer blocking the elevator's door, claiming that it is "out of order". V tells the bouncer that he is Kerry Eurodyne's guest and the bouncer grants them access.
If Kerry forced Us Cracks to comply during the events of I Don't Wanna Hear It:
During the phone call with Kerry, V learns that Us Cracks has reneged on their promise to not perform a cover version of Kerry Eurodyne‚Äôs song User Friendly and that the band is seeking a restraining order against Eurodyne.
The Dark Matter is all but empty, and Kerry mentions that he closed the club.
If Kerry and Us Cracks amicably came to an agreement during the events of I Don't Wanna Hear It:
As V enters the lounge, a promotional event is in full swing. In the scene, packed with fans and journalists, there is initially an anime video about Us Cracks and Kerry displaying on the screen. After the screen raises, Us Cracks and Kerry appear on stage and announce that they are collaborating on a new single. A reporter says that Kerry is "on top of his game" and asks Kerry how the collaboration came to be, to which Kerry replies that rock is once more evolving, adding that Us cracks are "energizing" and "electrifying" and wanted to work on a new song with Kerry. The reporter notes that Kerry's depression is a thing of the past and Kerry denies that he was ever depressed or thought about retiring. Likewise, Us Cracks are full of praise for Kerry, and Blue Moon says that meeting Kerry was "Doki doki. Love at first sight".
V can approach them by walking through the room among the fans. Kerry will beckon V to come. After V goes there, Kerry lays his arm on V's shoulder and introduces V to the journalists as his "right hand". One of them will ask V what it is like to hang out with Kerry Eurodyne, and V can choose whether to answer. Then Kerry will ask V to leave the scene with him. Before V leaves, they can talk to Us Cracks about the event.[Notes 1]
Kerry introduces V to Spector Cheng, who promises Kerry to give V a "friends and family" discount. Kerry then leads V to the balcony on the building. V and Kerry will talk about his life and career. If V chooses to hear Kerry out, Kerry will eventually admit that he hasn‚Äôt been honest with V regarding the Us Cracks situation. Kerry reveals that the real reason why he was uncomfortable with Us Cracks performing a cover version of one of his songs was not that Kerry was afraid of becoming a puppet for corporations. What Kerry really was afraid of was being in someone else‚Äôs shadow again just like he had been in Johnny Silverhand's shadow during the Samurai years.
If V has a masculine body and voice:
V is able to kiss Kerry Eurodyne and start a romance event. After kissing, Kerry Eurodyne will stay at the rooftop a little while longer to think.
If V has a feminine body:
V is able to attempt to kiss Kerry Eurodyne, but he politely declines V's attempts, as he prefers male company instead.
V heads back down with the elevator, and departs the club.[Notes 2]
Objectives:
Go to the given address.
Talk to the bouncer.
Look for Kerry.
If there's a party at the club:
Wait for Kerry.
Talk to Kerry.
Follow Kerry.
Talk to Kerry.

Walkthrough:
Shortly after you finish Leave in Silence, Solomon Reed will contact you asking to meet at the basketball court where you first met.
If you refused Songbird's request during Somewhat Damaged:
Reed will arrive to tell you that Songbird survived but will live on as Myers's Blackwall puppet. He will fulfill his promise of a possible cure and life after the Relic, continued in Who Wants To Live Forever.
If you honored Songbird's request during Somewhat Damaged:
Reed will bitterly concede that you were ultimately right in ending Songbird's life, thus concluding the central story of Phantom Liberty.
Objectives:
Wait for Reed to contact you.
Meet with Reed.
Talk to Reed.

Walkthrough:
Zetatech employee Pedro Aimar plans to steal an automated transport from his company and sell the AV thruster parts it is carrying. He reveals to V that he has ALS, and only has a few months left to save himself by undergoing a full-body conversion. While Zetatech refused to pay for the operation, Pedro found a Soviet ripperdoc named Dr. Federov in Abakan, Siberia who claims he can perform the operation relatively cheaply, and the hundreds of thousands of eurodollars that Pedro raises from this heist will cover the costs and then some. Pedro says he has secretly tampered with Zetatech's delivery route algorithm and arranged for a transport to drive through the same area at the same time every day, and all he needs V to do is get inside the transport and insert a shard so he can remotely take over the onboard computer. Pick up Pedro's shard before leaving his motel room.
Travel to the Kenmore Diner and take a seat inside to wait until 5pm, when the Zetatech transport is scheduled to pass by. As he truck crosses the intersection outside the diner, Pedro brings it to a halt by activating traffic barriers. Get into the front passenger seat of the truck quickly (taking too long will cause several Zetatech guards to arrive on the scene), and insert the shard. Pedro takes control of the vehicle and begins driving it to the drop-off point, a Tirempire garage near Megabuilding H4. On the way, Zetatech security catches up with the stolen vehicle, engaging V in a shootout. Once the pursuers are eliminated, V must drive the truck the rest of the way to the destination manually. Park the truck and exit to complete the gig.
Objectives:
Meet with Pedro in his motel room.
Talk to Pedro.
Take the shard.
Be at the Kenmore Diner at 5 PM.
Grab a seat in the diner and wait for Pedro's call.
Take the passenger seat.
Neutralize the Zetatech guards. [Optional]
Talk to Pedro.
Slot in Pedro's shard.
Wait until the onboard computer is hacked.
Leave the car at Tirempire.
Lose the Zetatech pursuers.
Wait for instructions.
Leave the car at Tirempire.
Exit the car.
Talk to Pedro.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Mr. Hands will call V at some point after finishing Firestarter to meet him in his suite at Heavy Hearts.
Mr. Hands is also very insistent on the importance of this mission. If V has any gigs from him already started when Run This Town is started they can be completed as normal, but if V attempts to start any new gigs within Dogtown Mr. Hands will message V saying that work can wait, and insist that V meet with him. The gig that V tried to start will be locked and cannot progress.
V says they do not want to play politics and tries to leave the room:
Mr. Hands will lock the door and try to persuade V by doubling their usual rate. V can either accept and continue the quest, or decline and fail the job.
V eventually accepts the job:
Mr. Hands will provide details. Mr. Hands tells V that there are two Dogtown leader candidates: Chester Bennett, Hansen's former chief aide, and Jago Szab√≥, his head accountant. Mr. Hands prefers Bennett to be the new leader due to his military background and close connection to Hansen providing continuity, stating that Jago is "immature", and that a bookkeeper is unlikely to be a good leader in a place like Dogtown.
In order to blend in and influence Dogtown politics, Mr. Hands would like V to disguise themselves as a highly respected Cuban cartel mercenary named Aguilar Nubiola (gender depending on V's), whose organization has a close relationship with Dogtown leadership. Mr. Hands will provide V with a behavioral imprint, a replica of Aguilar's gun, and their suit.
Meeting with Jago[]
After the meeting with Mr. Hands, V goes to the meeting site of Jago and Voodoo Boys. V activates the behavioral imprint and waits for the Voodoo Boys. After dealing with the Voodoo Boys, they wait for Jago.  When Jago and his bodyguard arrive, they are surprised to see Aguilar. V, disguised as Aguilar, discourages Jago from competing for leadership, and then Jago shares some information.
V allows Jago to explain:
Jago tells V that Bennett is negotiating with a dummy company backed by Arasaka and talking about collaboration, which will unlock an optional task to meet with Bennett.
Meeting with Bennett (optional)[]
If V has allowed Jago to explain, V can go to the usual meeting site between Bennett and Arasaka. After the behavioral imprint is activated, V has to take out Bennett's bodyguard waiting near the door. Johnny will suggest that V dump the body and wait for Bennett in the car.
When Bennett finishes the meeting and gets back in the car, V turns around and faces Bennett, who is confused and then shocked to see Aguilar. Bennett will try to explain what's going on.
V threatens Bennett to cut ties with Arasaka:
Bennett will turn hostile and start attacking Aguilar (V). Since V is in Aguilar's disguise, they can only use Aguilar's replicated gun to fight back; V cannot scan or use other weapons, implants or throwables.
After Bennett is defeated, Jago will be considered the leader.
V convinces Bennett to cut ties with Arasaka and says Jago will support him after the cut:
Bennett will be convinced and V can peacefully leave. Bennett will be considered the leader.
Hansen's Wake[]
After the meetings, V goes to Black Sapphire for Hansen's wake. V activates Aguilar's disguise, enters the building and heads for the elevator.
At the wake, V meets Jago, who says he has a bad feeling since Bennett has called in extra security.
Chester Bennett[]
For Bennett to be considered the new leader of Dogtown, V will have to either skip the optional meeting or go there but not provoke him.
V did not convince Jago to give up his contacts:
Bennett becomes the new leader of Dogtown and Jago is killed.
V convinced Jago to give up his contacts and didn't stop Bennett:
Bennett becomes the new leader of Dogtown and Jago is killed.
(Reflexes 10) - V convinced Jago to give up his contacts and stopped Bennett:
Jago becomes the new leader of Dogtown and Bennett is killed.
V convinced Bennett to give up on obtaining Jago's contacts:
After V draws their weapon and says "You would plunge Dogtown into chaos?", Bennett becomes the new leader of Dogtown and Jago survives.
Jago Szab√≥[]
For Jago to be considered the new leader of Dogtown, V will have to go to the optional meeting with Bennett, prompt him to attack, and say Jago will lead.
V did not convince Bennett to give up on Terra Cognita:
Bennett becomes the new leader of Dogtown and Jago is killed.
V convinced Bennett to give up on Terra Cognita:
Jago becomes the new leader of Dogtown and Bennett survives.
V convinced Jago to give Terra Cognita to Bennett:
Jago becomes the new leader of Dogtown and Bennett survives.
Calling Mr. Hands[]
Mr. Hands will be pleased with V's work if Bennett becomes the new leader and no one is killed. Otherwise, Mr. Hands will be angry and call V "unprofessional".
Objectives:
Meet with Mr. Hands.
Talk to Mr. Hands.
Take the briefing shard.
Familiarize yourself with the job details.
Take Aguilar's imprint.
Take Aguilar's gun.
Take Aguilar's suit.
Put on Aguilar's Suit.
Look in the mirror.
Go to the place where Jago will meet with the Voodoo Boys.
Find a way to get rid of the Voodoo Boys.
If V fights the Voodoo Boys: Neutralize the Voodoo Boys.
Wait for Jago.
Meet with Bennett before Kurt Hansen's wake. (Optional)
Activate Aguilar's imprint and wait. (Optional)
Deal with Bennett's driver.
Hide the driver's body.
Get in Bennett's car.
Wait for Bennett.
If V provokes Bennett: Neutralize Bennett.
Talk to Bennett.
Step away and deactivate Aguilar's imprint.
Call Mr. Hands.
Go to the Black Sapphire.
Activate Aguilar's implant and wait for the wake to begin.
Enter the Black Sapphire.
Take the elevator up to the wake.
Attend Hansen's wake.
Talk to Jago.
Follow Jago to meet with Bennett.
Choose the new leader of Dogtown.
Leave the wake.
Take the elevator down.
Deactivate Aguilar's imprint.
Call Mr. Hands.

Walkthrough:
While speaking with Brigitte in the Voodoo Boys' Rezo Agwe subnet, V is dragged into one of Johnny's memories.
After walking onstage and grabbing the microphone, they get sucked in deeper. Several scenes flash from the Samurai performance, with a final act of Johnny firing his Malorian sidearm. After the performance ends, V experiences the memory of Johnny for the remainder of the quest.
Kerry Eurodyne and Johnny exit the stage, all the while Kerry lashes out at Johnny for being reckless and crossing the line, stating that Samurai is not just Johnny's band and that it's not a solo act.
Johnny pushes Kerry aside while saying that he is the only one with a vision for the band's future, and tells Kerry to go fuck himself, while storming inside the dressing room, looking for drugs.
Inside the dressing room, Johnny's girlfriend, Alt Cunningham awaits him, and they engage in an intimate scene together. Afterwards, Alt tells Johnny that she is done with Samurai and what the band stands for and is leaving, but couldn't ghost Johnny without saying something. Johnny's anger is sparked once again, claiming that she and Kerry are both cowards, that they are afraid of Arasaka and that only he is the only one that can stand up to Arasaka.
While Alt dresses up, Johnny searches for his drugs once more. Though Alt leaves the building first, Johnny catches up to her and tries to make amends for his behaviour. While in the back alley, they are approached by several ominous-looking thugs. Johnny tells Alt to run and reaches for his Malorian. While managing to fire a few shots, Johnny is ultimately felled by one of the thugs equipped with Mantis Blades. The last thing Johnny sees of Alt is her being taken away by the thugs in a van.
Shortly after, while seemingly on his last legs, Johnny is saved by media Lyle Thompson. Lyle manages to bring Johnny to Milt Nauman, a ripperdoc and old friend of Johnny. Several hours pass as Nauman manages to put Johnny back in one piece. While Johnny gets back on his feet, he tells Lyle that he suspects that Arasaka are the ones behind the abduction, to which Lyle responds that this may be true as she was working on software for ITS that Arasaka wanted to acquire. They set out for the Atlantis to meet with Rogue, Johnny's ex-lover and a Solo, who may be able to help with rescuing Alt.
Arriving at the Atlantis, Thompson stays in the car to wait for Johhny's return. Once inside, Johnny heads onto the second floor and speaks with Engels at the door to gain access to Rogue.
Rogue is waiting with Santiago, a Nomad, for a possible client, but there seems to be no client coming as there are several emptied bottles. Johnny suggests that they both come with him to raid Arasaka Tower in order to save Alt. They both agree, but soon after they're attacked by Arasaka goons that have swarmed the Atlantis in force. They fight their way out and meet up with Lyle outside.
While making their escape in Johnny's Porsche, and after shaking off their pursuers, they plan their attack on Arasaka Tower by staging a diversion in front of it.
Once inside Arasaka Tower, they fight their way through the Arasaka soldiers to find the mainframe. The mainframe is guarded by Akira, a skilled Arasaka agent. After neutralizing Akira, head inside the room where Alt is being kept and attempt to save her. In his anger Johnny shoots Toshiro, Alt's handler, and disconnects her prematurely, severing the connection she has with her body. While mourning the loss of Alt, Johnny gets frustrated and lashes out at Lyle, who is still recording everything, and nearly beats him to death, only being halted by Rogue.
After Rogue confirms that Alt has deceased, V is sucked out of the memory and returns to Rezo Agwe.
Objectives:
Grab the microphone.
Go to the dressing room.
Talk to Kerry.
Talk to Alt.
Look for drugs (optional).
Talk to Alt.
Protect Alt from Thugs.
Fight for your life.
Talk to the Ripperdoc.
Talk to Thompson.
Leave the ripperdoc clinic.
Go to the Atlantis.
Find Rogue.
Ask around for Rogue (optional).
Talk to the bouncer.
Find Rogue.
Sit next to Rogue.
Convince Rogue to help.
Fight for your life.
Defeat the Arasaka agents.
Escape from the Atlantis.
Call the elevator.
Enter the elevator.
Wait for Santiago and Rogue.
Take the elevator down to the parking lot.
Defeat the Arasaka agents.
Get in Johnny's Porsche.
Escape from the Arasaka agents.
Plan your next move.
Talk to the rest of the crew.
Find the mainframe.
Destroy the turret.
Destroy the turret by the door to the mainframe.
Open the door to the mainframe.
Arm the explosives.
Find Alt.
Defeat the Arasaka agents.
Check on Alt.
Talk to Thompson.

Walkthrough:
You wake up in your penthouse with the option to turn around, which will then bring the romantic partner into view who you called during Nocturne Op55N1 to say goodbye (Panam will already be in the shower; you will be alone if no one was called). After getting up, you will take a shower where you are optionally joined by Judy/Kerry/River. While having coffee in the kitchen, your optional partner will voice concerns about you and your relationship. You will then have to join your partner on the balcony, where they bid farewell before you leave to do a critical job. Your dialog choices cannot alter the basic outcomes of these dialogues: Kerry and River will promise to wait for you; the status with Panam will remain ambiguous but hopeful; Judy will break up.
Before you depart, you can check your working room. There are messages about the upcoming job on V's computer. Johnny's Samurai jacket is hanging on the wall, you can wear it.
An AV operated by Delamain (depends on the choices you've made during Don't Lose Your Mind) will pick you up and take you to the Afterlife. Once you arrived at the Afterlife, you have the option to approach bartender Claire, who will invite you to have a special drink for the coming operation. If you have taken the (Don't Fear) The Reaper path, Rogue will sit next to you, suggesting to get a Tequila to oil the cogs before the important meet-up.
You then meet with Mr. Blue Eyes in Rogue's old booth to discuss the upcoming job. The quest is to get data about clients of the Crystal Palace casino. At the end of the quest, you will be in a spaceship where you activate the auto-pilot, then leave the seat, put a helmet on, and pick up a pistol. You then enter the airlock and, after all is done, open the door and float into the space, towards the Crystal Palace.
This final scene represents the tarot card "The Sun", thereby unlocking the associated achievement.
Objectives:
Take a shower.
Get dressed. (Optional)
If V called their romantic interest at the end of Nocturne Op55N1:
Talk to [Judy/Panam/River/Kerry].
Take your jacket.
Enter the AV.
Enter the Afterlife.
Talk to Claire. (Optional)
Meet with the client.
Sit.
Talk to Mr. Blue Eyes.
Leave the cockpit.
Get armed.
Put on the helmet.
Listen to the client.
Enter the airlock.
Decompress the airlock.
Wait for the airlock decompression.
Exit the airlock and soar into the stars.

Walkthrough:
For this gig, you'll need to help smuggle out Hwangbo, a former Tyger Claws member who's now marked for death for stealing from the gang. To do so, you'll have to find him at the motel he's staying at and get him out safely.
As you can guess, once you find him, Tyger Claws show up and you'll have to either sneak your way out or gun them down. Head to his car and drive him to the meetup point where a group of nomad smugglers from the Aldecaldo clan are waiting. Hwangbo has his reservations but you can convince him they're ok, stating the fixer wouldn't do them wrong. Hwangbo will then leave in the nomad's car as Regina calls saying a job well done.
Objectives:
Find Hwangbo.
Meet with Hwangbo in room 1237.
Talk to Hwangbo.
Escort Hwangbo to the meeting with the Nomads.
Use Hwangbo's car. [Optional]
Go to the meeting point.
Talk to Hwangbo before leaving.

Walkthrough: The auto shop housing the SUV can be accessed via climbing the perimeter fence, there are multiple Valentinos patrolling the area, with several more inside the shop.
Objectives:
Go to the Valentinos' auto shop.
Find the SUV.
Enter the SUV.
Escape with the SUV.
Deliver the SUV to the nomads.
Park the SUV in the garage.
Exit the garage.
Leave the area.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite from V's perspective]
The quest starts out with a montage of your exploits with Jackie in Night City. Six months later, V find themselves in their car alongside Jackie, discussing the job they're hired to complete by Wakako Okada.
V learns that the missing woman is probably in a den of Scavengers in room 1237 of a certain apartment block. T-Bug helps unlocking the main door and disabling the security system.
Upon getting inside, you and Jackie will head through two rooms, the second of which has the corpse of a woman packed with Zetatech repros on a table. The third room will contain your first enemy, which you will need to sneak up to and either kill or knock out before throwing his body in the container in front of him. Sneak up to the area next to the main room with Jackie, where you will need to wait for two more scavs to head through. Sneak up on one of them and then kill or incapacitate him.
There are five scavs to deal with in the main room, which you can take out however you like. You will also need to deal with the Scav Leader, who is packing some serious heat in the form of a Militech Mk. 31 HMG, which can and will kill you in seconds if you're open to him. Either take cover and blast him with whatever weapons you got off the scavs until he's dead, take the route that T-Bug gives you and provide cover fire so that Jackie can tackle and incapacitate him, or use a quickhack to distract him using the light in his chamber before sneaking up and dealing with him however you wish.
Once you've gotten past the scavengers, you and Jackie enter a bathroom on the other side of the apartment. In a bathtub you will find the missing woman, whose name is Sandra Dorsett, packed in ice with a dead man. While alive, she is medically unstable and requires you to save her using an AirHypo when she starts flatlining. After removing the GPS jammer which prevented Sandra's Trauma Team Platinum alert from activating, carry Sandra to the balcony where Trauma Team will arrive via an Atlus AV, order you to place Sandra on the stretcher they lay down and then extract her. You and Jackie must then leave using another elevator. Contact Wakako and tell her the job is done. It doesn't matter which of the options you pick.
On the drive back to V's home at Megabuilding H10 in Watson, you and Jackie will be ambushed by a van full of more scavengers. There are four scavs to deal with, two of whom open fire from the rear doors, another of whom fires on you upon opening a side door later on during the attack, and the driver. Deal with them quickly by shooting them with your pistol so you don't take too much damage, though if you don't take out all four scavs, the van will eventually crash and kill them all regardless.
You will then arrive at a NCPD blockade at the border of Watson, though Jackie will be able to convince an officer to let you pass, and then drive until you see a situation involving some gangoons running foul of a MaxTac squad and getting slaughtered. Finally, Jackie will drop you off before leaving to see his girlfriend. Head up to your apartment, where you will have the option to check your stash. Lying down on the bed will end the quest.
Objectives:
Follow Jackie.
Enter the elevator with Jackie.
Talk to T-Bug.
Follow Jackie.
Head to the apartment.
Hack the door.
Follow Jackie.
Examine the woman's body.
Get to the next room.
Find Sandra Dorsett.
Sneak up to the scavenger. [Optional]
Neutralize the scavenger. [Optional]
Hide the body in freezer. [Optional]
Hide from the scavengers. [Optional]
Wait while staying unnoticed. [Optional]
Neutralize the scavenger. [Optional]
Use the path marked by T-Bug. [Optional]
Defeat the scavenger leader.
Talk to T-Bug.
Examine the body.
Save Sandra.
Carry Sandra to the terrace.
Wait by the door to the terrace.
Wait for Trauma Team.
Place Sandra on the stretcher.
Wait for Trauma Team to help Sandra.
Talk to Jackie.
Enter the elevator.
Talk to Jackie.
Call Wakako.
Talk to Wakako.
Get into the passenger seat.
Ride back with Jackie.
Defeat the scavengers.
Ride back with Jackie.
Exit the car.
Go home.
Check your weapons stash. [Optional]
Go to bed.

Walkthrough:
After obtaining the high-score in Trauma Drama, you are contacted by Macroware, the developers of the arcade game.
Macroware instructs you to visit the Trauma Team netpage from your computer and navigate to the "We want YOU!" tab, and apply for an unpaid internship with Trauma Team. This can be done after logging in under "Trauma Drama Member Access" and signing in. On the "We want YOU!" page you can apply.
After applying, go to MedCenter to collect your rewards, a Trauma Team uniform and a Mini Trauma Team AV that can be displayed in your apartment
Objectives:
Read the message from Macroware.
Go to the Trauma Team netpage on your computer.
Go to the MedCenter to collect your consolation prize.
Scan your hand to confirm your identity.
Collect your consolation prize.

Walkthrough:
Indira Barazza has fallen victim to blackmail by Milko Alexis, a Netrunner affiliated with the Voodoo Boys. He's threatened to hack Indira's lungs if she refuses to comply with their demands. The victim reached out to Mr. Hands, who in turn hired V to resolve the situation and neutralize the threat.
V travels to Milko's base of operations in Dogtown, the Luxor High Wellness Spa, in order to make direct contact with Milko and deal with those that stand in their way.
If V encounters and talks with the supplier:
While navigating through the base, V encounters their supplier, who has a deal with the Voodoo Boys and supplies them with implants used for research purposes. V then asks if he knows about Milko's whereabouts, to which he responds that he doesn't.
If V chastises the supplier for his lack of thanks:
The supplier argues back, claiming that he had the situation under control until V showed up.
If V intimidates the supplier with physical force:[N 1]
V pushes the supplier against the wall to coerce him into talking. He still refuses, prompting V to punch him in the face until he finally shares what he knows.
The supplier explains that the Voodoo Boys take most of the implants and dismantle them in order to study their software and research new exploits. The leftover implants are installed in old combat robots. Of these robots, one in particular has proven useful to them.
He then offers to patch into the server room where the robots are kept and sabotage the servers to render them explosive.
If V offers a bribe of ‚Ç¨$500:
V attempts to bribe the supplier into divulging information with 500 eurodollars. He accepts the money, explains the purpose of the implants, and offers to sabotage the server room where the robots are stored.
V enters the server room, where a group of Robot R Mk.2s are deployed to eliminate the intruder. After V neutralizes the squad leader,[N 2] all of the other robots in the server room self-destruct and the emergency exit protocol is engaged. V follows the emergency exit hallway to find another man standing alongside a jacked-in Milko. He introduces himself as Alan No√´l, an undercover NetWatch agent tasked with infiltrating the Voodoo Boys' ranks.
He explains that his mission was to dismantle their criminal network from within, and that he needs Milko alive so that he can piggyback off of his connection and glean as much information as possible. He asks for V to spare Milko in order to continue his mission.
If V spares Milko and Alan:
After V leaves the Voodoo Boys hideout, they receive a call from Mr. Hands. He informs V that Indira Barazza was just added to NetWatch's witness protection list, guarding her against virtually any potential attack.
Mr. Hands pays you an extra ‚Ç¨$8,000 for your efforts.
Later on V gets a message from  Alan No√´l where he informs V about successful operation of uncovering a puppet master behind blackmail criminal network and invites V to get her hands on some stuff he left for her near Voodoo Boys' base in Luxor Heights, Dogtown. This message trigger side quest Corpo Of The Month that rewards V with some rewards, including a Netrunner skill shard.
If V refuses Alan's offer:
V declines Alan's offer, instead neutralizing him and Milko in order to fulfill the contract as originally planned.
Objectives:
Get inside the Voodoo Boys' base.
Find Milko Alexis.
Talk to the supplier. [Optional]
Neutralize Milko Alexis.
Talk to the Netrunner. [Optional]
Leave the Voodoo Boy's base.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Write from V's perspective]
The Clean Cut clinic has three security cameras and a handful of Maelstrom gang members patrolling the area. Lucy is in the far back left room, trying to save one of the gang's badly-injured members, Hans Otto. Despite being held against her will though, she's fully committed in trying to save him and tries to get you to help her.
If you agree to help, instead of continuing with the dialogue, follow her instructions, namely scanning the guy with your optics when asked and then getting the synthetic blood from the table nearby and applying it to the Maelstrom member. You can then talk for a moment before she'll finally leave with you.
If you aren't interested in helping, shooting the patient will also convince Lucy to leave with you.
Objectives:
Go to the Clean Cut building.
Find Lucy.
Talk to Lucy Thackery.
Persuade Lucy to leave.
Scan the patient. [Optional]
Pick up the synthetic blood. [Optional]
Inject the patient with synthetic blood. [Optional]
Escort Lucy Thackery outside.
Escort Lucy to the fixer's transport.

Walkthrough:
As long as the ending path ends with V connecting into Mikoshi (hence this excludes the Arasaka and Phantom Liberty paths), the player will be presented with this mission.
Changes can start in one of two ways, which depends on the choice the player makes regarding Jackie's body after The Heist. However, the mission will open up in similar fashion; V will be presented with a vision of them going to the ninth floor behind Misty's shop, as is what happened during the third half of Nocturne Op55N1.
If V took Jackie's body to Viktor Vektor after thus resulting in Arasaka stealing his engram, V will be given one last chance to talk to him.
If V took Jackie's body to Mama Welles or if the body was left in the Delamain Cab they escaped on, upon exiting into the roof, V finds their bullet necklace and takes it as the world around them fades away.
Either way, this will lead to the cyberspace inside Mikoshi. Alt Cunningham will recite a poem (both listed below) as V walks towards the beam of light, taking them into another section of cyberspace. After doing so, V will have a talk.
If the mission prior to this is Belly of the Beast or (Don't Fear) The Reaper, V will talk to Johnny Silverhand.
If the previous mission was Knockin' on Heaven's Door, the opposite will happen, as Johnny by that point had taken control of V's body.
The conversation soon shifts into a shocking realization for V; with Alt having separated their and Johnny's psyches throughout the raid on Arasaka Tower, the extended exposure to Johnny's construct has irreparably damaged their body. Alt gives them a choice; return to their body with six months to live, or let Johnny keep their body.
What follows after Changes if V returns to their body depends on the previous mission. If the previous mission was (Don't Fear) The Reaper or Knockin' on Heaven's Door, Changes will always lead to Path of Glory. If the previous mission was Belly of the Beast, the next mission will be All Along the Watchtower.
If Changes ends with Johnny keeping their body, the mission will always lead to New Dawn Fades, disregarding the previous mission and any ending path.
Objectives:
Go to the roof.
If Jackie was not delivered to Viktor at the end of The Heist:
Pick up the necklace.
If Jackie was delivered to Viktor Vektor at the end of The Heist:
Talk to Jackie.
If the previous mission was Belly of the Beast or (Don't Fear) The Reaper:
Talk to Johnny.
Enter the well to return to your body.
If the previous mission was Knockin' on Heaven's Door:
Talk to V.
Enter the well to return to V's body.
Cross the bridge and enter cyberspace forever.
Touch Alt to leave with her into the unknown.

Walkthrough:
After installing Patch 2.0 or newer, V will receive a call from Viktor Vektor that new cyberware software has hit the market, and has become available to them.
V can then proceed to visit any Ripperdoc to install their software update, in the form of a tutorial that informs about all the changes made to the Cyberware interface in Patch 2.0.
At the Ripperdoc, V has to install a Kiroshi "Sentry" Optics, Smart Link, and Subdermal Armor for free. After doing so, the quest will complete.
Objectives:
Talk to Viktor/Read the message from Viktor.
Install the cyberware update at any ripperdoc clinic.

Walkthrough:
About a day after returning Jake Estevez's pickup truck, V is contacted by Jake and instructed to go to a garage at the cargo station in Rancho Coronado, Santo Domingo.
Once at the garage, V can get behind the wheel of their new Quadra Turbo-R V-Tech.
Objectives:
Go to the garage near the cargo station.
Get in the car.
Leave the area.

Walkthrough:
After completing all of Mr. Hands's gigs in Pacifica and Dogtown, V is asked to return to Heavy Hearts Club for a reward. After talking with Mr. Hands outside the club, V will be rewarded with the Quadra Sport R-7 "Sterling".

Walkthrough: This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Objectives:
Get inside the Militech base.
Find the radar van P9D/2.161.
Steal the mobile radar P9D/2.161.
Deliver the P9D/2.161 radar to Dakota's garage.
Leave the garage.

Walkthrough:
The quest triggers upon discovering one of the four Tarot Card murals in Dogtown.
The King of Cups is found near the main entrance to Dogtown in the parking lot of northern Coastview.
The King of Pentacles is found on a wall on the upper floors of the Kress Street Hideout building in Longshore Stacks.
The King of Wands is found on the basketball court at the Tranquil Terrace in Luxor Heights.
The King of Swords is found on an exterior wall on the northeastern side of The Moth building in Longshore Stacks.
While searching for the cards, you can talk to Misty Olszewski about any that you have found. Once all four have been collected, she can be consulted to give a reading.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite]
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
As you progress through the main storyline, V will get chances to talk to Johnny, and try to understand him. During the initial phase he will be aggressive and argumentative. Over time, if V does not take the pseudoendotrizine and takes the time to talk to him, they will learn about his hatred for corporations for manipulating civilization to their own ends.
Objectives:
First phase:
Talk to Johnny.
Second phase:
Talk to Johnny.
Take the pseudoendotrizine. [Optional]
Third phase:
Sit and rest.
Talk to Johnny.
Fourth phase:
Talk to Johnny.
Last phase:
Talk to Johnny.
Enter through the window.
Open the cache.
Talk to Johnny.
Leave the hotel through the window.

Walkthrough:
When you go to Brendan's usual location outside Megabuilding H8, you will find an upset Theo Price is standing where his unit used to be. She'll explain that Brendan's owners had him taken away to "re-evaluate" his code, dismissing her pleas that he was a true friend and more than a simple S.C.S.M. unit.
At the SoftSys shop in Heywood, you can either bribe or convince (requires Technical Ability) the clerk to receive access to the room where Brendan is receiving a firmware update. Once in the room, Brendan notes he's being updated because he mentioned someone's marital troubles and the person didn't like that very much (you can also see this message on the computer next to him confirming it). With sufficient Technical Ability, you can deduce that Brendan is not a true AI, but instead possessed an exceptional convo-emulating algorithm to facilitate his interactions with visitors. He'll then ask you to tell Theo a message from him and give you one last joke if you wish.
Return to Theo to pass along Brendan's message to conclude the job.
Objectives:
Go to the service point.
Talk to the clerk. [Optional]
Find Brendan.
Talk to Brendan.
Talk to Theo.

Walkthrough:
After completing all of Wakako Okada's gigs in Westbrook, V is contacted once more by her so that she can thank them. Head over to the Stash in your apartment and collect the Byakko katana.
List of Prerequisites[]
Tier 1:
Gig: Tyger and Vulture
Gig: We Have Your Wife
Tier 2:
Gig: Greed Never Pays
Gig: Olive Branch
Gig: Until Death Do Us Part
Tier 3:
Gig: Getting Warmer...
Gig: Wakako's Favorite
Tier 4:
Gig: A Shrine Defiled
Objectives: Collect your reward.

Walkthrough: In a Northside warehouse in the northeastern part of Watson, Johnny Silverhand will appear near a Quadra Type-66 "Hoon", a weaponized vehicle. Behind this car is a metal shelf that has collapsed, covering a small container. The key to the Quadra is inside this container.
Objectives:
Search the warehouse.
Get in the car.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: This isn't how a walkthrough should be written on this wiki. Don't write a gameplay walkthrough, but write a story walkthrough. Don't use bullet points, use {{Condition}} instead.]
After starting You Know My Name, V is contacted by Mr. Hands that he has received an interesting item of business. Lina Malina, a local Braindance celebrity, claims that she has been kidnapped and is currently held against her will in a rental studio by the name of Brainporium.
Brainporium can be found atop Jason Exiled in Dogtown, Pacifica.
Inside the Brainporium, V can find Edgar Tool, a man being held captive in a room claiming that he's Lina Malina. V can ask Shank who's standing guard outside about what's going on, and Shank will lead V upstairs to can explain the situation. Alternatively, V can convince Shank to let Tool go, or use the code 1111 on the door, though this will end the mission early with no rewards beyond a thank you kiss from "Lina."
Shank will explain that Tool has been a big fan of Lina, but that after a power outage while watching one of Lina's BD's, Tool now believes himself to be Lina. After talking to Shank about Tool's situation, V is directed to Lina's apartment. Before she enters, a group of Scavs will be scattered around the area guarding the place. V has the option to:
Take out all the Scavs (If you hide their bodies Lina will act like they left, unaware of the bloodshed)
Explain to them the situation and get them to leave (StreetKid only)
Break in from an industrial shutter (20 Tech) or from the top of her apartment, then read about her schedule. V can use Lina's schedule to have the Scavs leave without bloodshed.
Either way, V will need the Scavs to leave and wait until dark. Lina will be disappointed by the disappearance of her guards when she arrives and V will have some options to convince her for the shoot:
Telling Lina the truth about Tool's condition will fail the quest.
You can pay her ‚Ç¨$10,000 to participate in the braindance.
You can send her the picture you took of Kerry Eurodyne and Us Cracks to persuade her if I Don't Wanna Hear It has been completed.
She can be convinced by mentioning Rachel Casich if They Won't Go When I Go has been completed.
A Corpo V has an option to convince Lina to participate in the BD shoot.
With a high enough intelligence, you can hack the computer on her kitchen wall and add in the BD shoot to her schedule yourself. When Lina arrives, you can tell her that you've been sent by her agent to make sure she knows, which after checking her schedule she accepts without any further convincing.
Shank will arrange for the shoot the next day, and V can sleep the night at the nearby Kress Street Apartment. After reaching the Brainporium V finds Lina and Tool arguing, requiring V to direct the BD shoot.
Directing Lina to "Tell him that he's your sister" results in the best BD. Lina will leave Baby Boomer, and later gift you the Malina-mobile.
Directing Lina to "Convince him that he's a clone created by the FIA" results in an okay BD, but no further shoots. Lina will leave Baby Boomer, and later gift V Lina Malina's T-shirt.
Sending Tool's letter as Lina's lines result in a bad BD, with Lina leaving, but Tool restored to himself.
V has the option of calling either Viktor Vektor or Judy √Ålvarez about the situation. Either one will give the advice of inducing cognitive dissonance, and a new side objective to find an item with personal importance to Tool will appear.
Objectives:
Rescue Lina from the BD store.
Find Lina Malina.
Talk to the strangers in the basement.
If V frees Tool from the basement:

Talk to Tool.
Message Mr. Hands to tell him the job is done.

If V follows Shank:

Follow Shank.
Talk to Shank.
Find Lina at her residence.
Text Viktor for advice about Tool. [Optional]
Text Judy for advice about Tool. [Optional]
Find something that carries sentimental value for Tool. [Optional]
Scan the letter in the basement. [Optional]
Talk to Edgar. [Optional]
Find Lina Malina.

If V talks to the Scavengers:

Persuade the gangers to leave.
If V engages the Scavengers:

Dispose of the gangers.
Hide the bodies. [5] [Optional]

Wait for Lina.
Convince Lina to participate in the BD shoot.
Message Shank to let him know Lina has agreed.
Wait until tomorrow for Shank's message.
Read Shank's message.
Return to Shank.
Observe the BD shoot.
Take charge of the BD shoot.
If V tells Malina to tell Tool that he is her sister:

Talk to Lina Malina.
Talk to Shank.
Loot Baby Boomer from the counter.
Read Lina's messages.
Go to the Brainporium to collect Lina's gift.
If V tells Malina to convince Tool that he is an FIA clone:

Talk to Lina Malina.
Talk to Shank.
Loot Baby Boomer from the counter.
Read Lina's message.
Go to the Brainporium to collect Lina's gift.
If V tells Malina to read Tool's Letter:

Read the message from Shank.

Associated Shards[]
"Rolling with the scavs" - scriptv.02_final_finalBraindance Quarterly: latest previewsBraindance SelectionBrainporium - Rental PolicyLetter from a fanLina Malina's BathwaterTool's Letter
Notes[]
Completing the quest will result in Brainporium permanently closing.
If you broke into Lina's apartment, she sends V a text message about it, wanting to desperately leave Dogtown.
If you hide a corpse in Lina's fridge, she texts you to ask if you know anything about it.
Sending Tool's Letter as the script will cause Lina to leave the BD shoot disgruntled.
This option will result in Johnny providing positive feedback to the player. However, Lina will not send a message to V, no gifts will be rewarded.
The "sister" option leads to continued BDs with Lina and TooLina, and them heading to Night City. Depending on how the Sinnerman questline ends, Rachel Casich will message V about their pitch for the "Lina & Toolina" show.
If the job Sweet Dreams was completed prior to starting Dazed and Confused, V will compare Tool's state to what happened to them because of Stefan's BD when texting Victor.
Trivia[]
The quest is named after the 1967 song "Dazed and Confused" by Jake Holmes.

Walkthrough:
V is tasked with finding and escorting the client, Tiny Mike, out of a Kabuki housing block alive, as he is being hunted by Militech for stealing data from a lab in the Badlands for Regina.
A stealthy path to Tiny Mike's location involves entering the block via a fire escape. Two locals loitering on the perimeter will point out that the fire escape can be reached by climbing a nearby vending machine and jumping from some pipes. Once on the fire escape, climb to the second level instead of entering the open window, and follow the catwalk. Watch out for a Militech drone on the ground to the left which has a partial view of the catwalk, and two Militech soldiers guarding an open apartment along the way. At the end of the catwalk, jump down and continue heading forward to a ladder close by. Climb up and head straight to enter the third floor of the building where Tiny Mike is hiding.
Tiny Mike is in an apartment on the second floor, in the bathroom. When prompted, grab his air hypo from the desk and give it to him, which gives him the strength to move, but not to help in any fighting. He allows V to take his personal weapon, the Hypercritical, which is sitting on the sink, to make up for it. Next, follow him downstairs, where he gives V the option to let him open up an alternate exit through an adjacent restaurant. Going through Tiny Mike's escape route is faster and avoids any remaining guards, but three Militech soldiers may still be patrolling outside the restaurant. It is possible to eliminate each of them quietly, but their patrol routines do allow a brief window where none of them are looking directly at the restaurant's entrance.
However V and Tiny Mike escape the block, enter the vehicle that Regina sent to leave the area and complete the gig
Objectives:
Get inside the lockdown area.
Use emergency stairs. [Optional]
Go to Tiny Mike's hideout.
Find Tiny Mike. (He's in the bathroom)
Talk to Tiny Mike.
Take the inhaler from Tiny Mike's backpack.
Give the inhaler to Tiny Mike. (You can give him one of your own)
Talk to Tiny Mike.
Take gun. [Optional]
Follow Tiny Mike.
Talk to Tiny Mike.
Escort Tiny Mike to the fixer's transport.
Lead Tiny Mike to the restaurant. [Optional]
Get in the car with Tiny Mike.

Walkthrough:
After meeting with the Voodoo Boys, V is contacted by Judy √Ålvarez, who asks them to come over as soon as possible.[N 1]
As V arrives at the apartment building on Charter street in Northside, Watson, they enter her apartment, and get immediately called over to the bathroom by Judy.
Inside the bathroom, V is encountered with a gruesome scene. Judy's friend and your former client, Evelyn Parker, committed suicide. Judy explains that she was away at the time when it happened, and is unable to forgive herself for leaving the apartment. Wanting to go through the proper channels, Judy calls the NCPD to report the incident, and asks that V carries Evelyn's body to the bedroom.
While V carries Evelyn's body to the bedroom, Judy is giving the NCPD an earful, as they appear to not have the time to come over to the apartment and investigate the suicide. After hanging up, Judy joins V in the bedroom and asks that V leaves the room while she takes care of her friend.
Moment pass, and Judy and V find themselves on the roof of the apartment building, passing the time. Judy asks V for a cigarette, which they take from Evelyn's cigarette case. Visibly emotional, Judy tells V that they can keep the cigarette case, as she thinks they like having it.
Judy will note to V that Fingers, the ripperdoc they met with earlier, had Evelyn for four days, and will also note that she talked with Tom Caldera from Clouds, who has told her that Evelyn had been missing from the place for a full week. Unable to sleep because she didn't know what happened to Evelyn during those three missing days, she dug deeper in the virtus she recovered from Evelyn's recording implant, trying to uncover more information. Judy was able to find out that Oswald Forrest, the manager of Clouds, kept her for those three days and had his way with her, before selling her off to the Scavengers.
Unsure with how to proceed, Judy asks that V leaves them alone for now so they can think on how to proceed, and promises to stay in touch with V.[N 2]
Objectives:
Go to Judy's apartment.
Talk to Judy.
Lift up Evelyn.
Carry Evelyn to the bedroom.
Lay down Evelyn on the bed.
Wait for Judy to finish.
Talk to Judy.
Leave the bedroom.
Close the bedroom door.
Talk to Judy.
Leave the building.

Walkthrough:
To unlock this side quest, do not side with Maiko or don't take her money in Pisces:
Some time after the events at Clouds, Judy calls V to meet her at an abandoned shack near Laguna Bend Reservoir at sunrise.
Once V arrives, Judy explains what she wants to do here. She tells V that she wants to go diving in the lake where the shack is located, and record a braindance of them doing so. V agrees to do so, and puts on a diving suit. After V puts on a braindance scroller, which links their brains, they dive into the lake together. While in the water, V calibrates their suit by swimming around Judy, then swimming backwards, then finally letting her hum a song to check auditory responses.
Once calibrated, Judy and V use a pole to dive down to Laguna Bend, Judy's old hometown that has since been flooded. Judy will talk about the different locations they come across, while V has the opportunity to locate and scan a few objects, with memories of Judy's childhood playing in their head throughout. They first come across a restaurant and her home, in which V can scan and talk about the restaurant's sign, an old photo, and a hockey stick. V can also pick up and give Judy an old camera nearby. They then come across a gas station, in which V can scan and talk about an umbrella, a doll, and an abandoned car.
After moving on from the gas station, they come across a church. V must find a way into the church. After finding a way inside the church, Judy begins talking about her memories near the altar. While she is doing so, V's relic malfunctions, causing them to pass out.
V wakes up on the dock to Judy performing CPR on V, and Judy is relieved when V wakes up. She then offers for V to stay the night at the house. V goes into the house with Judy afterwards. Soon after, V must go outside to start the generator to power the house. While outside, V will hear Judy's memories of Evelyn Parker. When V returns, Judy will have gone to the bathroom. V enters to check in on her, and Judy talks about what happened as a result of the raid on Clouds.
If V is female and chooses to romance Judy:
V gets affectionate with Judy. Judy takes V to the bedroom, and they have sex on the bed. V wakes up in the morning with Judy beside them, although she gets out of the bed before V wakes up.
After V dresses, she meets Judy sitting on the dock. Judy asks V what they think their day prior meant to V.
If V chooses "A pleasant distraction":
Judy becomes upset, and she will immediately leave not just the area, but Night City as a whole, and delete V from her contacts.
If V chooses any other option:
Judy and V form a couple, causing Judy to stay in Night City. She gives V access to her apartment through personal link, allowing them to visit at any time.
If V is male or chooses not to kiss Judy:
Judy goes to bed once they finish talking in the bathroom.
If V goes to bed instead of leaving:
V wakes up the next morning and meets Judy sitting on the dock. She will explain to them that she is leaving Night City, and gives V access to her now vacant apartment.
Objectives:
Meet Judy in the early evening.
Talk to Judy.
Go to the lake's edge with Judy.
Take the wetsuit.
Connect to the terminal.
Wait for Judy to calibrate your gear.
Dive into the water.
Follow Judy.
Calibrate your gear.
Stand in position.
Circle around Judy.
Go back.
Talk to Judy.
Follow Judy.
Search for clues near the diner and Judy's house. [4] [Optional]
Follow Judy.
Search for clues near the gas station. [3] [Optional]
Follow Judy.
Look for a path into the church.
Go to the cottage.
Enter the cottage.
Talk to Judy.
Start the generator.
Check on Judy.
Grab your clothes.
Find Judy.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite from V's perspective using 3rd person]
From the beginning of Act 2, on the floor below your apartment, you can find two police officers knocking on the door of Barry Lewis's apartment. Barry, an ex-cop who's so distraught over his friend's death that he left the force, has holed up in his apartment due to severe depression. Nadia Petrova and Juan Mendez will eventually see you and ask if you can see what's going on with Barry as he's refusing to answer them. You can try to knock on his door now, but Barry will refuse to answer, so come back in a few hours to try again.
This time Barry will answer and eventually let you in, talking about a really bad case he had to work that got swept under the rug and losing his close friend, Andrew, made it worse for him.
At this point you can either talk to his friends who are nearby, or go visit the columbarium in North Oak to learn more. If you choose to not visit the grave and talk to the cops, Barry will end up losing his life to suicide and you'll later find a distraught Mendez outside his apartment.
If you don't want to fail the quest, head out to the grave to learn Andrew wasn't a person, but actually a pet turtle. You can then confront the police officers with this information, in which case Mendez will open up to Barry about his own tough cases and talk to Barry.
Objectives:
Talk to the cops.
Talk to Barry.
Try talking to Barry in a few hours.
Try talking to Barry.
Find Andrew's niche before talking to the cops. [Optional]
Talk to Johnny. [Optional]
Talk to the cops.
Check on Barry.

A vehicle is stranded within a minefield, as well as a small handful of aggressive drones. A fairly easy gig initially as you work through the minefield and drones as there are no human opponents, you just need to be careful with scanning.
Just carefully pick your way through the field disarming everything in site and destroying the drones as soon as you can see them, and you can reach the vehicle safely and easily.[N 1]

Find the vehicle.
Approach the vehicle.
Get in the vehicle.
Examine the body. [Optional]
Get rid of the pursuers.
Deliver the vehicle to the garage.
Park in the garage.
Exit the vehicle.

Walkthrough:
When V is on Farrier street, behind Megabuilding H10, they hear a moaning man with no pants on holding his crotch. When inquired about what is wrong, the man, Jesse Johnson, will tell V that their Mr. Studd implant is having a malfunction and that they need to visit a ripperdoc as soon as possible.
If V decides to help Jesse:
Jesse instructs V to drive him to the nearest ripperdoc clinic operated by Cassius Ryder in Northside. While on their way there, there are several roadblocks that hinder their travel.
If V manages to get to the clinic in time:
V was able to drive Jesse to Cassius's clinic in time, ensuring Jesse's survival. Jesse called V some time after the operation, letting them know the operation was successful and that they are thankful for V's help. As a reward, he transfer them a payment of 1940 eurodollars.
If V fails to get to the clinic in time:
V was unable to drive Jesse to Cassius's clinic in time, as the implant exploded during travel, causing the man to die from his injuries. A niche dedicated to Jesse was installed at the Columbarium in North Oak, Westbrook.
If V leaves Jesse:
Jesse will die from the implant's malfunction. A niche dedicated to Jesse was installed at the Columbarium in North Oak, Westbrook.
Objectives:
Find out what's wrong with the distressed man.
Decide whether or not to help.
Grab a car and pick up the distressed man.
Take the distressed man to a ripperdoc.
Stop in front of the ripperdoc clinic.
Wait for a call from the distressed man.
Talk to the distressed man.

Walkthrough:
This quest will be given around 24 hours after completing Unfinished Sympathy. V will receive a text message from an unknown number telling them to "Return to the place that reminds me of home and see what you find," being Tranquil Terrace, where V could optionally meet with Song So Mi in Birds with Broken Wings.
V searches for a small container, and finds one next to a chair. Inside is a Quantum Tuner and a Metal pin. The mission ends after obtaining these items.
Objectives:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Read the message from the unknown sender.
Search the area around the provided coordinates.
Collect the contents of the container.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
V is tasked with eliminating Blake Croyle, a high-ranking Animals gang member who forcibly took over a clinic in Kabuki, in order to reclaim it for the client and original owner, Roger Wang.
V will later find out through computer messages that Roger had initially contacted Blake to discuss the possibility of taking out a loan, but an agreement was never reached. Despite this, Blake claimed Roger still owed him a debt for the use of his time, and for the "business advice" he provided, while revealing the fact that he knew Roger's daughter had recently gotten pregnant and lives in Kabuki.
Roger recognized the thinly veiled threat and wired the money immediately, hoping to settle matters once and for all. However, Blake was still not satisfied and pressured him into surrender his clinic as well. Again, Roger seemingly complied without protest.
Unbeknownst to Blake though, this time Roger had also hired fixer Regina Jones to deal with him permanently.
Objectives:
Go to the store seized by Blake.
Find Blake.
Neutralize Blake.
Carry Blake to the fixer's transport.
Put Blake in the fixer's transport.
Leave.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Should be written from V's perspective as a story walkthrough, anything else should go into the notes]
Meet with Sergei Karasinsky and he will tell you to drive a car to the Tyger Claws as a peace offering. He implies that the peace offering is more than just a car, but he does not elaborate and leaves after unlocking the garage containing the car.
When you enter the garage for the car, you can inspect the trunk immediately or ignore it. If you do not inspect the trunk before driving the car, you will hear pleas from the trunk while driving. If you open the trunk anytime before getting to the restaurant, you will find Alex Pushkin, a Biotechnica employee who refused an offer from the Tyger Claws and whom Sergei kidnapped to give to them to buy a pardon.
If you open the trunk and talk to Alex, you will have the option to either free him or close the trunk and deliver him to the Tyger Claws. If you are a Nomad and have previously completed Gig: Guinea Pigs, an additional dialogue option will appear that reveals Alex worked with Joanne Koch on testing a new product in the Badlands that killed dozens of members of the Red Ocher nomad clan; Alex expresses no remorse for his role in the tragedy and likens the victims to roaches.
If you deliver Alex and the car to the Tyger Claws' restaurant as contracted, the gig is successfully completed. Wakako Okada will additionally praise you for your discretion if you did not free Alex. Otherwise, he will pay you double what Sergei would have given you. Wakako will be surprised that you showed mercy to a corpo and left Sergei holding the bag, but remarks that Sergei was simply outbid and closes the contract.
If anything is done to antagonize the Tyger Claws while delivering Alex to the restaurant, they will turn hostile and an objective to kill them is given. After this is completed, the quest can only be finished by freeing Alex.
Alternatively, you can kill Alex yourself or attempt to drive him out of Night City, but both actions result in failing the gig and disappointing Wakako.
Objectives:
Meet Sergei at the designated location.
Talk to Sergei Karasinsky.
Get into the garage.
Get in the car.
Drive Sergei's car to the Tyger Claws' restaurant.
Defeat the Tyger Claws in the diner.
Talk to the man in the trunk. [Optional]

Some time after rescuing Bill Mitchel, he will message V.[Notes 1] Mitchel invites V over to his newly opened scopdog stand at Coyoacan in The Glen. As a reward for saving him, Mitchel offers V a reward in the form of 2,000 eddies, which V can decline, giving access to his wares.[Notes 2].
Objectives:
Read the message from Bill.
Meet with Bill in the Glen.
Talk to Bill.

Walkthrough:
Regina Jones sends V to the Kashuu Hanten eatery in Little China, a front for a Tyger Claws operated illegal casino, to retrieve an implant a man named Jacob Lamb gambled away.
After arriving in front of the eatery, V can take the alley to the right and enter through the back door guarded by a Racketeer. Once inside, there is a Kunoichi around the corner to the left and the implant is locked in the storage room. The door can be forced open passing a Body check. Otherwise, scanning it will add the optional objective to find the bar staff key. Either way, after opening the door, V can take the implant, leave through the back door and deposit it in the Drop Point to complete the gig.
Alternatively, if V checks the file on the computer, they will find out the Tyger Claws have been using their own implants to rig the games and win against the gamblers. This will add the optional objective of blackmailing the bartender. To do so, V must leave through the alley and return to the front door. Once confronted with the acquired evidence, the bartender will give Jacob Lamb's implant to V, but says they are both not welcome there anymore.
Objectives:
Go to the Kashuu Hanten bar in Little China.
Find Jacob Lamb's implant.
If V scans the locked door:
Find the bar staff key. [Optional]
If V finds the Kashuu Hanten Keycard or opens the door forcibly:
Steal Jacob Lamb's eye.
If V reads the computer file:
Blackmail the bartender to give you the implant. [Optional]
If V blackmails Keisuke Kagawa:
Wait for the bartender to bring the implant.
Deposit the implant in the Drop Point.

Walkthrough:
Head to the Afterlife and look for Rogue Amendiares, Night City's top fixer and Johnny Silverhand's ex-lover. Asking her about Anders Hellman results in Rogue demanding money in exchange for her help. After paying her and waiting a day, Rogue provides V with an information Shard. V slots it in, learning that the Kang-Tao transport is carrying an anonymous person, presumed to be Hellman. In order to take down the AV and interrogate Hellman, V must first recruit a driver named Panam Palmer, a nomad merc who can help. Rogue states that V must help Panam get her car back in exchange.
After contacting Panam and meeting up with her at the Rancho Coronado Container Freight Station, V explains the situation, offering info on Panam's cargo in return. She demands to know the location of her car, which V reveals is in Rocky Ridge. Panam agrees on the condition that they get her car first. She also explains that her partner, Nash, stole her vehicle and their cargo and plans to sell it in Rocky Ridge.
Panam calls the client, Boz, and agrees to meet over the phone. Panam explains she used to drive for Boz, a 6th Street gang member she refers to as a "good guy." They must go to the Aldecaldo Camp to pick up her friends to help.
Upon arriving at the camp, V meets Scorpion and Mitch, two of Panam's friends. The two tell Panam that Saul, the camp's leader, has order them to watch the generators until they are brought online, barring them from helping. However, Mitch offers the duo to take any gear they might need instead.
Panam and V arrive at the ghost town of Rocky Ridge. Panam checks the substation while V scan's the power source and fusebox. Panam plans to use the substation to confuse the Raffen with the traffic lights. They wait for the Raffen to approach and commence with the plan. After the Raffen have been disposed of and they have recovered Panam's car, Panam states that they need to track down Nash. Here, V can choose to help Panam or not.
If V decides to help Panam:
Panam explains that she granted Nash her trust, and he betrayed her. Her and V go to the Raffen Shiv's hideout to hunt him down.
While driving, they discuss the plan to meet the 6th street gang at the Sunset Motel. They arrive at the motel and Panam hands off a package of merch to Boz. They head inside the hotel and order a drink from the bartender Noah. Panam reveals that the package contained Betahaloperidol, "drugs for the cyberpsychos in our midst." Panam expresses a hope to start fresh in Night City, with Rogue, and with new friends. They rent a room for the night to sleep.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Partial rewrite from V's perspective]
The marker for this side job is found by a BARGHEST garrison in front of the Black Sapphire hotel in Dogtown.
V will be called out by a recruit named Paco Torres, who is currently drinking his problems away, alongside his companion Babs Okoye. V can hear him out, and after introductions Paco will share the story of an op lead by Kurt Hansen that went wrong.
At one point, Paco will offer to take V on a "Deep Dive", i.e. using drugs to make Paco's story more vivid. If V accepts, they will inhale the drugs, and the viewpoint will then shift from V into Kurt Hansen. As Kurt Hansen, talk to Yuri Bychkov, then go down into the lobby where Paco is standing. Talk to Paco to initiate a fist fight, with the goal being to defeat Paco. Once Paco is defeated, Hansen will assign Paco to convoy duty, and the game transitions back to V's viewpoint.
Paco will confess that he had been skimming cargo from the convoy. V is then asked to take another Deep Dive, which transitions them back to Hansen's viewpoint. This time, Hansen will be a passenger in a truck driven by Paco, moments before they are jumped by Scavengers in vehicles. A gunfight will ensue in which Hansen must defeat any pursuing vehicles using his Bald Eagle revolver. The truck is stopped by Scavengers manning a barricade, and Hansen will then disembark to fight them. Hansen only has his revolver and his Fang knife to defeat the Scavengers with, though they were accompanied by some Barghest soldiers that supported them. After defeating all of the Scavengers, Hansen approached one of the wounded Scavenger being tended to by Yuri.
The viewpoint will transition back to V, and Paco will reveal the gist of the story: the convoy was carrying generators, which Paco stole before selling them for cash, and now Paco and Babs want to ask V for advice on what to do. V can offer to tell them to either frame Yuri for the crime, leave Dogtown immediately, or have V call some friends for help (requires that certain Side jobs be completed beforehand).
If V tells them to frame Yuri:
Paco and Babs will agree with V's plan and give V both of their contact info, after which V, Paco, and Babs will agree to meet by the underpass beneath The Needle the following day. Either go to the meeting site and sit on the marked location to fast forward 24 hours, or wait 24 hours and go to the location. V will be met by Yuri, who then proceeds to open fire. Defeating Yuri will allow his body to be looted for Tier 5 weapons, and a message shard between him and Hansen that tells Yuri to hang Paco's body under The Needle. Go to the designated point, where V can find Paco's body hanging from the ceiling, at which point V can message Babs to check on her. Messaging Babs will reveal that she had called in a favor and escaped Dogtown to fly to Kenya.
If V tells them to leave Dogtown:
Babs will offer to stay behind in Dogtown to reduce suspicion on them both. After adding Paco and Bab into the contact list, V must follow Paco to the latter's car, where V can then ask Paco to get in the trunk. Drive the car to the marked location by the Grand Imperial Mall, then open up the trunk to let Paco out, after which he will then ask V to wait for two days. After 48 hours, a message from Paco will ask for a meeting by the Afterlife. Paco will be waiting outside near the Afterlife Fast Travel point, and will then tell V that he's giving them his assault rifle as a gift, and that he has joined the Scavengers. After arguing with Paco about their choice, V can then loot the Carmen DA8 Umbra from the chair it's laying on.
If V calls their friends for favors:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Subdivide in conditions for the specific friends]
V will offer to contact one of their friends to either smuggle Paco and Babs out of Dogtown or find generators to replace the ones Paco sold.
The available contacts that can be called depends on the character-related Side jobs that V has completed beforehand, giving them the choice of calling in favors from River Ward, Panam Palmer, or Rogue Amendiares to help, and V can then message them about the situation. Panam can help smuggle the two out of Night City, while River can supply replacement generators for the two out of an NCPD evidence locker in Santo Domingo. Rogue can be messaged about sourcing generators, but considers it too small time for her to directly supply them, instead directing V to the generators seized by the NCPD, which they will need to go through River to collect. Depending on which combination of favors are called in, after waiting 24 hours Paco will message V that they've either been successfully smuggled out of Dogtown and plan to leave Night City, or have received enough generators to avert suspicion from their superiors and intend to be more cautious in their black market entrepreneurship. As a reward, they will leave a crate in their tent in the Barghest garrison, on the chair where Paco was sitting, containing the Carmen DA8 Umbra, a Skill Shard: Solo, and ‚Ç¨$8000.

Walkthrough:
The Militech Basilisk is indestructible in this mission. Likewise Panam, Saul, Mitch, Carol, and Cassidy are unkillable. The deaths of Bob and Teddy on the other hand are pre-scripted and cannot be avoided.
When you exit the Basilisk inside the construction site, be sure to re-equip your weapon as it will have been replaced by a relatively low-quality Overwatch Panam handed to you earlier to fight the Militech drones.
Militech guards will enter the complex in groups of 4-5 within Chevillon Emperor 620 Ragnars. Using F-GX Frag Grenades to explode the cars before the guards exit can kill the entire group in a single stroke.
The Short Circuit quickhack is a good way to quickly and effectively deal with the Militech mech that appears at the outer gate of the complex.

Ram your way through the bridge. (2/2)
Ram the gate.
Exit the Basilisk.
Neutralize all enemies. (8/8)
Wait for Mitch and Carol.
Escort Mitch and Carol.
Neutralize Militech forces. (20/20)
Prepare for enemy reinforcements.
Neutralize Militech forces. (13/13)
Wait for the Aldecaldos to regroup.
Exit the Basilisk.
Neutralize Militech's strike team. (11/11)
Return to the construction site.
Drive into the tunnel.
