Walkthrough:
This is one of the more difficult fist fights, as Buck can deal a lot of damage in one punch to the point 2-3 hits on you will cause you to lose, so it's best to plan accordingly beforehand, like consuming boosters, food, etc.
When you approach to talk to him, he'll be talking about his unique rifle, O'Five. If you have at least 8 in Body you can comment on this which will then give you the option to have him also put it up for grabs, provided you have ‚Ç¨$ 18,000 to spare to fight him for it. Otherwise, you just need ‚Ç¨$ 6,000 to fight him.
Note that if you got him to put up his sniper rifle, once you win he and his buddies will turn hostile and start shooting at you. At this point you're free to also use your own guns and kill them if you wish. Once they're down, go collect the gun to complete the job. You won't automatically receive your eddies if you select this method, but you can loot the prize money from Buck's body.
The normal bet will end up with Buck telling you to leave if you win. You can just directly leave the area, or talk to him. You can decide whether to provoke him or to calm him down. If you decide to provoke him, Buck and his friends will proceed to attack you, and his rifle O'Five will be immediately be available for you to get.
Once they're down, go collect the gun to complete the job.
Objectives:
Go to the fight in Arroyo.
Talk to the champion of Arroyo.
Defeat Buck.

Walkthrough:
Some time after capturing Anders Hellman, V is contacted by Wakako Okada. Wakako offered V a job from one of her more demanding clients, Bill Jablonsky. Jablonsky wants to exact revenge for the murder of his wife, Caroline Jablonsky. The client wants everything to go exactly as planned, and is willing to pay V handsomely in return.
Wakako instructs V to meet with the client on at the Dewdrop Inn on the corner of Sixth and Brandon street in Arroyo, Santo Domingo.[N 1] She also informs V that the client wants to be present when his wife's murderer is neutralized by the mercenary.
After making their way to the meeting location, V waits for Jablonsky's arrival. V gets up from the bench and approached Bill, and talks to them. During the conversation, Bill reveals to V that he wants them to kill Joshua Stephenson, a notorious murderer, and instructs V to get in the driver's seat of his truck.
Inside the truck, Bill tells V that Stephenson is the one who murdered his wife, and that despite his conviction, he managed to get out of jail due to corporate involvement.[N 2] He also tells V that Stephenson is being transported out of the Night City Prison and is accompanied by other "regular" individuals. As the NCPD SUV passes by, Jablonsky instructs V to follow the SUV.[N 3]
If V successfully followed the SUV:
Despite the traffic hurdles, V and Jablonsky managed to follow the van transporting Stephenson up-to an underpass, where the van ran into a stationary semi-truck. After stopping the truck, Jablonsky and V both get out. Jablonsky‚Äìovercome with anger and his desire to kill Stephenson himself‚Äìpulls out his pistol and rushes over to the SUV but is shot by NCPD Lieutenant Vasquez.
If V talks to Joshua Stephenson:
After Vasquez shoots Bill, Stephenson urges Vasquez to keep V alive, and threatens to kill the deal with the corporation if V is shot. As Vasquez stands down, he contacts the NCPD about the incident, and allows V to speak with Joshua Stephenson, who wants V to tag along with them.[N 4]
Stephenson will introduce himself to V, and ask their name and their associates name. As Vasquez concludes his call to the NCPD, he makes a remark about having heard of V, and urging to Stephenson that V is too big a threat to take along with them.
If V goes with Stephenson:
V accepts Joshua's invite and gets inside the NCPD SUV, and Vasquez will proceed to drive them to their destination while Joshua and V talk.[N 5]
If V declines to go with Stephenson:
V declines Joshua's invite to tag along with them. The three get back into the SUV and continue their journey, while V stayed behind, concluding the job.
If V neutralizes Joshua Stephenson:
After Jablonsky gets shot by Vasquez, V engaged Stephenson and neutralized them. Afterwards, V called Wakako Okada, and tells her that they were able to neutralize Joshua Stephenson. Wakako Okada rewarded V with a payment of 9,300 eurodollars for completing the job.[N 6][N 7]
If V fails to follow the SUV:
V failed to follow the van and bring Joshua Stephenson to justice, too much annoyance of Bill Jablonsky, he will proceed to terminate the gig and be angry with V, demanding they exit the vehicle. After a while, Bill will send V and angry text informing V that they will not be receiving any payment.
Objectives:
Talk to Wakako Okada.
Sit and wait for Bill Jablonsky.
Talk to Bill Jablonksy.
Get behind the wheel of Bill Jablonsky's truck.
Talk to Bill Jablonksy.
Follow the car.
If V followed the car to the underpass:
Stop the car.
Exit car.
Follow Bill Jablonsky.
If V talks to Joshua Stephenson:
Talk to Joshua Stephenson.
If V agrees to tag along:
Get in the NCPD vehicle.
If V kills Joshua Stephenson:
Call Wakako Okada.
Talk to Wakako Okada.

Walkthrough:
V meets Garry the Prophet right outside Misty's Esoterica in Urmland Street. He has have five separate ramblings that V listens to and engages in a conversation with him on.[N 1]
During the last rambling where Garry is talking about nomads, two Aldecaldos approach and take issue with Garry calling them werewolves.
If V is a Nomad or completed Queen of the Highway prior to the final rambling, and chooses to acknowledge the Aldecados as allies:
V gets them to walk away without any fighting.
If V is not a Nomad or has not completed Queen of the Highway prior to the final rambling, or chooses not to acknowledge them as allies:
V helps Garry fight the Aldecados off.
Once done, Garry tells V about having heard that a mysterious meeting would take place somewhere in Kabuki.
Once at the marked location, Johnny talks with V, then both head over to the hiding spot marked by the quest and wait.[T 2] After some time passes, a group of Maelstrom gang members show up and talk to two corpos named Jane and John Doe before handing over a mysterious chip.[N 2][N 3]
If V prevents the corpos from leaving:
V obtains the Mysterious Chip off of Jane Doe's corpse, and returns to Garry the Prophet.[N 4] However, once V gets to his usual spot, Garry is nowhere to be found, replaced by his disciple who informs V he was taken away.[N 5]
If V donated enough to Garry earlier:
V can ask them about the chip and they will tell you what they know.
If V didn't donate enough earlier:
V can donate to them now to get them to talk.
If V lets the corpos escape:
The side job fails.
Objectives:
Go to the old factory.
Talk to Johnny.
Find somewhere to hide.
Keep a lookout.
Seize the conspirators' chip.
Search the corpse.
Show the mystery chip to the prophet.
Talk to the prophet's disciple.
Ask the prophet's disciple about the chip.
Talk to Johnny.

Walkthrough:
To begin this side job, first, head over to Woodhaven Street in Rancho Coronado East and travel up the street to the Gun-O-Rama gun shop. Around the back you'll find an accessible garage with a decal of a ghost horse to the left of it.
Alternatively, the quest can be started by finding Josie's body and reading the shard, "Bad news". In this case, the first objective will be to find the garage.
Once inside, V and Johnny will comment on the scrapped Brennan found inside. To officially start the side job, access the terminal on the opposite side of the garage. After reading the data stored, exit the terminal and V will pick up the photo of James Ito and Josie Alcazar resting next to it. This prompts V and Johnny to look for James to find out more about their situation.
To find James, travel to Japantown West and head south along the waterfront four lane road. There will be a plaza on the east side of the road after Holly Street with a 24/7 stand. James is sitting on the same bench in the photo, in front of the 24/7 stand. Talking to him will begin your investigation into what happened to Josie.
James and Josie's bench in front of the 24/7 stand
To find out what happened to Josie, head to Metro: Ebunike on the map. From the metro, with your scanner active, you will pick up a dried blood splatter on the ground. Following the blood splatters, past the Drop Point, on your right is an alleyway; and behind a dumpster, Josie's body.
There will be a shard labelled "Bad news" which details Josie's cause of death as well as information on the location of the bike she stole from a Tyger Claw boss. After having an exchange with Johnny, it's time to return to James in Japantown and confront him about what you've discovered. What happens to James after confronting him is up to you. After the confrontation, you will need to find the Tyger Claw boss's bike in order to complete the job.
The shard found on Josie's body mentions it being stowed on Maelstrom turf by All Foods. This will send you to the All Foods Factory in the Northside of Watson. Across street from the travel point, you'll see the "ghost horse" that Josie also mentioned in the shard. The bike is in the nearby garage. Punch in the date that James and Josie met (0214) into the keypad next to the garage and it will open.
James' location.Josie's location.Location of the Tyger Claw bike.
Objectives:
Find the garage Josie mentioned.
Pick up the still.
Find James.
Find out what happened to Josie.
Find James and confront him.
Find the stolen Tyger Claw bike.

Notes[]
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìùReason: Move notes to Notes group and incorporate into Walkthrough
If V is spotted by any cameras while escorting Myers through the subway tunnels, there is a laptop in a room at the end of the righthand route that can be used to wipe the camera recordings.
If one does not wipe the recordings, a group of Barghest soldiers will ambush V and Reed on their drive back to the hideout, with more at the building's lobby upon arrival. If Jacob and Taylor were convinced to help shelter Myers, they will be found dead.
If you kill Jacob and Taylor, you'll need to pick up one of the bodies, whereby a minor time skip follows with the bodies being disposed.
If you spare them, once you manage to enlist Reed for help, they'll be killed off later.
The telephone in the restaurant can have different numbers dialed in, which will make different sounds play through the phone and even elicit reactions from Johnny.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Needs to be written from the character's perspective]
Following the events of The Heist, wherein V is killed by Dexter DeShawn, the former's brain is repaired by the biochip's nanites, and they begin to relive the memories contained on it, specifically those that occurred on August 20th, 2023.
Now in the perspective of Johnny Silverhand, the Rocker makes his way to The Hammer, where Kerry Eurodyne has already begun to perform due to the former being late. Johnny is accosted by the bouncer, who angrily pushes Silverhand aside. Johnny continues inside until he is on stage, where he states that he is saying goodbye to his fans.
Before Johnny makes his eventual exit, he is stopped by Kerry, who hopes to dissuade him from marching towards his eventual death. Johnny brushes this off and depending on player choice, tells Kerry to pursue his own career instead of living in Johnny's shadow, or insults him.
Outside, Johnny meets with Rogue Amendiares, and the two board a helicopter destined for Arasaka Towers along with Shaitan and Spider Murphy. Upon reaching Arasaka Tower's roof, Shaitan begins to open fire on soldiers before being shot. Johnny takes over and clears the rooftop of all hostiles, he quickly checks the payload, revealed to be a miniature nuclear device to be planted inside of the building.
Johnny, Rogue, and Spider fight their way through the tower until they reach an elevator, which Johnny to send the nuclear device inside further down. Rogue motions for them return to the rooftop to make their getaway, though Johnny protests, stating he had another objective in mind: uploading a virus into Arasaka's systems which would free Alt Cunningham. Rogue gives him four minutes to secure Alt and make for the helicopter.
Johnny makes his way to Kei Arasaka's office, fighting soldiers in the garden area, before eventually uploading the virus under the direction of Spider Murphy. After completion, Johnny attempts to leave before being ambushed by Adam Smasher and his team. From there, there is a gap in Johnny's memories during which he evidently escaped Smasher, meeting with Rogue on the rooftop. Johnny rushes to reach the already-ascending helicopter, briefly getting lifted by Rogue before they are hit by an explosion, causing Johnny to fall be left behind. Smasher appears and shoots a dying Johnny, causing his consciousness to fade. He briefly reawakens on a stretcher being carried off by Arasaka employees amidst the chaos. Johnny wakes again, this time to an interrogation by Arasaka agents. Johnny can either stay silent or toy with the interrogators.
The interrogation is joined Saburo Arasaka, who after a brief interrogation, orders Johnny to be subject to Soulkiller.
Objectives:
Go on stage.
Grab the microphone.
Go outside.
Talk to Kerry.
Get in the helicopter.
Wait for the helicopter to descend.
Defeat Arasaka's forces.
Exit the helicopter.
Follow Spider Murphy.
Wait for the virus to upload into the network.
Find the elevator.
Defeat the Arasaka guards.
Wait.
Deploy and arm the bomb in the elevator.
Exit the elevator.
Wait.
Shoot the elevator mechanism.
Tell Rogue about your plan.
Find an Access Point to the network.
Defeat the Arasaka guards.
Connect to the Access Point.
Wait for the virus to upload into the network.
Return to the rooftop.
Get to the chopper!

Go toward the wind turbine.
Search the crate.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Further rewrite from V's perspective]
After Search and Destroy and another part of Tapeworm, Johnny will eventually ask to allow him to control your body so he can explain everything to Rogue to get her to help him take out Adam Smasher. V heads to the Afterlife and after talking with Johnny, takes the pill to surrender control to Johnny.
The events of the side quest A Cool Metal Fire take place.
V wakes up in a motel room, with Rogue Amendiares watching over them. She tells V that Johnny told her about Adam Smasher and then she leaves to gather more information about the Ebunike.
Ebunike[]
After about a day, Rogue calls and reveals that the Ebunike is an old container ship moored in Night City and ask V to meet with her back at the Afterlife to discuss further. Head over and after a short conversation with Crispin Weyland, follow Rogue out to her car where she'll give V a Replica of Johnny's Samurai jacket. They hop into Rogue's car and ride to the Ebunike Docks where the ship is.[N 1]
After spending some time to go over the plans and observing the location, Rogue and V enter the base and find a data term, which confirms that Grayson is currently aboard the ship. Rogue and V continue their path, and board the ship.
If V checks out the Kang Tao labelled crates on the Ebunike:
Rogue and V uncover that Adam Smasher was behind the Kang Tao raid reported some time ago. The crates contain firearms that were bound for South Africa.
If V checks out the body in one of the containers:
V finds a female body in one of the containers. The woman was strangled then shot point blank with hollow point rounds four days ago, as deduced by Rogue. According to Johnny, this is Adam Smasher's signature style.
If V checks out the audio recordings on the computer:
V can uncover that Adam Smasher was pulling the strings behind Militech backing out of a deal with Night Corp, as he was blackmailing Anthony Gilchrist by taking a woman by the name of Mallory hostage.
If V checks out the suspicious packages:
V finds some suspicious boxes labeled "Tri-phet."
After a short firefight with Grayson and his remaining goons, in which Grayson is defeated but not killed, he'll insinuate Rogue was actually on the same side as him at one point and there's more to the story on why she wasn't hunted down and killed after the Arasaka Tower bombing, but when V asks Rogue about this, she'll just note he's trying to distract V from their goal to find Smasher. Grayson will reveal that Adam Smasher is back in Japan, having been promoted to head of Arasaka's security, and thus unlikely to return to Night City. He tries to bargain his way into being spared, offering a special keepsake of Johnny's they can have if V lets him go.[N 2] After dealing with Grayson, Rogue becomes upset and V talks to her before her departing. Johnny suggests to give her a moment and let her cool down.
The Oilfields[]
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
V hops into a car and drives out to the Northern Oilfields to find Johnny's unmarked grave. At the supposed grave site, Johnny and V have a lengthy conversation, looking back on their adventure so far, and about what is still to come.
Secret Ending[]
Main article: Cyberpunk 2077 Endings#Secret Ending
The dialogue choices made here are critical to ensure the secret ending, (Don't Fear) The Reaper.[N 3]
Most dialogue choices will unlock Blistering Love, but to ensure the secret ending is unlocked, specific dialogue choices are required:
"Nah, fucked that up too."
"What do you want from me?"
"Ok. But as second chances go, this is your last."
If done correctly, Johnny will then request V calls Rogue on his behalf to ask her out on a date. If V does not give Johnny a second chance after choosing "Nah, fucked that up too," he will ask V to go and see Kerry Eurodyne.
Objectives:
Go to the Afterlife.
Talk to Johnny.
Complete A Cool Metal Fire.
Talk to Rogue.
Talk to Johnny.
Wait a day for Rogue to call.
Talk to Rogue.
Meet Rogue at the Afterlife.
Talk to Rogue.
Follow Rogue.
Take the gift from the trunk.
Talk to Rogue.
Get in Rogue's car.
Follow Rogue.
Open Cargo Door
Find the Dataterm.
Check the Dataterm.
Look for Smasher on the Ebunike.
Listen to the recordings. [Optional]
Take Johnny's gun.
Question Grayson about Smasher.
Talk to Rogue.
Talk to Johnny.
Lower the crane.
Open the container.
Remove the canvas cover.
Get in Johnny's Porsche.
Drive to the oil fields.
Find Johnny's grave.
Talk to Johnny.

Walkthrough:
This quest begins when you enter the Coyote Cojo. Two Valentinos, Juan and Pedro, will be harassing a drunk corpo, Joseph Odman, who is passed out at one of the tables. Pepe tells them to stop, and asks you to intervene. The Streetkid background has an additional dialogue option to convince them that Mama Welles wouldn't take kindly to blood in her bar.
After dealing with the gangoons, either by convincing them to back off or engaging in combat with them, the corpo will pay you for defending him before passing out again. Pepe offers you a free drink and a job: to find out with whom his wife is cheating on him. Leave the bar and head right (northeast) down the road; as soon as you leave the bar, Johnny begins his narration.
Identify Cynthia, but do not follow too close, as doing so will alert her and the quest will fail (15m will trigger a warning from Johnny). She will head down the road and enter a building where, upon entering, she can be heard arguing with a man. Confront Cynthia and the occupant, and you will have the option to say "Doesn't matter. I've seen enough", which ends the dialogue and quest.
Alternatively, you have the option to hear Cynthia out. She will reveal that the man is not a lover but her ripperdoc. She elaborates that her entire physical appearance is artificial, being the result of implants.
At this point, you must leave the building and call Pepe. There are two options: tell him the truth or that he must talk to Cynthia himself. If you tell the truth, Pepe will be shocked and upset over his wife lying to him for so long. You can either tell him that he has a right to feel cheated, or that Cynthia loves him and that he shouldn't give up on their marriage. Either way, Pepe will pay you and the quest will end.
If the player told Pepe to save their marriage, Cynthia will contact you by holo a day or two after the quest, thanking you and sending you another 2210‚Ç¨$ beyond the payment from Pepe. Otherwise, Cynthia will be disappointed in your actions, telling you that Pepe threw her out and she's now living on the streets.
Objectives:
Find out what's going on.
Decide whether to intervene.
If you fight the thugs:
Defeat the gangoons.
Talk to the corpo. (Optional)
Talk to Pepe.
Go to the area where Pepe's wife works during the day.
Scan and identify Pepe's wife.
Follow Pepe's wife from a safe distance.
Follow Pepe's wife into the building.
Find Pepe's wife.
Talk to Cynthia.
Leave the building.
Call Pepe.
Inform Pepe of your findings.

Walkthrough:
After completing all of Sebastian Ibarra's gigs in Heywood, V is contacted once more by him so that he can thank them. Head over to the Stash in your apartment and collect the Seraph Liberty.

This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite from V's perspective. Usage of {{Condition}}]
Upon approaching the Afterlife after being directed by Rogue to talk to Panam during Ghost Town or completing KOLD MIRAGE, Netrunner Nix messages V and asks them to stop by the Afterlife to discuss a job, which involves purchasing a rare "The Book of Spells" from the netrunner R3n0. As simple as the errand appears to be, Nix wants V to buy The Book of Spells in his stead just in case the exchange unexpectedly goes wrong, and he intends to compensate V for both the expense and the pickup. Nix sends R3n0's contact into to V. Call her to set up a meeting.
Travel to the restaurant Au Cabanon in Charter Hill, next to the Lele Park fast travel point. R3n0 is waiting by the bar with a laptop. At this point, V has two ways to get The Book of Spells. The first way is to speak with R3n0 and buy The Book of Spells for 5500 eurodollars, which concludes the deal without violence despite V's misgivings that R3n0 is a scammer. The second way is to avoid paying R3n0 at all by attacking her (scanning her laptop will also immediately turn her hostile), then jacking into her laptop after she is unconscious or dead. The Book of Spells's coordinates are in the laptop's messages, which also reveal how R3n0 came into possession of The Book of Spells: she is an employee of Hard Wire Ltd. named Clarity, and her boss asked her to review the data on an old cyberdeck that had been found in storage in one of their warehouses. Clarity could not get past The Book of Spells's malware, but recognized its value to a more skilled netrunner and decided to sell it without her boss's knowledge.
V is then directed to a shopping plaza across the street. Open the suitcase, tucked away next to a vending machine, to reveal The Book of Spells: a genuine Zetatech XPR tablet. Johnny Silverhand will comment that it was cutting edge tech back in 2020 and he used to own one. Take The Book of Spells. V can optionally crack The Book of Spells themselves before returning to Nix, which can potentially reward cash and some quickhacks.
Return to Nix to hand over The Book of Spells and receive payment. If V has high enough Intelligence, they can point out that The Book of Spells is worth much more than Nix is paying, and he will reluctantly give V a bonus.
Alternatively, V may access the "Smuggler's Cache" netpage after receiving Nix's message to see R3n0's post, which will change the objective to call R3n0. V will no longer be able to ask Nix what gig he is offering, and Nix will pretend he is not very interested in The Book of Spells and will not offer to compensate V for the price of purchasing it. But V will now have access to two Cool dialogue options to make Nix pay double or triple his original price. If V does not bargain with Nix, he will pay the same as if he had offered V the gig directly, but if he pays double he will offer 37.5% more and 75% more if he pays triple. V will still have access to the Intelligence option to point out The Book of Spells is worth more, in which case the cool dialogue options cannot be used.[verification needed]
Objectives:
Talk to Nix.
Call R3n0.
Go to the coordinates given by R3n0.
Talk to R3n0.
Defeat R3n0. [Optional]
Steal data from R3n0's computer. [Optional]
Collect the goods from the stash.
Open the stash.
Talk to Johnny.
Take the Book of Spells.
Open your Shards menu and decrypt the Book of Spells. [Optional]
Return to Nix.

Walkthrough:
Mercenary Benedict McAdams was promised safe passage out of Night City by Dakota Smith after assassinating a corrupt Night City councilman for her, but his driver, Jason Wildriver, went off course and McAdams has gone missing. McAdams had the forethought to implant a GPS chip before taking on Dakota's job, and Dakota wants V to investigate his coordinates so she can provide him with a new driver.
McAdams is imprisoned in the basement of an Abandoned House in the Biotechnica Flats. It turns out that Jason Wildriver decided to sell the merc to Militech instead of taking him out of the city. The councilman whom McAdams killed had deep ties to Militech, and the corp wanted to cover up the corruption by scapegoating McAdams for the murder and a litany of other shady dealings. Wildriver jumped at the chance to line his pockets. As V arrives at Wildriver's hideout, they can overhear Wildriver on the phone with a Militech representative, threatening to kill McAdams unless the corp increases their payout.
The only enemy in the area is Wildriver, who can be found roaming the yard outside the house. He can be killed or incapacitated, or avoided by sneaking into the house. Be warned that multiple mines have been placed behind the house, and the front is guarded by a turret. There is also a surveillance camera in the basement where McAdams is located, but it can be deactivated using the computer inside the house.
Speak with McAdams. He explains what happened to him and agrees to follow V. If V did not bring a car, there is an Archer Quartz "Sidewinder" in the garage that they can take to drive McAdams to the rendezvous point. Starting the car will alert Wildriver if he has not already been eliminated, but he can be easily escaped.
At the rendezvous point, exit the car and wait for McAdams' new driver. McAdams recognizes him as Starkey, an old friend, and they drive away together. Dakota then sends V their payment.
Objectives:
Find Ben.
Talk to Ben.
Take Ben to the meeting point.
Exit the car.
Wait for Dakota's guy.
Talk to Dakota's guy.

Walkthrough:
You get a call from Robert Wilson, the owner of the local 2nd Amendment in your megabuilding. He is hosting a shooting competition to drum up some local business. You arrive with five other competitors, although one is kicked out after breaking Wilson's pistol only rule.
Once the competition starts, your objective is simple. Hit as many targets as many times you are able to within the time limit. So it is advised to use a pistol that has a high-rate of fire and a large magazine. You are not restricted to the target in your lane, so make advantage of the fact that you are able to shoot the targets in other lanes.
If V wins the shooting competition:
Robert will give you a Lexington x-MOD2, and some eddies.
If V loses the shooting competition:
If you lose, the winner will complain that the weapon they've won is of low quality.
If you have enough points in Reflexes, Wilson can be asked about his situation, where he will lament that business is down and considers the shooting competition a failure as it did nothing to help boost sales in his shop. Otherwise, V can say their goodbyes to end the quest.
Objectives:
Go to Wilson's shooting range.
Talk to Wilson.
Enter the shooting range.
Listen to Wilson's instructions.
Draw and aim your weapon.
Wait for the competition to begin.
Get into position.
Shoot the targets. [0/100]
Go to Wilson.
If you won the competition:
Collect your reward from Wilson.
Talk to Wilson.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: none given]
Some time after investigating Lucius Rhyne's murder, V will receive a call from Jefferson Peralez requesting that he investigates another case for him and his wife.
At the Peralez apartment in Charter Hill, Westbrook, Elizabeth will guide V to the living room. There, the waiting Jefferson explains that he witnessed an intruder in their apartment several nights ago. Jefferson recalls shooting the man but losing consciousness shortly thereafter. Oddly, their private security, SSI, denies that any incident occurred. After the talking, Jefferson leaves the apartment for an election meeting, leaving Elizabeth to help V check the clues.
Elizabeth will begin with a brief tour of the apartment, but will soon let V to freely explore. During the investigation, V can explore the apartment and scan certain objects to ask Elizabeth for some information, such as their diplomas from Asukaga-Berkeley Law School, their wedding photo, their family's photo etc. During these investigations, V will likely soon notice that Elizabeth's memory is chaotic. For example, Elizabeth says her husband has never smoked, but V has previously seen Jefferson smoking; Elizabeth says the roses during the wedding are blue, but they are actually red in the wedding photo. V can also read a message about Jefferson's failing memory on one of the computers. Moreover, checking the computers in the control room downstairs reveals that SSI security are actually aware and complicit in the ongoing events.
Scanning the corridor upstairs will reveal patched bullet holes in the wall and chemically scrubbed residues of blood, which you should follow. Along the way, you will find a broken screen of smart glass, which you can attempt to repair with sufficient Technical Ability. Touching the screen this way triggers a shock that affects both V and Johnny, although Elizabeth notices nothing during the event. Eventually, the trail will lead to a wall that you can scan to find a hidden door. V can gain entry to this hidden room by force (requires 9 Body), via the computer in the control room (use the code 6709, which can be found in an adjacent computer station, or by hacking the station), or through a hatch on the roof of the building. Regardless, V will find a secret monitoring station, whereby Elizabeth and Jefferson were being observed without their knowledge. Elizabeth will be shocked and presently feels head discomfort, leaving V to continue the investigation alone. Scan the strange computer in the room, which will prompt V to follow the cables trailing upwards.
The nearby ladder leads to the roof of the building, where there is an old-fashioned transmitter, which Johnny notes resembles those used by Militech during the Second Central American War. Because such antennae rely on line-of-sight, V can find a distant van near another antenna. After finding it, V can return to Elizabeth and tell her about the transmitter, before leaving the apartment to find the van. Upon doing so, Johnny will suggest that V goes on wheels rather than on foot.
The vehicle in question is parked in the Japantown sub-district of Westbrook. Upon approaching, it will be revealed as a heavily modified Emperor 620 Ragnar, which will begin driving away, requiring V to pursui.
If V loses the van:
V calls Elizabeth, explaining the situation as the mercenary was unable to find who was behind the spying. She is disappointed, but will tell her husband about potentially investigating Holt. Elizabeth pays V and the mission ends.
The Ragnar will enter Northside and eventually go to a Maelstrom compound near the All Foods Factory. V's goal is to connect to the access point on the vehicle. One can sneak in by climbing to the roof using scaffolds in an alley to the right, but after going into the building. On one of the agents, V can find an encrypted shard regarding Project Condin.
Accessing the vehicle's database will uncover evidence that a shadowy organization is manipulating the brains of Jefferson, Elizabeth, and others to modify personalities and behavior. This process has already caused severe memory loss to both Jefferson and Elizabeth. Johnny suggests downloading the data, but after doing so, the data is deleted by someone. After the investigation, V must call Elizabeth and apprise her of the situation. She will ask the merc meets with her in person before doing anything else.
Elizabeth can be found at a ramen shop in Yagami Market. There, she will explain that she has already noticed Jefferson's changing personality, and she fears that she is also changing. Knowing her husband and fearing the consequences of his reaction, Elizabeth will implore V not to reveal the truth to Jefferson.
Jefferson will be waiting for V in Reconciliation Park in The Glen. When nearing the meeting location, V's optics will be spiked and they will receive a call from an unknown individual, who warns them not to cross the line by revealing to Jefferson what they have learned.
In the meeting location, Jefferson asks V about the investigation result, who can choose to tell Jefferson the truth about the brainwashing or lie and omit the information.
If V tells the truth to Jefferson:
Jefferson is shocked by the terrifying truth, and also angry at Elizabeth about lying to him. He will decide to play along with his manipulators' plans until he sees an opportunity to expose them but potentially risking his life and the lives of his family.
If V follows Elizabeth's words:
V tells Jefferson that there is no news and the SSI had been receiving money from Weldon Holt among many other clients. Jefferson will decide to win the election first, and then deal with Holt.
Objectives:

Use the intercom.
Take the elevator.

Walkthrough:
A group of Voodoo Boys led by Slider's right hand Ayo Zarin have taken control of the south side of the Luxor High Wellness Spa. Eliminate Ayo Zarin and the Voodoo Boys to complete the activity.
Ayo Zarin drops the Iconic Axe Agaou.
Objectives:
Neutralize Ayo Zarin.
Neutralize the Voodoo Boys.
Loot the cache.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Add choices using {{Condition}} template.]
The Ho-Oh club on Allen St. is where V needs to go in order to find Jotaro Shobo. Jotaro will be guarded by a good number of Tyger Claws on all three floors of Ho-Oh that V will either have to sneak past or fight through to get to the top floor, where Jotaro is. Aside from the Tyger Claws and Jotaro himself, there is also a turret on the third floor, which is by far the deadliest enemy that will have to be dealt with in this gig, either destroying it or using quickhacks to shut it down.
After getting to Jotaro, there are two choices in how to deal with him. V can either kill him, which ends the gig and just requires them to leave the club premises afterward, or neutralize him with a non-lethal takedown. Handling Jotaro non-lethally will yield an extra objective, which is to carry him out of Ho-Oh and deliver him to a fixer's vehicle so that he can be taken to the Mox to be dealt with. Placing his body in the car trunk will end the gig.
Objectives:
Go to the Ho-Oh club.
Find Jotaro.
Neutralize Jotaro.
If you killed Jotaro:
Leave the club.
If you knocked Jotaro out:
Take Jotaro's body and leave the area.
Carry Jotaro to the fixer's transport.

Walkthrough:
This quest starts after purchasing the Porsche 911 Turbo Cabriolet (930) from the Autofixer website for ‚Ç¨$74,000.
Santo Domingo Fixer Muamar Reyes will send V a message that his Autofixer service normally delivers the cars, but that somehow the seller vanished into thin air.
After replying to the text, Muamar sends V the coordinates of the vehicle last known location, the abandoned parking lot on the outskirts of Arroyo, Santo Domingo.
Once arrived at the scene, there is no sign of the car. Only the body of a man can be found. As you approach the body, Johnny Silverhand will appear and comment on the appearance of the man, as it appears to be an impersonator by the name of Johnny Silverman.
Inspecting the body for clues, you find a pair of shards on the man, a conversation between him and Muamar Reyes and a set of GPS coordinates, which will be uploaded to your navigation system.
Following the coordinates not far from the body, near a makeshift garage south of the EBM Petrochem Stadium, you find encounter several Wraiths surrounding the car. After neutralizing the Wraiths, you can find the Car Keys on one of them and unlock the vehicle by entering it.
After entering the vehicle, a message can be sent to Muamar Reyes about recovering the vehicle. After sending the message Muamar will deposit half of the original purchase price back to your balance.
Objectives:
Read and reply to the message from Muamar.
Go to the car's last known location.
Inspect the body for clues.
Find the car.
Defeat the Wraiths and recover the key.
Get in the car.
Text Muamar about recovering the car.

This will lead you and Takemura to meet with Wakako, who will with some persuasion hand over information about the upcoming parade's security measures. You however cannot act on this yet - Takemura says he'll need to do some preparations. Wait for his call.

Walkthrough:
This job starts by looting the [UNSENT MESSAGE] shard, on Dirty Fred's body, After neutralizing the Thug and Hooligan encountered underneath a walkway alongside Kennedy Street in Little China, close to the Kabuki: Central Data Term.
Go to the coordinates attached to the shard in Little China. Finally, grab all the items in box, which is located on the roof of a building close to the Drake Ave Data Term.
The roof can be accessed by jumping onto the roof of a nearby Cirrus Cola building, via the dumpster on the east side of the building, then walking across some cables connecting it to the roof of the building where the stash is located.
Objectives:
Go to Dirty Fred's stash.
Loot the stash.

Walkthrough:
This job starts during Chippin' In, and functions as an objective for it.
Johnny‚Äîusing V's body‚Äîdowns a large number of drinks before learning from Claire Russell where Cassius Ryder is. Cassius first asks Johnny which tattoo he wants, before giving him information on a man named Jeremiah Grayson, who works for Adam Smasher. He also provides the name of a night club dancer and his ex-girlfriend, Ruby Collins, who's known to be an associate of Grayson's. Johnny goes to the club where Ruby works, flirts with her, parties hard, fights with the bouncers, gets thrown out and finally leaves with Ruby in a stolen car. Things heat up between the two while Rudy's driving, distracting her and causing a car crash. They manage to get out of the wrecked car, and a wounded Ruby scribbles the name of Ebunike on a pack of Morley's before leaving. After taking a last draft of a cigarette, Johnny returns to a motel and goes to sleep.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: none given]
Several weeks have passed after the raid on Arasaka Tower[N 1], and V wakes up in Panam Palmer's Warhorse at the Coronado Dam overlooking Night City. Panam and V talk about how far they've come since they met, which is interrupted by V coughing up blood- a sign of their worsening condition; as well as their plans to leave Night City with the rest of the Aldecaldos to head for Arizona, along with all the plundered loot they've stolen from the corporation and discuss plans to use their connections to try and save V's life.
After talking, Panam heads back to her car, telling V to take their time looking at the city one more time before they get in the car and head to meet up with the others. As they ride to the Solar Arrays in Jackson Plains, they are joined by Mitch Anderson, who playfully teases Panam about the upcoming sandstorm as they drive to the meeting point.
Once arrived at the Solar Arrays, V talks with the other Aldecaldos‚ÄìCassidy Righter and Carol Emeka‚Äìbefore rejoining Mitch and Panam, who discuss using a famous Aldecaldo Tunnel to evade both Arasaka, who'll be looking for their stolen tech at every checkpoint, and Border Patrol, who'll want to stop any trespassers who try to jump the Border Crossing.[N 2]
If V has high enough Body:
V inquires Panam and Mitch about the possible security measures that the SoCal Border Patrol will have on the way to the tunnel, which Panam will respond by telling V to not worry, explaining that they'll know what to do, as well as mentioning that Cassidy and Carol will also help distract Arasaka from ever finding them.
Mitch and Panam tell V that after they escape through the tunnel, they'll collapse it to prevent anyone from following them, then making their way towards the meeting point with the rest of the Aldecaldos, then altogether moving towards Tuscon. Panam reassures V, telling them they won't be alone anymore starting today.
Boarding the Basilisk, the group charge across the Badlands and against the upcoming sandstorm, with V and Panam following them not far behind as they use it as cover to escape the Border Patrol drones, with Cassidy and Carol breaking off to distract them as planned, wishing them good luck. Heading to the tunnel entrance, V hands the controls to Panam, who use the modded Turbothrusters to ram through and into the tunnel, before making their way out the other side.
Having left Night City, the following ending cinematic will play where V will get out of the Basilisk to sit back and take in the night air as it hovers across the open water. Sitting back, V looks at the bullet pendant they received from Misty Olszewski, before taking it off and letting go of the necklace.
Objectives:
Join Panam.
Talk to Panam.
Get in the car.
If V called their romance to say goodbye during Op55n1 Nocturne:

Walkthrough:
After visiting Rogue Amendiares at the Afterlife during Ghost Town, V will get a message from their old car Thorton Galena 80845, revealing its geolocation in the Badlands, due south of the Medeski Fuel Station, within the landfill.
V heads out there and checks under the hood to see if someone has been tinkering with it, and they realize the engine is still warm - someone clearly drove the vehicle recently. As they finish checking it over though they'll be approached by a woman, Lana Prince, who's both surprised and annoyed V's messing with "her" car.
Upon asking, Lana reveals that she is desperate to leave the city and has had enough of the wastelands and sees the car as her only hope to start a new life.
V tells Lana they can keep the car:
V told Lana that she can keep the car and gives Lana some suggestions of what she should be doing in order to repair the car before leaving Night City.
V buys the car from Lana:
V offered Lana a large sum of eurodollars in order to buy the car out of sentimental value, so that she can buy something different instead and leave NC. This decision allowed V to reclaim the vehicle as their own.
V threatens Lana to leave:
V threatened Lana to leave, even willing to put her under gunpoint. This decision allowed V to reclaim the vehicle as their own.
Objectives:
Go to the indicated location.
Scan your old car. [Optional]
Look under the hood.
Check the engine.
Talk to the stranger.
Get in your old car.
Talk to Johnny.

Walkthrough:
Some time after after dealing with the Voodoo Boys, V will be sent a message to check their personal computer in their apartment regarding the Bartmoss Collective. After heading up to their apartment and checking out Nancy's post on the Bartmoss website, V give Bess a call.[N 1]
After contacting Nancy on the holo, V is directed towards the source of a signal coming from an apartment building on an unnamed street in Rancho Coronado, Santo Domingo.[N 2] After hacking the device, V receives a message from an unknown sender, directing V to another location in the Badlands.
V navigates to the second location in the Jackson Plains. They find another router can be found atop a trailer, which is guarded by Wraiths. After hacking this router, they will receive another message directing them to a third location.
They navigate to the third location in the Biotechnica Flats. They find another router at the top of one of the large Biotechnica installations. Once again, after hacking the router, they are sent a text message directing them to a fourth location.
V navigates to the fourth location at the West Wind Estates in Pacifica. They find a router next to a hacked Fortune Teller Machine, which appears to be the original source of the signal.[N 3]
If V decides to keep the Fortune Teller:
The fortune teller will remain active, and will keep misleading people on the net by spreading rumors and citations, satisfying Johnny in the process.
If V decides to hack the Fortune Teller:
V is able to choose to either disable the fortune teller machine or to hack the machine.
If V decides to disable the Fortune Teller:
V disabled the machine and with it also the website, to the dismay of Johnny. A niche commemorating Swedenborg is placed at the Columbarium in North Oak.
IF V decides to make the Fortune Teller produce more nonsense:
V hacked the Fortune Teller machine using their Intelligence, to make it produce even more nonsense, satisfying Johnny in the process.
Afterwards, V calls Nancy to update them on the current status of the mystery, concluding the gig.
Objectives:
Investigate the site from the Bartmoss Collective message.
Complete other jobs until Bes Isis, aka Nancy, is available to call.
Call Bes Isis and ask about Swedenborg.
Go to Nancy's coordinates.
Scan the area for clues.

For the quest to appear V needs to either leave the biomonitor at the drop point or destroy it during the last conversation with the agents in Gig: Spy in the Jungle.
V receives a message from Steven Santos, asking to meet. He will be waiting for V at the docks in Wellsprings. He will give V 3,000 eurodollars and share a few updates: that his career is progressing, Ana has been fired, and the SovOil deal is progressing as hoped.

Meet with Steven.
Talk to Steven.

Walkthrough:
V starts in a mechanic's garage in the small town of Yucca, just southwest of the SoCal Border Crossing to Night City. While looking into a mirror, V removes the patch of their old nomad clan. While V is removing the patch, a mechanic is trying to repair their car, but needs a part that he doesn't have in stock. V turns to face the mechanic, and moves the mechanic out of the way. They make a short-term workaround that should last long enough to reach Night City. V leaves the garage, but before they can continue, V is hassled by the local sheriff, who asks pointed questions about their presence in his town and makes it clear that nomads, with or without a clan, are unwelcome.
V needs to meet up with their contact, Jackie Welles, to pick up the package they will both be smuggling into Night City. V slips past the patrolling sheriff, and heads south, towards the radio tower. At the radio tower, V climbs the radio tower and contacts Willie McCoy to receive Jackie's location, which turns out to be an abandoned farm close to the border. V drives to the abandoned farm. After making introductions, Jackie retrieves the package and places it in the trunk of V's car, and they both head out towards the border crossing.
At the Border Crossing, V and Jackie are stopped by the border guards and ordered to report for an inspection. V tells Jackie to stay with the car, and they enter the Border Crossing building. V steps into the room with the papers declaring their cargo to be "lost on arrival" - along with a sufficient bribe to "encourage" the guards not to look too closely. The guard accepts the bribe, but V gets a bad feeling that the guard knows more than he is letting on. V returns to their car, where they have Jackie take the wheel and get out of there as soon as possible; as they think something is definitely going on and V doesn't want to stick around. As they leave the crossing, V and Jackie are cut off by Arasaka security, who demands that they halt and hand over the corporate property that they are smuggling, revealing that they were set up. V tells Jackie to gun it, and lead the security team on a chase through the Biotechnica Protein Farm on the city's outskirts, eventually shaking them successfully and hiding in a nearby garage, where V's car finally breaks down for good. Inside the garage, V opens up the package to see what caused all the trouble: a genuine, live iguana. After discussing what to do next, Jackie, deciding he likes V, offers his hand and friendship and partnership as the iguana looks on, leading into the Night City introduction montage.

Walkthrough:
After receiving compensation for their wrecked car, Delamain asks V if they have time to talk in the back, and ask V that they follow the Bombus drone into the factory.[N 1]
As V follows the drone, they will tell V that they are aware that customer services is at an unsatisfactory level at the moment, and that they want to give V a full factory tour as additional compensation.
As V and Delamain tour the factory, Delamain tells V that they are interested in expanding their business by offering repair services in the future, but explains that the expansion will have to wait as the shop is currently overwhelmed with work due to the vehicle failures, of which V was one of the victims. Delamain theorizes that it is due to a virus infecting the Delamain network, but is unable to find the cause as of yet. Because of the current crisis, Delamain is worried that the costs will eventually grow too high, and that it will attract unwanted attention to the company.
As Delamain and V enter the control room, Delamain asks V if they want to help them recover the vehicles that are still missing. Delamain explains to V that NetWatch is already starting to poke around, and is worried that Netwatch may try to recategorize him as a rogue AI from beyond the Blackwall.
V agrees to help, and Delamain gives them the coordinates of the last known locations of the seven missing vehicles and a scanning device, so that Delamain can reestablish a connection with the vehicles once they are within range and make them return to the headquarters. After taking the scanner, V is escorted out of the facility by the drone.[N 2]
If V finds all seven missing vehicles and Delamain re-establishes connection with them:
After V successfully gathers all missing Delamain Cabs, Delamain calls V and asks them to meet "face-to-face" back at the Delamain Corp Headquarters.
At the Headquarters, the receptionist Delamain asks that V returns the scanner they borrowed, and proceeds to thank them for their help in recovering the missing Delamains, and transfer V an additional 4,900 eurodollars.
Objectives:

Walkthrough:
V is tasked by Sebastian Ibarra to steal a guitar belonging to former Samurai member Kerry Eurodyne, which came in the possession of Gaston Slayton, a Samurai superfan.
When V enters the apartment building on Los Lobos Street and takes the elevator up to the 17th floor, there are two ways to break into Gaston Slayton's apartment. The first is to simply break in through the front door, which requires a high level of Technical Ability. Otherwise, you must access the apartment via the balcony, which involves getting to the roof. To do so, go to the fire exit at the right of the apartment door and go up the stairs until you reach the apartment roof. From there, go straight ahead to the edge of the building, where you will see the apartment's balcony below you. Disable or note the security camera before dropping to the balcony below, where you can enter an unlocked door to the apartment.
While inside the apartment, V can freely explore his surroundings without the risk of being caught, noticing various Samurai concert posters and vintage guitars, although Johnny Silverhand will call them "hot trash". Proceeding upstairs will take V to Slayton's bedroom along with a suitcase containing the Iconic item "Johnny's pants", and a shrine room containing Kerry's guitar. the door to the shrine is protected by a keypad, the code for which can be found on a still with the guitar in it with the date "2065". Simply enter the code (or force the door open with a Body attribute check), take the guitar. There is a computer in the bedroom locked via a keycode; although it doesn't unlock from the same code, entering the code into the door panel also appears to unlock the computer to check the messages showing Gaston wanted to get surgery to look like Johnny's band mate Kerry. V can also jack into the computer to get additional information. Exit the apartment building and head to Drop Point to deposit the guitar, completing the gig.
Objectives:
Get inside the building.
Go to apartment 1702 on the 17th floor.
Find Kerry Eurodyne's guitar.
Get inside the shrine room.
Enter the code 2065. [Optional]
Take Kerry Eurodyne's guitar.
Leave the building.
Deposit the guitar in the Drop Point.

Walkthrough:
About a day after Judy √Ålvarez and V met with Maiko Maeda at Clouds, Judy will text V that she is still working on a plan and that it will probably take a couple more days to finalize the details.
After some time passes, Judy will call V and tell them that she's devised a plan to take over Clouds, and invites V over to her apartment in the evening to discuss the plan in detail, with Tom Caldera and Roxanne Sumner‚Äìtwo dolls that work at Clouds, and Maiko Maeda, whom she managed to convince. She also asks V what they would prefer to have on their pizza. V, curious about this secret plan of Judy, asks her if she is privy to share more details now, to which Judy reveals that she managed to tweak the doll behavioral chips and how to turn them into fighter chips, but will go into more detail during the meeting.
After arriving at the apartment building on Charters street in Northside, V uses the intercom to let Judy know that they are there. V is promptly greeted by Tom, who tells them that their pizza is getting cold. As V enters and follows Tom to the kitchen, Judy greets V and introduces them to Roxanne, and tells them that she is one of the longest working dolls at Clouds. V sits down on the stool and talks with the others until Maiko‚Äìwho apparently was in the bathroom‚Äìcomes out to join in and makes a snide remark about the fact that Evelyn died in Judy's bathroom.
If V talks with Maiko Maeda and has killed Woodman:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
V talks with Maiko before talking with Judy. Maiko questions V about what happened to Oswald Forrest as he hasn't been to work in a few days, which V will happily explain to her.
V asks Judy what the plan is about, which Judy will explain in detail. She managed to modify the doll behavioral chips, and equip them with an advanced motor reflex system, that gives the doll enhanced combat abilities that could match a Solo. Judy will inform V that Tom already has the modified doll chip, and the chip's impulses replace ones natural reflexes, and makes the user feel like as if they were experiencing cyberpsychosis. Tom adds that it is basically the same as if he would activate his behavioral chip for a client.
If V has high enough Reflexes:
V asks about the possible side-effects of the behavioral chip, which Judy answers with that once a threat has been detected, the chip will automatically activate, and that she currently has not found a workaround for it, as it would require months of testing, which is time she doesn't have. Roxanne adds that there is an ethical side to the use of the chip, as you could murder someone and not remember doing so.
If V has high enough Body:
V tells them that being a Solo requires more than just executing a series of movements, and that it requires years of experience in the field to become a good Solo. Judy says that V is probably right, but that they do not have the time for years of intensive training.
If V asks Judy how she came up with the idea:
Judy explains that she learned how to adjust behavioral chips while she was working at Clouds, and given that how easy it was, the idea didn't jump into her mind as soon as they met with Maiko earlier. Maiko adds that due to all the surveillance at Clouds, this would probably never have happened during Judy's time there, as the Tyger Claws would have taken measures to prevent it from happening.
V wants to see how the modified behavioral chip works, asks for a demonstration. Tom will proceed to throw three kitchen knives at the wall in rapid succession. Unconvinced by Tom's display, V proceeds to ask for a one-on-one sparring duel with Tom, who proceeds to grab V arm and pushes them on Judy's couch.[N 1]
As V lands on the couch, Judy rushes over to them to make sure they are okay. Judy tells V that after they've taken over Clouds successfully, the chips will get neutralized so that they cannot be used again.[N 2]
Judy then reveals once they take over Clouds, the bosses will be given an ultimatum to take a cut of the proceeds to never show up at the club again, giving the dolls control of the place, but Maiko points out an obvious flaw: the Tyger Claws will just send more security in to regain control. She instead tells V that they need to go after Hiromi Sato‚ÄìClouds real owner‚Äìand humiliate him in front of the rest of the gang's bosses to remove him. Maiko will then suggest that they instead follow a two-pronged assault strategy, with Tom and Roxanne infiltrating the joyhouse and V infiltrating Hiromi's apartment.
If V decides to go forward with the plan:
V agrees to go forward with the plan. Maiko leaves with Tom and Roxanne in tow, whom ask her for a ride. V stays a little while longer at Judy's place to talk a little bit longer with Judy to discuss pay. As V stands up, they suffer another Relic malfunction, and sit back on Judy's couch with her help.
If V decides to tell Judy about the Relic:
V tells Judy about the Relic and what it is doing to them, and that they can only hope to find a cure.
Judy offers V to stay at her place for a little while longer, so that they can recover.
If V decides to stay:
V decides to stay over at Judy's place, and sleeps on the couch. In the morning, Judy texts them that they've gone out already, but left them breakfast on the kitchen counter.[N 3]
If V decides to pull out of the job:
V decides to pull out of the job, to much of the disappointment of Judy and Maiko.[N 4]
Objectives:
Keep busy while you wait for Judy's call.
Talk to Judy.
Go to Judy's apartment in the evening.
If it currently isn't evening:
Wait until evening.
Use the intercom.
Enter the apartment.
Sit on the stool.
Talk to the others.
Discuss Judy's plan.
Test out Tom's combat skills.
If V agrees to go forward:
Talk to Judy.
If V decides to crash at Judy's place:
Eat breakfast. [Optional]
Leave the building.
If V decides to leave:
Leave the building.
If V declines to go forward:
Leave the building.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìùReason: Addition of {{Condition}} if romanced or not
River will invite V for dinner at Joss'. Upon arriving in the evening, one will find River preparing jambalaya outside, and the two can talk about Randy. V can ask about the revenge on Peter Pan, River avoids the subject and instead tells them to get the rice. While doing so, V will run into Joss, with whom the player can converse with further. Upon returning to River with the rice, the pair finishes up the dish before sitting down at the patio for a drink. V can ask River about his past, whereby he can reveal the traumatic deaths of his parents (there is an option to halt this discussion, resulting in River being grateful not to discuss it.
The pair is then approached by River's niece and nephew want to play a AR game, which V has the option of let the kids win. After finishing, V and River join his family at the table to eat.[T 2]
If V has a feminine voice and body:
Joss will openly admit that River likes her, much to his embarrassment.
During this embarassing moment, River invites V to go to the nearby water tower. The pair climb to the top, enjoy the view, and River gifts his revolver to V in gratitude to for their help, claiming he has held it for too long. They then have a drink, and V (if female) can decide to whether to romance River or just stay friends. If V chooses the former a romance scene will play out, and they next morning the pair will wake up to discuss their relationship further. If V is male or elected to remain friends, the pair proceed to have more drinks into the night, waking up the next morning in the trailer with hangovers. River then heads out to take Joss to see Randy in the hospital, telling V to take their time to recover from their night.[N 1][N 2]

Walkthrough:
After agreeing to help Delamain track down his lost vehicles, V is able to encounter one at the sub-urban area in Rancho Coronado, Santo Domingo.
After getting close enough, the divergent Delamain will call V, asking them if they can see them‚Äìflamingos‚Äìas well. The divergent Delamain asks V to call them "Clarice," and wants V to destroy eight flamingos in the neighborhood before wanting to return home.[Trivia 1]
After V destroys the eight flamingos, they are called by the divergent Delamain again, and tell them to shut down, allowing Delamain to take control of the vehicle.
V is promptly called by Delamain to confirm the retrieval and transfers V a share of their payment.
Objectives:
Find the Delamain cab in Rancho Coronado.
Approach the Delamain cab.
Stay within signal range.
If you get too far from the cab:
Get back close to the Delamain cab.
Destroy the flamingos. [8]
Talk to the divergent Delamain.
Wait for Delamain to call.
Talk to Delamain.

Walkthrough:
Padre will call you, tasking you to steal a set of recordings from Sr. Ladrillo, pimp and proprietor of Dicky Twister. At the front door, you can pay $100 or convince the guard using sufficient Technical Ability to let you through. Your target is in Ladrillo's office, which is the glass room that can be seen above the dance floor. To reach it, you will need to proceed through the club and reach the stairs in the hostile area in the back, either by distracting the guard or using Optical Camo.
With very high Technical Ability, you can also open a locked door from the alley behind the establishment and reach a storage room past the main guards. With high Body, you can also open a double door in the alley, or jump to the roof and open a door leading directly to Sr. Ladrillo's office.
There are several guards and cameras on the top floor. When you reach the office, Saulo Capon, one of Ladrillo's lieutenants, will be standing near the computer. Neutralize him before stealing the data. You can also disable any remaining cameras from this terminal. Because this room is surrounded by glass windows, be careful, as you can be spotted by any remaining guards below.
Leave the establishment via the nearby doors to complete this gig.
Objectives:
Go to Dicky Twister.
Get to Sr. Ladrillo's office.
Steal the compromising material from within Dicky Twister.
Get out of Dicky Twister.

Walkthrough:
Shortly after completing Transmission, you will receive a text message from Ozob Bozo saying that he got your number from a friend and that they have a gig for you and that he will await your call.
After calling Ozob, he requests of you that you pick him up at the Cherry Blossom Market in Japantown, Westbrook. After picking up Ozob, he will instruct you to drive towards Urmland Street in Little China, Watson.
On arrival, Ozob will step out of the car to pick up "takeout" at a Chinese restaurant next to Misty's Esoterica. However, you will hear an explosion going off in the restaurant and Ozob stepping outside with several Tyger Claws on his tail. Help him neutralize the Tygers and speak to him for a reward and conclusions of the job.
Objectives:
Read the text from Ozob Bozo.
Call Ozob Bozo.
Park your car at the indicated location.
Honk.
Wait for Ozob.
Talk to Ozob.
Drive Ozob to Little China.
Wait for Ozob.
Defeat all enemies.
Talk to Ozob.

Walkthrough: The Zen Master can be found underneath the statue resembling a phoenix in the middle of the traffic roundabout below the North Oak sign, same location one of Delamain's cabs loiters around. After V briefly converses with the Zen Master expressing interest in continuing meditations, they are again offered the choice to pay what they feel is fair, this time being either nothing or 377 eddies. The BD meditation is themed after the element of fire this time. After it ends, the Zen Master is nowhere to be found, just as before.
Objectives: Talk to the Zen master.

Walkthrough:
As V approaches Megabuilding H4‚Äîin the south of Arroyo, Santo Domingo‚Äîthey find a green tag next to the entrance and a braindance recording in a nearby trash can. As V puts on the Braindance Wreath and slots in the braindance, they experience the death of cyberpsycho Lt. Col. James Norris and receive a warning about the fate of David Martinez.
After the braindance ends, V finds themselves on the ground. They text Muamar Reyes to inquire about David Martinez. Muamar relates some of David's story, and promises to be in touch when he has found out more about the whereabouts of his companions.
After about 24 in-game hours, V receives a text message from Falco. In it, Falco will explain that he used to run with David, although they have fallen out of the spotlight. Mentioning that V and David have much in common, and that while their 15 minutes of fame may be over, it is not yet too late for V. Falco instructs V to visit Muamar, as he has left behind a gift.
When V arrives at Muamar Reyes's location at the Dam Viewpoint, they find a cache on the balustrade. Approaching the cache reveals that the package left for them was David's Jacket. Looting the jacket will conclude the quest.
Objectives:
Play the braindance.
Text Muamar "El Capitan" Reyes and ask about David Martinez.
Wait a day for Muamar "El Capitan" Reyes to respond about David Martinez.
Reply to Falco's message.
Collect the gift from Martinez's crew left with Muamar "El Capitan" Reyes.

Walkthrough:
A day after finishing the race in the Badlands, Claire Russell reaches out to V to give them the starting location of the final qualifying race in Santo Domingo. She tells V to go to Brandon and Wollesen streets in Arroyo.
After arriving at the starting line, V calls Claire and she asks if they will be using their car or using her "Beast", then V sits on a nearby bench to wait for Claire and the others to arrive. This time, the competitors are teams from the Tyger Claws, The Mox, 6th Street, the Valentinos and the returning racers Jakub Antonowicz and Margot Wojciechowicz from the Aldecaldos.[Notes 1]
When V approaches Claire next to the vehicle, she tells V she wants to inspect the engine before they start. After speaking, Claire and V both get in the vehicle and prepare for the race.
If Claire and V win the race:
After winning the race, V receives a payout of 3,860 eurodollars, and has secured one of the finishes needed to qualify for the final race.
If Claire and V manage to qualify for the final race:[Notes 2]
After finishing the race, Claire will ask V to pull over at the nearby overlook to talk. Claire reveals that her late husband, Dean Russell, died during last year's championship race as Peter Sampson‚Äìa corporate working for Militech‚Äìpurposely slammed on his brakes while Dean and Claire were behind him, forcing Dean to brake as well and resulting in an accident where Dean died.
She'll then tell V the truth about why she wanted to do this year's race: she wants to kill Peter off in the championship and if forced between winning and killing Peter, she wants Peter killed.
If V agrees to help Claire:
After V agrees to help Claire, they will attend the final race in Westbrook. A day after finishing the race, Claire will text V.
If V's priority is winning:[Notes 2]
V says they just want to compete in the final race, and will put the race over her personal vendetta with Sampson. Claire understands V's decision, and they will attend the final race together. A day after finishing the race, Claire will text V.
If V refuses to help Claire:
After V refuses to help Claire, she says that she will continue the races with someone else and no longer shows up at the Afterlife.[Notes 3]
Objectives:
Head to the Santo Domingo race.
Call Claire to start the race.
Sit on the bench and wait for Claire.
Talk to Claire.
Get in Claire's ride.
Wait for the race to start.
Finish the race.
Talk to Claire.
Go to a secluded place.
Follow Claire.
Sit by Claire.
Talk to Claire.

Walkthrough:
After agreeing to help Delamain track down his lost vehicles, V is able to encounter one in Coastview, Pacifica. The Delamain cab patrols the road near the Grand Imperial Mall and the Pacifica Serenity Bible Church.
After getting close enough, the divergent Delamain will call V, identifying themselves as a mean Delamain.[Trivia 1][1] During the call, the mean Delamain lets V know that they have a surprise waiting for them after the next test, and that the surprise is that they are going to try and kill V.
At the upcoming underpass, near the border with Dogtown, and V gets ambushed by a group of Maelstromers. After defeating the ambush, V is able to talk with the mean Delamain, and after a few words, they will decide to return to the Delamain Corp Headquarters by themselves.
A short while afterwards, Delamain will call V and transfer V a modest sum of 1,640 eurodollars as part of the agreement.
Objectives:
Find the Delamain cab in Coastview.
Stay within signal range.
If you lose signal with the cab:
Get back close to the Delamain cab.
Defeat the gangoons.
Talk to the divergent Delamain.
Wait for Delamain to call.
Talk to Delamain.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite from V's perspective]
When V nears Megabuilding H6, Muamar Reyes will call with a job to sabotage a 6th Street hideout responsible for jumping a Militech transport in the area. He tasks V to infect their systems with a virus, and to kill Lucius Thoran, the Techie behind the 6th Street plans.
Follow the objective marker to the elevator of Megabuilding H6 and ascend to the 19th floor. This entire floor is a hostile area occupied by 6th Street gangers. Two will be waiting outside the elevator with their backs to you.
The computer you need to access is on the highest floor of the hideout, directly across the megabuilding from you, and your optional target, Lucius Thoran is in the same room. There is a stealth route through the abandoned rooms to your right (requires Body and Technical Ability).
Once you have completed your objectives, leave the hideout and return via the elevator. Some hostile 6th Street gangers may be waiting for you outside. After Muamar calls you, go to the drop point at the bottom of the building to complete this gig.
Objectives:
Enter the megabuilding.
Get inside 6th Street's hideout.
Kill Lucius. [Optional]
Upload the virus onto 6th Street netrunner's computer.
Leave the 6th Street hideout.
Go to the Drop Point.

Walkthrough:
You are contracted to investigate the cause of the disappearance of a smuggler's drones, and is directed to Union Railroad, an old railway station that is occupied by the Wraiths. The station is heavily guarded, with Wraiths both inside and outside the station's main building, automated turrets guarding the gateways, and cameras watching most of the grounds. Arriving at the station will prompt V to figure out how the drones are being intercepted, which can be done in two different ways.
The first method requires an Intelligence rank of 7. Enter the building, look for a computer on the ground floor, and pass the Intelligence skill check to hack it. Once hacked, go to the messages tab to discover the rooftop transmission antenna has been reprogrammed to broadcast a virus that disables the propulsion systems of drones that come within range, allowing the Wraiths to steal their cargo. V is directed to the roof to disable the antenna.
The second method is to ignore the computer and proceed straight to the roof to examine the antenna. Johnny Silverhand will appear and point out that the antenna is obviously being used to down the drones.
Disabling the antenna can be achieved by either destroying it with a weapon, which will alert any remaining guards and security systems on the premises, or by having a Technical Ability rank of 10, which lets V cut the antenna's power and stay undetected. Lastly, leave the area to complete the gig.
There is an alternative way to complete the gig. As a netrunner, it is possible to destroy the antenna without ever entering the compound:
Use a Tier 5 Ping on one of the guards and wait for the antenna to be highlighted, or
Take control of the surveillance camera at the very top of the tower, which will give a direct view of the antenna.
Hack the antenna with an Initiate Overload command to destroy it. Dakota will have a unique line if the antenna is destroyed in this manner.
Objectives:
Go to the signal source.
Find out how the drones were intercepted.
Destroy the antenna.
Leave the outpost.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
If you chose the Nomad lifepath, you can find a fellow nomad in the market and ask him about his own Nomad background. Once you do, you can then show him Anna Hamill's picture and he'll point you to where she's staying, in the motel right off the market. Alternatively, show the picture to Robert Rainwater on the south edge of the market.
When you confront Anna, there's three timed conversations with her. In the first one, if you chose to tell her you took the hit job, she'll immediately become hostile and you'll have to kill her. If you choose to warn her instead you have the chance to get her to back down with the next two timed dialogues, in which case she'll drop her investigation, albeit not happily.
With the Nomad Lifepath, one has the option to convince her to join the Aldecaldos.
Objectives:
Ask around the market about Anna Hamill. [Optional]
Confront Anna Hamill.
Leave the area.

Go to the Biotechnica container.
Search the Biotechnica container.
