Walkthrough:
Some time after leaving the PieZ restaurant after talking with Joshua Stephenson and Rachel Casich, Rachel will call V to say that Joshua has requested their presence while he prepares for his crucifixion braindance.
If V refuses the first time:
V says they currently don't have time to come, which will cause Joshua to plead with V over the phone, claiming that they need V to be present during recording. Rachel tells V that they'll receive extra compensation for their time.
If V refuses again:
V apologizes and tells them that they are on their own.[N 1]
If V agrees:
V agrees to help out and heads to Fourth Wall Studios, where there's a group of people protesting against "The Passion of Joshua"'s filming.[T 2] As V approaches the gate, they are hailed by Vasquez, who tells V that Rachel has been waiting for them, and instructs V to go to the building down the street with the NCPD Officer out front. After the Officer lets V inside, they talk to Rachel, who instructs them to talk to Joshua in the dressing room.
V approaches Joshua, and sits down on the stool in front of him. Joshua tells V that he is having second thoughts about recording the braindance and asks for V's opinion.[N 2] Eventually, Joshua will ask V to join him in prayer.
If V agrees, and lets him pray:
V and Joshua clasp their hands, and Joshua will recite Saint Augustine's Prayer to the Holy Spirit.
"Breathe in me O Holy Spirit, that my thoughts may all be holy."
"Act in me O Holy Spirit, that my work, too, may be holy."
"Draw my heart O Holy Spirit, that I love but what is holy."
"Strengthen me O Holy Spirit, to defend all that is holy."
"Guard me, then, O Holy Spirit, that I always may be holy. Amen."
If V clasps hands with Joshua, and does the praying:
V and Joshua clasp their hands, and V recites a prayer.[N 3]
If V doesn't want to pray:
V refuses to join Joshua in prayer, making Joshua pray silently on his own.
A moment later, Rachel enters backstage and interrupts Joshua and V, stating that the time has come to record the braindance. Joshua asks V if they want to perform his crucifixion.
If V agrees to crucify Joshua:
V accepts to crucify Joshua. After picking up the hammer, and waiting for everyone to be in position, V nails Joshua's wrists and feet to the cross while reciting the lines from the teleprompter.[N 4][N 5]
If V does not quit during the recording:
V presses the button to raise the cross, and waits for Joshua to pass.[N 6]
If V quits at any point during the recording:
V says that they are unable to continue with nailing Joshua to the cross, and another actor continues to fulfill the role instead. The actor presses the button and raises the cross, as V waits for Joshua to pass.[N 6]
Afterwards, V talks with Rachel, who will tell V that they'll reach out to V at a later point for their payment.
If V refuses to crucify Joshua, but agrees to stay:
V refuses to perform Joshua's crucifixion, and witnesses another actor fulfill the role instead.[N 4] After the crucifixion is finished and the cross is raised, V waits until Joshua has passed.[N 6] Before leaving, V talks with Rachel, who will tell V that they'll reach out to V at a later point for their payment.
If V refuses to participate and leaves the area:
V refuses to partake in Joshua's crucifixion and leaves Fourth Wall Studios.
V is contacted by Rachel again two days later, and she tells V that the braindance has been published.
If V was supportive of Joshua's actions:
Rachel exclaims that the braindance was a hit and thanks V for their help, and promises a bonus for them. After the call finishes, she will transfer V a moderate sum of eurodollars.
If V was not being supportive:
Rachel tells V that the braindance was of poor quality, and is angry with them. Despite this, she will transfer V a small sum of eurodollars.
Objectives:
Talk to Rachel.
If V agrees to come:
Talk to Vasquez.
Go inside the braindance studio.
Talk to Rachel.
Talk to Joshua Stephenson.
If V agrees to crucify Joshua:
Help Joshua record the BD.
Take the hammer and nails.
Wait by the cross.
Nail Joshua to the cross.
Raise the cross.
If V decides they can't continue:
Sit on the chair
Stay with Joshua until he dies.
Talk to Rachel.
If V refuses to crucify Joshua, but agrees to stay:
Help Joshua record the BD.
Sit on the chair.
Stay with Joshua until he dies.
Talk to Rachel.
If V refuses to participate and leaves the area:
Leave the braindance studio.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìùReason: Conditional statements
Rogue contacts V with a gig that she presents as a necessary evil. Either disrupt an otherwise respectable small business, or risk Militech cracking down on the city to stem the tide of jailbroken and untraceable weapons bearing their manufacturer's mark. The contract is for the former outcome.
V may either enter the Data Inc. store normally, through a set of industrial shutters in the alleyway south of the storefront, or circle around to the west of the store to attempt either a Technical Ability check on the rear door's lock or a Body check to force open the garage door.
If V enters via the storefront:
V can pose as a customer and even shop at the store without raising suspicion. The item selection is typical of a junk vendor, although sold at a significant markup by the surly and abnormally muscular salesperson. No weapons are available to buy even if V hints to the vendor that they are aware of the store's "high end" inventory. A gangoon will be arguing with the back-room staff about exactly this when V enters, but he leaves shortly after expressing his disappointment.
If V attacks the employees or is caught trespassing:
The customer puts aside his complaints and defends the store. If the employees are alerted after the gangoon leaves, he will also be alerted, although he's going to be too far away to provide much immediate help.
If V enters any other way, or tries to get behind the counter:
Attempting to get into an employee-only area will make the Animals posing as legitimate businessmen attack V on sight. If V opens the rear garage door, Rebeca will use her Netrunner skills to immediately start tracing V's location - presuming that the Animal in the back of the store doesn't see V as soon as the door opens.
Rebeca and a final guard can be found downstairs in a netrunning den. The last guard can be overheard on a holocall complaining to a friend that he's missing leg day because he has to "make sure [Rebeca] doesn't starve," provided he hasn't been alerted. Rebeca herself is out of her netrunning chair working on computers. A data shard in her inventory will reveal that she's in this business under duress rather than her own initiative, as Rogue had assumed. She will turn hostile if she spots V regardless; it seems that she has too much to lose.
If Rebeca is killed:
Rogue expresses no remorse if Rebeca is killed. In her mind, this was about maintaining equilibrium and nothing more.
If Rebeca is knocked unconscious and delivered to Rogue:
Rogue's tone is slightly more congratulatory. Incidentally, the quickest way to the fixer's transport is through the one-way door at the south end of the netrunning den.
Rogue does not remark on Rebeca's motivations in either outcome.
Objectives:
Enter the electronics store.
Reach the back of the store.
Find a way into the basement.
Find Rebeca Price.
Neutralize Rebeca Price.
Carry Rebeca out of the store.
Carry the body to the car.

Walkthrough:
Shortly after saving Saul Bright from the Wraiths Camp, Mitch Anderson will reach out to V with the request to help him organize Scorpion's funeral at the Mobile Camp.[N 1][N 2]
Upon agreeing to help, Mitch asks V if they can drive his car and follow him, while he drives in Scorpion's car to one of Scorpion's favorite spots.
Arriving at the spot‚Äîa collapsed bridge that borders the ravine of the northern Badlands‚ÄîMitch reveals that Scorpion's body is in the trunk of the car. V, freaked out by this, asks what Mitch is doing, who responds that Scorpion's final wish was to "sent off with a bang."
Mitch instructs V to grab a nearby gas canister filled with CHOOH2 and place it in the passenger seat of the car, as Mitch places Scorpion's body in the driver's seat. After that, Mitch asks V to light the rag he put in the car's gas tank on fire, while he starts the car remotely.
V and Mitch watch on as the car rides off the ramp into the ravine and explodes. Mitch explains to V that it felt right to include them as they are still alive because of them, and gives them Scorpion's Stinger and his beloved good luck charm, an Action Figure, as thanks.[N 3]
Objectives:
Talk to Mitch.
Follow Mitch.
Talk to Mitch.
Get in Mitch's car.
Follow Mitch.
Talk to Mitch.
Take the gas container.
Put the gas container in the passenger seat of Scorpion's car.
Talk to Mitch.
Light the rag on fire.
Follow Mitch.
Talk to Mitch.

Walkthrough:
This is an assassination gig and the target is Big Pete, a techie who works with the Wraiths. He can be found working in the basement of the New American Autoworks garage in the southern Badlands, which is guarded by two turrets (both facing the main road), six cameras (four external, two interior), and a total of nine Wraiths gang members (five exterior, four interior). Combat will finish the gig quickly, but stealth is also possible as long as the interior cameras and enemies are dealt with quietly.
However the enemies and defenses are handled, look for the door into the basement on the left side of the garage's interior. Upon entering the basement, Big Pete immediately notices V and pleads for mercy, explaining that the only reason he has a price on his head is because he sold a faulty signal jammer. In exchange for lying about killing him so he can escape with his life, Big Pete offers to double V's payout for the hit. If V perused one of the computers in the garage and read about Big Pete begging his brother, Tiny Mike, for money, they can point out that Big Pete is broke, but he will claim that this is no longer the case.
Once Big Pete is dealt with, V can use a utility tunnel that is only accessible from the basement as an alternate way to leave the area. The tunnel exits behind a communications tower behind the garage, out of view of any enemies or surveillance devices.
If V spares Big Pete and accepts his bribe:
Big Pete wires V the eurodollars and promises to leave Night City forever. Dakota Smith is surprised that V let the target go, but closes the contract since the problem has been solved.
If V spares Big Pete and declines his bribe:
Big Pete promises to leave Night City forever. Dakota Smith is surprised that V let the target go, but closes the contract since the problem has been solved.
If V kills Big Pete:
The contract is fulfilled normally and Dakota Smith is pleased.
Objectives:
Get inside Big Pete's garage.
Find Big Pete.
Neutralize Big Pete.
Leave the area.

Walkthrough:
Preliminaries[]
After the initial fight with the training robot, it acts as a tracker for the following side jobs:
Beat on the Brat: Arroyo
Beat on the Brat: Kabuki
Beat on the Brat: Rancho Coronado
Beat on the Brat: The Glen
Only the Kabuki fight can be done during Act 1, as the rest of the locations are inaccessible until Act 2 due to Watson being under NCPD lockdown. Completing all four fights will unlock the championship fight against professional boxer Razor Hugh. To unlock this final fight, you must first complete Transmission.
If V has completed the side job Send in the Clowns‚Äîwhich unlocks after completing the main job Transmission‚Äîan optional fifth preliminary fight will be unlocked:
Beat on the Brat: Pacifica
Razor Hugh[]
The championship fight against Razor Hugh is held in the Grand Imperial Mall in Pacifica. The fight starts at 12:01 AM, and if V arrives before that time, they'll be prompted to skip the time on a nearby bench. Before the fight begins, Coach Fred will offer to double V's cash reward if they throw the fight and let Razor win. V can accept, ensuring they will receive the bonus no matter how they lose. If V wins the fight, then regardless of whether they took Fred's offer, they will still receive the standard amount of money as a reward.
Close to where Coach Fred privately speaks to V there is also a child that wants to talk to V. She will mention how her father fought Razor years ago, fell in the third round and despite the referee calling the match, Razor kept attacking, badly injuring him in the process. She says she wants Razor to pay for ruining her family's life.
Among the audience there are all of V's past opponents ‚Äî Esquerdo & Certo, C√©sar Diego Ruiz, Rhino ‚Äî and Viktor Vektor, who will tell V that Razor is weak to hits in the torso because he recently had new abdominal muscles implanted. Punching Razor in the gut will stagger him for a few seconds. Razor is fast and hits hard but can be stun-locked by repeatedly breaking his guard with charged punches using Gorilla Arms. He also badly telegraphs his moves; a well-timed guard will turn into a counter with a brief couple of seconds of slowed-down time, letting V get several key punches into his gut.
If V accepted to throw the fight and lost:
Coach Fred rewards V with the standard ‚Ç¨$50,000 and an extra ‚Ç¨$20,000. Viktor will notice this and criticize V for it.
If V accepted to throw the fight and won:
Fred will be angry, but they will still reward the merc with ‚Ç¨$50,000. Viktor and the other fighters will compliment V for winning the fight.
If V didn't accept to throw the fight and lost:
Fred is happy that V has changed their mind, offering ‚Ç¨$50,000 plus an extra that V can either accept or decline. If accepting, Viktor will notice this and criticize V for it.
If V didn't accept to throw the fight and won:
Coach Fred will reward the standard ‚Ç¨$50,000. Viktor and the other fighters will compliment V for winning the fight.
If V talked to the child and won the fight:
As V is leaving the venue, V will overhear the girl having a phone conversation with someone where it appears she lied about her family's situation in order to motivate V to win the fight so she can win more money betting on Razor losing. When confronted, the child will run away.
If V talked to the child and lost the fight:
She will ignore V.
Objectives:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Talk to the coach.
Defeat the training robot.
Talk to the coach.
Defeat all opponents to get to the final round.
Wait for the final fight.

Walkthrough:
A group of BARGHEST led by Ross Ulmer are protecting the smuggling tunnel between Dogtown and West Wind Estate.
Neutralizing Ross Ulmer grants access to the Iconic Senkoh LX Raiju.
Objectives:
Neutralize Ross Ulmer.
Neutralize the BARGHEST soldiers.
Loot the cache.

Walkthrough:
A day after helping Panam Palmer and the veteran Aldecaldos seize the Basilisk from Militech, V is contacted by Panam, telling them that they have completed the assembly of the panzer vehicle, and ask V if they want to drive it.
After accepting Panam's invite, V heads back to the Mobile Camp in Rocky Ridge to meet with her and the other Aldecaldos. Upon approaching them, they tell V that they're still finalizing a few little things, such as the panzer's Intrusion Countermeasures Electronics. Cassidy tells V that they left the Militech trucks at a nearby Raffen Shiv camp so that the corporation would start looking at them instead of the Aldecaldos. Upon telling them that they always dreamed of driving one of them, Panam tells V that they can climb inside the panzer.[N 1]
As V climbs inside the panzer, Panam joins them in the other seat and starts up the Basilisk, which does not go smoothly. After starting the machine, Panam ask V what they think about the machine, and explains that while connected to the vehicle's systems, it in essence becomes an extension of the body. As Panam pilots the vehicle out of the camp for a test run, she explains V that a co-pilot is needed to handle the sensory overload, which is why the pilot takes care of the vehicles movement and the co-pilot takes care of the vehicle weapon systems.[T 2]
Once far enough away from the camp, Panam disconnects from the vehicle, and instructs V to jack-in themselves and pilot for a short distance before asking them to maneuver through the Wind Farms. After piloting past several wind turbines, Panam tells V that it is time for some target practice, and asks that they take the five targets in the area.
After the target practice, Panam tells V that she will also be connecting to the vehicle. After she connects, V experiences strange feelings and asks Panam what happens. She explains that, while both jacked-in, the pilot and co-pilot's systems become intertwined.
If V romanced Panam:
Panam asks V if they want to "try it out," which they accept, and a romantic scene will engage.
Suddenly, Panam and V are attacked and surrounded by the Raffen Shiv, and have to defeat them. Saul Bright contacts them over the radio, informing them that the Raffen Shiv have also started assaulting the camp, and instructs them to return to help.[N 2]
After defeating the Raffen Shiv, Panam and V park and exit the Basilisk, and proceed to meet with Saul. Saul tells Panam that she's been making the right decisions for the Aldecaldos family, and asks her that she leads them alongside him. He admits to Panam that he was wrong about her actions before, and proceeds to hug her. After hugging, Panam exclaims that things have to change in order for her to accept her new position, to which Saul responds that the first thing they have to do is find a new location for their camp before Militech and more Wraiths find them. The rest of the Aldecaldos congratulate Panam, before she asks that V follows her.
While walking, Panam and V reflect back on their adventure so far, and Panam tells V that it is mostly because of them that they've made it this far, and that if they were ever in the need of the Aldecaldos's help, they would have it. Upon arriving at the camp's bar, she will ask V what type of drink they'd like, and talk more with each other. While talking, Panam asks that V stay with the Aldecaldos, which V isn't sure about because of the situation they are in. As V turns away from the bar, they suffer from another Relic malfunction and drop to the floor.
Some time passes, and V is woken up by Panam inside a tent. Panam explains to V that while they were passed out, the Aldecaldos moved camp to a safer place. Panam proceeds to ask V what is happening to them, to which V will explain the unique situation they are in. After talking, V gets up and is met by Mitch and Saul, also asking V what happened.
After talking with them, Panam escorts V out of the camp back to their vehicle. While following Panam, she will tell V that the camp's new location is outside Militech's usual patrol areas and that they have a better tactical advantage due to the layout, but that despite that, they will soon have to move again.
Upon reaching V's vehicle, Panam will ask V how she can help them get better, to which they don't really have an answer but tell her that they will let her know if they do find more information.[N 3]
Objectives:
Leave the camp and wait for a day for the Basilisk to be ready.
Meet with Panam.
Talk to Panam and the veterans.
Get in the Basilisk.
Talk to Panam.
Get the Basilisk in position.
Drive past the wind turbines.
Get the Basilisk in position.
Shoot at the targets. [5]
Talk to Panam.
Defeat the Raffen Shiv. [28]
Return to the nomad camp.
Wait for Panam.
Meet with Saul.
Follow Panam.

Follow Panam.
Talk to nomads.
Follow Panam.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Mower is a fairly tough opponent. In addition to punches that cause fire damage, she can also electrify the water you are standing in, causing damage. She also uses a submachine gun if you're not interested in slugging it out with her and choose to stay out of the water. As her health gets low, she will also use Optical Camo. Like the other Cyberpsycho Sighting gigs, you have the option to take her down using non-lethal methods for a bonus.
Once you've taken Mower down, read the shard she drops to learn about her problems and Militech's response to them, then send the info to Regina.
Objectives:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Locate Cyberpsycho.
Neutralize Cyberpsycho.
Search the area to collect information.
Read the shard with the conversation between Dr. Martin Sypura and Lt. Mower.
Message Regina about Cyberpsycho Sighting: Lt. Mower.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
You can sneak in and find a computer in the basement where you can upload malware then sneak out again. However, there is no bonus reward for stealth in this mission, so it's better to just use violence so you can gather their gear to sell or dismantle.
To successfully complete this mission, either blow up the 3 large pressure tanks along one wall in the basement, or upload malware to the computer in the middle of the room they are in. Once one of those tasks is accomplished, leave the area.

Client Flavio dos Santos is on 6th Street's hit list after Will Gunner's successful coup, and V has to escort him to an Aldecaldo smuggler who can get Flavio out of town. However, there is a problem: instead of lying low at his hideout until V got there, Flavio threw a massive party. As V arrives at the dilapidated house, it has already been surrounded by 6th Street gang members who have massacred several joytoys. V must search the house to see if Flavio is still alive.
The first three entrances are in sight of enemies. Deactivated surveillance cameras can be used to scout some of the house's interior. To find Flavio to the second floor, and takes the door furthest from the stairs. The building has four points of egress - front door, the garage, back door, and a crawlspace under the house which leads to a hole in the floor.
V encounters a bloodbath, with Flavio the only survivor. Wake him, then lead him downstairs to the car waiting in the garage; you are required to use this car, if you leave it and try to switch to another vehicle Muamar Reyes send an angry message to you to get back or fail the gig. Drive the car down the street to a parking lot where the smuggler awaits. With that, V's part in Flavio's rescue is over, but the smuggler is upset that Flavio is bleeding out because he will not be paid if his client dies. As the smuggler frantically drives Flavio away to a ripperdoc, Muamar Reyes calls to pay V and close the gig.
Objectives:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Enter the hideout.
Find Flavio dos Santos in his hideout.
Scan the bodies to find Flavio.
Talk to Flavio.
Escort Flavio to the transport.
Get in the car with Flavio.
Bring Flavio to the nomad contact.
Exit car.
Talk to the nomad.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Nika Yankovich, after learning her twin brother Gaspar had been brought to Haven Clinic, stormed into its premises with a group of fellow Scavengers and chased out Odell Blanco alongside all the patients after ripperdoc Anthony Anderson refused to let her see her sibling and barricaded himself in his office. Blanco reached out to Mr. Hands, who contacted the mercenary V to solve this predicament.
After talking to Odell‚Äîwho has made a temporary clinic across the road at The Golden Fleece‚ÄîV approaches the former church to find a way inside.[N 1]
Once inside, V deals with the Scavengers and goes downstairs to Anthony Anderson's office. There, they find Nika threatening the ripperdoc at gunpoint, demanding to see her brother. Anthony explains Gaspar overdosed and died after arriving at the clinic, but at least he could harvest his Implants to save other lives. Nika refuses and demands him to give her brother's corpse.
If V engages combat with Nika Yankovich:[N 2]
V neutralizes Nika, much to Anthony's relief.
If any Scavengers are still alive and conscious:
The other Scavengers are alerted to the situation, leading V to neutralize those that remain.
With the threat now taken care of, Anthony plans to clean up the mess and continue his work at the clinic.
After leaving the clinic, Mr. Hands congratulates V on a job well done. Anthony has apparently declined his offer of help in cleaning up the mess, instead choosing to examine the bodies himself.[N 3]
If V lets Nika Yankovich kill Anthony Anderson:[N 4]
V decides to leave Anthony's fate to Nika, who then beats Anthony to death. After leaving the the clinic, V returns to Odell and delivers the bad news. Odell laments Anthony's loss and says that they're finished, but V convinces him to keep the clinic running in his stead.
Mr. Hands is disappointed that V failed to protect Anthony. However, since the threat from the Scavengers has been dealt with, he decides to close the gig and consider it complete regardless.
If V manages to convince Anthony to tell Nika where Gaspar's body is:[N 5]
V managed to talk Anthony Anderson into submission and give up Gaspar Yankovich's body to his sister. He reveals that the body was kept in the "cooling room" in the room across from his office.
Mr. Hands is pleased that V managed the gig without killing anyone, because this way Anthony and his clinic won't have to fear a possible retaliation by the Scavengers.[N 6]
Objectives:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Meet with Mr. Hands' client, Odell Blanco.
Talk to Mr. Hands' client, Odell Blanco.
Find a way into the clinic.
Find a way to the clinic basement.
Find Anthony Anderson's office in the clinic basement.
See what's going on in Anthony Anderson's office.
Talk to Nika and Anderson.
Talk to Anthony Anderson.
Leave the clinic.

Neutralize Zoe Alonzo.
Neutralize the remaining enemies.

Walkthrough:
This quest only becomes available if Nele Springer was saved from Biotechnica and left in amicable terms with V during Gig: Roads to Redemption. After a few days, you will receive a message from Nele's number asking V to meet her at the designated coordinate within Dogtown.
The mission marker will lead to a closed shipping container, where another message will arrive from Nele stating that she is inside. Opening it will set off a flashbang grenade, blinding you as a small group of mercenaries in the employ of Biotechnica attacks. Defeat all of the mercenaries in order to complete the job.
Objectives:
Read the message from Nele Springer.
Go to the meeting point.
Meet with Nele Springer.

There are several ways to get the shard from bot:
Sneak behind the vendor's "office" into restricted zone and get to the van with the robot inside. There are only three guards and one security camera in the area.
The robot can be purchased for ‚Ç¨$31000, which can be lowered to ‚Ç¨$15000 with Cool attribute skill check, from the Junk Vendor in order to avoid combat.
Threaten vendor and fight through everyone.
Objectives:
Go to the landfill.
Find the broken bot.
Go to the broken bot's location.
Pull the shard from the bot.
Deposit the shard in the Drop Point.

Walkthrough:
After clearing the Grand Imperial Mall and returning to Batty's Hotel, Brigitte leads V to the Maglev Tunnel beneath the Pacifica Serenity Bible Church. This is a hideout of the Voodoo Boys and the physical location of their Data Fortress, Rezo Agwe. Brigitte exploits V and Johnny Silverhand to communicate with Alt Cunningham, who can help the Voodoo Boys' members go through the Blackwall.
In cyberspace, V experiences one of Johnny's inaccurate memories. In the memory, the player will control Johnny in the year 2013.
Never Fade Away[]
Main article: Never Fade Away (quest)
In 2013, Alt Cunningham was abducted by goons hired by Arasaka. Johnny tried to defeat the goons but got ambushed by one of the goons using Mantis Blades. Johnny was later saved and taken to a Ripperdoc called Milt Nauman by Lyle Thompson, a Media who initially planned to meet Alt at the same time.
Later, Johnny hired Rogue and Santiago to break into Arasaka Tower and save Alt together. Rogue was initially unwilling to get involved. However, in the middle of the meeting between Johnny and the two, Arasaka agents broke in the location. They succesfully escaped from the agents. After defeating the agents, Johnny finally got into his car, with Lyle driving. Rogue and Santiago took motorcycles. They went to a safe place and planned the strike. Johnny organized his fans to make a rebellion against Arasaka, and decided to call Nancy to report the rebellion, in order to distract Arasaka. Then Johnny, Rogue, Santiago, and Lyle struck into Arasaka Tower and approached the mainframe. They finally found Alt, who had been jacked in Soulkiller. Johnny unceremoniously killed Toshiro next to Alt, and subsequently unplugged Alt from the mainframe, denying her to return to her body. Much to Johnny's madness, he punched Lyle since Lyle was still recording for the news. Then Johnny had to admit that Alt was dead.
The Blackwall[]
After the playback, V is returned to cyberspace. V talks to Johnny about the memory, and then flashes back to Brigitte in cyberspace. Brigitte takes V and her Netrunners next to the Blackwall, and sends V to go through the Blackwall and talks to Alt Cunningham for taking the Voodoo Boys' members through the Blackwall.
If V has chosen to cooperate with Bryce Mosley in I Walk the Line:
Because the shard given by the agent has removed Placide's malware in V but installed NetWatch's own tracker. Once the VDB's contact Alt, she realizes NetWatch is taking action and to stop them she flatlines the Voodoo Boys except for V.
After V exits cyberspace, with Brigitte and her Netrunners' bodies lying on the chairs, the rest of the Voodoo Boys' members led by Placide are on alert. V must defeat Placide and the remaining Voodoo Boys' members to escape the church.
If V has followed Placide's plan in I Walk the Line:
With Alt's aid, the Voodoo Boy's Netrunners successfully go through the Blackwall.
After V and Brigitte exit cyberspace, V confronts Brigitte, and Brigitte finally forces V to leave. V can go leave the church peacefully or choose to use violence.
Objectives:
Follow Brigitte.
Talk to Brigitte.
Get in the ice bath.
Wait for the connection.
Talk to Brigitte.
Investigate the source of the noises.
Unblock Johnny's memories.
Talk to Brigitte.
Touch the Blackwall.
Talk to Alt.
Talk to Brigitte.
Leave the chapel.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
After taking out the Satwave Power Plant, Panam Palmer and V chase after the crashing Kang Tao AV deep into the Jackson Plains of the southern Badlands. While chasing the AV, communications on the radio frequency have Mitch and Scorpion approach the AV first. Panam attempts to warn Mitch and Scorpion, but the EMP interferes, and she is unable to do so.
Panam and V are attacked by three Kang Tao Griffin drones which have to be taken down. V does so by jacking into Panam's truck and taking control of its machine gun. However, while V takes down the drones, the gun malfunctions, forcing Panam to put the truck on autodrive and fix the machine gun. She does so after several seconds, but a bullet ricochets into her back. Regardless, she goes back to driving, and V takes down the drones.
Panam and V arrive at the site of the AV crash. Panam takes an expired injector to deal with her wound. V agrees to go to the AV, while Panam stays to cover V with Mitch's gun.
If V abandons Panam and heads straight for the gas station (does NOT unlock I'll Fly Away):
V leaves Panam and single-handedly retrieves Hellman from a nearby gas station that he and his bodyguards sought refuge in. Panam then shows up with Aldecaldos reinforcements, saying that she managed to rescue Mitch herself and that unlike V, she does not bail. Her subsequent text messages will be very frustrated about her life outside the clan and include a remark about Mitch, who gave Scorpion an Aldecaldos-style funeral by himself.
If V assists Panam in clearing the wreckage (unlocks I'll Fly Away):
Nearing the AV's crash site, Panam instructs V to use a surveillance drone to identify any remaining Aldecaldo survivors and scan for enemies in the area, and the AV. After scanning the AV and Mitch, V can exit the drone. Panam provides overwatch while V takes out the hostile forces. As a last stand, the remaining Kang Tao operative takes Mitch captive and locks them both inside the AV. When opened by V, the operative can be intimidated (dialogue options "only looking for Hellman" and "I'm losing my patience"), causing him to reveal Hellman's whereabouts. This allows Panam and V to immediately head for the gas station to the west that Hellman and his guards took refuge in.
Alternatively, V or Panam (if one waits too long) can shoot the soldier holding Mitch, the latter will tell the pair that Scorpion died during the assault, and that Kang Tao escaped using Aldecaldo vehicles. The group then has to follow the tire tracks around the wreckage to pursue find Hellman. Scanning the tire tracks allows V to see a simulation of where Kang Tao went. However, this delay will result in additional Kang Tao reinforcements present at the gas station.
V and Panam will subsequently head to the gas station via motorcycle. In the end, Aldecaldos reinforcements will arrive and Panam and V part ways after a short talk.
Regardless, once in the gas station, V searches for Hellman.
If V finds the gas station owner:
V finds the gas station owner locked in a room behind the counter. He tells V that he is unarmed, and can tell V that Hellman is on the second floor.
V finds Hellman being attended to by a Kang Tao medic. Hellman panics about Arasaka being sent after him, but V knocks him out.[N 1] They call Goro Takemura, telling him to meet them at the Sunset Motel. They then carry Hellman outside, where they meet with the Aldecaldos. After V and Panam talk, she allows V to take Scorpion's Apollo, and V takes Hellman to the motel.
V wakes Hellman up once there in a motel room. V tries to get Hellman to help them with their biochip, doing so by explaining the biochip, how they have it, and what they've tried to do about it so far. He tells V that the biochip was experimental, and that the biochip was in its trial phase. After some conversation about the biochip, Hellman jacks into V to examine the biochip. He then tells V that they cannot function independently of the biochip, as their neural network has deteriorated too much for that to be possible. He also says that all he can do is to send V to a clinic in Sweden, and help V minimize their pain. He can then ask V about how they deal Johnny Silverhand's engram, although V can choose to not to talk about it. V threatens Hellman, and he offers to help them if they come with him to Kang Tao, which V refuses.
Takemura walks into the motel room, interrupting the conversation. Hellman gives V a chip containing a blueprint to V's brain and the biochip. V exits the motel room, leaving Hellman with Takemura. As V leaves, however, their relic malfunctions, and V talks with Silverhand's engram. Once V is finished talking to Silverhand, the mission will end.

Walkthrough:
Panam Palmer asks V to meet her again during midnight at the garage near the Sunset Motel in Rocky Ridge, to discuss their plan on how to take down the Kang Tao AV.
When V meets her there, she will be working on her truck. She quickly finishes up, and she and V will discuss a plan to use an EMP launched from a power station to take down the Kang Tao AV, and enter the AV to take Anders Hellman.
After they discuss the plan, V rides with Panam to the location where they plan to take down the AV. While on their way there, Panam stops the car, and lets V calibrate to the machine gun attached to her car, requiring V to jack in and shoot at a few abandoned vehicles with it. Afterwards, they discuss how they plan to launch the EMP using the power station.
V and Panam then wait a few hours for the AV to fly over before making their way to the power station. Upon arriving, V jacks into Panam's machine gun mounted to her car, and they are chased down by a few drones that V must shoot down. Once the drones are shot down, V jacks out of the gun, and Panam drives her car into the entrance of a control station. There, V overcharges the terminal, and rushes back to Panam's car, and they drive out of and away from the power station to a cliff looking over it, as to ensure the pulse from the EMP does not interfere with them.
Panam gives V the detonator for the EMP, and they wait a brief period of time before they spot the AV flying over coming from Pacifica. V triggers the detonator, which does not work immediately, and sends the EMP too late to take the AV out of the sky. Panam steps out of the truck, and uses an RPG to shoot down the AV herself. This does not take it down either, but does force it to lose altitude. This leads directly into Life During Wartime.
Objectives:
Meet Panam at midnight.
Talk to Panam.
Take the passenger seat.
Talk to Panam.

Take out the power plant security. [4]
Get to the terminal.

Take the passenger seat.
Go to the hill with Panam.

Walkthrough:
Along the Sage Gulch Road in Rattlesnake Creek in the southern Badlands, there is a burned out car. Near it is the corpse of a Netrunner who went by the name Jackal. A shard titled: Transcript: Jackal and NC#1554 can be found on the body.
Upon looting this shard, you will be directed to a location down the road, close to the Abandoned Fuel Station. You will find a crash landed locker containing loot, including two pairs of Antisurge ICE-protected netrunner infovisors.
Objectives:
Go to the drop site.
Loot.

Walkthrough:
If V encounters the traffic jam in City Center:
A few days after helping Delamain recover their divergent vehicles, V encounters a traffic jam on the Ring Road in Corpo Plaza, City Center.[N 2]
Upon approaching the traffic jam, V will encounter three Delamain Cab that have intercepted a Kaukaz truck, and Johnny Silverhand will project himself to talk to V. Johnny suggests that V try and contact Delamain to investigate further.
When V calls Delamain, it quickly becomes clear to them what is happening. The virus that has been corrupting Delamain's systems has now also infected the core system, and Delamain asks V for help.
If 48 hours have passed after completing Epistrophy:
A few days after helping Delamain recover their divergent vehicles, Delamain calls V to let them know that they are in need of help, as the virus they discovered has now also infected their core systems.
Upon arriving at Delamain Headquarters, V finds Delamain having difficulties communicating. It tries to open the doors toward the offices and garages but fails to do so. Unable to find any other ways to enter through the reception area, V leaves the building and manages to find an alternative entry point.[N 3]
Inside the building, V searches for a way to open the locked door that is barring their way. They manage to find a terminal, with which they can unlock the door.[N 4] As V treads through the hallway onto the workshop, they can hear multiple drones patrolling the area and attacking each other.
After managing to find a way across the workshop floor, V enters the control room. In the control room, each divergent Delamain tries to influence V by asking to be set freed by them, with the exception of the original Delamain, who asks V to reset the core.
As V approaches the core, Johnny projects himself in front of them, asking V to not reset the core.[N 5][N 6]
If V resets the core:
V chooses to reset the core and restores the original Delamain.[N 5] Because resetting the core also wipes his memory, Delamain has no recollection of who V is, but is able to access previous logs to identify them as the person who has helped them get rid of the virus by resetting the core. After exiting the core, Delamain will transfers V ownership of one of the vehicles from their fleet, as has been declared by Delamain's "previous version."[N 7]
If V hacks the core (requires a high Intelligence check):
V chooses to hack the core and merges the divergent Delamain's with Delamain's core, creating a singular Delamain entity who has no other desire than to leave Night City.[N 5] Upon speaking with the entity, he will mention that he leaves his "one true son" to V, and state that he will remain at V's side until their dying breath, before bidding them farewell. After exiting the core, the remaining Delamain asks V to enter the cab, and will introduce themselves as "Junior."
If V destroys core:
V chooses to destroy the core, and liberates the divergent Delamains, who flee from the garage of the facility.[N 5] Upon speaking with Johnny, he will mention that one of the Delamain Cabs has apparently stayed behind in the hangar. When entering the cab, he will introduce themselves as "Excelsior," and allow V to become their new "owner."
Objectives:
If V goes to the traffic jam in City Center:
Discover the cause of the traffic disturbance.
Talk to Johnny.
Call Delamain.
If V is contacted by Delamain:
Return to Delamain HQ.
Find a way inside Delamain HQ.
Search the office for a way to open the door.
Proceed down the hallway.
Find a way into the workshop.
Find a way into the control room.
Find a way to the stairs. [Optional]
Go downstairs. [Optional]
Cross the room. [Optional]
Hear out the Delamains.
Find Delamain's core.
Talk to Johnny.
Destroy the core to liberate the divergent Delamains. [Optional]
Reset the core to restore the original Delamain. [Optional]
Hack the core to merge all the Delamains. [Optional]
If V resets the core:
Talk to Delamain.
Leave through the side exit.
Talk to Delamain.
Get in the driver's seat.
If V hacks the core:
Talk to Delamain.
Leave through the side exit.
Approach the car.
If V destroys the core:
Talk to Johnny.
Approach the car.
Get in the driver's seat.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Turn bullet points into actual events]
V stumbles across three NCPD patrolmen, Corey Aldwyn, Keegan Kelly, and William Becker, beating up a man in an alley, but the situation is not all that it appears. V can intervene by speaking with Officer Aldwyn. V can choose to demand that the officers leave the man alone, which turns them hostile, or turn a blind eye and walk away.
If V has a Streetkid background, they have an additional dialogue option to learn more about the beaten man's circumstances. The man, Nigel Hamilton, is a wealthy corpo who showed an XBD to a girl that put her into a coma. That woman happened to be the daughter of one of Aldwyn's friends, and Aldwyn was taking justice into his own hands since Hamilton's status meant he was going to avoid being charged with a crime. V can then persuade the officers to leave peacefully by volunteering to deal with Hamilton for them.
However the officers are handled, V must then wake and confront Hamilton, leaving the area at this point causes the job to fail. In addition to immediately letting Hamilton go, V can also dig deeper or force him to pay for the help.
If V has 5 Cool: V can demand payment. Hamilton hands over ‚Ç¨$2280. V then has two more options, either of which will conclude the side job:
Let Hamilton go.
If V has 5 Body, they can demand all of Hamilton's money. Hamilton gives up an extra ‚Ç¨$2660.
If V has 5 Reflexes: V can ask Hamilton to tell the truth about what the cops wanted from him. He will claim to not know and insinuate he was attacked for no reason. V then has two more options, either of which will conclude the side job:
Let Hamilton go.
If V has 13 Cool, they can demand money. Hamilton pays ‚Ç¨$2280.
If V has 5 Body, they can demand all of Hamilton's money. Hamilton gives up an extra ‚Ç¨$2660.
If V is a Streetkid: V can mention that they know Hamilton is showing spiked XBDs to people. Hamilton will confess that he is aware the XBDs are harmful, and he showed one to the girl deliberately. V then has two more options, either of which will conclude the side job:
Let Hamilton go.
If V has 13 Cool, they can demand money. Hamilton pays ‚Ç¨$2280.
If V has 5 Body, they can demand all of Hamilton's money. Hamilton gives up an extra ‚Ç¨$2660.
V can also kill Hamilton which will also result in the job being completed. Looting his corpse after extorting "everything" from him will result in even more money, indicating Hamilton lied about handing over everything he had.
Objectives:
Defeat the cops.
Wake the corpo.
Talk to the corpo.

Walkthrough:
The opponent here is C√©sar Diego Ruiz, a member of the Valentinos and boxing champion of the Glen. He has a girlfriend, Micaela, with a baby on the way. In lieu of betting money, Ruiz will stake his ride, the Villefort Alvarado "Vato". In turn, you'll need to stake ‚Ç¨$20,000.
This match may seem difficult at first, especially if challenging him at a lower level. Ruiz has a large health pool, and his signature attack can knock you out in as few as two hits. Fortunately, his signature attack has an extremely obvious tell. Back away from him a good distance, making sure to leave ample room to move on the right. Ruiz will put up his fists and step with a blur effect towards you before jumping and throwing a punch. Simply circle to the right of him when he begins to blur or before he jumps and his attack will be completely avoided, leaving him wide open for a few seconds. Punch Ruiz's head a few times before he turns around, then back off and wait for your stamina to recover. Rinse and repeat until he goes down.
You can also cheat a bit to give you a slight advantage by littering recovery items and non-lethal melee weapons on the court and pick them up during the fight to get around the block usually in place on these items during matches. Furthermore, recovery implants and the Gorilla Arms implant can be freely used if you have them installed.
When Ruiz is defeated, he will concede the money and car as promised, but you have a few options:
Take both the car and the money
Take the car, but leave Ruiz the money
Take the money, but leave Ruiz the car
Decline both the money and car
The options only affect your final reward and the discussion Ruiz and Micaela have afterwards. As long as you didn't take both the car and money, Ruiz and Micaela have the same reaction.
Objectives:
Go to the fight in the Glen.
Talk to the champion of the Glen.
Defeat C√©sar.
Talk to the champion of the Glen.

Walkthrough:
After talking with Takemura at Tom's Diner on Urmland Street, you receive a text message from El Capit√°n that his chooms Bob and Emma from EZEstates have some new digs for you to check out on their website.
After checking out the new EZEstates website in your current apartment, you see that there are four new apartments that you are able to rent. For the Japantown Apartment you just need to put down 30,000 eddies through an online transfer or visit the apartment in person to acquire access.
The apartment can be found in an apartment block on the Holly and Floyd Street in Japantown, Westbrook.
Objectives:
Rent the Japantown apartment: (‚Ç¨$30,000, one-time fee)
Go to the Japantown apartment.

Walkthrough:
After V receives a text message from Claire with the race's starting coordinates, they travel to Martin Luther King Boulevard and Skyline East in Vista del Rey, Heywood, after which they call Claire telling her that they're ready to race. During the phone call, Claire and V decide which vehicle to use. After ending the call, V sits down on a nearby bench and waits for the others to arrive.[Notes 1]
As V gets up from the bench, they are mocked by Peter Sampson, who has also come to observe the races. Claire and V's competitors consist of a crew of 6th Street gangers, Moxes, Tyger Claws, Militech goons, and Valentinos.
V walks over to Claire and talks with her. She tells V that the NCPD won't bat an eye at the races and what transpires during them, as long as they're being paid off. She also hands V a shard that V will need to navigate the route laid out for the races. After V slots in the shard, Claire and V hop aboard the vehicle and start the race.
If Claire and V finish second or third:
Claire and V have secured one of the finishes needed to qualify for the final race.
If Claire and V win the race:
After winning the race, V receives a payout of 3860 eurodollars, and have secured one of the finishes needed to qualify for the final race.
Having finished the race, Claire and V talk a little bit more and she offers V a ride back to her garage.
Objectives:
Head to the City Center race.
Call Claire to start the race.
Sit on the bench and wait for Claire.
Talk to Claire.
Take the shard.
Get in Claire's ride/Get in your vehicle.
Wait for the race to start.
Finish the race.
Stop at the finish line.
Talk to Claire.
If V accepts the ride back:
Get in Claire's ride.
Return to Claire's garage.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite from V perspective, rewrite notes into walkthrough as conditions]
Some time after completing I Fought the Law, River will call V, needing assistance and requests them to meet him in person to discuss the details.
After you get to the designated location and wait for him to arrive, he'll pull up in his truck. Get in and talk to him a bit but he's not really in a chatty mood and will instead send you a video clip to watch of a news reel. It'll reveal a man named Anthony Harris who's also the dubbed "Peter Pan" serial killer being apprehended in his car by NCPD as one of his victims falls out of the vehicle. Anthony tries to run but is shot down by police and the clip will note the victim died from septic shock. Meanwhile Anthony, while still alive, is comatose in a hospital so there's no way to interrogate him about where other victims are being held.
After it finishes, River will reveal while Peter Pan was never his case, his nephew, Randy, recently went missing and the victim in the video was wearing Randy's shoes. Furthermore, the detective that is on the case isn't doing much and so it's not looking good in finding Randy in time and River isn't on good terms with his sister so he doesn't know much about Randy's disappearance. But he does have an idea: to try and view Anthony's dreams as a braindance to see if enough clues can be found to find and save Randy.
NCPD Lab[]
With that, get out of the vehicle and follow River across the street to the lab, but he'll note he doesn't have access to get inside. Head to the left from the entrance to find an alleyway with a door with a leveled Technical Ability requirement. Alternatively, V can head to the right from the entrance to find a door with a leveled Body requirement. Alternatively, one can use a container to get over the wall next to the first door.
River will inform V that the place is empty, so the pair won't be disturbed. Head to the central area and enter the child's room to the side and scan the file cabinets here to locate Anthony's file. While searching them, V and River will be interrupted by Yawen Packard. After some back and forth where River will blackmail Yawen into helping. She will reveal that Anthony isn't dreaming, so they can't get any BDs off him. River will take it upon himself to find a way and heads out.
Go through the front door where Johnny will talk a bit and, if using a female V, he'll note River seems rather interested in V. Get in River's vehicle and he'll start driving out to his sister's place while you can talk to him about his suspension, Randy, and the case.
Visiting Joss[]
The pair will eventually arrive at Joss', who isn't happy either about seeing River but will agree to let him and V look through Randy's stuff if it means finding something that could help bring back her son. Follow River to the other trailer where Randy was living and look around for clues. In particular, to be successful in saving Randy in time, V will need enough major clues. Some of these clues include:
In the kitchen area pick up the key on the shelf near the table and use it to unlock the cabinet in Randy's bedroom
Have enough Intelligence to hack Randy's computer (or scan the record player in the hallway to learn the password)
Read all the messages and files on the computer
On the "Net" tab click the image of the red people to find the secret website, then on that site, click the "Join Us" then "Files" tabs, then back to the computer's main files to view the video again. River will then send this to Yawen to see if that gets Anthony dreaming
While it helps, it's not necessary to find Harris' IP address (high Intelligence required). To do so exit out like normal from the computer but this time one will have the option to tell him V can or lack the skills to do so. V can also find enough clues in the BDs to compensate for this if V does not enough Intelligence to find the IP.
After doing everything one can, follow River back over to Joss to talk to her about the findings. Agree to stay and V can talk a bit to Joss before heading to bed. River will wake them up some time later with good news: the video worked, and Anthony is dreaming. One will now need to scroll the BDs they got for additional clues:
School
3 visuals: the teacher, the bulletin boards, and the trophy case
Childhood Barn
7 Visuals: Young Anthony, the cow, Anthony's father, the console to the left of Anthony's father, the injection system console Anthony passes, the dietary supplements across the barn, and the cartoon playing
Note if one found enough clues in this one, V may not be able to scan the last one (the optional objective to find clues may disappear if this is the case)
Adulthood Barn
13 Visuals: Solar box, clock, electrical parts, fuel barrels, victims x3, infusion pump, FDNC certificate, computer, crawling victim, number to top left of barn entrance, towers of light (outside the barn)
Audio: AV sounds (through the ceiling)
If V found enough clues, River will deduce the correct location is Edgewood Farm, or if one has already travelled to the farm before, V will recognise it if they scan the towers of light. Otherwise, one will need to guess, though it is in the list of guessing options so V can select it there if they didn't get enough clues. That said, if V guesses the wrong farm, Randy won't be found in time. Romance note: If one wishes to romance River, they need to make sure to pick the right farm here, otherwise it'll lock River's last quest out and he won't be able to be romanced.
Finding Randy[]
Edgewood Farm doesn't have any enemies, but the yard is littered with mines, along with four turrets and several cameras. In addition, leaving the area will result in both River and Randy dying (as River will be killed from the barn's defenses and nobody else will arrive in time to save Randy).
If one does not or cannot turn off the defenses individually, the house nearby contains a desk with a switch underneath. Pressing it to reveals a hidden room with a second computer that will turn off the turrets and cameras. The Tinker Bell can be found nearby as well. If done, V will only need to worry about the mines as they make their way to the left of the barn entrance where a ladder is located. Use it to get up on the roof and enter through an opening here. River will find Randy but needs V to turn off the BD machine in the control room before he can unplug Randy. After doing so, head back around to help the other three victims (two will still be alive). Afterwards, River will call for V for their assistance, so go help him out and then it'll fast forward to where the police have arrived and working on getting the victims to the hospital. River though still has one more agenda: Anthony has to die. Romance note: Do not select the "count me out" option here if one wishes to romance him. After some more dialogue, River will part with the Trauma Team, ending the quest.

Walkthrough:
V and Judy save Evelyn Parker from the Scavengers' XBD studio at an abandoned power plant, and Evelyn is taken to Judy's apartment to recover.
After speaking with Judy, she heads into the apartments workspace to continue tweaking the braindances extracted from Evelyn. You can approach and sit beside Evelyn, but she simply lies on the bed without any reply.
Afterwards, you can visit Judy's editing room, and Judy will show you the two BDs extracted from Evelyn.
The First BD[]
In this BD, Evelyn is talking to the female Netrunner who hired Evelyn to record the BD of Yorinobu's penthouse. Unfortunately, the woman's face detail was strongly encrypted and neither V nor Judy are able to figure out who she is. V notices a symbol on the Holoview and concludes the contractor must be working with the Voodoo Boys. Additionally, V believes the location to be Pacifica according to the flyers on the ground near Evelyn, and the v√©v√© markings around the altar.
The Second BD[]
In this BD, Evelyn is in an alley, while the Netrunner speaks to someone on the phone while remaining concealed at the bottom of a staircase. According to the dialogue between the woman and the other Netrunner, V and Judy find out that they need to meet Alt Cunningham in cyberspace via Johnny Silverhand's engram.
After[]
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
After seeing the two BDs, Judy talks to you about the Engram, and V asks Johnny for the details. Finally, you are prompted to leave Judy's apartment.

‚ö†Ô∏è This section contains information that requires cleanup.
It's important to note this gig only becomes available after completing Playing for Time, and can only be started between 8pm and 5am (otherwise it'll disappear off the map if you're outside these hours). Upon arriving, V will see a massacre of bodies and entrails strewn everywhere. They question a dying Maelstrom who speaks in riddles, shortly dying. A shard is on the gang member, that when cracked, talks about a ritual, summoning the cyberpsycho Zaria Hughes from a strewn refrigerator. She is extremely quick, running towards V with her Mantis Blades. Upon defeat, the shard "The hard reset approacheth" can be looted, allowing V to contact Regina with the necessary information.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Remove bullet points]
A short time after completing Search and Destroy, V receives a text message from an unknown caller seeking their help. They are told to meet at the No-Tell Motel.
Inside the motel room, V finds a woman in shining chrome with her back to them. Once she starts talking, V learns that she is Lizzy Wizzy, the renowned celebrity musician. She'll eventually reveal that she suspects that her manager and new boyfriend, Liam Northom, is cheating on her. Given her privacy concerns and highly public profile, she wants V to discreetly investigate the matter at the Riot nightclub, which Liam frequents.
V can only enter the club after 8pm. There are several different ways to enter:
The front door, guarded by a bouncer (requires Body to intimidate the bouncer or sufficient Street Cred).
The fire escape in the alley to the left of the building. Ladder can be lowered by hitting or shooting it.
The door to the security room just inside the garage on the right side of the building (requires Intelligence to hack the keypad). An employee badge can also be found on the desk with the computer.
The garage door, to the right of the security room door inside the garage (requires Body to lift the metal shutters).
V does not need to find Liam, but instead find a computer with surveillance feed. To do so, if V acquires the employee badge, go to the door opposite the male bartender and follow the marker to the elevator and head down to street level. The computer can also be reached directly by hacking the door to the security room from the exterior garage (see above). Use the computer and access the surveillance cameras to find Liam talking with a woman in the VIP lounge. V quickly learns it is actually not a romantic affair: Liam is with an Arasaka employee, discussing about making a backup of Lizzy. After listening to the full conversation, Johnny Silverhand appears briefly, where he suggests acquiring the video footage as proof. Interact with the computer again to obtain the video footage. After this, V can call Lizzy to complete the mission, or optionally confront Liam. Note that V cannot confront Liam after calling Lizzy.
Liam can be found in the VIP lounge on the third floor. The male bartender on the second floor can be convinced to reveal his location with either a bribe or a threat (requires Body). V can access the VIP lounge from a second elevator in the security room aforementioned.
If V decides to confront Liam, he will demand to know why they are there:
V claims they went to the wrong room:
Liam demands that V leaves. If V takes too long, the security guards will become hostile, and V will not be able to interact with Liam again.
V threatens to expose Liam's misdeeds:
V can extort Liam for a very substantial payout (30,000 ‚Ç¨$) in exchange for the promise of not telling anyone what he is up to. Even if V promised Liam that they wouldn't tell their employer what happened, V can still tell Lizzy the truth.
Upon calling Lizzy, V can lie or tell the truth.
Tell Lizzy it was just an affair:
This ends the job. Lizzy is somewhat satisfied with V's work, even though they don't have proof of the affair. Within an hour or so, Lizzy will send a 1,900 ‚Ç¨$ payment as thanks. Part 2 will not trigger if V tells Lizzy that Liam was having an affair, even if they downloaded the security footage.
Tell Lizzy about the secret plot:
This temporarily ends the job. Lizzy is distraught and abruptly hangs up. Within an hour or two, Lizzy sends a 2,800 ‚Ç¨$ payment as thanks. If V overheard Liam's conversation and captured the security footage, Part 2 of this job will trigger within a few days.
Part 2[]
If V has told Lizzy the truth, she will call them several days later and ask to meet again at the No-Tell Motel. When V returns, they see that Liam is lying dead on the floor, with Lizzy standing over him. She explains that she pushed him and without realizing the strength of her chrome arms. If V scans Liam, they can note to Lizzy that she strangled him. After some dialogue, she will panic briefly about the possibility of the media finding out before considering her audience's titillating reaction. Eventually, she will ask V to dispose of the body.
Refuse to dispose of Liam's body:
V refuses, telling Lizzy that something isn't right. Lizzy says, "On the contrary, everything is falling into place. Go, V. And shut the door."
Agree to dispose of Liam's body:
V says they'll take care of the body and tell Lizzy to sleep soundly. Lizzy responds that she doesn't need to sleep, then thanks Liam's body for a beautiful gift. V asks what she's talking about, but Lizzy dismisses V, telling them to go and take the body and dispose of it.
Afterwards, Lizzy will send eddies and a messaging of thanks. A few days later, Lizzy will send another message saying that their "adventure" was very inspirational and she put out her new BD thanks to V.
Objectives:
Meet with the mysterious client at No-Tell Motel.
Talk to the client.
Sit down.
Talk to the client.
Go to Riot in the evening and ask for Liam.
Find proof of Liam's betrayal.
Ask about Liam. [Optional]
Go to the VIP area.
Confront Liam. [Optional]
Leave the VIP area.
If you fail to confront Liam and do not leave the area.
Escape the VIP area.
If you choose to use the cameras:
Check the security computer.
Check the cameras linked to the computer.
Talk to Johnny.
If you listen while standing close:
Break into Riot's security room.
Steal the club's surveillance data.
Call Lizzy.
If told the truth:
Answer Lizzy.
Go to the motel room.

Walkthrough: Head behind the Grand Imperial Mall to find a group of locals hanging out at the rollercoaster, which they're trying to get working again. Offer to help, then scan the ride's car to locate the control panel nearby. Go fix it and let Jean know it's done, but the group will have second thoughts about actually riding the old thing. Johnny, on the other hand, is all for it. If you agree to do the first test run, don't worry as it'll go fine, and you can do a few interactions during the ride.
Objectives:
Scan to find the control panel.
Use the control panel to activate the roller coaster.
Inform Jean the roller coaster is working.
Talk to Jean.
Get on the roller coaster.
Enjoy the ride.

Walkthrough:
About 24 in-game hours after completing Off the Leash, Kerry Eurodyne will call you to meet up at the Gold Beach Marina in Downtown, City Center at 7 PM. If you arrive early, you can wait at the dock to pass time.
Kerry will be on the deck of one of the yachts moored nearby, calling you aboard. After you sit down next to Kerry, he will activate the autopilot of the vessel, "Seamurai," which will begin to sail to open waters. Kerry will start playing a new song on one of five custom-built Lancaster guitars as Johnny appears nearby. Kerry will muse on life's cycles and explain that the purpose of this little boat trip to close on chapter and begin a new one, and he needs V's company to do so.
When the boat finally stops, Kerry will smash the guitar and begin destroying the yacht, explaining it belongs to L.B. Kovachek, his manager, who gave the Us Cracks the rights to his song without his knowledge. You can choose to join Kerry in destroying the boat (the coffee machine, painting, and record player can be trashed), or you can refuse to participate in the vandalism. Then Kerry will ask your help break a pole off the wall.
If V has a male voice and male body type:
You can choose to kiss Kerry Eurodyne, and a romantic scene will trigger, or you can decline him.
If V is female:
Kerry will avoid the upcoming romance first.
Afterwards, Kerry will set fire to the ship. Jump in the water and swim to shore, where Kerry will meet you. After a chat on the shore, while watching the Seamurai sink, you can choose to go home with Kerry or decline. Either option will conclude the quest.
Objectives:
Talk to Kerry on the holo.
Meet Kerry at the marina at 7:00 PM.
Go onto the deck.
Talk to Kerry.
Break whatever you find! [Optional]
Destroy the record player.
Destroy the painting.
Destroy the coffee machine.
Wait for Kerry.
Help Kerry.
Female V only:
Talk to Kerry
[Optional] Set the yacht on fire.
Swim to the shore.
Wait for Kerry.
Talk to Kerry.

Find the trail.
Follow the blood trail.
Search the body.

Walkthrough:
Two days after participating in the City Center race, V is contacted again by Claire Russell, for the second race coordinates. Claire instructs V to come to Brookland street in Laguna Bend Reservoir, Badlands.
After arriving at the Dam, V calls Claire to tell her that they are ready for the race, and they sit down on a nearby bench to wait for Claire to arrive.
Some time later, all competitors have arrived, consisting of two Wraiths teams and three Aldecaldo teams, one of which consists of Jakub Antonowicz and Margot Wojciechowicz. V briefly chats with Claire, before getting in the car and starting the race.[Trivia 1] Mere moments before the race starts, V is taunted by Luigi, who mockingly wishes them good luck.
If Claire and V finish second or third:
Claire and V have secured one of the finishes needed to qualify for the final race.
If Claire and V win the race:
After winning the race, V receives a payout of 3860 eurodollars, and have secured one of the finishes needed to qualify for the final race.
Having finished the race, Claire and V chat a little bit more. She will talk about how her husband, Dean Russell, was an amazing driver. After talking, she offers V a ride back to her garage.
Objectives:
Head to the Badlands race.
Call Claire to start the race.
Sit on the bench and wait for Claire.
Talk to Claire.
Get in Claire's ride.
Wait for the race to start.
Finish the race.
Stop at the finish line.
Talk to Claire.
If V accepts the ride back:
Get in Claire's ride.
Return to Claire's garage.

Walkthrough:
V meets Mr. Hands' netrunner Baird near the entrance of the academy. Baird briefs V on his cover-up story and their main objective: reaching Fiona Vargas' office to steal all the tax-related data in their computer after pretending to be a recruiter for a San Diego sports team. V may ask for more details about their cover-up story: the netrunner declines to elaborate since V's fake identity is only supposed to get them into the facility and they shouldn't speak about themselves once inside.
If V tells the barman they work for a San Diego sports team:
While chatting with the barman upon entering the Academy, V can tell him they work for a San Diego sports team. Another man then turns to V and starts asking inquisitive questions about specific people from the staff of their supposed club. Without any good answer from V, a suspicious guard is called to take V for another security check. After the check fails, every Academy member turns hostile to V.
If V doesn't talk to the barman:
V can tell the Barman they don't want to chat. One of the kids on exhibition will crack the glass screen in front of him, and this will cause the bartender to leave. Nobody will be watching the nearby door marked Personnel only, and they can use it to sneak into the staff only areas.
If V wants to sneak into Fiona Vargas' office:
V can sneak into the underground facility by going directly to their right after exiting the elevator to the Exhibition Hall. A guard is monitoring an access to a technical back office where the Academy's netrunner works. There is a computer V can use to disconnect the surveillance system. A vent hole in the wall provides access to a technical shaft from which V can drop in a lab in the underground facility and meet Dr. Vargas. Double jump is required to go back in this tunnel through the ceiling.
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìùReason: Addition of conditionals
Fiona's office is located one floor below the main floor, entering the office seems to cause the door to lock behind you. When you enter the office, you will see Tommie Walker trying to find something in the drawers and spend some time talking to him. When you try to steal the data from Fiona's terminal, it will fail and Fiona will walk in. After some talking, Fiona will make you an offer to leak some data of low importance. You can ask about Tommie's chances of getting signed, and accept Fiona's offer to leak the data and ensure that Tommie gets signed. Regardless of which option you choose, the rewards are the same and Mr Hands is satisfied. Note that the elevator is disabled after the quest, nor can you go back to the exhibition hall after taking the elevator from Fiona's office.
She will prompt V to leave, while they can decide to kill her right there. V can choose to kill Fiona Vargas after they decided what to do about her offer. If V kills her, Johnny will appear and express satisfaction about it, and V can grab Fiona's elevator key, which can shortcut to the ground floor.
Once the quest is completed, V can find Tommie Walker helping his dad David Walker at the EBM Petrochem Stadium. If V shut down the facility and let Tommie's father know, he'll resent them for shutting down their only chance at getting out of Dogtown.
Objectives:
Go to the location provided by Mr. Hands.
Meet with Hands' contact.
Talk to Hands' contact.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Mr. Hands contacts V with a new gig. In Longshore Stacks' The Scraper, Scavengers have taken possession of a prototype Zetatech implant. V is tasked with retrieving the prototype from the Scraper by any means necessary.
Getting closer to the prototype's signal atop the Scraper, V encounters Hasan Demir, a former Techie for Zetatech, whom had the prototype implant installed in his own ocular system. After freeing Hasan and leading him safely out of the base, V has several options.
Essentially, your choice boils down to turning Hasan over to Zetatech or letting him escape with the prototype while you (and Mr. Hands) keep the schematics.
Hasan will explain his side, and V will get a choice of two dialogue options:
If V contacts Mr. Hands:
V and Mr. Hands decide Hasan's fate together.
If V sends the coordinates:
V turns Hasan over to Zetatech.
If V tells Mr. Hands to let Hasan go:
Mr. Hands sides with V and lets Hasan go after the prototype is safely removed. After a few days, Hasan will contact V after having set up shop in Longshore Stacks. Choosing this option leads to Go Your Own Way.
If V directly lets Hasan go:
V keeps the schematics for Mr. Hands. A few days later, Mr. Hands texts V to tell them a vendor appeared on the market selling the exact same Zetatech implant, adding "it might still interest you to learn he was last seen in a Golden Pacific squat". Hasan will appear at the Kress Street Hideout, no longer wishing to talk to V after the ripperdoc scammed him from his implant.
Objectives:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Go to the Scraper construction site in the Longshore Stacks.
Enter the scav den inside the Scraper.
Find the prototype emitting the signal.
Talk to the prisoner.
Talk to Hasan.
Open Hasan's cell using the passcode: 2753
Talk to Hasan.
Follow Hasan.
Take the tablet with the schematics.
Talk to Hasan.
Lower the drawbridge to escape from the Scraper.
Follow Hasan.
Talk to Hasan.
Deposit the schematics in the drop point.

Walkthrough:
Beep-beep, motherfucker!
¬†‚Äî Divergent Delamain, Human Nature
After recovering in their apartment from the aftermath of Konpeki Plaza heist, V receives a message that their car‚Äîthe Archer Hella EC-D i360‚Äîwas returned to the Megabuilding H10's parking lot.[N 1]
Upon entering the car, it is immediately rammed by a divergent cab from the Delamain Corporation, wrecking V's car.[N 2] This incident causes Johnny Silverhand to appear before V, and they have an exchange of words.[N 3]
Upon exiting the car, V receives a message from the Delamain Corporation to visit their headquarters in Vista del Rey.
Some time after the incident, V receives another text message from Delamain, this time to let them know that their car has been repaired.[N 4]
Objectives:
Fetch your vehicle from the parking garage.
Talk to Johnny Silverhand.
Get out of the damaged car.
Read the message from Delamain.
Keep busy while you wait for the car to be repaired.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Important thing to note about this cyberpsycho, Ben DeBaillon, is that he's a Netrunner so it'll be harder to use quickhacks against him. He also has two griffin drones and a robot that he will send towards you when you open the garage door, so be ready to take care of those first.
Objectives:
Find the cyberpsycho.
Neutralize the threat.
Search the area to collect information.
Search the computer for more info.
Message Regina about Cyberpsycho Sighting: Lex Talionis.

Walkthrough:
After V's car is wrecked by the divergent Delamain Cab, V is contacted by Delamain to visit Delamain Corporation's headquarters on Pajaro street in Vista del Rey, Heywood, to assess the damages done to V's vehicle and receive compensation.
When V arrives at the location and enters the building, it is evident that they are not the only one that was attacked by a rogue cab, as numerous other Night citizens are there to file a complaint against the company. As V cuts in line and talks to the receptionist‚Äîwhich is currently running on a subroutine of Delamain's core. After V's identity is confirmed, Delamain himself will take over and talk to V and apologizes to them, and explains to V that they are currently occupied dealing with an internal crisis. As compensation for their damaged car, Delamain transfers V a sum of 4900 eurodollars.[N 1]
Objectives:
Go to Delamain HQ.
Talk to the receptionist.
Talk to Delamain.
This quest has no journal objectives.

The Hercules 3AX Iconic Smart assault rifle can be looted from a cache in the shooting range/storage area of the Nighthawks Rehabilitation Center.
If V fights the Biotechnica agents:
The job will be completed, Nele will survive, and V will receive ‚Ç¨$7,000 as payment. If Nele leaves in amicable terms with V, you will be contacted in a few in-game days, starting One Way or Another.
If V allows the Biotechnica agents to take Nele:
The job will be completed, but V will only receive ‚Ç¨$4,000, as Nele was captured by Biotechnica.

Walkthrough: Since the last gig, V's cyberware has started to malfunction, so Jackie suggests they pay a visit to Viktor's Clinic to find out what the problem is. After a brief chat with Misty, they head into the clinic and talk to Viktor. They take a seat in the chair and have their new cyberware installed and scan Viktor.
