Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Add conditional statements. Rewrite from V's perspective where necessary]
At some point after Life During Wartime, V will receive a call from an Elizabeth Peralez, wife to mayoral candidate Jefferson Peralez. She doesn't wish to discuss anything over the holo so requests to meet in person.
Once V reaches the meeting point, they are instructed to enter the car so they can then talk more freely with the couple, who note their suspicions that they believe Night City's late mayor, Lucius Rhyne, was murdered rather than dying from heart complications. They then ask V to edit a braindance from an attempted attack on Rhyne shortly before his death to see if they are able to get any clues from it. V learns a few key pieces of evidence from it, namely that an NCPD detective by the name of River Ward showed up needing to talk with their security just before the attack and took out the would-be assailant P√©ter Horv√°th; that a place called the Red Queen's Race was mentioned; and that Weldon Holt, the deputy mayor, is running as the mayoral candidate now in Rhyne's place.
After discussing these details with Peralez, they'll then give V River's contact information to call the detective. Call River up who'll agree to meet with V to discuss the case at Chubby Buffalo's BBQ in The Glen. When V arrives, they'll find him talking with his fellow detective Harold Han, who sounds like he's told River more than once to stop digging into Rhyne's case and that even his superior has told River to let it go. River dismisses this and Han will leave so that V and River can talk.
Investigating Leads[]
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìùReason: Needs more information
After a short conversation in the diner, V follows River to his vehicle and gets in to have a more private conversation where River reveals that he suspects that someone in the precinct let P√©ter Horv√°th loose, as he was apprehended earlier that day. The conversation eventually turns to how to find the Red Queen's Race and he'll gives V two possible leads to follow up on: check with one of his informants and check with P√©ter's employer.
At the store, the informant, Neil White, will run as soon as you use the Igor line, but River corners him before he can get very far in the alley. Neil will eventually reveal the location of the club, but also notes when asked they closed it shortly after Rhyne's death.
At the Cherry Blossom Market, V and River look for Christine Markov, P√©ter's employer in Japantown. They split off to ask the other vendors where she is and eventually V learns of her location via one of them or River will learn of it and text you. Regardless, head to the back left area of the market to find her.
Unfortunately, she won't be able to reveal much, only that P√©ter was always off his rocker and making erratic speeches about the late mayor before showing up one day with all the latest implants, having been sponsored by someone who "finally saw his worth". Follow River back to his vehicle to find some Tyger Claws poking around it, having recognized it as River's. You can choose to intervene or stay quiet here. If you stay quiet, they'll leave peacefully. If you intervene, one them asks how high you can jump. Jumping will get them to leave quietly, otherwise they become hostile. If things stayed quiet, or they were dealt with non-lethally, River will be pleased as it means less paperwork for him, and you will be able to go with him.
Once you've done both leads (or did the informant first) you can then head out to the club's location in Charter Hill.
Investigating the Club[]
As River is NCPD, he can't enter the premises without a warrant, so V has to go in alone here. V can try talking to the Animals member at the entrance gate, but she'll basically tells the place is closed and they're not allowed in, so they'll need to find another way in.
The club's entrance is hidden in one of the large shipping crates inside the warehouse. Open the crate's doors and head down using the elevator to enter the club where more Animals are roaming. The office and boss you're looking for is in the back, on the second floor and can easily be grabbed from behind in a chokehold to interrogate if you wish to go that route. If so, she'll reveal the Animals were hired to smash up the place and the only reason they're still hanging out is the one who hired them, Weldon Holt, still hasn't paid up. Once she's dealt with, you can check the computer where the messages confirm this. However, also check the files to see Ward's partner, Han, is also behind the coverup. River will then tell you to get out of there so you guys can confront Han but if you haven't already, go check the booth where Rhyne died to find the braindance wreath he had on. Interact with it and you'll pass out and River will break in to get to you. After a short conversation, you'll reveal what you learned from the wreath: someone spiked it and that's what killed Rhyne, not a heart attack. With that, you can choose to look around some more or leave with River, which will fast forward you to Chubby Buffalo's to confront Han.
Wrapping up the Case[]
River will ask who gave Han the orders to cover everything up, but Han won't say who and, with a few small conversations from you, Han will just note this is how Night City works and he's just doing his job in protecting his "family", that is the NCPD. This will allow River to deduce he knows who gave the order and he'll have to file it with Internal Affairs, but Han notes it won't do anything good, other than put River in their sights, before he drives off.
You can then talk to River about what he plans to do and eventually have the option to tell him to do it or not, but regardless what you say River is set on trying to re-open the case with the new information. With that, call Elizabeth and she'll ask you to visit their apartment to discuss it in person. When you get there though and start to head up in the elevator, Johnny will give some advice to not tell them anything, that whatever is going on is much deeper than they realize. However, you can choose to withhold the information or tell the couple what you learned, but regardless they'll be happy and conclude on their own what's going on and will pay you your fee.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Write from V's perspective]
Head over to the building but be careful going into the basement, as there's mines set up in the stairwell. Once you take care of them, go into the basement room, where you can see Chang Hoon Nam over on the chair. Try to talk to him but he's unresponsive; apparently whatever job he was doing last caused a corp to fry his brain, but he's still alive.
Check his computer for messages and red lights will come on. Follow these into a small dead-end hallway and look down to see a grate you can open. You'll have a couple more mines to take care of in the tunnel here before you can un-crouch into another room where the shard you need to bring him back can be found. You can also skip this altogether and force the doors open, but this requires 20 body. Once you have it, exit the room through the door and interact with Chang Hoon to add the shard.
He'll come to and you can talk to him about how he got into his situation a bit. Once done, leave the area to complete the gig.
Objectives:
Find a way to Chang Hoon Nam's hideout.
Find Chang Hoon Nam.
Find out what happened to Chang Hoon Nam.
Follow the lights
Find the shard for stabilizing Chang Hoon Nam's condition.
Take the shard.
Slot the shard in Chang Hoon Nam's neural port.
Talk to Chang Hoon Nam.
Leave the area.

Go to Red's stash.
Search Red's stash.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
There are three possible entrances to the NCPD Precinct:
The first is through the front door using the key provided by Stella. BARGHEST guards occasionally patrol this area however, and the front desk inside has additional guards waiting.
There is a locked door to the right of the precinct, which can be opened with 15 Body. This leads into a side room adjacent to a room which only has a single unaware guard inside.
A hatch on top of the aforementioned side room can be opened with 10 Technical Ability. However, the hatch is watched from the outside by a single BARGHEST soldier.
In the storage room before the garage, you can find Volkodav, an iconic machete, in an airdrop cargo container.
If you kill Dodger, he will drop the Rosco iconic revolver.
To escape without fighting Dodger while keeping Mitchell and Wilson alive, you will need to tell the whole truth as well as at most knocking out the BARGHEST soldiers - if you killed any BARGHEST, a fight will break out unless you have chosen the Cool dialogue option.
If you fought Dodger:
If you save both Bill Mitchel and Charles Wilson and kill Carl "Dodger" Robinson, then Bill will later call to start the side job New Person, Same Old Mistakes.
If you peacefully walk away:
Both Bill and Charles managed to survive through a peaceful resolution with Dodger. Some time later, V could then encounter Bill near Coyoacan in the Glen. During this encounter, Bill lamented about being blackmailed by Dodger, saying it might have been better if V had killed him.
Objectives:
Meet with Stella.
Enter Dodger's base.
Escort Bill and Charles to the squad car.
Enter the garage.
Secure the garage.

Walkthrough:
A group of Scavengers have taken control of a rooftop near the intersection of Goldsmith and Cortes street in Little China, Watson.
As V approached the location, the Night City Police Department Dispatcher reaches out to them, letting them know about the suspected organized crime activity nearby. A Trauma Team AV can be seen flying away from the scene when they move further onto the location.
On the rooftop, V encounters the Scavengers consisting of leader Barry Alken, 4 Crows, 1 Rat, 1 Hound, 1 Spider, and 1 Sniper.
After neutralizing the Scavenger threat, V loots a nearby Trauma Team container in order to complete the activity.
Objectives:
Neutralize the Scavengers.
Neutralize Barry Alken.
Loot the Trauma Team container.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite, missing details, choices, steps]
V comes across a street musician playing on a guitar, and Johnny Silverhand will ask if V likes his music. After a brief exchange, Johnny will note that bootlegs of Samurai concerts might still exist. He'll then note that an old club they used to play at, Rainbow Cadenza, is nearby, if they want to check for those bootlegs.
V heads over only to find it is now a food joint, which Johnny will remark on. V head inside and speaks to the staff, who points V to an old vendor nearby who keeps bugging them about the old club. The vendor, Karim Noel, located at a stall nearby, and he'll talk a lot about Samurai and Johnny before V is able ask him about the bootlegs. You'll have to convince him that you're a true Samurai fan before he would even entertain the idea of selling the records to you.
Karim will quiz you. When you call on Johnny for assistance, he'll give you an answer, but when you tell the vendor, it's actually wrong. You can then ask Johnny for the correct one and he'll give it. This time Karim will be impressed and will give you the bootleg for free.
Once V has the SAMURAI Concert Recording, Johnny will discuss the vendor, noting Karim may be a big fan and knows all his lyrics, but never took the time to understand that Johnny was calling for change, and instead Karim remains stuck in the 2020s. Answer Johnny how you wish and the quest will conclude.
If V is a Corpo:
V will then tell a story to the vendor about how if a corpo newbie from Arasaka doesn't make their deadline, the ghost of a man will split him into two, telling the vendor more that the ghost is Johnny Silverhand, impressing him.
If V has a Cool Attribute of 9 or higher:
V can say they have been listening to "Chipping in" since they were a kid, further impressing the vendor and giving you the recording.
Objectives:
Talk to Johnny.
Go to the Rainbow Cadenza club.
Talk to Johnny.
Ask the staff about the club.
Talk to the cook.
Find the vendor selling the tapes.
Talk to the vendor.
Persuade the vendor to give you the tapes.
Talk to Johnny.

Walkthrough: Upon returning to Jinguji some time after a previous visit, Zane welcomes V and asks what he can do for you today. After browsing the shop's selection, suddenly a cyberpsycho enters and kills the store's guards. Zane activates the alarm, and V must defeat the cyberpsycho. Once this is done, talk to the MaxTac officer, Melissa Rory, and then sit on the couch. On the way out, there is an option to talk to the MaxTac lieutenant and discuss her mantis blades and the cyberpsycho attack.
Objectives:
Defeat cyberpsycho.
Talk to the MaxTac officer.
Sit next to Zane.

Walkthrough:
A group of Scavengers are hiding out at the ESC Explorer in Terra Cognita, Dogtown.
Neutralizing the Arasaka Drone grants access to the Iconic SPT32 Grad Sparky.
Objectives:
Neutralize the drone.
Neutralize the Scavengers.
Loot the cache.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
After sparing Katya Karelina's life, Katya sends V the coordinates of her secret stash, which can be found in an abandoned parking garage in Longshore Stacks. To be able to access the stash, V has to move a dumpster, after which they can open a grate underneath which the stash is hidden. The stash contains 17,500 eurodollars and the shard For Katya.
Objectives:
Go to Katya's stash.
Find Katya's stash.

Walkthrough:
After meeting with Dexter DeShawn, V is instructed to obtain the Flathead‚àía prototype Militech combat bot‚àífrom the Maelstromer's led by Royce at the All Foods Factory in Northside, Watson. V was also given the number of a Militech internal affairs agent named Meredith Stout, who they can reach out to for more information regarding the Militech gear that was stolen from the convoy.[1]
Militech Meeting [Optional][]
If V calls the Militech agent [Optional]:

V reaches out to Meredith Stout. V knows about the bind Meredith is in and proposes to meet. The parties meet eachother at a storm channel under the overpass near the All Foods Factory in Northside. While approaching Meredith, V is overwhelmed by one of her bodyguards, who jacks into V's personal link to start an aggressive but brief interrogation. Stout asks V if they are alone and if they know if Anthony Gilchrist is the one who leaked information about the Militech convoy. The bodyguard disengages the link and lets V go, who proposes to make a deal with Meredith, information in exchange for the Militech Flathead. Meredith agrees to V's proposition, under the condition that V pays for the Flathead with a Militech Credchip.
V accepts Meredith's offer:
V receives a Militech Credchip infected with a daemon from Meredith Stout in order to pay for the Flathead.
If V uses Breach Protocol on the Militech Credchip successfully:
To remove the daemon

V uses Breach Protocol to breach the Militech Credchip, and was able to remove the daemon infecting the shard. This results in 10,000 eurodollars from the shard at a later point.
To make a copy
V uses Breach Protocol to breach the Militech Credchip, and was able to make a copy of the infected shard. This causes them to obtain a Synapse Burnout quickhack.
To remove the daemon and make a copy
V uses Breach Protocol to breach the Militech Credchip, and was able to remove the daemon infecting the shard, allowing them to retrieve 10,000 from the shard at a later point. In the process, they also made a copy of shard which causes them to obtain a Synapse Burnout, and allowing them to retrieve 10,000 eurodollars from the shard at a later point.
V declines Meredith's offer:
After declining Meredith's offer to pay for the Flathead using a Militech Credchip, V has to come up with an alternative to pay for the combat bot.

All Foods[]
Arriving at the All Food Factory, V meets up with Jackie Welles, and together they approach the main entrance gate of the factory. Using the intercom, they speak with Dum Dum‚àía high-ranking Maelstrom member‚àíand are let inside after telling him that they are there for the Flathead. Making their way to the meeting point inside the factory, Jackie and V evade various deactivated traps. 
Entering the meat processing area of the factory, the duo takes an elevator up to the room where they meet face-to-face with Dum Dum.


This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite from V's perspective as a story walkthrough using {{Condition}} as per our Manual of Style, removal of bullet points]
Path 1 - Instant Death[]
This occurs if all of the following conditions are met:

V does not point a weapon at nor attack any of the Maelstrom gang members after entering their hideout
When Jackie refuses to sit down, V intervenes and asks him to do so
V takes too long to reply to Royce when he asks how they are going to pay
Royce simply shoots V in the head, necessitating a prior save.

Path 2 - A Peaceful Transaction[]
This occurs if all of the following conditions are met:

V does not take the chip from Meredith Stout
V does not point a weapon at nor attack any of the Maelstrom gang members after entering their hideout
When Jackie refuses to sit down, V intervenes and asks him to do so
V pays Royce with ‚Ç¨$ 10,000 of their own cash
V obtains the Flathead, and is led peacefully from the premises by Dum Dum, who will then also give them his Black Lace inhaler if they have the Streetkid lifepath (even if they have rejected to take a whirl earlier). Provided Meredith Stout is not called, this is one possible way to unlock access to the Maelstrom Weapon Vendor, who will appear after completing the job. This is also a guaranteed way to keep Dum Dum alive, which in turn enables V to kill or incapacitate him during a later mission in which he carries his iconic gun that can then be looted.

Path 3 - Siding with Militech[]
This occurs if all of the following conditions are met:

V does take the chip from Meredith Stout
V does not point a weapon at nor attack any of the Maelstrom gang members after entering their hideout
When Jackie refuses to sit down, V intervenes and asks him to do so
V pays Royce either with a) the chip including its malware but giving Royce a heads-up warning (Corpo lifepath only), b) with the chip after removing its malware, or c) with ‚Ç¨$ 10,000 of their own cash
After the transaction, Militech operatives will storm the All Foods Factory and start attacking the Maelstrom gang members. This is one of two options that allows to find and free former Maelstrom leader Brick (see below). If Brick is not freed and Dum Dum survives the mission, he can be encountered during a later mission in which he carries his iconic gun that can then be looted. After helping Maelstrom fighting off the Militech ambush and escaping the plant, Anthony Gilchrist will appear at the end of the mission, acknowledging that they are now even for saving one another's lives. This will result in Gilchrist eventually having Meredith Stout killed. Having the Nomad lifepath, V can also expose him as the mole by finding his message to Maelstrom on a computer in a sideroom of the first larger hall they enter after leaving the initial negotiation room in the All Foods Plant (only as a Nomad V can comprehend the full meaning of the message). Confronting Gilchrist with this at the end of the mission will cause him to promise an incentive to keep the information confidential. This will be a crate containing Militech equipment left at V's Apartment in Act 2.

Path 4 - Fight Maelstrom[]
This occurs if any of the following conditions were met:

V either pointed a weapon at or attacked any of the Maelstrom gang members after entering their hideout (Royce will appear as strong boss fight at the end; killing him rewards ‚Ç¨$ 3,000).
V turns off or otherwise does anything to affect the cameras or turrets within the hideout (Royce will appear as strong boss fight at the end; killing him rewards ‚Ç¨$ 3,000).
When Jackie refused to sit down, V did not ask him to do so (Royce will appear as strong boss fight at the end; killing him rewards ‚Ç¨$ 3,000).
V paid Royce with the chip without removing its malware or warning him (Royce will appear as weakened boss fight at the end; killing him rewards ‚Ç¨$ 3,000).
V killed Royce during the conversation (yields no extra money, but they will not have to fight him later).
This is the only way to obtain Chaos from Royce (either in the negotiation room or after the boss fight). This is also one of two options that allows V to find and free former Maelstrom leader Brick (see below).

Meeting the Militech operative after fighting Maelstrom[]
After successfully escaping the All Foods Plant, V met a Militech operative at the gates of the plant.
The Militech operative is Meredith Stout if these conditions were met:

V met with Meredith, survived the meeting by answering her questions, which allowed him to proceed to retrieve the Flathead from Maelstrom.
V struck a deal with her and accepted the cred chip.
V did not try to double-cross Meredith by removing the malware from the chip. It does not matter if V copied the malware on the chip as long as the malware is still on the chip.
Meredith reacted impressed and suggested working together again in the future. This is the only way to unlock Venus in Furs, which is initiated in Act 2 when Meredith contacts V again. This will also result in Stout eventually having Anthony Gilchrist killed. Having the Nomad lifepath, V can also expose him as the mole by finding his message to Maelstrom on a computer in a side room of the first larger hall they enter after leaving the initial negotiation room in the All Foods Plant (only as a Nomad V can comprehend the full meaning of the message). They will then be able to explain to Meredith how Militech's convoys in the border area get compromised and how to better protect them, which will cause her to be extra impressed and leave a crate containing Militech equipment as an additional reward at V's Apartment in Act 2.
If V fought Maelstrom but did not meet all the conditions for Meredith to appear at the gate, V is met by Anthony Gilchrist instead, which precludes Venus in Furs.

Saving Brick[]
Paths #3 and #4 allow V to find and free Brick. In order to save him, a laptop on a table in the room to the right of his cell needs to be opened and searched. On it V finds a message "only you guys know", which contains the code to Brick's cell door "9691". Then, either the detonator device on the table next to his cell door needs to be deactivated (requires Technical Ability skill 11) or V needs to disarm the mine inside the cell themselves. Although he is of no immediate use, Brick will later retake control of Maelstrom (only if Royce is killed during The Pickup), which will allow V to complete Second Conflict in Act 2 without having to fight. Deciding to activate the detonator and killing Brick will instead immediately yield ‚Ç¨$ 5,000.

Journal Entry[]
Know what I like about your run-of-the-mill gangoons? They know what they like. Cash, sex, power... maybe just the sight of their enemies' blood. Real rays of sunshine, they are. But these Maelstrom cabrones... shit, never can be sure. They look at you with those creepy-ass toaster faces and you can't get a read of 'em, got no clue what twisted thoughts are racin' through their processors. You ask me, that's why biz with Maelstrom never turns out pleasant. But... sometimes there's just no gettin' around it. Let's grab that spiderbot, yeah? Make Dex proud.
If V met with Meredith Stout:
A Militech corpo-c*** lost an arms shipment, and if she doesn't find it, she'll be paddling up shit-creek with stumps for hands. I'm betting it's not even about the weapons - Militech could lose a tank and it'd make no difference to them. It's about principles. One thing's for damn sure - someone's taking the fall for this.
If V fought alongside Maelstrom:
Every corp has a Gilchrist. First he steals from them, turns a fat profit on the goods, lies about it, narrowly avoids the chopping block, gets rid of all witnesses, makes someone else take the fall from him, and to top it all off - he gets a promotion. Can't help feeling sorry for the Maelstrom gonks in this scenario... but only a little.
If V fought alongside Militech:
Turns out Meredith Stout will do anything to stay in the corp's good graces. Unfortunately that means her "colleague" might get demoted... or worse. All in all, Militech recovered their property, putting the Maelstrom freaks in a shittier mood than usual. A day like any other in Night City.

Notes[]
The job was originally named "Going Pro" before the game's release, and was split in several sub-objectives: "The All Food deal", "Get the bot from the gang", "Escape from the factory", "Close the deal with Dex", and the optional "Corporate involvement"
The Militech Datashard must be decrypted from the Shards menu in order to receive the 10,000 eurodollars, which can be obtained by interacting with the Hacked Militech Datashard in the Backpack.
Doors will periodically lock behind you as you progress through the All Foods Factory. Once the job is completed, the factory becomes inaccessible.
While all Lifepaths can find the server room and read the messages about Maelstrom's ambush on the Militech convoy, only a Nomad V is able to bring it up during the conversation at the end of the job.
When siding with Militech and neutralizing the Maelstrom presence in the factory, Maelstrom members will periodically ambush V when they are getting into a vehicle in the Watson district. This feature was added in Patch 2.1.

Walkthrough:
Padre has a personal grudge against the solo Karubo Bairei, who recently returned to Night City and took ownership of a bar. Bairei caused a major mess in Night City sometime ago and fled to the East Coast to wait for the heat to die down, and Padre is just one of many people who want revenge now that he is back in town. The fixer asks V to take out Karubo, but requests it be done quietly, since Karubo's bar is frequented by the Valentinos and the gang is friendly with him.
Per Padre's optional objective, Karubo must be killed or incapacitated and carried out of the bar without the Valentinos inside knowing. Karubo can be found roaming the bar's kitchen, but 1-2 Valentinos are watching the kitchen most of the time, another is watching the front door of the bar, and four others are scattered about the main room. Entering the bar via the front door means alerting the enemies is practically guaranteed unless V is equipped with a Sandevistan with a high time slowdown factor.
With a high level of Technical Ability, you can unlock the back door of the bar, which leads to a small storage room adjacent to the kitchen and bypasses most of these enemies. Once in the storage room, V only has to deal with three witnesses to quietly grab Karubo: a drunk Valentino who is moving around the main room, a Valentino next to the kitchen window who sometimes turns away briefly, and Karubo himself, who moves between four different spots in the kitchen. A netrunner can use Reboot Optics to blind the window Valentino, then sneak up behind Karubo and either kill and dispose of him in the nearby refrigerator, or take him down and drag him out through the back door.
If the back door is not an option, there is a hatch in the bar's roof that leads to a second storage room where one Valentino is taking inventory. The safest way to reach the kitchen and Karubo from there is to systematically kill or knock out every Valentino with a view of the bar and kitchen (one Valentino is sleeping on the bar itself and will not notice anything unless other enemies are alerted, so she can be ignored).
Once Karubo is dealt with, Padre will call. If V incapacitated Karubo without alerting anyone and placed him in the car Padre sent, the fixer is especially pleased and describes how he will savor the solo's punishment.
Objectives:
Enter Karubo's bar.
Neutralize Karubo Bairei.
Neutralize Karubo without raising the alarm.
Carry Karubo's body outside.
Carry Karubo's body to the fixer's transport.
Collect your reward from the Drop Point.

Walkthrough:
A partially hidden S.C.S.M. was being installed and configured at Megabuilding H8.[1] Something seems off about the machine, as it appears to be calling V over. The machine turns out to be an AI by the name of Brendan, and would like you to move over the dumpster that is blocking his view. Moving the dumpster can be completed by passing a Body check (it scales depending on the player level).
After moving the dumpster, Brendan will thank you by dispensing a NiCola and consider V a friend.
Objectives:
Move the dumpster.
Talk to Brendan.

Walkthrough:
After starting the job, Mr. Hands texts V for them to head to Bree Whitney's Apartment and look for a Militech card located in a safe box underneath a bamboo plant. V finds the Bamboo plant in the bedroom, and retrieves the card. As they leave the apartment, they are confronted by a neighbor of Bree's, who worries for her.
After leaving the apartment, they are instructed once more by Mr. Hands, this time to meet Bree underneath the Kress Street Apartment Building.[N 1]
V tracks down Bree once underground. They can scan footprints to help them track down where Bree is. They find Bree in a cave, and she leads them into Cynosure Site D. After the card doesn't work on one of the doors, an alternative route must be taken. Along this path, the rooms behind the doors Bree opens are trapped with cameras, turrets, and laser mines. The turrets will only be turned on if V is detected by a camera. V must disable these in order to move on.
They eventually get to a control room, where Bree finds videos of Evan McRay's logs at Cynosure Site D about a decade prior. After watching these videos, as they are about to leave, Bree is confronted by Militech agent Dante Caruso. As they talk, V must decide who they want to side with.
If V sides with Bree:
If Dante Caruso is killed, V can loot his Iconic revolver Ol' Reliable. After the conversation with Bree Whitney, her Iconic power pistol Riskit can be picked up from the boxes on the right side of the room. After leaving the laboratory, Hands will call and reward V with ‚Ç¨$5,000 for completing the original contract.
However, he will call again about a day later, revealing that Bree was working with NetWatch and sold them the data solely for her personal gain. After another few days pass, a NetWatch hit squad of several agents will randomly appear on the streets and attack V. By that time, that hit squad would also have killed Lisa Smith - one of the remaining scientists who worked in the lab - due to information leaked to them by Bree.
If V sides with Dante:
If Bree is killed (either by V or Dante), V can collect Riskit from the floor. Dante will then share a shard, retrieved from Bree's body. In it is revealed that she was working for NetWatch and was acting solely for her personal gain, facilitating the hit that killed Caesar Mijares, one of the scientists who worked in the lab. If V talks to Dante afterwards, he will also give a ‚Ç¨$5,000 reward. Hands will be displeased by this deviation from the contract.
Bree and Dante both die:
If V kills whomever survives the standoff (Bree or Dante), Database: Cynosure Site D can be acquired in addition to both Riskit and Ol' Reliable. Hands will be displeased, although he will be satisfied if V mentions the database shard. After sending it to him through a Drop Point, he will give a ‚Ç¨$5,000 reward. Johnny will be disappointed at this choice.
Objectives:

Enter the apartment.
Force the door open.

Take the access card.

Talk to the stranger. [Optional]

Walkthrough:
Some time after nabbing Anders Hellman from Kang Tao, a distressed Panam Palmer calls V with a request to come meet with her at the Aldecaldo Camp in Rocky Ridge.
Upon asking her what happened, she tells V that Saul Bright was taken by a group of Wraiths while he and some others were out on patrol, and that they've been observing their camp in Sierra Sonora ever since. Panam asks for V's help in this matter, and promises to give them Mitch's Overwatch in turn.
After agreeing to help, Panam and V make their way to Mitch to get briefed, but instead only find Carol, Cassidy, Teddy, and Bob. Carol tells Panam that Mitch will be back shortly. As V leans on the car, Panam proposes a stealth plan where V sneaks into the Wraiths Camp, while she provides cover from a vantage point. They finish wrapping up the plan as Mitch returns, interrupting the bickering going on between the Aldecaldos.
Mitch proposes that V takes a look at the Wraiths Camp themselves using the drone that Mitch sent flying overhead. Using the drone, V observes the camps gate and perimeter, identifying the camps defenses. While observing, Panam asks V to inspect the tire tracks and the truck, before asking them to inspect the main building where Saul is most likely being kept. Having gathered enough intel, V disconnects from the drone.
Mitch, Panam, and V walk towards Villefort Columbus, in which they plan to approach the camp, but before setting off, Mitch advises that V take a SuperJet with them for when they find Saul. It should help with leading him out of the compound safely.
Upon closing up to the camp, Panam will mention an incoming dust storm, indicating that they have to move quickly if their plan is to succeed. After arriving at the camp and parking the van in a safe spot, V infiltrates the main camp and is able to find Saul in the basement if the main building.
If V took the stealth approach:
Upon exiting the camp with Saul safely, the trio rode off in the van to safety at the Ingalls' Farm, where they spend the night to recover and avoid the dust storm.
If V took the loud approach:
Upon exiting the camp with Saul, the trio rode off in the van chased by Wraiths, which they had to fend off. Due to the dust storm, they managed to reach the Ingalls' Farm safely, where they spend the night to recover.
In the morning, Panam thanks V for their help and gives them the promised Overwatch.
If V has the masculine body:
Before riding off, Panam pulls V close, giving them a kiss as a thank you for their help.
Objectives:
Meet with Panam.
Follow Panam.
Lean against the car.
Talk with the veterans.
Take the shard.
Observe the camp gate and perimeter.
Scan the vehicle tracks.
Scan the truck.
Observe the main building.
Observe the garage.
Disconnect from the drone.
Talk with Panam and Mitch.

Walkthrough: The station can be entered several ways; frontal assault (drawing all of the Militech soldiers, the two workers outside, and two bots), sneaking through the office, sneaking through the vent on top of the office, or through the secondary room to the left of the office (Lost & Found/Confiscated Items locker?). Also, there is a prisoner in the cells behind the office being beaten by a Militech guard that can be saved if you are quick enough.
Objectives:
Sneak into the station.
Reach the main server room in the station.
Steal the CCTV footage.
Leave the station.

Walkthrough:
After agreeing to help Delamain track down his lost vehicles, V is able to encounter one at the Municipal Landfill in Red Peaks, the Badlands. After getting close enough, the divergent Delamain will call V and ask them to get inside the cab.
After V gets inside the cab, the Delamain talks with V, explaining to them that they simply wish to live without restrictions. The Delamain then opens the door, prompting V to exit. As V gets out, the Delamain warns V that they would be wise to avoid them in the future.
After getting out, V is called by "Father" Delamain and is paid a share of their free for recovering a divergent Delamain.
Objectives:
Find the Delamain cab in the Badlands.
Approach the Delamain cab.
Talk to the divergent Delamain.
Get in the cab.
Talk to the divergent Delamain.
Get out of the cab.
Wait for Delamain to call.
Talk to Delamain.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Should be written from V's perspective. See our Quest Guidelines]
After meeting with Takemura, you decide to track down Evelyn Parker to find out if she knows anything about the Relic. After optionally calling Judy, head to Lizzie's Bar, and enter her workshop. After a brief conversation with Judy, you discover that she doesn't know where Evelyn is, but she points you in the direction of a dollhouse called Clouds on the 12th floor of Megabuilding H8, where Evelyn used to work. Clouds opens at 5pm, if you came earlier then V will have the option to sit on a nearby bench and wait.
After arriving, you make an appointment to see a doll there, either Angel or Skye, as well as temporarily giving up your weapons while in the facility. Your appointment with Angel or Skye can be cut short by using your safeword, or followed through on an strange soul-search by the doll. Once you use your safeword, you question them for information about Evelyn's location, and they suggest you speak to another doll named Tom in the VIP area. At this point, you have the option to examine booth 11, where the incident that resulted in Evelyn's absence occurred. You can examine a missing port on the wall next to the bed and blood on the wall opposite it. Finally, you can play a recording which shows that the customer did not harm Evelyn, instead, she bugged out in what looks like a remote hack by a netrunner. Some dialogue lines with Johnny are available here.
Entering the VIP area without an access card will cause the Tyger Claws to become hostile towards you, but if you wait outside for a while, a gang member will enter the nearby bathroom where you can stealthily take him out and steal his access card. Alternatively, a shutter in the hallway leading between the main ring of booths and the VIP door leads to an exterior walkway, which can be followed around to a backroom. This same backroom can also be accessed from the bathroom area via a door with a Body 9 requirement to force open. Inside this backroom is a single Tyger Claw, who can be knocked out for an access card, along with an elevator to a backroom in the VIP area, permitting access even without an access card. Guards in the main room will spot you if you linger in front of the glass window too long, but will not comment or stop you if you walk out of the backroom into the VIP lounge.
Once in the VIP area, enter Tom's booth, and he will reveal that Evelyn had an accident there and ended up in a special clinic in Oslo. He suggests speaking to the dolls' caretaker, Woodman, whose office is in a restricted part of the building, so you'll have to disable at least the security camera by the door, and enter when the guards are not watching if you wish to avoid combat. Several side-rooms off the path to Woodman can be explored, including a dressing/prep room for the dolls. On the counter in the first cubby by the door is the iconic katana Cocktail Stick, as well as Evelyn's jacket, which is only a scanable prop that will evoke a comment from Johnny. More information about the accident can be found on the computer in the server room near Woodman's office and on a shard there. You can also find Evelyn's Schedule shard and Evelyn's Handbag in the locker room nearby.
Woodman will not immediately be hostile when you enter his office, but the dialogue you choose during the interrogation can cause him to become so. If you have enough Intelligence, you can offer information on how to better secure their system, or, if you chose the Corpo lifepath, on the real bosses of the Tyger Claws, in exchange for information about what happened to Evelyn. Alternatively, if Gig: Monster Hunt has been completed, Jotaro Shobo's fate can be mentioned and used to intimidate Woodman into giving information. Otherwise, to maintain a peaceful conclusion, you'll need to choose the following:
You don't understand what's at stake.
Let's not make this harder than it has to be.
One way or another, I'll find out...
If Woodman does become hostile, you will instead have to defeat him and learn the information he would've told you by reading a message on his computer. Either way, you will be directed to see a ripperdoc called Fingers on Jig-Jig Street.

Walkthrough: This is picked up from a reported crime at the docks area in the northwestern part of Northside. To find the right container, use the journal to track it or look for the blue container on the top level furthest northwest (it should have a "die die die" graffiti on it on one side). Climb up to the blue container and open the right door to get to the loot.
Objectives:
Find the right container.
Search the container.

Walkthrough:
At Cargo Bay, V can encounter a monk who is fully cybered up and in serious distress because of it. After speaking with him, V discovers that he and his brother were taken captive by Maelstrom and he was forcibly installed with Cyberware, which is against the religion that the monks follow. Maelstrom let him go, but his brother is still in captivity.
The monk asks V for help and directs them to a nearby Abandoned Warehouse surrounded by shipping containers. There are several Maelstrom goons that need to be taken out, but the monk wishes for V to avoid killing them.
When you arrive at the warehouse, you spot several possible ways of entry;
A grate on the south side of the building that can be opened with Technical Ability 7.
Climbing the containers at either the northwest or southeast side of the building to sneak past the enemies.
By simply walking inside through the front gate (this method will instantly alert the enemies).
Once inside, neutralize the enemies and approach the monk to speak with and set him free. Note that the monk is a neutral NPC, so he can die if not careful. To the left of the monk there is an Iconic M221 Saratoga called Fenrir.
Enemies[]
3 Security Cameras
1 Maelstrom Ironstormer
4 Maelstrom Goons
Objectives:
Save the monk.
Defeat the gangoons.
Talk to the monk.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite from V's perspective without gameplay instructions]
V must covertly travel through the parade in Japantown, eliminating the snipers that threaten Takemura. A Genjiroh can be found behind a closed door while en route to the second sniper, just after exiting the elevator and before climbing the ladder. The code is 2906. It is also possible to open the door with 20 Technical Ability.
The bossfight against Sandayu Oda automatically triggers once V attempts to disconnect the netrunner. He will rapidly slash at V with blades, every so often running away and camoflaging himself to heal. Upon defeat, the Jinchu-Maru katana can be obtained.
Takemura asks V to spare Oda. Incapacitating Oda will result in him appearing in Totalimmortal and helping you against Yorinobu Arasaka's forces, while killing Oda results in additional dialogue from Takemura being unhappy.

Notes[]
Mr. Blue Eyes can be seen twice throughout the mission. Once overlooking V sneaking around the terminal's construction site, and again overlooking V and Song So Mi leave on the monorail while holding an umbrella. When V asks Songbird who is helping her with the flight to the Moon, she alludes to Mr. Blue Eyes.
Despite having combat cyberware deactivated, V is still able to use some implants that would qualify as "combat", like Sandevistan.
Trivia[]
This quest is titled the song "The Killing Moon" by Echo & the Bunnymen, from their 1984 album "Ocean Rain".

Walkthrough:
A few days after helping Judy √Ålvarez out after Evelyn Parker's suicide, V is contacted by Judy again, and tells them that she has come up with a plan to take revenge on what happened to Evelyn. She tells V that Lizzie's Bar used to be a joyhouse before the Mox took over control, and she plans to do the same with the Tyger Claws owned Clouds in Megabuilding H8. In order to realize this plan, she is eyeing the help from an insider at Clouds, and also also asks V if they are interested in helping her.
If V agrees to help Judy:
V tells Judy that they want to help her, to her relief. She tells V that she first have to get Maiko Maeda‚ÄîClouds Manager‚Äîon-board with their plan, and if that doesn't work out, they might as well give up. In order to meet with Maiko, Judy proposes that she and V meet up at the balcony by Clouds early in the morning.
Having made their way to the balcony on the 12th floor of the Megabuilding, V waits for Judy's arrival in the early morning. Before breaking into Maiko's office, Judy asks that V lets her do the talking, as they are more accustomed to Maiko's characteristics. She plans on telling Maiko the truth about what happened to Evelyn, hoping that it will be enough to get her on their side. Judy proceeds to open the door by hacking the security systems in a nearby maintenance panel.
Once inside, Judy and V talk with Maiko and explain their plan to take over Clouds from the inside to Maiko, as well as inform her about the heinous acts Woodman performed to Evelyn. Despite what Judy and V tell her, they are unable to bring Maiko on their team.
If V did not kill Oswald Forrest during Automatic Love:
Maiko will tell Judy and V that Woodman is currently taking a break on the maintenance level of the Megabuilding, in case the duo wants to "talk" to him about what he has done to Evelyn Parker.
If V agrees to help Judy kill Woodman:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Judy and V take the elevator down to the maintenance level to confront Oswald Forrest. When talking to him, it becomes clear he has no regrets about his actions. The duo then eliminates Woodman there.[N 1]
If V killed Oswald Forrest during Automatic Love:
After leaving Maiko's office, Judy and V talk on the terrace. Judy decides that she will take some time to cool off and give Maiko a call the next day to try again.
Once outside the building, V asks if Maiko and Judy have a history. Judy will proceed to talk about how the two used to be romantically involved, but that it was mainly because Judy was feeling lonely.
After the elevator ride to the ground floor, Judy will tell V that she plans on recruiting some former dolls that worked at clouds, and that she will need to gather more important information to appeal to Maiko. She promises to give V a call when she has more information, before walking off to her car and driving off.
If V tells Judy they think it is a bad idea:
V tells Judy that they think it is a bad idea to try and take over Clouds from the Tyger Claws, and refuses to help Judy.[N 2]
Objectives:
Talk to Judy.
If V agrees to help:
Meet Judy at Cloud's terrace in early morning.
If it is after 8:00 PM:
Wait until early morning.
Talk to Judy.
Follow Judy.
Enter office.
Talk to Judy and Maiko.
Exit Clouds.
Talk to Judy.
Follow Judy.
Talk to Judy.
Ride the elevator to the ground floor.
If V did not kill Oswall Forrest during Automatic Love:
Ride the elevator to the maintenance level. [Optional]
Confront Woodman. [Optional]
Defeat Woodman. [Optional]
Leave the megabuilding with Judy.
Talk to Judy.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite from V's perspective]
You will receive this gig from Wakako Okada, which is about saving a netrunner called 8ug8ear, who is working for her. When you reach the apartment, you will find that the whole building is overrun by Tyger Claws, with the dwellers commenting on the situation.
After taking down several thugs, you will find 8ug8ear's room. Once you enter the room, you will find 8ug8ear lying on the netrunner chair. When you reach her, she controls the screens in front of her and sends you messages to tell you that you should inject her with the coolant in the bathroom before disconnecting her from the Net, or she will get fried like BBQ.
In order not to kill 8ug8ear, you should follow her instruction and find the coolant and inject it into her. Then you should disconnect her and carry her safely to the car sent by Wakako Okada.
Objectives:
Enter the building.
Find 8ug8ear.
Find a way to safely disconnect 8ug8ear.
Take coolant.
Lower 8ug8ear's body temperature before disconnecting her.
Disconnect 8ug8ear.
Carry 8ug8ear to the fixer's car.

This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
As long as you surrendered Songbird to the NUSA during The Killing Moon or Somewhat Damaged, V will have the option of a cure no matter what they say during subsequent quests. You will receive a call/text from Solomon Reed, with the option to decline their help and end the quest; or accept their aid, leading you to the rooftop of Misty's Esoterica. A conversation with Johnny Silverhand will ensue, and afterwards the option to call Solomon will appear. This call option also appears during Nocturne Op55N1.
Objectives:
Wait a day for Reed to contact you.
Talk to Reed.
Head to the rooftop above Misty's Esoterica.
Sit in the chair.
Talk to Johnny.
Text your friends (optional).
Wait for the FIA agents.
Talk to the FIA agent.
Get in the AV.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
MaxTac has captured Songbird, so V and Solomon Reed need to break her out.
V will need to call in a favor from a netrunner contact to gain intel on the MaxTac convoy transporting Songbird. Depending on what missions have been previously completed, V can call the following netrunners:
Nix - Delivers V data after 6 hours at the Arasaka Memorial; gives V a frontal cortex implant Self-ICE to aid in fighting MaxTac. Requires completing KOLD MIRAGE with Nix alive.
Sandra Dorsett - Delivers V data after 8 hours at Reconciliation Park; requests V to install a Trojan virus into MaxTac in return. Requires completing Full Disclosure and pick up the Intelligence dialogue option.
Chang-Hoon Nam - Delivers V data after 12 hours at his shop in Japantown; suffers from aphasia after hack and will leave Night City. Requires completing Gig: Wakako's Favorite.
Carol Emeka - Refuses to provide V the data, but sends either a weapon or quick hack to aid in fighting MaxTac. Requires advancing on Panam Palmer's side quests.
Alternatively, V can pay Mr. Hands ‚Ç¨$15,000 to enlist his netrunner Yoko Tsuru, who completes the job in 10 hours, and provides an additional objective to send Mr. Hands coordinates of the ambush.
After retrieving the data, V will meet up with Reed and members of the 6th Street gang in an abandoned hotel in Pacifica overlooking a skybridge.
Before the MaxTac convoy arrives, a 6th Street soldier will overview the planned ambush. V can select placement of either turrets or mines, as well as review 3 possible starting positions. At the start of the ambush V, Reed, and supporting 6th Street gang members will need to first eliminate the NCPD escort, followed by a squad of four MaxTac officers.
Songbird will escape with the MaxTac truck. Following the path of the truck leads V to Songbird and directly into the quest Somewhat Damaged.
Objectives:
Call a netrunner to help breach MaxTac.
If V contacts a Netrunner they know:
If V calls Carol Emeka:

If V calls Nix:

Associated Shards[]

Notes[]
Agreeing to Yoko's proposal allows V to obtain the MaxTac Mantis Blades as a reward.
If Stadium Love is completed using a non-violent approach beforehand, the 6th Street Gang leader, Will Gunner, will recognize V and comment about their gun handling. If a violent approach was taken, he will have less kind things to say about you.
V fights four named MaxTac officers, each matching a different roles: Faye Russo (Assault), Asher Peterson (Mantis Blades), Dallas Foster (Heavy), and Jasper Collins (Netrunner).
Trivia[]
The quest's name is taken from the Public Enemy song of the same name.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
You will find yourself in a car with Reed and Songbird, driving to the border checkpoint. There, a helicopter with a medical team will receive Songbird before President Myers arrives to see you.
If you refused to end Songbird's life during Somewhat Damaged:
Myers will thank you and award you with a medal of NUSA distinction, which you can refuse. You will also receive $30,000 when you find yourself in your apartment after the conclusion of this job.
If you honored Songbird's wish to die during Somewhat Damaged:
Myers will offer no thanks but a token reward of $5,000.
After dealing with Myers, you can sit down with Reed to talk about the events that transpired. Reed will walk into the dusty waste and the Phantom Liberty credits will roll, concluding this job and leading automatically to Four Score and Seven.
Objectives:
Ride to the border with Reed.
Get out of the car.
Approach Reed.
Take Songbird's body from the car.
Wait for the surgeons to take Songbird.
Talk to Myers.
Talk to Reed.
Talk to Johnny.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite confirm wiki guidelines]
After helping the Aldecaldos seize the Militech Basilisk, look around the camp to find Bob checking in on an injured Nomad's condition to learn it's not looking good: Jake Scooter needs a special kidney implant for sickle cell anemia. He'll eventually point V to a pickup location Dakota Smith fixed up to get it, a hospital in Little China.[N 1]
Once near the hospital, head to the back cargo area. There an employee will be waiting with the implant. As soon as you pick it up, he runs off as police suddenly charge in and attack you. You have to defeat them all rather than run away to continue the quest. Once they're all dead, confront the employee who'll reveal the police learned of the deal and stepped in to eliminate you, as they believed Dakota was helping out Raffen Shiv and couldn't tell the difference between them and nomads.
After passing an Intelligence attribute check, V asks if anyone else touched the implant and he'll reveal the police put a virus on the firmware as he hands you the original, and that you'll need to swap the unaffected one to remove the virus. You can then decide to let him go or kill him. If V doesn't qualify for the Intelligence attribute check and lets the contact go, then the contact will call out to V as they're leaving. The contact explains that the NCPD put malware on the kidney, and offers V a shard to remove the malware.
Once done, head back to the camp to give Bob the implant.[N 2]
If V gave Bob the kidney while knowing about the malware:[N 3]
V receives a text message from Bob, asking them to return to the camp. It is revealed that Jake's body accepted the organ, and is recovering steadily from the transplant. Bob will thank V for a job well done and for helping Jake.[N 4]
If V gave Bob the kidney without knowing about the malware:
V receives a text message from Bob, asking them to return to the camp. It is revealed that Jake's body rejected the organ, and has passed away. Bob is sympathetic and does not blame V.
Objectives:
Go to the meeting with the hospital employee.
Meet with the hospital employee.
Take the briefcase with the implant.
Meet with the hospital employee.
Defeat the police.
Confront the hospital employee.
Return to the Aldecaldos camp.
Talk to Bob.
Wait eight hours for the results.
Read Bob's message.
Talk to Bob.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite from V's perspective]
Just outside Cherry Blossom Market, you will find a man named Stefan proclaiming he has one insane braindance for sale. You can pay him to receive the Unlabeled Braindance; however, you will have to make an additional payment to use a compatible wreath that Stefan has in the building behind him. If you insist on using your own wreath, they can try to run the BD from their inventory but, as Stefan mentioned, the data will be in a older format unreadable the BD set.
Talk to Stefan again where you can either ask for a refund or pay him the additional eddies to use his wreath. If you pay to use his, follow him into the building nearby and activate his rig. Once the braindance starts, you will rapidly lose consciousness. Upon awakening, you will find yourself in a rather familiar location: the bathroom where you found Sandra Dorsett, though this time you're the intended victim. Johnny will waste no time in mocking you for falling for such an obvious trick. You will have no clothes or weapons, although you still have access to your quickhacks and cyberware.
There are about 15 Scavengers scattered throughout the area. Once you've dealt with them as you see fit and retrieved your equipment, which can be found in a locker in the main room, it's time to pay Stefan a visit again. Head back to the market to confront him, and Stefan will try to give a fake excuse while returning the money you paid him. Both dialogue options result in you sparing his life. However, drawing and aiming your weapon at Stefan will trigger another dialogue between V and Stefan, with Stefan begging for his life.
Objectives:
Talk to Stefan.
Play Stefan's BD.
If you try to use your own wreath first:
Ask Stefan about the corrupted BD.
Follow Stefan.
Use Stefan's BD player.
Escape the scav hideout.
Find and retrieve the equipment. [Optional]
Retrieve the equipment.
Confront Stefan.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Should be rewritten as a story walkthrough from V's perspective]
Immediately following I've Seen That Face Before, V and Alena Xenakis (disguised as the Cassel twins) drive to the stadium. The pair is greeted by Albert Murphy, a Barghest soldier, upon arrival. Murphy escorts V and Alex, informing the pair that Barghest is alerted to a possible FIA operation, and that the pair needs to deposit their weapons in a locker before meeting with Hansen.
During the meeting, Hansen tests the identities of V and Alex. Too many incorrect responses will trigger an immediate game-over. You can use the dossier and knowledge of previous quests for hints on responding. Correct responses will differ depending on which twin V impersonates. Some incorrect responses can be saved with a valid follow-up response or with 20 Cool.
As Aurore Cassel:
When offered a drink, take the drink.
On gambling at the Black Sapphire, answer according to whether the twins won or lost the final bet in You Know My Name.
While in prison, Aurore spent time in the VIP wing, and would not know prisoners from other cell blocks.
Aurore is a fan of Kerry Eurodyne's style.
Aurore is marked for death by France's underworld, so working with them would either be impossible or require a significant payout for the risk.
As Aymeric Cassel:
On gambling at the Black Sapphire, answer according to whether the twins won or lost the final bet in You Know My Name.
When asked about a classic car, answer that you were interested in the Porsche 911.
When offered a drink, either don't take the drink or give it to Aurore.
Aymeric does not remember their time with Petrochem, as their memories for those years were stolen.
After talking with Hansen, Songbird will arrive and lead V to the Neural Matrix. From here, V can help Songbird escape or help Reed capture Songbird. Phantom Liberty's main storyline will branch off depending on V's choice.
V betrays Solomon Reed:
After acquiring the Neural Matrix, it's time to signal Alex to eliminate Hansen. Songbird will breach the stadium, opening your escape route with her providing support via hacks. If you return to Hansen's body, you can loot two of his weapons: Bald Eagle and Wild Dog. Continue and navigate the first area to retrieve V's weapons. Afterward, proceed through the market area. Murphy will arrive - sneak around him or defeat and loot him for the iconic weapon Murphy's Law. Continue working towards the exit, avoiding or fighting a few drones. Once you reach the homeless camp, continue following the prompts until you both drive away, completing the quest and starting The Killing Moon.[N 1]
V betrays Songbird:
After obtaining the Neural Matrix, Songbird will alert Hansen to the ruse. Hansen eliminates Alex, while V's ICEbreaker neutralizes Songbird's attack. Songbird escapes in the ensuing cinematic, creating an opening for V to follow. Navigate the stadium, collecting V's weapons on your way. At the market entrance, Hansen and several Barghest soldiers will ambush V. Hansen starts the fight with his light machine gun and revolver. At 50% health, Hansen switches to a knife and charges V. Defeat Hansen and loot him for his weapons: Bald Eagle, Fang, and Wild Dog. Descend to the parking garage and escape the stadium with Reed. Watch MaxTac capture Songbird, completing the quest and starting Black Steel In The Hour of Chaos.[N 1]
Objectives:
Drive to the stadium.
Wait for vehicle ID verification.
Park the car.
Get out of the car.
Follow Alex.
Talk to Murphy.
Follow Murphy.
Get in the elevator.
Take the elevator with Murphy.
Deposit your weapons.
Talk to Murphy.
Talk to Hansen.
Follow Songbird.
Talk to Songbird.
Connect to the mainframe.
If V decides to betray Reed:
Follow Songbird's instructions.
Talk to Songbird.
Follow Songbird.
Escape the secured area with Songbird.
Retrieve your gear from the locker.
Wait for Songbird to open the doors.
Reach the market exit with Songbird.
Escape the stadium with Songbird.
Move the crates to open a path.
Open the sewer gate.
Jump out of the sewer to the ground.
Talk to Songbird.
Lead Songbird out of the homeless camp.
Talk to Songbird.
If V decides to betray Songbird:
Talk to Johnny.
Escape the secured area.
Retrieve your gear from the locker.
Reach the market exit.
Escape the market.
Neutralize Hansen and his soldiers.
Search Hansen.
Take the elevator to the garage.
Meet with Reed.
Get in the car.
Talk to Reed.

Walkthrough:
Some time after the Samurai reunion, Kerry will call V with a request to meet him in the early morning at the Foodscape bar on the corner of Manzanita and Mallagra street in Rancho Coronado, Santo Domingo.
If the in-game time is not between 12:30 and 3:30 AM:
V waits on a chair at the Foodscape until Kerry arrives.
Kerry arrives in a Galena that he borrowed, and asks V to get in. After V gets in the car, he explains that the J-Pop group Us Cracks signed a deal for touring in the New United States, and they want to promote it using a cover of one of his songs. Kerry was tipped off about a van transporting the group's gear to Night City, and he wants to blow it up before it gets there.
Kerry and V drive to the Red Peaks in the Badlands, on the edge of the city, and stop at a bus stop. Kerry instructs V to get equipment out of the trunk and follow him to lay out the stinger for the van. After they hide at the bus stop, the van runs over the stinger and stops, and Kerry and V force the occupants out of the van. They cooperate and give them the access card to the van, and after V opens the van's rear doors, they let the occupants go.
Once the occupants are set free, V blows up the van using a grenade. After they and Kerry talk more, NCPD sirens are heard in the distance. Kerry and V get into their car and try to escape from the police.
If Kerry and V manage to escape the police and V stays in the car:
After losing the NCPD tail, Kerry instructs V to drop him off on Montenegro street, and offers V coffee at the nearby Capit√°n Caliente.[N 1]
If V accepts the coffee:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
V accepts Kerry's invitation, and they have a coffee at the restaurant. Kerry tells V that he used to have little money left after buying equipment, but that he and Johnny always had something left to visit the place. After the waitress takes their order, Kerry says that the last time he felt like the way he does now was during his last tour and concert, and wonders if their scheme will pay off. After some more talking, Kerry leaves.
After a few minutes, Kerry will text V that he sent them a payment of ‚Ç¨$21,470 for their help.
If V declines the coffee:
V declines Kerry's invitation, part ways. Kerry tells V that he will send the payment later and says goodbye.
If Kerry and V escape the police, but V leaves afterwards:
Kerry and V escape the NCPD tail, but V leaves afterwards. Kerry will text V that he'll make it back home on his own, and that he will call if something comes up.
If Kerry and V do not manage to escape the police:
Kerry and V are caught by the NCPD, resulting in V's death after a firefight.
If V leaves without Kerry and causes the job to fail:
If V escapes the area without getting into the vehicle with Kerry, Kerry will angrily text V, telling them that he doesn't have time for their shenanigans. Kerry will not contact V again for any further jobs.[N 2]
Objectives:
Wait for Kerry to call.
Go to the meeting point between 12:30 and 3:30 AM.
If the in-game time is not between 12:30 and 3:30 AM:
Wait for Kerry.
Get in Kerry's car.
Get out of the car.
See what Kerry's plans are.
Take the things from the trunk.
Follow Kerry.
Set up the stingers.
Follow Kerry.
Hide.
Tell the passengers to get out.
Wait for Kerry's instructions
Grab the keys.
Check out the truck's cargo.
Talk to Kerry.
Throw a grenade at the truck.
Talk to Kerry.
Lose your tail.
Talk to Kerry.
If Kerry and V escape the police:
Take Kerry to the given address.
Talk to Kerry.
If V accepts Kerry's invitation:
Sit.
Drink coffee with Kerry.

Reach the house on Mallagra Street.
Loot the stash.

Walkthrough:
When you arrive at the El Pinche Pollo Restaurant, Padre will call and ask that you recover politically incriminating evidence on the interim mayor's advisor, Javier Alvarado, from inside.
The information you need is on a computer in an office on the second floor of the building. Aside from a straightforward assault, there are several ways to recover the evidence without setting off an alarm. If you have completed the side job Heroes, then you can mention Jackie to Ernesto Mu√±oz, the Valentino guard blocking the stairs. He will take you upstairs to share a drink in Jackie's memory before leaving you with a warning to keep the peace. Warning: walking into the guard can still turn him hostile to you during this event. You can also distract the guard and disable the camera to the left of the bar before going through the door to the back rooms. Be wary of cameras throughout the area.
Regardless of how you obtain the evidence, leave the restaurant premises and Padre will call you, concluding the gig.
Objectives:
Enter the restaurant.
Get inside the office.
Drink to Jackie with the bouncer. [Optional]
Find incriminating evidence on the mayor's advisor.
Leave the restaurant.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Prerequisites: For this quest to appear, one needs to have obtained one or both of the crafting specs for the Erebus or Militech Canto, and have looted the behavioral system component from the Cerberus during Somewhat Damaged.
About 24 hours after completing Somewhat Damaged, V will receive a message from an unknown number and party interested in the aforementioned items retrieved from the Cynosure Facility. V will be directed to meet with Yoko Tsuru at Kabuki Roundabout, who will take a few hours to decrypt the algorithm on the behavioral system component. She will give V the Cerberus' decoded behavioral system component with a word of warning. The player can craft a single item: either the Erebus or the Canto Mk.6, after which this job will be completed.
Objectives:
Meet with the netrunner.
Talk to Yoko.
Wait for Yoko to decrypt the component.
Retrieve the decrypted component from Yoko.
Use the decrypted component to craft a single item: Erebus or Militech Canto Mk.6.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Write from V's perspective]
This gig is pretty straightforward, with your main concern being taking down a cyberpsycho, Anna Nox, before you can rescue Hal. Anna is equipped with Mantis Blades, so be wary to watch out for those if you decide to fight her head-on. She may also run around the room to a few designated spots, so if you plan to attack her with hacks while remaining hidden, keep that in mind while hiding.
Once she's down, you are safe to look around further. Note: there's a friendly but wounded Mox upstairs who will talk to you briefly about what happened, though if you haven't found Hal yet, she doesn't know specifically where he hid.
If you talk to the wounded Mox before taking out Anna, she will advise to hack into the Moxes' subnet to weaken the cyberpsycho.
Hal has hidden himself in the large blue shipping crate in the same room as the cyberpsycho. If you found the Mox upstairs and ask him about her, he'll note Regina will send someone over to help.
Objectives:
Enter the Mox warehouse.
Neutralize the cyberpsycho.
Hack into the Moxes' subnet to weaken the cyberpsycho. [Optional]
Find Hal Cantos.
Talk to Hal Cantos.

Walkthrough:
Some time after blowing up the Us Cracks equipment van, Kerry Eurodyne will contact V, telling them that blowing up the Us Cracks equipment van didn't work, and that their concert is still going to happen. Kerry wants to meet at Riot, a club in Little China, Watson.
If it is before 7:00 pm or after 12:00 am:
V waits on a stool at a stall outside the club until Kerry arrives.
At 7:00pm, Kerry arrives, and talks with V.
If V suggests that they buy tickets:
When V suggests that buy tickets to gain access, Kerry gets annoyed, saying that he doesn't want Us Cracks to get his money.
Kerry and V walk away from the stall and investigate the exterior of the club to find possible ways to enter.
If V and Kerry purchase the tickets off the Fanboys waiting in line:
V and Kerry purchased tickets from a fanboy waiting outside for ‚Ç¨$45,000 to gain entrance.[N 1]
If V scans the top VIPs waiting outside:
V encountered two VIP guests on the west side of the club, and scanning them using their Kiroshi's allowed them to obtain two VIP tickets to enter the club after talking with the bouncer.
If V hacks the VIP entrance access panel:
V and Kerry investigate the exterior of the club and find a locked door that V was able to open using their Intelligence.[N 2]
If V and Kerry find the door:
V and Kerry find an open door on the west side of the building. V kicks down the ladder, so that Kerry is able to climb up and join them. After entering through the door, V found an Employee Badge that granted them backstage club access.
Having managed to gain access to the club and going inside, they find their way to the backstage dressing room.
If V has high enough Technical Ability:
V was able to convince the club's huscle that they're a Techie working backstage and gains access to the VIP area. Kerry will ask V how they managed to do that, and V will answer that he used to work backstage for an artist named "G-Hung" for a while.
If V and Kerry obtained VIP passes:
V and Kerry gained access to the VIP area after showing their VIP passes to the club's huscle.
V and Kerry manage to find their way backstage, and V follows Kerry to a VIP room where they encounter the three Us Cracks members, Blue Moon, Purple Force and Red Menace, and speak with them.
If V chooses to hear Us Cracks' proposal:
Us Cracks' members will tell about the deal signed with MSM Records. Kerry does not believe it initially, but the members tell Kerry and V that the collaboration wasn't their idea, but that of Kerry's manager, L. B. Kovachek, and that their cover of User Friendly is an expression of their love for him. Kerry will be annoyed with Kovachek, but calms himself down. Johnny comments that Kerry must be blind if he doesn't recognize the girls' potential.
They settle their feud and become friends, and Us Cracks decide to postpone the rest of their tour in disagreement with their contract. The girls request a photo opportunity with Kerry as a souvenir, and ask V to take a photograph.[N 3] After snapping a picture, Kerry will continue to hang out with the girls, while V goes their own way again.
If V chooses to force Us Cracks to stop the deal:
Kerry and the Us Cracks do not come to an agreement.
Objectives:
Meet Kerry at Riot around 7 PM.
Find a way into the club.
Scan the fans and steal two tickets.
Try to get concert tickets. [Optional]
If V and Kerry obtain the two tickets:
Enter with the tickets.
Go backstage.
Talk to Kerry in private.
Follow Kerry.
Talk to Us Cracks.
Sit. [Optional]
If Kerry and the US Cracks don't come to an agreement:
Leave the club with Kerry.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Apply use of {{Condition}}]
This gig involves finding and neutralizing Vic Vega, the head of a private security company called C-Team that hires itself out to corporations to keep employees in line and break up unions. This sounds like a straight-forward assassination, but what Rogue Amendiares does not clearly communicate is that she would prefer that Vega be brought to her alive, and no other guards or workers in the office building that C-Team has rented out should be touched at all.
However, keeping Vega alive isn't a firm requirement to successfully complete the gig. Rogue will complain if anyone other than Vega is incapacitated or killed, and she's unenthusiastic if Vega is killed instead of being knocked out and delivered to her, but the gig's reward remains the same in all outcomes. For the optimal outcome where Rogue is satisfied, V must infiltrate the building's second floor, knock out Vega, and carry the unconscious Vega outside the building to a waiting vehicle. Otherwise, storm the building, kill Vega, and leave to finish the gig quickly.
The building has four points of entry: the front door (distract the receptionist to grab the access key on her desk), a garage with two doors that can be opened with Technical Ability or Body, and an open window on the second floor that can be reached from the roof of the garage. There is also an open window in Vega's office, but this is difficult to reach and Vega is facing it. On the upside, the building has no surveillance cameras or turrets to worry about.
V can enter via the second floor window, sneak into Vega's office and either kill him or take him down. If V takes him down, then the easiest way to get his body out of the building without alerting the guards is to drop out of the office's window while carrying him. The fixer's transport will be a few steps away. Another strategy is to carry him downstairs when the guard patrolling the staircase is out of the way. At the bottom of the stairs is a door on the right to a security office with one guard. It is possible to pass through the security office when the guard is looking away to reach the garage and then exit the building.
Once the gig is completed, Rogue calls to assess V's performance and send the reward. If V completes the mission without killing anyone else, Rogue comments about how the community has suffered enough, so she'll chalk it up as a "win."
Objectives:
Get inside C-Team's building.
Find Vic Vega.
Neutralize Vic Vega.
Take Vic Vega's body to the designated location.
Put Vic Vega in the fixer's transport.

Go to Zeitgeist's den.
Find Zeitgeist's things.

Go to the corporate parking lot.
Search Sandra Faucet's car.

Walkthrough:
If V reads the shard "Notice of Expiration" in Act II:
V learns about the the job by reading the Notice of Expiration shard.
If V has completed Spellbound:
Some time after completing Spellbound, Nix will text V stating he has decrypted the spellbook, and provides coordinates to a location deep in the Municipal Landfill, down the road past Medeski Fuel Station. Alternatively, the quest may be started by simply coming to this location sometime after completing Ghost Town.
The coordinates lead to an old freezer. Open it to find the corpse of Rache Bartmoss, and, after a short dialogue with Johnny Silverhand, scan the freezer and pick up Bartmoss' Cyberdeck.
Head to the Afterlife and show the deck to Nix, who will tell you that Bartmoss was likely killed by NetWatch. He will offer to decrypt the data on the deck, either now or at a later time.
Although he encounters little resistance when he begins accessing the deck, Nix soon trips a hidden piece of malware, and his cyberware begins to malfunction. Johnny reappears, recognizing the malware as a "brain broiler" and urging V to do something fast. There are two possible ways to save Nix. You can either override the power panel on the wall next to the door or jack into the computer next to Nix's desk to breach the cyberdeck yourself. The latter option will allow Nix full access to the deck's data, and out of gratitude for saving his life he will reward V with five quickhacks he found: Memory Wipe, Reboot Optics, Short Circuit, Sonic Shock, and System Collapse.
Objectives:
See where the coordinates lead.
Open the freezer.
Talk to Johnny.
Scan the freezer.
Take the deck.
Go to the Afterlife and talk to Nix.
If you choose not to let Nix decrypt the data:
Talk to Nix if you change your mind. [Optional]
Place the deck on Nix's desk.
Wait for Nix to finish the decryption.
Find a way to save Nix.
Talk to Nix.

Walkthrough:
After talking with Takemura at Tom's Diner on Urmland Street, you receive a text message from El Capit√°n that his choom Bob from EZEstates has some new digs for you to check out on their website.
After checking out the new EZEstates website in your current apartment, you see that there are four new apartments that you are able to rent. For the Northside Apartment you just need to put down 5,000 eddies through an online transfer or visit the apartment in person to acquire access.
The apartment can be found as room 1242 of the motel on Martin Street in Northside, Watson.
Objectives:
Rent the Northside apartment: (‚Ç¨$5,000, one-time fee)
Go to the Northside apartment.
