Walkthrough:
After V retrieved the flathead from Maelstrom and the information from Evelyn Parker, V is now ready to start the job Dexter DeShawn hired V and Jackie for.
V heads out to The Afterlife to meet up with Jackie and talks to him for a bit before heading into the club. The bouncer will eventually let them in regardless of the option V chooses. As Dex is still busy, V can look around some but ultimately they'll need to go sit down at the bar with Jackie and can talk a bit more with him and the bartender, Claire, before Dex's bodyguard Oleg summons them.
Heist Briefing[]
Follow Jackie to the back room where Dex and T-Bug are waiting to go over the heist's details. V can converse with T-Bug before placing the flathead in the case. Once they do, sit and Dex will begin to ask V some questions, particularly about Evelyn, who V can reveal wanted to cut out the middleman or not. Regardless, Dex will eventually direct them to a shard on the table, take it as Dex and T-Bug continue to fill you in on the plan.
V can ask questions about the mission, then Jackie will bring up how the pay is being split. Dex notes V and Jackie get 30% but V can have him bump it up to 35% if they point out this is about more then eddies, and then that they want to be remembered for something, or, for Corporate Lifepath, that this is about revenge on Arasaka as well. Dex will bump it up to 40% if he is told about Evelyn Parker's desire to cut him out of the deal. After Dex heads off, V can then talk to T-Bug some more before she also heads out. Jackie will then ask if V is ready or not.
Note that once V gets in the cab, they won't be able to return to exploring Night City and finish other missions until Act 2, so if you need to wrap anything else up before then, do it now.
Infiltrating the Hotel[]
Once V is ready, they can put on the suit and get in the taxi. After some banter between Delamain and Jackie, it'll verify V's and Jackie's identity and then drive them to the hotel. On the way, V can talk to Jackie some about how he's acting regarding this job. Once they arrive, follow Jackie once he gets the flathead out and head in through the scanner and then check in. At one point during the convo with the receptionist, they will need to stall her. If V doesn't say anything T-Bug will pose as the receptionist and trick the hotel receptionist. Once the receptionist guides them to the lobby V can continue to the hotel's bar or continue to follow Jackie up the elevator (Jackie will refuse and heads upstairs if you look around).
Once upstairs and in the room, T-Bug will ask V to scan for the entry point for the flathead to use, which is right in the corner between the terrarium and the window. Jackie will command it initially but eventually V will be asked to control the flathead as it got stuck and Jackie's optics can not scan. The flathead fully navigates itself, they just need to tell it where to go, but some rooms V has to interact with objects via the Flathead to progress.
Eventually the flathead reaches the area outside the hotel's netrunner, where V will have to do a mix of scanning a particular object and then manually switch cams to see inside the netrunner's room to find a way for the flathead to get inside. Once it's in, T-Bug needs a few hours to get around their security so go sit and it'll fast forward to night.
When V wakes up, Jackie will be questioning why Yorinobu even tried to leave his family as he could want for nothing under the Arasaka name, but instead tried to start a gang. T-Bug will then note it's time, so head out to the elevator, which will give V and Jackie direct access to the penthouse. While they'll press to make it quick, they can still look around and loot stuff like Yorinobu's attire: Yorinobu's formal shirt, Yorinobu's slacks, and K≈çtetsu no Ry≈´ coat, and an Iguana Egg at the terrarium. Once ready, join Jackie and as T-Bug is uploading to it, they will see some unexpected guests arriving by AVs. To make things worse, as Jackie gets the case, T-Bug warns them that Yorinobu is heading too quickly to the penthouse so they will need to hide fast. Head behind the TV screen where she'll open the panel here, and get in.
If V doesn't enter the panel and instead waits for the elevator to arrive:
Adam Smasher will enter taking V down in one shot and then stomping their head as Jackie yells out to them. This event will instantly kill V.
A scene will play out with Yorinobu entering with Adam Smasher before they're unexpectedly joined by his father, Saburo Arasaka and his own bodyguard, Goro Takemura. After dismissing the two bodyguards, things go awry between the son and father and Yorinobu kills Saburo by strangling him to death before initiating a hotel lockdown, claiming someone poisoned his father.
Escaping[]
Taking the elevator is out, so T-Bug will direct V instead to the balcony to try and get to a ladder there. However, just as she gets the doors opened, she's killed on her end. When V gets to the corpse, Jackie will say that his AV should still be on the roof, suggesting to drive it to safety, go to the AV and defeat the two guards, there is some loot inside the AV but unfortunately AV will recognise that there are trespassers and lock itself down. The AV's AI will alert more security leaving them to run to the window T-bug opened. They head out and around and walk across the thin railing to the ladders, but halfway across hostile forces will spot V and Jackie and they will have no choice but to jump. After a short dialogue scene, Jackie will plug the Relic into himself to keep it safe while they both try to escape the hotel.
They will have to go through a number of areas with Arasaka guards. The first elevator they reach won't be accessible as an access token is required. As they reach the second elevator location, they will spot the officer who's carrying it here and they will need to take him out (lethal or non-lethal) to get the token. Once they have it, they access the elevator and can talk a bit before they reach the hotel's lobby area with more guards and if not done stealthily a mech.
Whichever way they manage to get back to the entrance, they take the elevator here to Delamain, which will be under fire, they can ignore the enemies and enter the cab. However, Arasaka sends out Adam Smasher to retrive them and pursue them with three drones, consisting of one Octant and two Griffins. V needs to shoot them down to progress.
After managing to escape, Jackie's injuries prove to be too severe and after he hands the Relic over to V, he dies. Delamain will subsequently ask where V would like to send his remains, and they can choose from several options:
If V chooses to send Jackie's body to his family or tells him to stay put:
This will unlock the sidejob Heroes.
If V chooses to send Jackie's body to Viktor Vektor:
It will later be revealed that Arasaka took the body from Viktor.
After making a decision, V exits the vehicle to go meet Dex inside the No-Tell Motel.
Dex is none too pleased with what happened, as the offing of the emperor is all over the news now. Even if V tells him that it wasn't them and Jackie that did it, Dex will tell them that Arasaka and their ninjas don't know or care about that. He'll eventually agree though that escaping Night City is the best option here before sending V off to go wash the blood off their face. Once they do and leave the bathroom though, his bodyguard knocks them down before Dex shoots them in the head.
Objectives:
Head to The Afterlife.
Talk to Jackie.
Follow Jackie.
Talk to the bouncer.
Sit next to Jackie.
Get up.
Follow Dex's bodyguard.
Join Dex in the booth.
Take part in the briefing.
Put Flathead in the briefcase.
Put on the Militech suit.
Enter the Delamain.
Exit the Delamain.
Wait for Jackie to take Flathead.
Follow Jackie.
Talk to the guard.
Stand in the scanner.
Check in at reception.
Place your hand on the panel.
Follow Jackie.
Talk to Jackie.
Check out the hotel bar. [Optional]
Head to the elevator.
Take the elevator to the 42nd floor.

Walkthrough:
Some time after helping Panam Palmer rescue the Aldecaldos's leader, Saul Bright, she contacts V again, this time to ask if they are able to come to the Mobile Camp in Rocky Ridge as soon as possible.[N 1][N 2]
After V arrives at the Mobile Camp, they meet with Panam, Mitch, and Saul in the communications trailer. As V approaches them, Panam receives an earful from Saul Bright for calling them over to the camp, and tells Panam once more that he forbade her from even thinking about the Militech convoy that they heard about. Mitch also joins into the argument, calling Saul a fool for letting a Militech Basilisk slip through their fingers. Saul retorts by mentioning that it could mess up the job they came here to do, which is revealed to be a crop protection contract for Biotechnica, with whom he is meeting later.
Panam reveals that they plan on assaulting a Militech convoy that they have heard about in order to obtain a Basilisk from them, which could prove useful for the Aldecaldos, as it could restore some of their reputation as since taking on the Biotechnica contracts they have been going through a rough time. When V asks how they can help out, Panam suggests that they talk to the others‚ÄìBob Sagan, Cassidy Righter, Carol Emeka and Teddy Simos‚Äìfirst and walk over to them near the food truck.
After taking a seat, Panam starts explaining the plan to everyone. Panam explains that the Basilisk will be transported on two trucks on Highway 101, and she plans to block the convoy's path by occupying the railroad intersection that crosses the highway.
If V declines to help Panam:
V tells Panam that they don't want to get involved in such a risky job. Despite V declining, the Aldecaldos will continue their plan to try and take over the convoy, and ride off in their vehicles to the train station. Mitch tells V that if they change their mind, they can join them there.
If V decides to join the Aldecaldos at the train station:
V changed their mind and met up with the Aldecaldos at the train station.[N 3]
If V decides to tell Saul[N 4]:
Instead of meeting with the Aldecaldos at the train station, V opted to talk to Saul. V tells them that Panam and co. went on to execute their plan to try and take over the convoy. For their honesty, Saul awards V with 42940 eurodollars.
A few hours later, V is called by an angry Panam, asking them how they could rat her out to Saul, and breaks off contact with V.
A few days later, Saul sends V a text message telling them that they did the right thing by informing him about her plan, and that the entire family owes them a huge debt of gratitude. Saul adds that the contract with Biotechnica did not work out and that the Aldecaldos will be moving their camp soon, with Panam, Mitch and the other veterans already having gone ahead of them. As a parting gift, Saul tells V that they left them something at the Sunset Motel.[N 5]
If V agrees to help Panam:
V agrees to help Panam and goes to the Corp-Bud Railroad Station.
If V decides to travel with Panam:
While driving to the train station with Panam, V talks with her. She notes that Saul probably is in favor of them not being at the Mobile Camp, considering that Biotechnica will be dropping by for a visit. Panam also mentions that Saul is afraid that the Raffen Shiv will attack the Aldecaldos as retaliation for taking the Biotechnica contract from them, and has posted extra security around the camp. When V asks if she misses Night City, she will tell V that she misses the excitement but that she at the same time misses the emptiness of the Badlands. V can understand some of this sentiment and tells Panam about Jackie Welles.
Once the Aldecaldos arrive at the train station and exit their vehicles, they go once more over the plan, and note that all that is necessary to put their plan in motion is to get the old freight train working again. Carol explains that in order to get the train operating, Panam and V will need to override authorization in the control tower.[N 6]
V helps Panam find the entrance to the control tower,[N 7] and together they make their way up to the control room.
Once up high in the tower, Carol tells Panam and V that they have to look for a punch card somewhere in the building in order to gain access to the locomotive's control panel. After finding the Punchcard in a cabinet, V returns to Panam to tell them they have found it, and Carol will instruct them to enter the card into the control panel's reader. After entering the card into the control panel, the locomotive will activate and start moving. Panam will have a heart-to-heart conversation with V, and asks them why they've decided to help her out.[N 8]
After talking with each other, Panam and V join the other Aldecaldos at the campfire near the junction. [N 9] The nomads talk with each other about their current situation and Scorpion, before going to bed.[N 10][N 11]
In the morning, Panam will wake up V and tells them to get in her vehicle, as the Aldecaldos are preparing to start their assault on the Militech convoy. After getting in the vehicle, the Aldecaldos and V ride alongside the locomotive to the railroad crossing on Highway 101 and intercept the convoy. After a firefight, the Aldecaldos manage to secure the Basilisk and escort the trucks back to the camp.[N 12]
Back in the camp, Panam is welcomed by an infuriated Saul, who give each other an earful. Afterwards, Panam instructs the other nomads to get to work on the Basilisk and talks with V, and tells them she will give them a call when she needs more help from them.[N 13]
Objectives:

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Not completely following the Manual of Style]
Johnny Silverhand, now in V's body, wakes up in an apartment at the West Wind Apartments in West Wind Estate, Pacifica as they try to get used to their new life. Before heading, he gathers his things and checks an automated text from the North Oak Columbarium, telling him to pay for their order within 24 hours before it'll be cancelled.[N 1]
If you did Knockin' on Heaven's Door following this ending:
Johnny picks up Rogue Amendiares's gun, Pride, off a shelf and apologizes for getting her killed.
Taking a Night City Bus Ticket, he says he's "Got a bit of time. Think I'll manage to swing by and visit you two.", mentioning that he'll ask Steve for a ride. After Johnny gets his bag and leaves the apartment, he visits a kid Johnny befriended named Steve Sanchez, calling him via his intercom as he comes out of his apartment to greet them (depending on your V's gender).
Johnny can ask about Steve's bruise on his eye, to which Steve responds that his dad beat him for not waking him up in time for work, to which Johnny can comfort them in either option, telling them it happens or offer to give them his alarm clock to him.
Johnny can also ask if they have been improving their skills, to which Steve sheepishly admits he's been botching them, to which you can tell him that he'll get it eventually, or that his technique doesn't matter and he'll find his own flow.
But primarily, Johnny can ask him for a ride to which he'll head out of the apartment. But outside, Henry Sanchez- Steve's Dad, gets mad at Steve for planning to going out on his own, and then attacks him for taking his car keys.
Johnny can tell him to leave Henry alone, play it cool and tell Henry that Steve's just going to be driving him and he'll be back in two hours, or respond aggressively, telling him he'd stay if Steve had a real home and a scumbag of a dad that didn't beat him. Either way, Henry lets you and Steve go and you can hear Henry complain to his friends about the "terrible influence" Johnny/V has had on Steve, to which they encourage him to beat him again next time if you stay close to him long enough.
On the car ride to Time Machine, Steve and Johnny talk about Kerry Eurodyne who shopped there one time, discussing about a rumor about Kerry using Johnny's death as a means to get to fame, to which Johnny retorts that "Can't do much about media vultures. Got shit for brains, 'specially the ones who cover music;" as well as complimenting Kerry's skills as a musician.
Steve talks about his dream for being a musician, to which Johnny can tell him that he'll need a backup plan so he doesn't get desperate, as well as that being a musician isn't the easiest gig, that hard work and practice are the start- but that it'll get harder and that he'll have to get used to the "critics, haters, non-stop pressure, batshit crazy lifestyle..", remarking that it can chew him up. Primarily, Johnny tells him that he's gotta start writing songs and practice, with Steve saying that he doesn't know what to write about. Johnny can tell him that he can write for the people, write with what you know about, or write the truth. Either way, he'll advise Henry that since he's still young, ideas will come as he can give himself enough time.
Arriving at Time Machine, Johnny and Steve get out as they check out the store for a guitar, asking the Owner for a "Six-string. Electric." She'll gesture to the nearby wall, to which you can scan three guitars- Anima Rebel, Ardor Session, and Noise Contagion- and Johnny can give his critiques on each of the three, pointing out flaws in the guitars. He tells the Owner that he's looking for "a real instrument", and is willing to pay "real money".
The Store Owner takes Johnny and Steve to the back, showcasing the newest guitars, with her pointing out the "vintage axes" in the back- a Deluze Orphean and Tenzor Paradize. You can ask about either of them, before picking one to test out and tune. He compliments V's playing style, saying that he never knew anyone who could play Silverhand so well and how he read that Silverhand was "..self-taught." and "Made up his own style." Surprised, he asks how V/Johnny can play so effectively, to which Johnny can either tell him that he is Johnny reborn, which Johnny can choose to explain or not tell him, or to tell him to devote his time and effort into practicing, and he can come up with his own style like Johnny.
Johnny offers Steve the guitar he chose, allowing him to strum a tune as he talked about Rockers being rebels and how they weren't afraid to speak their minds, saying that he tried it once with his dad, mentioning that it didn't end well. Johnny can tell him that being a real rebel means being authentic, or that it needs time to develop. After the conversation, Johnny heads back to the Store Owner and pays 5000‚Ç¨$ (Eurodollars/Eddies) for the guitar, before heading back to the car with Steve as they drive towards the Cemetery.
On the radio, you can hear about Yorinobu abandoning peace talks with Militech as they prepare for an impending war, with Steve asking Johnny if it's likely to happen, to which Johnny can tell him he doesn't care about it, or that there won't be another war.
Steve will talk about a friend of his who lives nearby, saying that he likes driving through the area, to which Johnny can tell him that the city feels alive and it feels like Frankenstein's Monster, and that it's nice to drive through, noting that he never had the time to sit back and appreciate the view as it slipped through his fingers. Steve asks if he's planning to write a song about it, but Johnny responds with a "maybe."
Steve can ask about Rogue's gun, complimenting it and mentioning his dad used to sell them, and following up and asked Johnny if he was planning to shoot anyone with it. Johnny can either respond "Not without a reason." or "It's a memento."
Arriving at the Columbarium, Johnny tells Steve to wait in the car while he pays 4000‚Ç¨$ at the Columbarium for two spots for the next 100 years- one for Rogue and one for V.
For V, Johnny put the Bullet Pendant in the container, saying that he can't hold onto it anymore, thanking him for everything, his epitaph reading "Dreamer".[N 2]
For Rogue, he put Pride in the container, saying that she'd still be Queen of the Afterlife if not for him, saying that "Yeah, we fuckin' got 'em.", and apologizing for dragging her into it and getting her killed, her epitaph reading "Queen of the Afterlife".
Leaving the Columbarium and meeting Steve outside, Johnny can take the cigarette out of Steve's hand, saying that he "Gave all that up. So should you.", saying that "It's bad for your body. Bad for your soul." Steve asks what now, to which Johnny can either respond that he can go home or that he's got a bus to catch, to which Steve asks about the friend Johnny visited, noting that he misses her. He responds saying that when his grandpa died, he missed him a lot.
Eventually, Johnny boards the bus and puts in his ticket, loading his bag as he takes a seat and the cinematic plays.
Sitting back before Johnny leaves, Steve urges the bus to stop, saying that Johnny left the guitar he bought. Johnny responds, saying that he can keep it. As the bus pulls away, Johnny takes off their shades as they look out the window and the bus begins to leave Night City once and for all.

Walkthrough:
V is instructed by El Capit√°n to visit the residence of Juliet Horrigan, one of his favorite netrunners. Juliet regularly provides him with stolen data from Zetatech, but she has not been heard from since her last heist two weeks ago. V's priority is retrieving Juliet's latest score, but the fixer is also a little concerned about why she went silent so abruptly.
The Horrigan residence has three entrances. Opening the front door requires a Technical Ability check, and opening the back door requires a Body check, but if you lack sufficient levels in both you can climb onto the front roof and enter through an open window into the upstairs bathroom. Once inside, investigate the first and second floors to find a locked safe, where Juliet's data shard is kept, and traces of something terrible that happened. Upon inspecting the safe, you will be prompted to search for the access key, and by this time there is only one place it could be: the basement. If you have checked the computer near the safe, you can access a surveillance camera in the basement that reveals Juliet has been killed by her sister, Rose Horrigan, who has fallen victim to cyberpsychosis.
Juliet's tragic fate can be surmised from the evidence throughout the house. Her sister Rose had implanted a large amount of cyberware for her job, but she was fired and moved in with Juliet and her husband, Cy. Over time, Rose fell ill and began exhibiting symptoms of cyberpsychosis. Juliet tried to cure her sister by giving her high-end painkillers and antipsychotics, but Rose required larger and larger doses to stay lucid. Juliet even consulted with Viktor Vektor, but Rose was too far gone to help and he could only suggest contacting MaxTac to take her in before she became a danger to everyone around her. After Rose broke Cy's arm, he left for the Sunset Motel for his own safety, but Juliet refused to go with him and continued to care for her sister. A month later, Rose became convinced that Juliet was poisoning her and stabbed her sister in the back.
Rose still wanders the basement of the house, where Juliet's body and the safe access key can be found. V's only option is to neutralize Rose. After retrieving the access key near Juliet's body, V returns to the safe, and opens it to recover the shard.
After V tells El Capit√°n what happened, he is saddened by Juliet's death, and shocked to learn that she had a sister.
Objectives:
Go to Juliet's home.
Look for the chip.
Find out what happened to Juliet. [Optional]
Find a way to open the safe.
Open the safe.
Deposit the datashard in the Drop Point.

Neutralize Rufus McBride.
Neutralize the remaining Wraiths.

After receiving more information from Oswald Forrest as to Evelyn Parker's location, head to Fingers' clinic on Jig-Jig Street. Before going there, V has the option to let Judy know. She will be waiting for V in front of Fingers' office whether V calls her or not.
V must find a way to get inside Fingers' office.[N 1] Once inside, V and Judy will talk to Fingers. Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
To unlock this side job, the player must have completed Push It to the Limit, which acts as the tutorial of sorts. This quest can be initiated upon encountering a random vehicle marked with a blue steering wheel icon (visible both in-game and on the minimap). If one does not enter the vehicle after a certain amount of time, or get far enough away, it will become unmarked as an objective, and one will need to wait for another vehicle to be marked.
The marked vehicle can either be parked and guarded by a handful of hostile guards, or already occupied and moving. In case of the latter, the player must find a way to stop the vehicle from moving or removing the occupants from the vehicle before they can take the vehicle for themselves.
There are three variants of missions available for this side job that can be encountered while exploring Night City:
The first variant will involve a simple delivery of the marked vehicle to the destination, however enemy vehicles will appear that will attempt to kill the player and block their progress. Players must either shake off their pursuers or eliminate them. To shake off the pursuers, players must escape the yellow marked area on the minimap without enemies following.
The second variant has no enemy pursuers but will provide an optional objective of bringing in the vehicle "in good condition", i.e. no parts missing or visibly broken.
The third variant has the initial marked vehicle be a modified Mizutani Shion "Blackbird", which is equipped with vehicle hacking gear. The player must drive the Blackbird to the actual marked target which will be moving and remain in vicinity of the target until the Blackbird's system can hack it to make the vehicle stop. The target vehicle can then be hijacked and then driven to the destination.
An optional objective can appear in all variants which tasks the player with delivering the vehicle within a set time limit, which will depend on the distance to the location, but range from 90 seconds to five and a half minutes. This time limit objective can also appear on its own.
Once the vehicle has reached its destination, V can leave the car, and then collect their rewards from a nearby marked container. The mission ends upon exiting the garage or parking space the vehicle was parked in.
The rewards the player can receive is dependent on their performance, mainly on the completion of optional objectives and the condition of the vehicle upon arrival, with the maximum Tier depending on the player's level. Rewards included are:
A single Autofixer's Discount Extravaganzzza ticket, which grants a discount on purchasing vehicles from AUTOFIXER terminals. Multiple tickets can be stacked with each other, allowing players to massively reduce the price of buying vehicles.
One or two Weapons depending on performance.
One or two Weapon Attachments.
A Money Shard.
A random Skill Shard (tier dependent on level).
A number of Crafting Materials.
A new vehicle becomes available for purchase each time this mission is completed.
Objectives:
Deliver the vehicle to the indicated location.
Neutralize or lose pursuing enemies.
Deliver the vehicle in good condition. [Optional]
Deliver the vehicle before time expires. [Optional]
Leave the car.
Collect your reward.
Leave the garage.

Go to the marked area by The Needle, and look for a teal and grey machine with a keypad on it. Enter the code "941229", which will open a small door with a duffel bag, where players can find the Rook handgun, a text log, and ‚Ç¨$ 8,000.
Note that players can access the cache beforehand by entering the code at the keypad, skipping this quest entirely.

Walkthrough:
Two years after accepting Solomon Reed's offer, in 2079, V wakes up from a medically induced coma in Edward Kernaghan Military Medical Center with Reed at their side. Reed explains to V that the operation to remove the relic was successful, but that due to the procedure V's brain became permanently damaged and unable to handle cyberware.
Solomon Reed proceeds to give V a job offer from the NUSA goverment, so that they can at least continue living, and allows V to reach out to their friends.
If V calls Viktor Vektor:
Viktor Vektor is happy to hear from V, and V shares their diagnosis with the ripper. Vik will say the doctors are wrong, and the merc should pay him a visit.
If V calls Judy √Ålvarez:
Judy √Ålvarez is surprised to hear from V but will admit her relief to know they're alive, also stating she won't be part of their next adventure as she is now living in Pittsburgh and married to a woman named Bianca.
If V romanced Judy:
Judy will also apologize to V and ask her not to try and ruin their marriage, effectively ending their relationship.
If V calls Panam Palmer:
Panam won't answer the call, and V leaves her a phone message. Mitch Anderson sends V a video message during the epilogue saying she doesn't want to talk to them, and that it would be best if V does not try to call her again. If V romanced her, the relationship is ended.
If V calls River Ward:
River Ward is angry at first, but gives V a chance to explain that they just woke up from two years of coma, after which River apologizes. After suggesting meeting up, River reveals that he sold everything he knew about the NCPD to Trauma Team to earn some money to pay for Randy's rehab, and as a consequence, he is now a wanted man. Ashamed of himself, he's unable to face V in person and ends the call. If romanced, the relationship is ended.
If V calls Kerry Eurodyne:
Kerry Eurodyne is happy to hear from V but is also busy and constantly interrupted during his call as he's at the Crystal Palace on a concert tour, admitting that he doesn't have time for V at the moment. If romanced, he promises to reunite with V once the tour is over in a few months.
Afterwards, V returns to Night City and takes a Delamain cab to Viktor's clinic (which is now a Zetatech franchise), having opportunities to talk with those two about what has changed in Night City. Viktor will also concur with the NUSA doctors, stating that V's motor cortex appears to have "turned deaf to implant signals".
After leaving Viktor's, V is accosted and beaten by a single street thug, a sad reminder of how weak they've become. Misty Olszewski arrives and helps V up. She shares that she is moving to Poland, and gives V advice on living as an average citizen. V can express various outlooks on their life and goals. In a cutscene, Misty leaves, and V fades into a crowd.
Objectives:

Go to the window.
Call your friends and decide who to visit.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìùReason: Requires a partial rewrite as there are some things incorrect
After speaking with Nancy Hartley's assistant Steven about her whereabouts, Johnny tells V to travel to the Totentanz.
When V arrives at the club, and after they travel to the third floor and go to the proper entrance to the club, the Maelstrom guards recognize V from an earlier job.
If V resolved The Pickup peacefully:
Dum Dum will come out of the entrance and lead V to Nancy, where she is meeting with Royce.
If V killed Royce and Dum Dum during The Pickup:
Patricia will come out of the entrance and lead V to Nancy. V has to fight the Maelstromers on their way out.
If Brick was freed during The Pickup:
Patricia will come out of the entrance and lead V to Nancy, where she is meeting with Brick.
Regardless of the outcome, V and Nancy are soon dismissed. Nancy leads V to her car, saying that V will have to come along with her to talk. While they walk to Nancy's car, and while driving, V convinces Nancy to join Kerry Eurodyne's gig for a Samurai reunion.
After V leaves Nancy, V is told to head to Denny's Mansion to meet with her and Henry. When they arrive, the gate will be locked, and the intercom will not be picked up, forcing V to trespass onto the property.
While looking for Denny and Henry, V comes upon a scene in Denny's backyard. Henry had driven a cement truck into Denny's yard and dumped cement into the pool, and the two are arguing about it. Kerry is standing to the side, and when V confronts Denny and Henry, they are forced to choose between the two for the gig, with the other being replaced. If V consults Johnny, he will not have a preference, saying that Denny is a control freak and Henry can't be trusted.
If V chooses Denny:
Henry will be angry about this, and will leave the property. Kerry tells Denny about Nancy joining the gig and leaves, ending the mission.
If V chooses Henry:
Henry claims that he has no problem with Denny joining them. Despite that, Denny dismisses the group. Kerry takes Denny to his car while telling him about Nancy joining the gig, and the mission ends.
Objectives:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Enter the Totentanz.
Talk to Maelstromers.
If V resolved The Pickup peacefully:

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite from V's perspective, use of {{Condition}}]
The task is to retrieve a video file from a warehouse that NCPD officer Aaron McCarlson claims is a Maelstrom torture den. The warehouse is guarded by a total of six gang members: three outside, and three inside. The computer holding the file is in a room on the second floor and can be reached either through an open hatch in the rooftop, or by entering through any of the building's doors and going up the stairs.
Before retrieving the file from the computer, V can view the video itself in the "FILES" tab (note: the file will be removed from the computer when you steal the data). It is a short, looping clip that shows Aaron murdering a woman in the alley behind the warehouse. Watching the video will cause Johnny Silverhand to react with disgust at Aaron's actions, and an optional objective will appear to tell Aaron that V knows what is on the video. Leave the premises once the file has been downloaded.
Now head to Aaron's apartment, which is on the second floor of a small apartment building just north of the Longshore North fast travel point. Interact with the "call" button to the left of the door to summon Aaron. If V managed to swipe the file without alerting any of the Maelstrom gang members, Aaron will compliment V on their skills. At this point, V can hand over the file and then exit the building to complete the gig. Regina will wire payment and mention that gaining Aaron's trust means she can take advantage of his NCPD connections.
If V informs Aaron about their knowledge of his deception, there is an extra decision to make. On the one hand, Aaron can be extorted to pay double the money, which concludes the contract successfully, but earns the scathing disapproval of Johnny. On the other hand, V can declare that they want Aaron to go to jail for his crime, which turns him hostile and forces V to fight him, delighting Johnny. If Aaron is killed, Regina will call to say that she understands why V took out Aaron, but criticizes it as a wasteful move since he wielded huge influence inside the NCPD and V had leverage over him. The client being dead also means neither Regina nor V get paid. Alternatively, if V manages to knock Aaron down without killing him, Regina will comment on the turn of events and will be pleased as she can now use Aaron, once he wakes up, as her asset inside the NCPD.
Objectives:
Get inside the warehouse.
Find the computer with the footage.
Retrieve the footage from warehouse.
Bring the footage to Aaron.
Tell Aaron you know what he did. [Optional]
Leave Aaron's building.

Walkthrough:
In order to unlock this ending, players are required to make specific choices at the end of Chippin' In. In order to succeed in this quest, reaching somewhere near maximum level is recommended before attempting.
On the rooftop towards the end of Nocturne Op55N1, V needs to be indecisive in making a decision on who to call for help. After about five minutes of doing nothing and simply leaving the dialog choice open, Johnny will comment that it is tough to decide who "will die for you", and proposes they enter Arasaka Tower alone‚Äïmaking this a suicide mission. This echoes Dexter DeShawn's question in the beginning:
"Would you rather live in peace as Mr. Nobody... or go down for all times in a blaze of glory?"
Two factors make this mission uniquely difficult:
Saving is not allowed throughout the entire mission. However, the game still autosaves at checkpoints, the first being at the start of the mission, the second after descending to the mainframe level, and the third immediately before the confrontation with Adam Smasher.
V's max Health will be lowered by 25% at the start of the mission, and gradually decreases by an additional 1% at certain intervals, indicated by the "Relic Malfunction Detected" notification. The longer it takes to complete the mission, the harder it gets to survive.
A level in the mid-40s or higher as well as good equipment is therefore advisable.
Dying at any point will result in a credit roll, which will prompt video messages identical to the "easy way out"/suicide ending. Although the game will not offer to "load last save" and cut to credits instantly, it can be resumed from the autosave points mentioned above.
Choosing Johnny's "suicide run" option will result in an immediate cut right to the front entrance of Arasaka Tower. In the entrance area, V will have to fight two Arasaka Samurais and three Arasaka Special Agents who are all at maximum level. After defeating the guards along with two Arasaka mechs, Johnny leads V to the elevator for which an access token is needed. More guards will spawn and they will have to be defeated in order for the token to be looted. As V obtains the access token, they will have to call for the lift, which will only arrive after a significant amount of time, leaving V in the lobby having to defend against guards that will spawn from time to time, including Juggernauts - their Mk.31 HMGs will prove very useful, and by the time you run out of ammo, another juggernaut will have appeared. It is advisable to retreat to the entrance area and fight the guards from there as they will enter the elevator area from two sides. Using a wall-penetrating Tech Sniper Rifle like the Tsunami Nekomata can make the fights here and throughout the mission decisively easier. Enter the elevator immediately after the door opens, and select the Netrunner floor. Another Mech will spawn in front of the elevator before its doors close. The Short Circuit quickhack is a good way to quickly and effectively deal with the Mechs throughout this mission.
There are very few advantageous locations from which to fight multiple enemies after reaching the elevator. It is advised to bring the best guns and armor and stock up on ammo and meds before proceeding, but these can also be crafted between combat (and in the elevator). Enemies spawn as V reaches certain checkpoints, and therefore it is difficult to hide and pick them off. Your final enemy will be Adam Smasher, who will summon reinforcements at preset points during the fight: 6 Arasaka Snipers appear on the balcony around the room and three Juggernauts on the ground level.
Once Alt is successfully uploaded to the access point and is connected to Mikoshi, she will offer V a choice to either give their body to Johnny, or to keep it. Choosing Johnny results in the New Dawn Fades (Temperance) ending, whereas choosing V will result in the Path of Glory (The Sun) ending, albeit modified by the fact that Rogue is still alive in both.
Objectives:
Find a way to the level with Mikoshi.
Defeat all enemies in the lobby.
Gain access to the elevators.
Defeat all enemies in the lobby.
Loot the access token.
Take the elevator to Mikoshi.
Find the Mikoshi Acess Point.
Defeat all the enemies in the control room.
Find a way to connect Alt to the mainframe.
Defeat all enemies in the mainframe room.
Expose the mainframe.
Connect Alt to the mainframe.
Defeat Adam Smasher.
(Optional) Decide Adam Smasher's fate.
Enter the well to return your body.
Cross the bridge and enter Cyberspace forever (Optional).

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Unlike most of the other cyberpsychos, this one is a netrunner and as such, she'll turn on two turrets near the bodies in the back of the camp while she sneaks up from behind at the camp's entrance. She'll also be harder to quickhack so unless you have a full skill tree to make it easier, you'll need to focus more on traditional melee or gun tactics here.
Objectives:
Find the cyberpsycho.
Neutralize the threat.
Search the area to collect information.
Read the shard "Archived Conversation: Tamara Cosby and Tony Ludic".
Message Regina about Cyberpsycho Sighting: Under The Bridge.

Walkthrough:
Shortly after V and Panam Palmer rescued Saul Bright from the Wraiths Camp, the other Aldecaldos‚ÄîCassidy, Carol, and Teddy‚Äîwent into Night City to deliver cyberware to a group of Scavengers.
Upon approaching the location at an industrial complex on Martin Luther King Boulevard and Valley street in Arroyo, Santo Domingo, V is stopped by Aldecaldo Taco and informed about the situation.
Intent on helping the Aldecaldos, V goes to see what is going on and interrupts the conversation between the Aldecaldos and the leader of the Scavengers, who is complaining that the delivery of cyberware was three days later than intended. The Aldecaldos reason that this was due to the dust storm that passed a few days ago.
As V talks with them, the Scavenger leader will agree to a percentage cut, but realizes that V participated in shooting up the Scavenger Den. With sufficient Body, you can intimidate the scavengers to resolve the deal peacefully and pay the Aldecaldos. Otherwise a gunfight will break out; Carol will be displeased by this outcome.
If V has high a enough Body attribute:
V was able to intimidate the Scavengers and have them make the deal with the Aldecaldos. The Aldecaldos thank V for their help before returning to the Mobile Camp.
If V started a fight:
A gunfight broke out during the conversation, causing the Scavengers to engage V and the Aldecaldos. After the gunfight, Carol will be angry with V, but Cassidiy will reason with her. The Aldecaldos thank V for helping before returning to the Mobile Camp.
Objectives:
See what's going on.
If a gunfight breaks out:
Neutralize the Scavengers.
Talk to Carol.
If V is able to intimidate the Scavengers:

Help the nomads negotiate a deal.
Talk to Carol.
Notes[]
If V is male and initiated this side job before Queen of the Highway, Cassidy will write him a text message concerning Panam some time after completing the job.[1]
V can covertly kill the entire Scavenger team except Roman before the negotiation dialogue has even ended. The leader will act as if they are still alive.
Taco and his twin brother Jeff can be approached at the Mobile Camp after this job, where they will both thank V for their help.
If With a Little Help from My Friends is started while Gun Music is available but not yet started, Gun Music will temporarily disappear until the former is completed.

‚Üë Cassidy Righter#Notes

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Write from V's perspective]
Approach[]
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Two of Placide's sentries can be found near the Grand Imperial Mall standing by an old vehicle. Upon speaking to them they will direct V to enter the mall via the garage.
The Garage[]
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
There are about three Animals enemies standing directly in the garage entryway and a further five further inside the entry way, two of which will leave the complex and the other three are grouped together in the left corner. In order to avoid the first three, head down the right hand side of the ramp, hop over the low wall bordering the ramp, and then keep as close as possible to the building until reaching the first two on the motorcycles, then wait for them to depart then simply walk along the right wall to avoid being seen by the group of three on the left.
The Atrium[]
Placide will warn V before entering the atrium.
The atrium is a large open space on the lower level, with a gallery surrounding it on the upper level. There are around six Animals in the gallery, and 12-18 more on the lower floor, along with a turret.
Enter the atrium in one corner of the gallery. The van, which is the objective, is parked roughly in the middle of the far side, on the lower floor. Immediately in front of V upon entering are a pair of escalators down to the lower floor.
This takes V to a side room on the lower level. If V exit this side room V will soon reach another side room which can be entered. In this room is a server which is connected by a thick cable to the van, which is parked just outside another entrance to this room.
There are three Animals standing immediately outside this second entrance by the van, who are on high alert.
Move around this room to the corner immediately behind this van. Through a glass window here, one can see the left hand side of the van where V need to jack in, but no way was found of breaking the glass in this window without attracting attention.
The Van[]
When jacking into the computer system in the van, V will discover that the NetWatch netrunner is in the cinema on the upper level. Unfortunately, this will also make him aware of V's presence.
The Cinema[]
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
V proceeds up to the cinema. If V fought in the atrium, Placide will open a route to it. Following this route, there is one opponent at the top of the escalator going up, Then go round a corner to the movie theater entrance where Sasquatch is keeping guard.
If an alert had been triggered or V are detected by an Animal in the Grand Imperial Mall before, the Netrunner will have preemptively shut the gates to the movie theater and Sasquatch will be waiting for V. Sasquatch will attempt to rush at them and attack with her signature hammer, her attacks are powerful but slow, and will take several seconds between each swing.
However, if V remained undetected throughout the GIM, the gates to the movie theater remain open and it is possible to sneak past Sasquatch without a fight. Being detected by her causes the gates to automatically close and the fight will proceed normally.
While V are fighting with Sasquatch, the Netrunner is trying to spike V's brain and kill them, but with Placide's help, he cannot kill V immediately. V should defeat Sasquatch quickly before the Netrunner manages to kill them. The weakness of Sasquatch is a shining implant on her back, once V destroy the implant, she will get hurt significantly and can no longer recover her health level.
Once Sasquatch is defeated, V finds the NetWatch netrunner Bryce Mosley, in the projection room. He will tell V that the Voodoo Boys are planning to double-cross V. One can choose either to side with him and have the virus removed (and thus prevent the breach of the Blackwall) or knock him out, in which case the virus that Placide uploaded to V earlier will wipe out many Netwatch facilities across the continent, and attempt to kill V as well.
Back to Batty's Hotel[]
After exiting the Mall, Placide's sentries will be waiting outside. They will be shocked to see that V have survived, and nervously offer to take V back to Placide, which can be accepted or declined.
Once in Batty's Hotel, talk to Placide and Brigitte.
Objectives:
Leave Batty's Hotel.
Meet with Placide's people.
Enter the mall.
Find the van in the lobby.
Reach the van.
Deal with the enemies near the van (if hostile approach).
Connect to the van.
Talk to Placide.
Find the agent in the cinema.
Deal with Sasquatch (optional if sneaking).
Confront the agent.
If V knocked Bryce Mosley out:
Jack into the agent.

Talk to the agent.
Take the shard.
Talk to Johnny (if not making a deal with the agent).
Leave the Grand Imperial Mall.
Talk to Placide.
Head to Batty's Hotel.
Get into the back seat. [Optional]
Talk to the guards (if ride not taken).
Meet with Placide in Batty's Hotel.
Talk to Placide.
Talk to Brigitte.
Notes[]
During the dialogue between Brigitte and Placide, they conclude if V is a "ranyon"[1] or not[2], based on the scans Placide did on V.
The dialogue depends on whether or not V accepted the deal with the NetWatch agent. If so, Placide will call V a "normal, filthy ranyon"; otherwise, Brigitte will defend V as being "no ranyon".
"Ranyon" is Haitian Creole for "rag" or "floor rag", as the agent says, meaning "useful disposable outsider".
Trivia[]
The title of the job comes from the Johnny Cash song, I Walk the Line.
The movie projected on the screen in the cinema where V confront the NetWatch agent is One-Eyed Jacks, a western from 1961.
References[]


‚Üë Placide: "I know. I scanned him/her. Only a normal, filthy ranyon."/"He/She is ranyon. Nothing special. V see de scans."

‚Üë Placide: "But V saw--" Brigitte: "Yes. But I also saw his/her scans. He/She is no ranyon."

Walkthrough:
This gig requires you to enter a club called Empathy, which has a whole lot of Animals around the place. If you enter through the main scanner (to the left after walking in the front door), one of the guards will stop you, telling you to check your weapons in the container. If you want to avoid a fight in the entire club (which is one of the optional objectives in this mission), you have to deposit your weapons. Alternatively, you can enter through a door to the right of the entrance room, navigating through a set of private backrooms with several hackable computers before entering the club proper without relinquishing your weapons.
Once you are in the club proper, head through until you reach an area called "Private", which leads upstairs to the computer room where you need to go to upload the malware. You will need to sneak past one of the Animals guards on duty, and you do not want to let him spot you. Sneak up to the computer room beyond, and you will see another Animals guard with his back turned to you. Either take him out however you wish and stuff his body in the nearby container, or just upload the malware.
Once you've uploaded the malware, it's time to delta out of there. You can do this in one of two ways. You can either retrace your steps and head back the way you came, collecting your weapons before you go, or you can slip out the back door of the computer room where you can drop into the lot below. This will fulfill the "Leave the club" objective, after which you can circle around the building before heading back into the entrance and retrieving your gear again. Once that's done, all you need to do is head for the drop point to complete the gig.
Objectives:
Enter the "Empathy" club.
Deposit your weapons [Optional]
Avoid getting into combat. [Optional]
Find the subnet's main computer.
Upload the virus to the club's server.
Leave the club.
Retrieve your weapons [if you deposited them earlier]
Collect your reward from the Drop Point.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìùReason: Rewrite from V's perspective
After completing Ghost Town and reaching 40 Street Cred, an undiscovered quest will appear some time after on your map, in the same tunnels where Nash's Raffen Shiv hideout was. The quest starts automatically once you visit the location, where you come across an odd sight: among the darkness and crags of the unfinished tunnel, in an old shipping container, is a jet black Rayfield Caliburn "Murkmobile", along with several containers and amenities that imply someone set up shop here or at least intended to do so. A quick search in a nearby container reveals the story. A young man, orphaned by the murder of his parents, resolved himself to become a vigilante, a creature of the night dedicated to fighting the darkness of the city from within the darkness: Murk Man. Unfortunately, Murk Man seems to have abandoned his hideout or, possibly, was killed by the very criminals he had hoped to fight. Still, every vigilante needs a nice ride--hence the Caliburn. And if Murk Man isn't around to make good use of it, you may as well in his stead.
Objectives:
Search the container.
Get in the car.

Walkthrough:
After agreeing to help Delamain track down his lost vehicles, V is able to encounter one on Eisenhower street in Northside, Watson.
As V approaches the street, they are contacted by Delamain, telling them that the location information for this divergent Delamain has been corrupted. After some investigation, V is able to find them in a small storage facility near the intersection of Eisenhower and Longshore North street.
However, as V approaches the divergent Delamain, V is called by the Delamain cab and tells them to stop and go away, as the seemingly scared Delamain speeds off at the sight of V.
As V follows the cab across the Northside sub-district, it eventually crashes into a small shack and come to standstill, which allows the main Delamain to take control back of the vehicle.
V is contacted by Delamain and is given a share of their payment as a reward.
Objectives:
Find the Delamain cab in Northside.
Find the hidden Delamain cab.
Follow the Delamain cab until it stops.
Wait for Delamain to call.
Talk to Delamain.

Walkthrough:
After agreeing to help Delamain track down his lost vehicles, V is able to encounter one on the intersection of Hanford and McBride street in The Glen, Heywood. After getting close enough, the divergent Delamain will call V, who asks them if they have come to finish the Delamain off. As V tells them they are just there to reset them, the Delamain attempts to commit suicide by attempting to drive off the viewpoint.
After the attempt, V explains to them at that they are not there to hurt them, and instead want to help them, and is able to talk them down and make them return to the Delamain Corp Headquarters.[Notes 1]
After getting out, V is called by Delamain and is paid a share of their free for recovering a divergent Delamain.
Objectives:
Find the Delamain cab in the Glen.
Approach the Delamain cab.
Stay within signal range.
Wait for Delamain to call.
Talk to Delamain.

Walkthrough:
On Waldrop street, near the MedCenter in Little China, Watson, V encounters several Maelstrom members; 2 Goons, 1 Scout, and 1 Maniac.
The Maelstromers are surrounding a derelict vehicle with a cache in its trunk, that contains a shard that can be read. The shard contains the coordinates to an offshore cargo cache.
If V follows the coordinates to California Ave in Little China, they can find the already unlocked sunken cache containing a coat and a body-presumably that of Mike-just off the docks, close to the rear of the Konpeki Plaza hotel.
Objectives:
Go to the given coordinates.
Search the sunken cargo.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
After V spoke with Dexter DeShawn, they were sent to Lizzie's Bar on the corner of Kennedy Avenue and Sutter Street to get in touch with the client, Evelyn Parker.
Once inside the bar‚Äîbetween 6:00 PM and 6:00 AM‚ÄîV approaches the bar and asks the bartender, Mateo Thiago, about Evelyn's whereabouts. As V approaches the bar, Evelyn is sitting on a barstool with Judy leaning next to her, but V doesn't know who they are yet. Mateo refuses to provide any information, and Judy leaves offscreen during that conversation. Evelyn, who was awaiting V's arrival, interrupts their conversation, and introduces herself to V as Mateo pours a drink for them. Evelyn will proceed to ask V to follow her to a more secluded VIP room.
In the VIP room, Evelyn briefly interrogates V about their relationship with Dexter DeShawn, after which she explains her unique gig and its attached strings. Evelyn tells V that the Arasaka biochip called the Relic is in a secure location inside Konpeki Plaza in penthouse. The penthouse is occupied by Saburo Arasaka's son and heir Yorinobu Arasaka, who recently arrived in Night City. Evelyn proceeds to explain that Yorinobu stole the biochip from an Arasaka laboratory, and intends to make a deal with NetWatch in order to sell it. Evelyn reveals that she has scrolled a braindance of Yorinobu's penthouse while she was there as Yorinobu's personal joytoy, as V and Evelyn move further inside Lizzie's Bar towards the workshop. While heading down to the basement, Evelyn tells V about Judy √Ålvarez and warns V to behave themselves.
Once in Judy's workshop, Evelyn introduces V to Judy, who was just finishing up compiling the Konpeki Plaza braindance. If V has high enough Technical Ability, they can have a short side conversation about Judy's tech setup before Evelyn interrupts. Judy instructs V to sit down in the chair nearby, after which she places the Braindance Wreath on V. Judy returns to her desk to calibrate V's sensory profile and then prepares V for the calibration braindance.
During the calibration braindance, V re-experiences the last minutes of a low-life Scavenger that robbed a Cali Express. The Scavenger was shot and killed by his compatriot, upon which the braindance ends and calibration finishes.
Having exited the calibration braindance, V needs a moment to catch their breath and is unsure if they want to continue. Evelyn reminds them of the importance of the next braindance and that it's crucial for the gig. Convinced by Evelyn's words, V tells Judy that they need to involve the Netrunner T-Bug as well, so that she can study the security of Konpeki Plaza.
Judy resists allowing T-Bug to link in, but Evelyn convinces her to allow it, reassuring Judy that she'd never let harm come to her. T-Bug and V navigate the braindance of Yorinobu's suite, where they identify high-tech security systems and a temperature-controlled vault that contains the Relic. T-Bug is sure that she can override the security systems, and she points out the gun that Yorinobu keeps in the suite, saying that V should keep it in mind.
After V exits the braindance, Judy scrubs V's profile from her system. She's worried that Evelyn and V will get killed, and that if Arasaka finds out about the braindance, they'll kill everyone involved. V and Evelyn reassure Judy, and then Judy tells V to keep the braindance wreath. Before leaving Judy's workshop, V can optionally have a brief conversation with Judy to thank her or express interest in seeing her again.
Before V leaves the basement, Evelyn wants to talk, and V can ask several probing questions about the job and Evelyn's relationship with Yorinobu. Evelyn then asks V to do the job just for her, without including Dex. V protests that hazing Dex will ruin them, but Evelyn dismisses the concern. V can refuse or say that they'll think about it. Evelyn says that she needs to talk Judy, and V is directed to leave Lizzie's.
Objectives:
Go to Lizzie's Bar between 6:00 PM and 6:00 AM.
Talk to the bouncers.
Sit at the bar and ask about Evelyn.
Follow Evelyn to the VIP room.
Enter the VIP room.
Sit.
Talk to Evelyn.
Follow Evelyn.
Talk to Judy.
Sit.
Look at Judy.
Talk to Judy.
If V decides to dive into the tutorial braindance:
Rewind to the beginning.
Fast forward.
Reset the recording.
Play the recording until you spot the gun.
Scan and inspect the gun.
Switch to the audio layer.
Scan the audio source and listen.
Switch to the visual layer.
Fast forward to where the customer is hit.
Scan and inspect the hurt customer.
Fast forward to where the robber is shot.
Rewind until the CCTV screen appears.
Scan the CCTV screen.
Exit the braindance.

Unpause the recording and watch the scene.
Follow Judy's instructions.
Examine the braindance in Analysis Mode to find the Relic.
Scan the apartment's security systems. [Optional]
Watch the whole recording from Evelyn's point of view. [Optional]
In the audio layer, scan Yorinobu's phone as he talks.
Listen in on Yorinobu.
In the visual layer, scan Yorinobu's datapad while it's turned on.
Scan for thermal clues to find the Relic.
Exit the braindance when you're ready.
Talk to Evelyn.
Leave Judy's workshop.
Call Dex.
Talk to Dex.
Notes[]
The robbed shop featured in the calibration braindance is a Cali Express located in The Glen. It is the food vendor found between fast travel points Ventura & Skyline and Metro: Glen South. Speaking to the vendor will give V the option to comment on the smell of chlorine, to which the vendor will reply about having to clean up "[a] few stains that wouldn't come out", referencing the robbery and murder seen on the braindance.
Trivia[]
The Information is a 1998 song by Course of Empire, from the soundtrack of the film, Dark City.

Walkthrough: Towards the end of The Rescue, V receives a phone call from T-Bug instructing them to visit Yoko's netrunner store in Kabuki Roundabout, where they can obtain a free Ping quickhack.
Objectives:
Retrieve the Ping quickhack from the netrunner.
Equip the Ping quickhack in your inventory.
Upload Ping to the camera to find the Access Point.
Use your personal link to connect to the Access Point and hack it.

Walkthrough:
The different Aldecaldos V must talk with to complete the optional objective "Talk to the nomads" are:
Dakota Smith (having a free weapons give-away in the center of the camp)
Saul Bright (in front of the terminal truck)
Bob Sagan, Carol Emeka and Teddy Simos (sitting at a table towards the west end of the camp)
After ending the conversation and getting up, stay and wait for the three to finish talking among them, or it will not be counted towards the objective.
Cassidy Righter (shooting at empty bottles at the southeast end of the camp)
V can join Cassidy's target practice; hitting 12 or more bottles prompts him to offer V his revolver, Amnesty. It is advisable to crouch and aim before Cassidy gives the go.
If their respective missions were successfully completed, additional characters can be found around the camp and need to be talked to for the optional objective (other than Jake, their respective dialogs are the same as before this mission):
Jake Scooter from Fortunate Son (playing guitar on a couch by the large camp fire; see also Trivia)
Benedict McAdams from Gig: MIA (leaning by the stairs up the food truck)
Bruce Welby from Gig: Goodbye, Night City (sitting on a chair outside the weapon's dealer tent)
Anna Hamill from Gig: Woman of La Mancha (leaning by the water truck at the western edge of the camp only if V is a Nomad and convinced her to join a clan)
On top of that, several unnamed Aldecaldos deliver unique wild lines when approached, but do not count towards the mission objective.
Objectives:
Follow Mitch
Talk to Saul
(Optional) Talk to Mitch
Talk to Dakota
Get in the tub
Talk to Saul
(Optional) Talk to the nomads
(Optional) Talk to Mitch
Talk to Panam
Join Panam when you're ready

Neutralize all enemies.
Neutralize Anton Kolev
Neutralize the remaining Scavengers and Wraiths.

Walkthrough:
V is contracted to assassinate Gustavo Orta, a high-ranking Valentino, after his girlfriend Martha Frakes, the daughter of 6th Street member Nolan Frakes, was shot and put into a coma. Nolan blamed Gustavo and reached out to Padre to exact justice for his daughter. At Gustavo's apartment building, take the elevator to the 32nd floor. The hallway area outside Gustavo's apartment has some points of interest. First is a neutral surveillance camera that is linked to two more cameras inside Gustavo's apartment, which should be helpful for stealthy netrunners to scope out the interior. Second is a utility closet that can be unlocked with 9 Technical Ability to reveal a small trove of loot. Third is the entrance to Gustavo's apartment, which can only be opened with 17 Body or by quickhacking the keypad to the door's left; be warned that prying open the door will instantly alert all of the apartment's occupants. Lastly is a large shutter that opens onto a narrow catwalk outside the building, from which V can reach the lower and upper balconies of the apartment.
To carry out the hit, reach Gustavo Orta in his office on the apartment's second floor. Gustavo can either be killed or incapacitated and carried to a car waiting outside to complete the gig.
Alternatively, the gig can be completed nonviolently, either by jumping onto the upper balcony and sneaking into Gustavo's office, or by ringing the doorbell and answering correctly with the Streetkid (Lifepath) (the guard opening the door for V will point out that Gustavo is upstairs). If V has not harmed anyone in the apartment or been noticed, Gustavo will engage V in conversation and explain the circumstances of Martha's injury. Martha disliked her father and ran away from him to be with Gustavo. Later, Gustavo's car was ambushed by 6th Street when he was with Martha. During the ensuing shootout, Gustavo survived unscathed, but Martha was caught in the crossfire. Nolan did not truly care about his daughter, but hated Gustavo for taking her from him and used her injury as justification to have Gustavo killed. V can choose to spare Gustavo by telling him to leave Night City. He is reluctant to abandon Martha, but agrees to go when V points out that Martha will never be safe as long as she is together with him. He gives V safe passage out of his apartment (If V attempts to read any computers or hack any access points in the apartment while being watched by Gustavo and or his henchmen, they will turn hostile. However, if V hacks an access point unnoticed, they will not turn hostile). Exit the building and head to the dropbox to receive payment. Padre then calls to inform V that Gustavo committed suicide, but he assumes that V somehow made Gustavo do it and is impressed by the feat. V can then return to Gustavo's apartment to loot his body for a note and other items.
Objectives:
Go to Gustavo's apartment.
Go to the 32nd floor.
Go to Gustavo's apartment.
Find Gustavo.
Neutralize Gustavo.
Leave the apartment complex with Gustavo's body.
Put Gustavo in the trunk.
If V listens to Gustavo's side:
Convince Gustavo to leave Night City. (Optional)
Leave the apartment complex.

Neutralize all enemies.
Neutralize Denzel Cryer.
Neutralize Jesse Sabara.
Neutralize the remaining Animals.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: none given]
In an alleyway, close to the Cherry Blossom Market in Japantown, you find some Scavengers causing trouble. They appear to have had some run-in with Tyger Claws member Jacob Ostapchuk. After clearing the Cur and two Hooligans, you can loot a shard from Jacob's body titled "Archived Conversation: Jacob Ostapchuk and Peter Golus".
While reading the shard, you will uncover the location of the drug dealer's stash as he sent them by accident. Head to the parking garage on Raymond Street, where you will encounter 5 Tyger Claws. After dealing with them, you can loot the locker inside the garage box and complete the NCPD Scanner Hustle.
Objectives:
Go to the dealer's stash.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Walkthrough needs to be rewritten from V's perspective, removal of bullet points and pseudo-headers]
Search for Songbird
From the hole in the wall, head down to the crashed MaxTac truck. Searching the truck reveals traces of the Blackwall, which acts as a trail to Songbird. To continue following the traces, V will need to force open two sealed gates (20 Body Attribute check) or bypass them by finding a floor exit panel and swimming through flooded passageways. V can briefly chat with Johnny Silverhand before plunging down a deep shaft. Exit the water, and continue following the Blackwall traces until V reaches a room with a terminal and Cynosure logo, marking the outskirts of the Cynosure Facility. Jack in to trigger a conversation with Reed. Johnny will add some comments based on whether the player has completed Shot by Both Sides or not. Songbird will cut off communication before talking with V as well.
Descend Deeper into the Cynosure Facility
Use the elevator to descend further down. Songbird will sever communication with Johnny, leaving V to continue alone. Proceed through the facility until V sees a "memory" of Songbird talking with Hansen, followed by a brief conversation with Songbird. Next to the terminal where the two are speaking, you can find a Site Map of the facility, which can be toggled like the dossiers in Firestarter. Afterwards, V must force open a door (Body Attribute check).
Bypass the Lockdown
Continue onward until you see Songbird, standing just past the gateway to a new area. If approached, Songbird will close the entry gate and initiate a lockdown protocol preventing V from reaching her. To continue, V must deactivate the lockdown by disabling data terminals Alpha and Bravo.
Disable Alpha: Enter the Server Room with a Body Attribute check to force open the closed shutters. Then, jack into terminal Alpha using your personal link and complete a Breach Protocol.
Disable Bravo: After disabling Alpha, the floor exit gate in this room will open. Drop down and proceed until you take a ladder up to terminal Bravo. Once again, jack in with your personal link. Songbird will prevent your hacking attempts, but scanning the terminal will reveal power cables. Crawl under the terminal to unplug and disable Bravo.
Escape Cerberus
As V crawls from under Bravo, a ceiling grate will fall onto V, followed by a Militech Cerberus controlled by Songbird. Remove the grate, then watch a brief scripted sequence before regaining control of V. Run away from Cerberus into the only open room. On the left is an open floor exit panel V can use to hide. Drop through the opening, then continue until you reach a ladder that takes V to the Living Quarters. Another copy of the Site Map can be found on a bed. The next room has another "memory" of Songbird undergoing surgery by the FIA.
Failing to remove the grate in time or getting caught by Cerberus will result in a game over.
Before dropping down the floor exit, another Site Map shard can be found by the computers.
Cerberus will now hunt V throughout Cynosure. Use the Gameplay Tips below for help surviving.
Reach Engineering and Disable Sierra
V's next destination is Engineering. Either exit through the door directly across from Engineering with a Body Attribute check, or exit through the doors across from Administration, go right then right again at the hallway intersection. Enter Engineering, and to V's right is the room housing terminal Sierra. To disable, jack in with V's personal link and complete a Breach Protocol. This will alert Cerberus to V's location; once it is safe, leave Engineering and move on to the next terminal.
Reach Security and Disable Victor
V's next destination is Security. Exit Engineering, go right until the hallways intersect, then right again towards the Sector 3 gate. Security will be the second door on the left. This first room has a Site Map shard, and the second has an area V can use to hide on the left. Continue to the final room with terminal Victor. To disable, jack in with V's personal link and complete a Breach Protocol. As you leave Security, V will see another "memory" of Songbird standing after her surgery. Now on to the gate.
Obtain Erebus Crafting Specs (Optional)
Across from the entrance to Engineering is Maintenance, but the door panel is disabled. Turn left, enter the Storage Area, and head to the back room. On the wall is a Distribution Box V can rewire using their Technical Ability, powering the door panel. Return to the door panel and enter Maintenance; the Erebus crafting specs will be directly ahead. V can leave through the doors, or take the ladders up to the ceiling vents. Heading through the vent lets V can drop down into Section 3, just past the gate.
Exiting via the vents will lock V out of the previous area but also bypasses disabling Sierra and Victor.
Open the Gate and Proceed to Sector 3
Interact with the terminal and wait for the gate to unseal. Head into Section 3, and soon V will need to run from Cerberus. Flee down the only path forward until V reaches an airlock door. Enter then close the door behind V, and wait for the airlock to cycle. Once V can continue, proceed to the next airlock and another "memory" of Myers and Songbird taking the oath. Leave once the airlock cycles and continue following the Blackwall traces to Core Control.
Shutdown the Core
Talk with Songbird, then interact with the terminal and initiate a shutdown of the core. Three subsystems remain online and require manual shutdown. Turn around to leave and see another "memory" of Reed talking with Songbird. Next, head into Labs.
Neural Network: Enter Labs, and the Neural Network Room is to V's left, with the entrance across from another "memory" of Songbird. Once inside, find and unplug 3 cables connected to the subsystem. Cerberus will arrive and resume hunting V.
Datafront Central Command: Instead of heading left, head forward and enter the Observation Room. To the left is the door to the 1st room of Datafront Central Command, followed by the 2nd room and 3rd room. V will need to destroy 6 firewall devices to disable the subsystem. 2 are located in the 1st room and 4 are in the 3rd. Each time you destroy a firewall device Cerberus will come down from one of three vents and hunt V. The three vents are located in the 1st and 3rd room, and one outside of the Datafront Central Command entrance.
Thermic Control: Enter the Observation Room. Head forward and enter Thermic Control. Either directly hack the terminal with a high Intelligence check, or scan the terminal to track the cables to an electrical panel. Open the nearby shutters, then climb out and override the electrical panel disabling the subsystem. Climb back in and see another "memory" of Reed and Songbird.
Experimental Prototyping room: this area, near the neural network and observation rooms, Intelligence or by entering the code 714212. Inside, you can find blueprints for the Militech Canto cyberdeck.
Enter the Core
Evade Cerberus as you make your way back to Core Control. There is one more "memory" in the Observation Room. Upon reaching Core Control, interact with the terminal to trigger a scripted sequence and the conclusion. Retrieve the Behavioral system component from the fallen Cerberus. All that remains is to finish talking with Songbird and then decide her fate in Leave in Silence.
Objectives:
Investigate the area.
Find the MaxTac transport truck.
Look for Songbird in the truck.
Follow traces of the Blackwall left by Songbird.
Gain access to the sealed-off area.
Talk to Johnny.
Jump down the shaft.
Get out of the water.
Talk to Reed.
Find a terminal.
Talk to Songbird.
Follow the Blackwall traces.
Take the elevator.
Talk to Johnny. (Optional)
Find a way around the gate.
Listen to the conversation.
Talk to Songbird.
Locate dataterminals Alpha and Bravo.
Use the computer to disable dataterminal Alpha.
Use your personal link to breach dataterminal Alpha.
Go to the room containing dataterminal Bravo.
Use the teminal to disable dataterminal Bravo.
Scan for a way to destroy dataterminal Bravo.
Crawl under dataterminal Bravo to manually disable it.
Disable dataterminal Bravo manually.
Hide from the robot.
Find dataterminal Sierra.
Use your personal link to breach dataterminal Sierra.
Find dataterminal Victor.
Use your personal link to breach dataterminal Victor.
Bring back power to the control panel near the maintenance room.
Open the door to the maintenance room
If V breaches all four dataterminals:
Return to the sealed gate.
Use the terminal to open the gate to Sector 3.
Go through the gate to Sector 3.
Follow the Blackwall traces.
Outrun your pursuer across the bridge.
Find a place to hide.
Open the airlock doors.
Enter the airlock.
Close the airlock door behind you.
Pick up Songbird's trail deeper within the facility.
Follow traces left by Songbird.
Talk to Songbird.
Use the terminal to access the core's controls.
Find the neural network room.
Use the terminal to check the subsystem's status.
Unplug the cables from the neural network system. (0/3)
Find the thermic control room.
Use your personal link to breach the thermic control terminal.
Find another way to shut down the thermic control system.
Find the datafort central command room.
Use the terminal to check the subsystem's status.
Scan the firewall device. (Optional)
Destroy the firewall device to disable the subsystem. (2/6)
Return to the core control room.
Hide from the robot until it leaves the room.
Use the computer.
Enter the core.
Check Songbird's vitals.

Walkthrough:
After talking with Takemura at Tom's Diner on Urmland Street, you receive a text message from El Capit√°n that his chooms Bob and Emma from EZEstates have some new digs for you to check out on their website.
After checking out the new EZEstates website in your current apartment, you see that there are four new apartments that you are able to rent. For the Corpo Plaza Apartment you just need to put down 110,000 eddies through an online transfer or visit the apartment in person to acquire access.
The apartment can be found in a hotel on Republic Way, next to Empathy in Corpo Plaza, City Center.
Objectives:
Rent the Corpo Plaza apartment: (‚Ç¨$110,000, one-time fee)
Go to the Corpo Plaza apartment.
