Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Not written correctly, missing information]
After breaching the party at Black Sapphire and stealing the identities of the two netrunners that will attend a meeting with Kurt Hansen and Songbird, Alex and Reed tell V to meet them at the basement of The Moth to discuss what comes next. The plan is to intercept the netrunners assume their identity and meet Hansen and snatch both the matrix and Songbird also killing Hansen for attempting an assassination on the president.
The plan is to hack into Charon Exotics and take control of the netrunners vehicle. To do that Alex instructs V to go to a tracking station of Charon Exotics and install the encryption key. But as V leaves The Moth Songbird reaches out to V and asks them to meet her to talk in private.
If V meets with Songbird:
Songbird asks V to come to a spot that she likes and reminisces about old times. Then after V confronts her, she confesses that she was the one who told Hansen about when and where Space Force One would be. She tells V that her real plan was for her and V to run away with the matrix and save the president, but that her getting captured changed everything. Her plan is to escape from Hansen and to give the matrix to a ripper who can help both her and V.
If V has sufficiently high Intelligence, V only needs to visit one Charon Exotics tracking station by choosing to remote access the second tracking station. If not, the second transceiver is broken and a kid named Luka can be paid 1000 Eurodollars to play a hot or cold game to restart the transceiver. After receiving the data, V needs to wait a couple hours for Reed to contact them. While waiting Alex reaches out and invites V to The Moth to kick back a little.
At The Moth V and Alex talk about who they would want to be if they weren't who they are now. They bond and V can choose to dance if they choose to.
A few hours later Reed calls and tells V to see a specific ripperdoc to get an implant that will allow V to use the biometrics of the netrunners. Reed also plans on taking Songbird with him but thinks he needs to ICE her first so implants a module to ICE Songbird into V as well.
as V gets the implants they talk to Johnny about the predicament that they are in. One side is a woman trying to survive as a living nuke, potentially dragging you with them to the explosion, while the other side is a man that runs on principles trying to do good by them potentially ready to mess up the entire situation. Leaving the ripperdoc finishes the mission.
Objectives:
Wait a day for a call from Reed.
Talk to Reed.
Go to Alex's safehouse.
Talk to Reed and Alex.
Take part in the briefings.
Follow Alex.
Talk to Alex.
Leave the safehouse.
Access the tracking station transceiver.
Talk to Songbird.
If V decides to join Songbird at the Tranquil Terrace:

Meet Songbird between 11:00 PM and 1:00 AM.
Talk to Songbird.
Follow Songbird.
Talk to Songbird.
Call Reed.
Talk to Reed.

Neutralize all enemies near the transceiver.
Access the tracking station transciever.
Talk to Alex.
Access the second tracking station transceiver.
Find a way to restart the transceiver.
Pay for a tip on how to fix the transceiver. [Optional]
Talk to the kid.
Follow the hints to find the control panel.
Use the control panel to restart power.
Wait for the power to restart.
Download data from the transceiver.
Talk to Johnny. [Optional]
Wait a few hours for Reed to call.
Reply to Alex's message.

If V decides to join Alex at The Moth:

Meet Alex at The Moth. [Optional]
Talk to Alex.
Sit.
Leave the bar.

Talk to Reed.
Go to Farida's clinic.
Use the intercom.
Talk to Farida.
Talk to Reed.
Talk to Farida.
Sit in the chair.
Proceed with the operation.
Talk to Johnny.
Get up.
Exit the clinic.
Associated Shards[]
Archived Conversation: Jake Carson and Kay EllingDogtown ‚Äì Analytical SummaryEBM Petrochem Stadium, Night CityPsychological Evaluation: Col. Kurt Hansen, 4732688215Time to Put on Your Face
Notes[]
A board in the basement will have photos of BARGHEST's top echelon: Kurt Hansen, Jago Szab√≥, Albert Murphy, Chester Bennett, Yuri Bychkov, Carl Robinson, Ross Ulmer, and Leon Rinder. If a character has been killed prior to the quest, their photo will appear marked with a red X on top.
When slotting in the shard given to V at the start of the mission, the codename "Phantom Liberty" briefly appears while the shard is booting.
The song Alex plays in the jukebox is Hardest to Be by P.T. Adamczyk and Sora Lion.
NDI Osprey is available at Alex's hideout after You Know My Name is complete therefore in this mission.
Trivia[]


‚Üë The job is named after the Ben Caplan song "Birds with Broken Wings."

Walkthrough:
On a hill top due north of the Trailer Park in Red Peaks, V will find an abandoned trailer and an underground bunker guarded by a lone turret.
After disabling the turret, climb on top of the trailer and you'll find the corpse of Valentin Krylov, along with a shard containing his conversation with Shelma. Reading the shard will automatically unlock the door to the underground bunker, where you'll find a hackable Access Point, a laptop, and Shelma's body on a netrunner's chair.
Reading the shard found on her body will reveal that Valentin and Shelma were Russians working directly under Mikhail Akulov. At the time of their deaths, they were tasked with tracking Chinese activities on the Net, spying on their dealings with Arasaka, as well as disguising Akulov's true intentions for visiting Night City. Unfortunately, the Chinese had anticipated this and managed to burn the duo before they could reach Akulov for help.
Objectives:
Open door to underground bunker.
Search the stash.

Walkthrough:
After agreeing to help Delamain track down his lost vehicles, V is able to encounter one in Wellsprings, Heywood. After getting close enough, the divergent Delamain will call V and utter "Beep-beep, motherfucker!," identifying it is as the same divergent Delamain that V encountered earlier in Megabuilding H10's parking lot and wrecking their car. Not intent on getting taken back to Delamain Corp Headquarters, the Delamain turns hostile towards V.
After V manages to damage the car enough to have it surrender, they are able to allow Delamain to establish a connection with the vehicle and have it return home. Delamain will transfer V a modest sum of 1,640 eurodollars as part of the agreement.
Objectives:
Find the Delamain cab in Wellsprings.
Approach the Delamain cab.
Stay close to the Delamain cab.
Damage Delamain's car to deactivate it.
Wait for Delamain to call.
Talk to Delamain.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Walkthrough must be written from a third-person perspective and not a gameplay walkthrough]
Roh is being held in the basement of a small building. The building is located inside a small walled courtyard, with one guard posted at the entrance and several Tyger Claws inside. The the courtyard is a public area, so the exterior guard doesn't react to V's presence in the courtyard. On the left side of the building is a side door that requires a Body check to open. On the roof above that door is a window that requires a Technical check to open. Elsewhere on the roof is a window that doesn't require any check to open.
If you enter from either of the attribute check entrances, you're positioned at the top of a stairwell that leads directly to the basement where Roh is being held. In the basement, there are two cameras and two guards. One guard is beating Roh, and the other is in a different room, watching TV. The guard that's watching TV will patrol, so it's a good idea to take him out first if you want to avoid triggering an alarm. Kill or incapacitate the guards and then lead Roh out of the building. If you entered through the door with the Body check, you have an easy exit out. The Tyger Claw at the entrance to the courtyard will be gone when you leave the area.
Roh moves quite slowly, so you will have to wait for him. When you reach the Fixer's transport, he stops to sit on a bench and asks V who paid to get him out. V can tell him it was Macidew or say that it's a secret. If V tells him it was Macidew, Roh seems surprised and expresses mixed feelings because Macidew is the reason he got picked up to begin with. V advises that it's a good idea if Roh and Macidew don't see each other again, and Roh agrees.
If V rescues Roh without tripping the alarms, Regina is impressed and includes a bonus payment for V to pick up at a drop point.
Objectives:
Go to the Tyger Claws' dojo.
Do not raise the alarm. [Optional]
Find out where Roh is being held.
Set Roh free.
Talk to Roh.
Help Roh get outside.
Escort Roh to the fixer's transport.
Talk to Roh.

Walkthrough:
The gig can be unlocked by finishing The Beast In Me and waiting several days. V receives a message text from Jim Jarry, the organizer of the street races. After agreeing to his offer, there will be four new gigs on the map, marked with crossed flags. Going to one of the flags, V needs to sit on the marked bench and pay ‚Ç¨$ 2,000 as entry fee to join the race.
Locations[]
There are 4 different races and tracks which represent the tracks from the Side Jobs:
The Beast in Me: City Center
The Beast in Me: Badlands
The Beast in Me: Santo Domingo
The Beast in Me: The Big Race

Some time after V and Judy √Ålvarez save Evelyn Parker from the Scavengers, Claire Russell reaches out to V, offering them a job. She tells V that she needs help with some street races, and is looking for a driver, and since V is a reliable mercenary, she approached them. She asks that V meet with her in her garage on Valley street[B 1] in Arroyo, Santo Domingo during the day.[N 1]
As V enters the garage, they can hear Claire mumbling to herself about her car. She will slide out from under the vehicle, which she introduces to V as "Beast." As V asks about the race rules, Claire tells them that there aren't really any, other than that you race in pairs; a driver and a gunner. She tells V that she is more of a gearhead and a shooter than a driver, and that is why she needs one.
When V asks if she has raced before, Claire answers that she has, but that her previous driver passed away during a race a year ago.
If V agrees to become Claire's driver:
V accepts Claire's offer to be her driver during the street races. Claire says that there will be four races in total, and that the first one will start in the City Center district, followed by a race in the Badlands, then Santo Domingo, and a final round in Westbrook. When asked about a payout, Claire tells V that first place will receive some prize money, that they'll split equally. She will also tell V that the decision about which vehicle they will enter with is up to V.
As a final bit of information, she informs V that in order to qualify for the Watson final, they will have to qualify in the top three in at least two of the races. She asks V to wait for her call and meet her at the first race in City Center.
If V refuses to become Claire's driver:
V declines Claire's offer to be her driver during the street races‚Äìdespite her efforts to convince them‚Äìand forfeits the job.[N 2]
City Center Race[]
Main article: The Beast in Me: City Center
In the morning of the following day, Claire will text V with the coordinates to the first race held in City Center. The race will start on Martin Luther King Boulevard and Skyline East in Vista del Rey, and go through Corpo Plaza to the finish on the Wellsprings Docks in Wellsprings.
Badlands Race[]
Main article: The Beast in Me: Badlands
Two days after participating in the City Center race, Claire will contact V again, this time to give them the the coordinates for the second race on Brooklands street in the Laguna Bend Reservoir, Badlands. For this race, Claire demands that they use her "Beast" instead of V's vehicle, as she wants to test it out in the field.
Santo Domingo Race[]
Main article: The Beast in Me: Santo Domingo
A day after competing in the Badlands race, V is contacted by Claire once again, this time for the final qualifying race in Santo Domingo. She tells V to go to Brandon and Wollesen Street in Arroyo. Unlike the previous race, Claire allows V to pick the vehicle they will be competing with in the race.
If Claire and V qualify for the final race:
Claire and V managed to qualify for the final race, taking place in Watson.
If V agreed to help Claire:
After accepting to help Claire kill Sampson, Claire will reach out to V later for the final race.
If V just wants to attend the final race:
V says they just want to compete in the final race, and will put the race over her dispute with Sampson. Claire understands V's decision, and will reach out to V later for the final race.
If V refused to help Claire kill Sampson:
After refusing to help Claire kill Sampson, V was sacked from the team.[N 3]
The Big Race[]
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Main article: The Beast in Me: The Big Race
Two days after competing in the Santo Domingo race, Claire contacts V to flick them the details for the final race, instructing them to meet on Pardey street in Charter Hill, Westbrook.
During the final race, Peter Sampson will split off after his vehicle has mechanical issues. Claire wants V to follow him off the highway.
If V follows Sampson as he exits the highway:
After following Sampson off the highway, V and Claire witness Sampson collide with another car, and get out of their vehicle. Claire rushes over to Sampson, and starts to mock him for his current situation as he tries to crawl out from under his wrecked vehicle.
Sampson, begging for Claire to spare his life, claims that he didn't kill Dean, but that he got himself killed.
If V wants to hear what Sampson has to say:
V tells Claire that they want to hear what Sampson has to say. Sampson will tell them that Dean tried to pass him just before the finish line, but that he lost control of the car when Sampson rammed him, which is according to him not against the rules of the race. After hearing what Sampson has to say, V comes to the conclusion that it was an accident; an accepted risk of racing.
If Claire kills Sampson:
Claire shot Sampson despite V's attempts to spare his life. As a reward for V's help, she will gift V her "Beast", as she has no use for the car anymore.
If V prevents Claire from killing Sampson:[N 4]
V prevented Claire from killing Sampson. Despite Sampson living, she gifts V her "Beast" as a thank you, as she no longer has a use for the car.
After a few days, V receives a text message from Sampson, saying that he wants V to have his car.
If V agrees to go with Claire:
V agrees to go back to Claire's place. While driving back, she tells V more about Dean and that she has no desire to race in the future.
If V opted to finish the race instead of following Sampson:
Claire gets mad at V and refuses to service them at the Afterlife bar.[N 5]
Objectives:
Talk to Claire in her garage during the day.
Talk to Claire in her garage.
Wait for Claire to contact you.
Complete the qualifying races. [3]
Read the message from Claire.
Send a message to Claire.
Read the message from Claire.
If V and Claire qualify for the final race:
Finish "The Big Race."
If V and Claire follow Sampson during The Big Race:
Confront Sampson at Claire's side.
Talk to Claire.
If V agrees to go back with Claire:
Return to Claire's garage.
Talk to Claire.

Walkthrough:
To be able to progress in this quest, you must first have completed Firestarter and, potentially, Run This Town.
V meets with Michael Maldonado underneath The Needle. He will explain that he was forced to testify against his son, Eric Maldonado, by D.A. Georgina Zembinsky and her partner, Hank Davis, after they tortured Michael for a false confession. He will tell V to go to the Heavy Hearts Club, where Georgina spends much of her time. On their way there, Mr. Hands will text V to not cause trouble within the Heavy Hearts Club, due to the fact that he operates out of there.
If V talks to the bartender, she will say that the D.A. is likely in the VIP booth, and to meet with a person named Jack in the bathroom for more information.
If V finds Jack:
V interrupts Jack while in the middle of some sort of deal in the toilets of Heavy Hearts.
If V pays 550 eurodollars to Jack or if V has the Streetkid Lifepath:
After paying Jack a sum of 550 eurodollars, or convincing him that V can get him better connections in Night City in exchange, he will tell V that Georgina may be in VIP room 04.
If V questions the waitress:
V questions one of the waitresses of the Heavy Hearts club, and learns that Georgina may be in VIP room 04.
If V breaks into the dressing room (requires high Technical Ability):
V breaks into the dressing room of the Heavy Hearts club, and can find a computer terminal there with a list of guests at the club. Through this, they learn that Georgina may be in VIP room 06.
If V enters VIP room 04:
V can interact with a man inside VIP room 04 telling them that Georgina is actually in VIP room 06.
Once inside VIP room 06, V will confront Georgina and Hank. They will explain that they need Eric in prison in order to help catch Hector Sacrist√°n, a high-ranking Valentinos gang member accused of being a serial murderer she's been after for two years. They will also explain that Eric is a gang member himself, being accused of various crimes. Furthermore, they will deny that they tortured Michael, and that his testimony was not fabricated, despite what Michael claims, though he did receive payment for the testimony. They will then show a recording of his testimony, where Michael testifies that Eric told him over a holocall that Hector shot a man named Marcos Ferreria, and ordered his body to be dumped in the bay. They then offer to anonymize Michael's testimony, to ensure that Eric does not know that his father testified against him.
If V agrees to let Georgina anonymize the testimony:
Georgina will anonymize the testimony as she says she will, and V is free to leave the club and return to Michael.
Upon doing so, V will tell Michael that she removed his name and data from the testimony. Michael will be unhappy that Georgina did not delete the testimony, and refuse to pay V. No matter which dialogue option is chosen, V will demand that Michael pays up in return for V's silence. Michael does so, giving them ‚Ç¨$2000 before dismissing them. Mr. Hands will appear unhappy that his client is unhappy, but will note it if V did not raise the alarm and pay them ‚Ç¨$6000.
If V makes Georgina wipe the testimony:
V will not believe Georgina and Hank's claims and demand that they delete the testimony. Georgina will then tell Hank to threaten V but if they have a high enough Body attribute they can threaten Hank first, If V does so Hank will give in to V's demands and leave the room; Otherwise, Hank will attack V and they'll be forced to defeat him. Regardless of what happens, Georgina will delete the testimony, and V is free to leave the club and return to Michael. Upon doing so, V will tell Michael that Georgina has deleted Michael's testimony, and he responds happily to this. After V requests their payment, Michael will pay them ‚Ç¨$2000, and V leaves. Mr. Hands will appear happy because his client is happy, and if V did not trigger the alarm, he will pay V ‚Ç¨$6000; Otherwise, he will only pay them ‚Ç¨$4000.

Walkthrough:
When you approach the area, Muamar Reyes will call you to start this job, directing you to meet with Ted Fox, a reporter for N54 news, who is waiting in a car outside the Kendachi factory. Ted explains that he wants to publish an expose about Kendachi cooperating with 6th Street to design its latest product line, but he needs V to help him acquire proof of this connection by covertly installing a tracker on a Kendachi transport. V must sneak into the factory, plant the tracker on the van, and get out without raising any alarms. Take the tracker from Ted to proceed.
The factory grounds are small, and there are only two cameras, both outside the main building, but several security guards patrol the parking lot. Two guards are also inside the building: one in the garage with the van and another in the adjacent office.
A fast stealth strategy is to equip Fortified Ankles or Reinforced Tendons and enter the factory from its roof by circling around behind it and climbing up using the dumpsters. Once on the roof, there is an unlocked hatch in the skylight that can be opened. Watch out for the guard near the van below, and jump down onto the van. Take down the guard and hide the body in the crate behind the van. Next, place the tracker by interacting with the van's driver-side panel door. To exit, simply go back the way you came by jumping up to the skylight from the van's roof (this is where the leg implants are most helpful) and leave by way of the dumpsters.
Once V is clear, Muamar will wire payment. If no one was alerted, he will be pleased and provide a bonus through a nearby dropbox. Otherwise, Teddy will still get the proof he needs, but Muamar gives V a "C minus" for their performance.
Objectives:
Meet with Ted Fox.
Enter Ted Fox's car.
Talk to Ted Fox.
Take the tracker.
Get to the parking lot.
Remain undetected. [Optional]
Install the tracker.
Leave the parking lot.
Collect your reward.

Walkthrough:
You can enter Tucker's building by one of the three routes: the front door where a guard is waiting; the back door (requires Technical Ability); or an upper window, accessible by augmented jumping (eg, Reinforced Tendons) to a fire escape. Inside, you will find eight guards scattered around the house. Avoid or neutralize them to reach Tucker's office on the top floor.
There, you can choose to hear her out. She will ask why you're there, expecting you to have been sent by one of her competitors, and becomes dismissive when she discovers that you were sent after her because of the girl she hit with her car, saying that the case is closed because she already paid compensation and was insured for such accidents. Relaxed, she offers you a deal: you get the money in her safe (which she declares must contain more than the payment you were offered to go after her) if you let her go. She says that nobody has to know. You can choose to take the deal and leave.
If you refused her deal or if you accepted the deal and then changed your mind, you neutralize Tucker - lethally or not. If you retrieve the administrator access token on her, you will have access to the money in her safe. Afterwards, you carry an unconscious Tucker's body to a car if she's still alive, or if she's dead you can simply leave.
Objectives:
Get inside Tucker's building.
Find Tucker Albach.
Neutralize Tucker Albach.
Talk to Tucker Albach. [Optional]
If Tucker is neutralized non-lethally:
Carry Tucker out of the building.
Carry Tucker to the fixer's car.
If Tucker is neutralized lethally:
Leave Tucker's building.
If you take Tucker's deal:
Take the money from the safe. [Optional]
Leave Tucker's building.

Walkthrough:
V must scan or interact with the 20 tarot cards in Night City. (Two of the Major Arcana, The Devil and Judgement, are only found in certain endings and are not required for this job. The four King cards of Phantom Liberty are also not required for this job.)
Misty mentions these missing cards and discusses The Fool's Journey in reaching The World. To reach it, there are four paths V can take to obtain them, foreshadowing the various endings, being The Sun, The Star, Temperance, and The Devil. V becomes bitter, saying they could die instead, also foreshadowing the suicide ending. After talking with her, Misty gifts V her dreamcatcher, which will appear in V's apartment above the bed.

Walkthrough:
Panam cannot be killed during this mission. Likewise, Saul is invincible until his encounter with Adam Smasher.
The group of Robot R Mk.2s guarding the seismic dampeners underneath Arasaka Tower can easily be neutralized in one batch by using a few F-GX Frag Grenades.
The ladder to the maintenance shaft is located just right of the big gate labeled "Sector B".
Remaining undetected and not raising any alarm until you slot in the shard that gives Alt access has the advantage of Alt neutralizing several enemies (including one Arasaka mech) for you instead of having to fight them yourself.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìùReason: Incomplete
V in cyberspace sees a red figure and follows it. V follows this flickering form a few times before they are eventually able to interact with him. They will wake up in a landfill and crawl out of it before Dexter DeShawn and Goro Takemura appear.
As V slips in and out of consciousness, Takemura ends up killing Dex and puts V in his vehicle to take them to Hanako Arasaka. However, when V comes back around, an injured Takemura needs their help and gives V an airhypo. V needs to take it and fight off Arasaka assassins who are attacking them.
If V fails to use the air hypo in time:
V failed to use the airhypo in time and succumbed to their injuries.
If V uses the air hypo in time:
Takemura will hand V a JKE-X2 Kenshin to dispatch the assassins, but then another with mantis blades will show up. After Takemura squashes the last assassin by crashing into a billboard, Takemura asks for a ripperdoc that V can trust so both of them can get the medical attention they require. After V names Viktor, they call Delamain, who picks the duo up. Takemura performs triage on V with Delamain's help, and narrowly manages to bring V to Viktor's Clinic in Little China, with Takemura almost succumbing to his own injuries upon arrival.
Several weeks pass with sporadic moments of consciousness‚Äîas Viktor tries to keep V alive‚Äîuntil one day V regains full consciousness, and is able to speak to Viktor.
Viktor explains that V's hallucinations are fragments of Johnny Silverhand's memories, triggered by Dex shooting them in the head. The Relic inside of their shard slot was consequently triggered, using nanites to revive their brain. However, these nanites also recognize V's mind as a foreign entity, which it is now destroying in an effort to clear the way for the Johnny's engram.
Misty enters the room and takes V back to their apartment and gives them medicine: Pseudoendotrizine that speeds up the process, and Omega blockers that slow the process down. V talks with her a bit before she leaves.
When V wakes up, Johnny will be rather hostile and when V tries to leave, he'll instead push them backwards. However, Johnny and V will realize that they are connected, with Johnny attempting to disconnect the Relic, nearly killing V. When V comes to and attempts to take the pills, Johnny slaps them out of their hand and instead demands that they "stick an iron in your mouth and pull the trigger", before leaving them to crawl to their pills. V swallows one and passes out.
V will wake up in the shower and then when leaving the apartment, Takemura will call asking to meet in Tom's Diner to talk. In the diner he talks about why he saved V and his future goals, including proving that Yorinobu killed his father using V as a witness. He also promises that Arasaka can help V with their biochip problem. V talks about alternative methods of possibly dealing with the biochip but Takemura disregards them and leaves the diner.
When Takemura leaves, Johnny Silverhand projects himself in front of V. He says he has changed his mind and doesn't want V dead anymore and that he and Rogue knew each other a long time ago and that she can help.

Walkthrough:
The quest only appears if you didn't pick up your gear during Firestarter:
V receives a text from Mr. Hands, recounting how he was visited by one of Hansen's men and sold him equipment he recognized to be V's. He then offers to return all of V's weaponry for a finders fee of 20,000 Eurodollars. V then pays the fee, and Mr. Hands delightedly tells V their gear will be ready in a few hours.
Later, V receives another text from Mr. Hands, informing V that their arsenal has been deposited at the Kress Street Hideout.
Objectives:
Send payment to Mr. Hands to get your gear back.
Collect ‚Ç¨$20,000 for Mr. Hands to recover your lost gear.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Some time after receiving Judy √Ålvarez's message thanking them for being a good friend and agreeing to help her free Clouds, V receives a phone call from Judy, telling them that she finally heard back from Maiko Maeda, and that she is gathering with the others‚ÄìTom Caldera and Roxanne Sumner‚Äìat Megabuilding H8.
Once V joins them at the Megabuilding, the group reiterates the plan before taking the elevator to the maintenance level, where Judy and V disembark to take control over the level, while Tom and Roxanne continue on to level 8 where Clouds is located.
To gain control over the level, Judy tells V that she needs to gain access to the control panel located on this floor, but that the Tyger Claws resistance in the area may make it difficult for them, and tasks them with taking out the Tyger Claws. After V has dispatched of the enemies, they regroup with Judy at the control panel. Judy informs V that she will not be coming with them to the penthouse, and that from here on out they are on their own until they meet with Maiko. Judy stays behind on the maintenance level to observe both V's situation as well as the situation in Clouds, and V takes the freight elevator to go to the roof of the Megabuilding.
Once on the rooftop, Judy instructs V to jump down onto the balcony of Hiromi's penthouse. Inside the penthouse, there are four more Tyger Claws that make it more difficult for V to gain access to Hiromi's office. After V dispatches them and opens the door to the office, V is greeted by Maiko, who was waiting for their arrival. Inside the room, Hiromi Sato is accompanied by Jun Azegami and Marcus Ichida, two other high-ranking Tyger Claws bosses, and three dolls for pleasure. The three of them are engaged in a braindance, while V and Maiko talk.
When V questions Maiko about the unexpected presence of the two Tyger Claws, she reveals that she only went along with Judy's plan to arrange her own rise to power as Hiromi's replacement. The Tyger Claw bosses are there so Maiko can expose Hiromi's incompetence, gain their trust, and join the Tyger Claws herself. She is certain that without the protection of a gang, the dolls will be unable to hold onto Clouds by themselves and will be crushed. As Maiko prepares to jack the men out, V must decide what to do next: either side with Maiko in her negotiation with the bosses, or side with Judy and stick to the original plan to liberate the dolls.[N 1]
If V sides with Maiko and accepts her money:
V decides to side with Maiko and accept her bribe. Angered by their decision, Judy severs ties with V over the betrayal and leaves the city. It is later revealed that although Clouds no longer has a constant Tyger Claw presence with Maiko in charge, working conditions are just as bad under Maiko as they were under Woodman. Tom and Roxanne are unhappy with the situation, but continue working at Clouds.[N 2][N 3]
If V sides with Maiko and declines her money:
Judy is disappointed with being played but comes to terms with it, admitting that Maiko knows more about how to protect Clouds than she does. It is later revealed that although Clouds no longer has a constant Tyger Claw presence with Maiko in charge, working conditions are just as bad under Maiko as they were under Woodman. Tom and Roxanne are unhappy with the situation but continue working at Clouds.[N 4]
If V sides with Judy and kills Maiko:
Judy is shocked that Maiko is dead. V can argue that it was self-defense, and Maiko should have known better, but Judy insists that Maiko's death was unnecessary. Judy leaves, saying she needs time to process events. It is later revealed that the Tyger Claws retaliated against the dolls harshly and reclaimed Clouds. Tom is killed, Roxanne is forced into hiding, and Clouds is closed indefinitely.[N 5]
If V sides with Judy and Maiko is left alive:
Judy is pleased that V stopped Maiko's power grab and Clouds is now managed by the dolls.[N 5][N 6] Judy will mention that the Tyger Claws retaliated, resulting in Tom's death and Roxanne fleeing.
After the confrontation in Hiromi's office is settled, V must leave the apartment and take the elevator to the ground level to meet with Judy to discuss what happened.
Objectives:
Wait for Judy's call.
Talk to Judy.
Go to Megabuilding H8 in the afternoon.
If it is not afternoon:
Wait until the afternoon.
Meet with Judy and the dolls.
Talk to the group.
Follow Judy.
Ride the elevator to the maintenance level.
Defeat the Tyger Claws.
Talk to Judy.
Go into the freight elevator.
Get to the roof.
Find a way into Hiromi's penthouse.
Get into Hiromi's office.
Join the meeting.
Talk to Maiko.
Talk to the Tyger Claw bosses.
Defeat Tyger Claw bosses.
Talk to Maiko.
Defeat Maiko. (if Maiko becomes hostile)
Leave the apartment.
Ride the elevator to ground floor.

Walkthrough:
V starts out by fixing their broken nose at the El Coyote Cojo bar located in The Glen. Pepe, the bartender, tells V that he took out a loan from Kirk Sawyer, a new small-time Fixer in town, and Kirk is threatening to break his legs if he doesn't pay soon. Pepe requests that V either talks to Kirk into either forgetting about the debt or finding another way to settle it.
V approaches Kirk and, while he refuses to forgive Pepe's debt, a deal is settled. Kirk tasks V with stealing a Rayfield Aerondight owned by a corporate from Arasaka; If V is able to steal the car, then Kirk will forget about the debt Pepe owes him, and Kirk will even pay V some extra eddies for the job. After agreeing to the deal, V drives to Westbrook where the car is located, hitching a ride with Padre, a friend and local Fixer. Despite a brief confrontation with 6th Street gangoon Sam Carter, Padre delivers V to their destination and hands V his card.
Using the service key given to V by Kirk, V unlocks the car and turns it on, bypassing the alarm systems on the car that prevents the Night City Police Department from being alerted. Things seem to be going smoothly until someone suddenly opens the door from the outside, and V finds themselves staring down the barrel of a gun wielded by Jackie Welles, who intends to take the car for himself. V is then interrupted by the sudden arrival of the NCPD and Inspector Stints, who capture both of V and Jackie and has his officers pin them to the ground. Stints criticizes the two of them on their life choices and how little has changed, but before he can take them into custody, an Arasaka corporate, Kaoru Fujioka, who owns the car, comes to see the commotion. He uses his corporate reputation to order Stints to break V's legs and dump both V and Jackie in the river to drown. The officers knocks them unconscious, but instead of following what the Araskaka corporate said, Stints instead decides to just leave both V and Jackie in a alley since he dislikes corpos as much as everyone else.
V wakes up in the alley. V and Jackie talk as V takes a moment to recover. After getting to know V and the reason why they were stealing the Aerondight he had his eyes on, Jackie says that Kirk isn't as powerful as he seems to be, and his threats against Pepe are hollow at best. Jackie then invites V to breakfast, ending the questline leading into an introduction montage of Night City.
Objectives:
Find Kirk on the second floor.
Talk to Kirk.
Leave the bar.
Go to Embers.
Talk to Padre.
Get in Padre's car.
Ride with Padre to Embers.
Get out of the car.
Take the elevator to the garage.
Find the Rayfield.
Find Rick. [Optional]
Disable the lock using Kirk's device.
Get in the car.
Steal the Rayfield.
Talk to the thief.
Talk to the police officers.
Talk to Jackie.

Walkthrough:
This job can be started after completing Spider and the Fly.
Coach Fred messages V with a request to help a fellow boxer named Aaron. V meets with Aaron at the boxing ring near Montezuma's Throne, who explains he needs their help to reach a particular ripperdoc, Damir Kovac.
Aaron and V decide to meet at 9PM at the Digimmortal exposition in Terra Cognita. Here, Aaron confesses that he is in hot water with the Animals. The gang supported his fighting career but, along with his implants, saddled him with a chip that could be remotely triggered to render him unconscious, thus throwing his matches. Aaron suspects that Angie, a pack-leader of the Animals, is out to get him, which is why he needs Damir to remove the implant.
The duo makes their way inside Digimmortal. When they reach Damir, Aaron undergoes a procedure to have the chip implant blocked, while V passes time in a nearby chair until the procedure is finished.
After some time passes, the procedure completes, but Angie arrives at the clinic while Aaron is still under sedation. She offers V a cut of the winnings if they agree to leave and let Aaron take the fall.
Agree to Angie's deal:
A few days later, Angie will ask to meet V at the boxing ring in Dogtown, where she will reward them Ôªø22,000 Eurodollars. Coach Fred will message them, lamenting they couldn't help Aaron.
If V has the Corpo lifepath:
V can extort Angie for an additional 20% eurodollars.
Refuse Angie's deal:
If V refused to cooperate with Angie, they'll have to fight her and the two Animals accompanying her. If they manage to do so, Aaron and V will be able to leave freely. However, a few days later, Aaron will request that V meets with him at the Dream Gig bar in Dogtown. When V arrives, a server will mention that they spotted Aaron with some Animals in the alley out back. There, V will find Aaron's dead body near the dumpster. Johnny will appear and speak his mind, and Coach Fred will send a final message to V, concluding the job.
Threaten Angie:
This option is only available if V defeated Sasquatch during I Walk the Line
Angie will be intimidated and back off, and Aaron will awake unharmed. If V tells Aaron to throw the fight or talks about his past, he will throw the fight but later find satisfaction as a coach for kids in Dogtown. If V convinces Aaron to fight, he will lose and travel to Costa Rica where he will attempt a professional fighting career again.
Regardless of choice, V is able to leave Digimmortal safely and will receive 5,000 Eurodollars. However, the Scavs are not marked as friendly and they can turn hostile if V strays too far from the path to the exit.
Objectives:
Read the message from Coach Fred.
Find Aaron.
Talk to the bookie. [Optional]
Wait until the fight ends.
Talk to Aaron.
Meet Aaron at Terra Cognita.
Wait for Aaron.
Follow Aaron.
Talk to Aaron.
Reach Damir's clinic with Aaron.
Defeat the Scavengers.
Talk to Damir.
Talk to Aaron.
Wait for the procedure to end.
Talk to Damir.
Talk to Angie.
Defeat the Animals.
Talk to Aaron.
Exit the scav hideout.
Wait for Aaron to reach out.
Read the message from Aaron.
Meet Aaron at the Dream Gig bar.
Ask the server about Aaron.
Check the alley behind the bar.
Talk to Johnny.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
During the surgery in the Arasaka Tower's Medical Center‚Äîto have the Relic prototype with Johnny Silverhand's engram removed‚ÄîV and Johnny speak with each other one last time in cyberspace before being separated. They reminisce on their time together,
After the surgery, V is transported to the Arasaka Orbital Station, where they wake up in the clinic for the first time since the surgery and start their recovery. After a short conversation with their doctor, Professor Sachiko Kusama, they are escorted to their room, and go to sleep.
During their first night's sleep, V has a nightmare in which they hear still Johnny's voice. The voice draws V to the door, which they open and gaze upon the vast emptiness of space, before leaping into it, causing them to wake up. After waking up, a WNS report on the television reveals that Saburo Arasaka has taken over the body of his son, Yorinobu Arasaka, while they hold a speech on television ensuring that the Arasaka Corporation will go back to its roots and be stronger than ever. As the news broadcast ends, Professor Kusama enters the room to see how V's recovery is going with various tests, such as reading text from a monitor, solving a Rubik's cube, responding, responding to keywords, and motor functions test using treadmill. After the tests, V goes back to sleep, and has another nightmare.
V hears Johnny once more while sleeping, and again drawing them to the door. This time the door opens to the hallway of the station. Upon exploring the hallway, V relives the memory of Jackie's death, with the Relic being inserted again into their neuroport.
V wakes up again, and this day a news report by N54 news is on the television, still reporting on Saburo Arasaka's apparent resurrection and 
that numerous Virtu 100 Company CEO's, religious leaders, and human rights groups have signed a letter of protest. Professor Kusama enters V's room again, to subject V to more tests, which after completion allow V to use the communications system.
If V calls Viktor Vektor:

V calls Viktor Vektor and he picks up. Viktor tells V that they want them to visit him for a check-up after returning to Earth. Viktor also tells V that Misty Olszewski is visiting family in Warsaw. Unable to provide the right counseling that V requires, they ask that V makes the decision that seems right to them.
If V calls Panam Palmer (requires completion of Queen of the Highway):

If V did not romance Panam:
V calls Panam Palmer and she picks up. She demands that V returns to Earth immediately and hangs up as Mitch Anderson requires her help with something.
If V romanced Panam and called them during Op55n1 Nocturne:
V calls Panam Palmer and she picks up. Panam angrily tells V that they heard about their situation through Viktor, and that they are mad with them for not telling her about it themselves. Panam demands that V returns to Earth before Arasaka is able to hurt them.
If V calls Judy √Ålvarez (requires completion of Pyramid Song):

If V did not romance Judy:
V calls Judy √Ålvarez, but gets played a pre-recorded message, in which she mentions that they may call V back when they are no longer angry with them.
If V romanced Judy and called them during Op55n1 Nocturne:
V calls Judy √Ålvarez and she picks up. Judy is distraught about the fact that they trusted Arasaka, but at the same time she is happy that they were able to remove the Relic. She confesses to V that they would not know what to do if they found out if they were gone, and demands that V returns to Earth in a matter of hours.
If V calls River Ward (requires completion of Following the River):

If V did not romance River:
V calls River Ward and he picks up, only to tell V that they currently do not have time to talk, and tells V to call back later.
If V romanced River and called them during Op55n1 Nocturne:
V calls River Ward and he picks up. They talk on the phone while River is also in a conversation with his nephew. River asks V the name of the orbital station, so that he can fly up and bring them home. V is unable to give River the name of the orbital station, as they do not know it, and warn River to not trust Arasaka. The call is ended with River saying that he will find out wherever V, to bring them home.
If V calls Kerry Eurodyne (requires completion of Boat Drinks):

If V did not romance Kerry:
V calls Kerry Eurodyne and he picks up. V explains their situation to him, but finds himself unable to place himself in V's shoes, suggesting them to just leave wherever they are, and hangs up so they can continue watching a TV show.
If V romanced Kerry and called them during Op55n1 Nocturne:
V calls Kerry Eurodyne and he picks up. Kerry is ecstatic when V tells them that Arasaka was able to remove the Relic, and comforts V, promising to watch a reruns of a TV show together. Worried about V being all on their own in the orbital station, Kerry tells V that they are the best thing planet Earth has going for herself and that they should return home. Before ending the call, Kerry tells V that they will make the necessary calls to get them back safely to Night City.
If V calls Hanako Arasaka:

Hanako Arasaka did not pick up when V called her.

While V is asleep that night, they dream about the tests, eventually breaking open the Rubik's Cube which reveals an image of a Devil. Waking up from the nightmare, a WNS news bulletin about the increasing tension between the Arasaka and Militech corporations is playing, warning of a possible armed conflict. 
As the tests go on for the new few weeks, V grows increasingly annoyed at them. Eventually V reaches a breaking point, and becomes aggressive, causing the Professor to hastily leave the room.
The following day, after a recovery period of almost 30 days[N 1], V has to make their final decision, as they are informed by Sachiko Kusama that the treatment has been ineffective so far.
If V saved Goro Takemura:[N 2]

V wakes up to Goro Takemura, who offers V to become a part of the Secure Your Soul program by having their psyche digitalized. In an effort to help V make their choice, Takemura encourages V to go through with the digitization.
If V didn't save Goro Takemura:

V wakes up to Anders Hellman, who offers V to become a part of the Secure Your Soul program by having their psyche digitalized.
V signs the contract:
V signs the contract and agrees with being digitized and becoming an engram until Arasaka has found a new body for them.
V refuses to sign the contract:
V refuses to sign the contract to become digitized. V leaves the station to live out the remainder of their life on Earth in realspace, while singing the lyrics of Never Fade Away to themselves.
Objectives[]
Talk to Johnny.
Follow the guard.
Go to sleep.
Step onto the treadmill.
Leave the room.
Investigate the noise.
Call the people close to you. [Optional]
Go to sleep.
Follow the doctor's orders.
Vent your frustration. [Optional]
Go to sleep.
If V saved Takemura:
Talk to Takemura.
If V did not save Takemura:
Talk to Hellman.
Make your final decision.
Notes[]


‚Üë The game's subtitle files have the amount of total days V has stayed at the Orbital Station noted in their title.

‚Üë In order to unlock The Devil achievement at the very end of this mission, Goro Takemura had to be saved during Search and Destroy by returning to his apartment.


Trivia[]


‚Üë The job is named after the Pixies song "Where Is My Mind?"¬†from the 1988 album "Surfer Rosa."

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
After having exhausted all other options, V has no choice but to meet with Hanako Arasaka at Embers.[N 1] After having been cleared by security and taking the elevator to the 13th floor, V meets with Hanako in person.
As V approaches Hanako, she stands up from behind the piano and tells V that she knows the location of Mikoshi, beneath Arasaka Tower. Johnny will interrupt V as they sit down at the bar, after which Hanako will state that her brother should be held accountable for the murder of their father, and the Arasaka Corporation should learn the truth of the situation.[N 2] She suggests a trade in which V confronts Yorinobu at a meeting and testifies to the actual events, and in exchange she will help to rid them of the construct.
After heading back to the elevator and pressing the button to return to street level, Johnny will stop the elevator and suggest that if V gives him control of the body, he can find Mikoshi without Hanako's assistance, by teaming up with Rogue and blasting into Arasaka Tower, like they did in 2023.[N 3] After talking with Johnny the Relic malfunctions and V blacks out.
V awakes to find themself in Viktor's clinic once again. Viktor explains that Johnny had to drag V back from Embers, and once V is able to sit, he'll give his prognosis: that one more Relic malfunction will likely kill you. After standing up, V will take the last of the pills and a Unity Handgun from the nearby table and, as V goes to leave the clinic, Misty will suggest a better place to decide what you should do next - a place which Jackie once visited when he had an important decision to make.
She leads V to the elevator behind her shop, which they take up to the 9th floor, then up a few more stairs onto the roof of the building. V sits next to Misty as she briefly reminisces about Jackie, then leaves V alone to talk with Johnny to decide on what comes next.[N 4][N 5]
If V chooses the Path of Least Resistance:
Instead of getting help from any of their allies, V opts to put things to rest, and throws away the pills. V and Johnny have one final conversation before V grabs their pistol and commits suicide.
If V chooses Hanako Arasaka's help:[N 6]
Johnny will be upset with V's decision but ultimately says he doesn't care and that V'll regret this decision. V calls Hanako but she says Yorinobu already invited her to his estate and his people are watching her; and that she'll send someone to pick up V and bring them to the estate so so they can rescue her. Upon going downstairs Misty talks to V and offers to do a reading, when she finds out you're working with Arasaka she's upset because they caused Jackie's death and she leaves. When the driver enters the shop it turns out to be Anders Hellman and he talks with V about an prior conversation.
If V chooses Panam Palmer's help:[N 7]
Johnny asks if V is sure about this decision and says he thinks they'll regret it. V calls Panam and tells her that they need into Arasaka tower and tells her about Mikoshi. V says if they don't get access to Mikoshi that they are going to die. so Panam agrees to help V and tells them to wait for her to pick them up. Upon going downstairs Misty talks to V and offers to do a reading. Panam shows up and says that everyone is waiting at  camp.
If V chooses Rogue Amendiares's help:[N 8]
Johnny asks if V is sure about this decision and V says they trust him, Johnny assures V that they're gonna be fine and says he'll see them on the other side.
If V chooses Solomon Reed's help:[N 9]
Johnny asks if V is is sure about this decision and V says that this their best shot at survival. After V calls Reed he asks if V's at the meeting point and sends an AV to pick up V; V then thanks Reed for everything and hangs up. Johnny is initially very angry at V, but once they apologize, Johnny says he understands and just needs to think. V waits for the AV's arrival.
Secret Ending:[N 10]
Johnny suggests another option, in which he and V storm Arasaka Tower together.
Objectives:
Meet Hanako at Embers.
Talk to Hanako Arasaka.
Sit with Hanako Arasaka.
Leave the restaurant.
Talk to Johnny.
Talk to Viktor.
Talk to Johnny.
Take the pills.
Leave Viktor's clinic.
Talk to Misty.
Follow Misty.
Take the elevator to the roof.
Sit by Misty.
Talk to Johnny.
If V calls one of their romances:
Talk to [Panam/Judy/River/Kerry].
Decide what comes next.

Walkthrough: This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
Objectives: Go to the dealer's stash in Japantown.

Walkthrough: Approach Brendan and talk to him. V can remark on Theo Price, who just talked to the machine, whether or not they actually saw her or not. After some time (can be a day or more), the job marker on the map will reappear. Return to Brendan and a vandal can be caught spray painting the poor machine. Take care of the vandal however you wish and Brendan will thank you and talk a bit before suddenly makes a rather startling comment about you dying. He will then note that he can't read minds, he just picks up on everything he hears and is able to deduce what's going on with various individuals.
Objectives:
Stop the vandal.
Talk to Brendan.

Reach the stash.
Search the stash.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Add use of {{Condition}}]
To receive this job, V must have resolved amicably the dispute between Kerry Eurodyne and Us Cracks during I Don't Wanna Hear It and completed Off the Leash.
Some time after completing the prerequisite jobs, V will receive a call from Blue Moon, who asks them to help her dealing with a stalker that has sent death threats. If asked, the only clue she can provide is that he signs his letters "GC". Her plan is to go for a stroll around Kabuki Roundabout to lure the stalker out so V can catch him in the act. Then she wants V to teach him a lesson without killing him, because that would be bad for Us Cracks' image. V agrees to the plan and meets Blue Moon at Kabuki Roundabout. She will walk through part of the lower level of the roundabout, turn into an alley to the market and then go up to the footbridge.
Right after starting the operation, V notices a suspicious person on the upper level who starts taking photos of Blue Moon. Confronting him will complete the optional objective "Make sure the stalker isn't lurking on any level of Kabuki Roundabout.". When questioned, he will say he is taking pictures of Blue Moon to sell them. If asked whether he has noticed anything out of the ordinary, he will point out a girl in green who is in every single photo he has taken.
Scanning her reveals that her name is Griselda Martinez. She has a brown ponytail, a green tank top and a pink rabbit backpack. She can be first seen leaning against a wall while Blue Moon is talking to V, then starts following at street level with her head turned towards Blue Moon, who is on the lower level. She will lean against the railing while Blue Moon is confronted by a group of 5 Animals who think they recognize her. After passing them, Blue Moon will stop to browse a magazine display. At this point Griselda will approach her, asking to take a picture together and saying her name is Green Cloud.
If V has been told the stalker's letters were signed GC, they can confront Griselda about her nickname and how she signs her letters, making her hostile. Otherwise, she can still be questioned, but, without any proof, she will just walk away. If followed, she will go to the nearby Weapon Vendor and, if asked what is she doing in a gun shop, she becomes nervous and attacks V.
Alternatively, V can keep following Blue Moon until she reaches the middle of the footbridge, where Green Cloud reappears in front of her, pulling a gun and starting to rant. V should quickly incapacitate Green Cloud before she shoots and kills Blue Moon, failing the job.
In any case, after neutralizing Green Cloud, V can search her body to find a Disturbing Diary and a Marred Still of Blue Moon, a picture with the eyes cut out.
With the stalker revealed and unconscious, Blue Moon asks V what to do. They can either tell her to let the NCPD handle things, or simply kill the stalker. If Green Cloud is killed, Blue Moon will be briefly dismayed. V will justify themselves by saying that stalking is not punished with lifetime imprisonment, and they would have eventually attacked Blue Moon again. If V tells Blue Moon to let the police handle it, she will be worried about the stalker attacking again, with V telling her to simply give them another call in such an event. There are no consequences for either option. Blue Moon leaves and will send V payment soon after.
Objectives:
Go to the meeting spot and wait for Blue Moon.
Make sure the stalker isn't lurking on any level of Kabuki Roundabout. [Optional]
Find the stalker and don't let Blue Moon get hurt.
Defeat the stalker.
Find evidence you got the right person.
Wait for Blue Moon next to the stalker.
Talk to Blue Moon.
Decide the stalker's fate.
Tell Blue Moon that the stalker should go to prison. [Optional]
Kill the stalker. [Optional]
Talk to Blue Moon.

Walkthrough:
This one requires you to complete the main job Transmission first to then open up the side job Send in the Clowns which needs to be completed for this. As such, you can actually end up doing the championship fight in Beat on the Brat with Razor Hugh before you get this one based on how you completed other quests.
You'll be fighting in the large, dry pool area, so you'll have plenty of room to evade. That said, your major concern is Ozob's nose: it is a live grenade so if you hit it wrong too many times, you could set it off.
Ozob's grenade nose will detonate after accumulating about 75% of his health in damage to his head. This instantly kills Ozob and V wins by "technical knockout" and must talk to the referee standing on the side of the pool to get the reward money and complete the quest.
Objectives:
Go to the fight in Pacifica.
Talk to Ozob.
Defeat Ozob.
If V beats Ozob without detonating his grenade nose:
Talk to Ozob.
If V targets Ozob's face until his nose detonates:
Talk to the referee.

Walkthrough:
You don't need to put up anything for this fist fight, as Rhino notes this is only for fun/making a name for yourself.
That said, Rhino is a hard hitter, where 2-3 punches can knock you out, so make sure to make ample use of dodging techniques to avoid her punches.
Objectives:
Talk to the Animals champion.
Defeat Rhino.
Talk to the Animals champion.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
As you approach the Monokatana Workshop located on Raymond Street in Japantown, Wakako Okada will call you with an available contract to free Bradley Costigan's wife, Lauren. She is being held in the basement of the workshop by Tyger Claws.
Objectives:
Get inside the workshop.
Find Lauren Costigan.
Rescue Lauren Costigan.
Escort Lauren out of the building.
Talk to Lauren.

Walkthrough:
The quest automatically initiates as you approach the Desert Film Set, located at Jeff's Dirt Track to the east-northeast of Rocky Ridge town in the region of the same name in the Badlands. Upon arrival, an Trauma Team Atlus can be seen flying away, leaving behind a scene of carnage: Multiple dead bodies, some wearing the uniforms of the Wraiths, and others, oddly enough, sporting very out-of-place high end clothing, something more likely to be seen on a Media; also present is an admittedly nice-looking Thorton Colby CX410 "Gran Butte".
After a little searching, V finds a shard on one of the apparent victims which tells the story: Evidently, the executive of some high-end clothing business got it in his head to do a photoshoot out here, as a way of demonstrating the versatility and comfort of their clothing line and appealing to a more "rustic" sense of fashion, with the Butte being the centerpiece as a stand-in for an executive limo or sports car. Such activity attracted the Wraiths, who decided that they'd rather shoot bullets than pictures at the unfortunate models. Said models, however, were savvy enough to bring their own iron for just such an occasion, and a firefight ensued between the two sides. What was left of the photoshoot team fled in the AV, leaving their set, and their prized Thorton Colby, behind for the taking-and better for it to be in V's capable hands than the Raffen Shiv.
Objectives:
Search the area.
Get in the car.

Walkthrough:
After a set amount of time (can be approximately eight in-game days) after Skippy has changed firing modes, he will reveal that he has found data on its previous owner, Regina Jones. The gun will then ask you to return him to her. The mission will be added to you journal even if you decline to follow Skippy's request.
If you ask Regina about Skippy, she will remark that he was stolen, and asks you to set him down so she can run a diagnostics test. After she runs the test, Regina says that either a deeper test is required (if Skippy is set to Stone Cold Killer mode) or she will reset Skippy to his default factory settings and rename him "Daisy" (if Skippy is set to Puppy-Loving Pacifist mode).
You can then ask her where she got Skippy (won in a poker game), or whether V is going to be compensated for their trouble. If Skippy was reset, there is also the option to accuse Regina of killing Skippy. She will dismiss the accusation because the gun has no consciousness. After receiving the reward, the quest ends.
Objectives:
Take Skippy to Regina Jones.
Set Skippy down.
Talk to Regina.

Go to the fight in Kabuki.

Walkthrough:
V witnesses local residents mourning of Jason Foreman in a dirty courtyard in Longshore Stacks. Mr. Hands instructed them to speak to Briana, the client. Briana explains that one the Stacks' younger residents, Jason Foreman, has recently been killed by a BARGHEST super killer, Leon Rinder.
V has to use their scanner to investigate the clues around the courtyard, mostly holes in the wall splashed with blood, massive footprints in the mud, a box of fired bullets and a fallen failsafe on the roof of a nearby container.
Then Briana gives V a encrypted shard to read. A hacking puzzle unlocks it. A conversation between Jason and Slava Makarov, a scavenger, leads V to a former motel in Pacifica, Los Osos. Jason was indeed an intermediary between a man supplying top-tier Militech chrome and the scavengers.
V can investigate new clues in the former motel - now a scavengers' hideout - to learn more about Rinder's actions. Rinder himself is locked in a room on third floor and is guarded by a heavily chromed scavenger. V finds out that most of Rinder's chrome has been sold to scavengers by Rinder himself. He reaches for a pistol when V enters, but in his convalescent state, he only manages to knock it out of his own reach.
If V has investigated the area:
Completing the Investigate the area. [Optional] objective unlocks the dialog option "Whatever I did"? Let me enlighten you. when V confronts Rinder.
It appears that one of Slava Makarov's suggestions pushed Jason into agressively demanding a bigger share to the supplier, Leon Rinder, which may have contributed to his death by leading the latter into cyberpsychosis.
If V decides to kill Rinder:
Take Rinder's dog tags from his body and bring them to Briana Dolson to complete the gig.
If V decides it is not worth killing Rinder:
Take Rinder's dog tags and bring them to Briana Dolson to complete the gig.
If V decides to spare Rinder and accept his deal:
Leon gives V the coordinates of his personal stash, a garage in Terra Cognita, starting the quest Addicted To Chaos. Take Rinder's dog tags and bring them to Briana Dolson to complete the gig.
If V makes Rinder call Regina:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite from V's perspective]
When questioning Rinder after completing the Investigate the area. [Optional] objective, choosing the dialogue option "Whatever I did"? Let me enlighten you. will make V realize that Rinder suffers from cyberpsychosis.
You must also choose Put gun to Rinder's head | Choose your next words carefully dialog option, which will give you an option to force Rinder to contact Regina Jones for help.
If you choose to send Rinder to Regina, you will still get his dog tags to finish the gig. He will also send you the coordinates to his stash, starting the mission Addicted To Chaos. After a few days Rinder will contact you via text message and will thank you for making him contact Regina. Some time after that, Rinder will text V again, this time saying he wants to take responsibility and compensate the community for his bad deeds. He intends to offer Briana some eddies, conceding that it "won't change much" and is "prolly[sic] gonk anyway." V can either encourage or discourage this idea. Allowing Rinder to contact Briana proves his intuition correct. Briana will pull V aside the next time V visits that area of the Longshore Stacks to berate V for not honoring the intent of the gig's contract. She says that she doesn't believe she will ever forgive Rinder, and revealing his true fate to the others would 'break' them due to lack of closure. At the end of her tirade, she declares that V is no longer welcome in her area of the Stacks.
Objectives:
Meet with Briana during the evening vigil (10pm-6am)
Talk to Briana.
Follow Briana.
Talk to Briana.
Crack the shard.
Investigate the area. [Optional]
Go to the old motel.
Find Rinder.
Find Rinder on the third floor.
Defeat the enemy.
Get to Rinder.
Confront Rinder.
Take Rinder's dog tag.
Exit the building.
Deliver the dog tag to Briana.

Walkthrough:
After acquiring the plans from Mr. Hands, V enters the Black Sapphire via the flooded tunnels that connect to the maintenance area of the hotel. After an underwater section at the tunnels and defeating some enemies at the maintenance zone, they are tasked with helping with making a meet with Solomon Reed.
To unite, a bridge must be drawn and Reed has access to the control panel. V has to take control of a mounted Rasetsu sniper rifle and help gather intel and eliminate targets to securely escort Reed to the panel. Reuniting with Reed, they take the elevator up to the party and infiltrate.
After reaching the floor, they join the party where lots of celebrities or important figures of Night City are. After a while, as she promised, Songbird reaches out to V. Songbird says that Kurt Hansen has the cure, which she is expected to work on with two netrunners who are currently attending the party. She is then whisked away by Hansen and she re-establishes the connection via the Relic.
To attend the upcoming meeting that Hansen, Songbird and the two netrunners are going to have, V needs to impersonate one of the runners. To impersonate them, V needs to have their behavioral imprints scanned. V joins the netrunner siblings playing roulette. To scan their behavior, V asks the siblings questions to provoke emotions from them to get scanned. Just as the roulette game ends, Hansen joins them and says that he knows that V is an NUS agent, threatening V and kicking V and Reed out the hotel. They then leaves the party and then is escorted out of the hotel.

Walkthrough:
Some time after a romantic relationship has been established, V is contacted by their partner expressing an interest in meeting up. V and their date agree to meet up at one of V's apartments except Kress Street Hideout due to safety concerns in Dogtown.
During the date, a number of activities can be engaged in.
Conversation - V will be able to engage in a selection of small talk with their date.
Cuddling - V will be able to cuddle with their date. When cuddling V can kiss their date as well as engage in another selection of dialogue. This can be done on sofas, and in some of V's apartments there will be additional areas (such as by a window) in which an embrace or kiss is possible.
Showering - If V takes a shower while their date is in the apartment, their date will join them.
Mirror - If V uses the bathroom mirror during the date, there's a chance their date will briefly join them at the mirror.
Dancing - Many of V's apartments have an area where V can dance, and their date will join in and dance with them.
Sleeping - If V decides to sleep their date will join them in bed.
The date will end when either V or their partner leaves the apartment.

Walkthrough:
Some time after deciding which Samurai band member will play during the reunion and rescuing Nancy Hartley from the Totentanz, Nancy calls V, telling them that they are ready for the Samurai reunion at the Red Dirt bar.
When V arrives at the bar in the evening, Nancy asks that V open the guitar case. To Johnny and V's surprise, it is Johnny's old guitar, which was kept in a private collection. Nancy mentions that Kerry should be there momentarily, and that he will bring Drausin from Cutthroat with him to stand in for the missing bandmember.
If V chose Denny during Second Conflict:
When V talks to Denny, she will mention that she helped Henry get with a new band, which helped him quit using drugs. When things started to go well for Henry, he proceeded to remove her from his live again, until a month later Denny stumbled upon Henry again, living on the streets because his new pals threw him out because he was acting up again, but she just left him there and made sure that he would not figure out where she was staying. When asked about how she feels about playing with Samurai again, she says that it feels weird, especially because Johnny isn't here, and that she misses him.
If V chose Henry during Second Conflict:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
V was able to talk with Henry, he may explain that when he hit rock bottom, Denny left him, and that she refused to talk to him. He also mentions to V that Kerry helped him get ready for the gig.
After talking with Nancy, V goes to the bathroom to discreetly take the Pseudoendotrizine, and allows Johnny to take over.
When Johnny returns in the main room, Kerry and Drausin have arrived. After a brief conversation, once the group is ready, it will cut to the group on stage. The group then starts playing "A Like Supreme."[Notes 2][Notes 3][Notes 4]
After playing, Johnny and Kerry sitting at the bar, talking to each other. Johnny gifts Kerry the guitar, and gives V back control of their body. In return, Kerry gifts V the Archangel, his iconic Overture, and leaves the bar.[Notes 5]
Objectives:
Wait a day for Nancy's call.
Talk to Nancy.
Go to the Red Dirt in the evening.
If it is not evening yet:
Wait until evening.
Talk to Nancy.
Go to the bathroom and take the pills.
Take the pills to give Johnny control.
Go back to the main room in Red Dirt.
Talk to Kerry.
Perform with Kerry.
Talk to Johnny.

Walkthrough: The Zen master can be found just south of Muamar Reyes's usual location, overlooking a westward facing cliff just off the paved road in Jackson Plains. V can open conversation with different questions, though the Zen Master will only answer one, and may indicate he is aware of V's predicament with Johnny. He will then offer a meditation BD, with his usual payment condition. V can pay either nothing, or around 600 eddies for the practice. The final meditation is on the element of air, and like the previous sessions, the Zen Master will disappear after it ends. A shard, his robes, and his altar-necklace are left behind, and V can take his altar as an apartment decoration. Johnny will be seated next to the Zen Master's robes and through conversation, implies he did not see the Zen Master at all, and suggests V speak with Misty about the experience.
Objectives:
Approach the Zen master.
Talk to the Zen master.
Talk to Johnny.

Walkthrough:
After talking with Takemura at Tom's Diner on Urmland Street, you receive a text message from El Capit√°n that his chooms Bob and Emma from EZEstates have some new digs for you to check out on their website.
After checking out the new EZEstates website in your current apartment, you see that there are four new apartments that you are able to rent. For the The Glen Apartment you just need to put down 80,000 eddies through an online transfer or visit the apartment in person to acquire access.
The apartment can be found in a hotel on Palms View Way in The Glen, Heywood.
Objectives:
Rent the The Glen apartment: (‚Ç¨$80,000, one-time fee)
Go to the The Glen apartment.

Walkthrough:
In the south side of Santo Domingo, you will come across a group of homeless men crowded around a corpo briefcase, unable to open it. You can convince them to hand it over before they get hurt, either by threatening them (requires Body) or paying them off.
Once the briefcase is V's, you will be tasked to find the body of its former owner, who can be found by following a scannable blood trail to the nearby dumpsters. From the corpse of the hapless corpo, you will retrieve an access card that can be used to open the locked briefcase. Alternatively, you can hack it open (requires Intelligence). Either way, open the file launch.exe on the computer; this will send a signal triggering something to drop from orbit. You will be directed to a new objective about two kilometers to the south, in the Badlands.
Go to the new marker, but be wary of a Militech response team that was also dispatched to the area. All seven soldiers will need to be taken out before the pod can be accessed. Once done, open the pod, and Johnny will comment it is a valuable painting, likely from a wealthy highrider on the moon.
Once looted, the Untitled 18 ‚Äì Brancesi, 2021 will be on display in V's Apartment.
Objectives:
Talk to the bums.
Find the body of the suitcase's owner.
Examine the suitcase. [Optional]
If the body was found:
Slot the access shard into the suitcase.
Browse the files on the computer.
Go to the drop point.
Defeat all enemies. [0/7]
Open the package.
Talk to Johnny.

Neutralize Bruce Ward.
Neutralize the remaining Wraiths.

Walkthrough:
The grounds are a razor-wire fenced area with many unlighted areas at night. In addition to the named character John Quaid, there are about 5 unnamed others, either Security Guards or Veteran Guards.
Once the guards are neutralized, a backpack container in a well-lit area somewhat near the gate will have a conversation datashard and assorted items, and the looting of which will end the first part of the quest.
Once the unnamed scanner hustle is complete, a second quest will be triggered. It will lead to a body on the roof of a nearby building which previously held 3 of the guards. The body can be seen prior to this but was locked, and has another conversation datashard and assorted loot.
Objectives:
Neutralize any ongoing threat and secure evidence.
Go to the dealer's stash.

Walkthrough:
Some time after meeting Takemura, Meredith will message V to let them know that everything has worked out following the raid on the All Foods Factory. V then sends a flirtatious reply to Meredith, after which she tells V to meet her at the No-Tell Motel in Kabuki, Watson.
Upon reaching the room at the hotel, V'll be greeted by a provocatively dressed Meredith, who comments that they probably didn't expect to see her there. V will ask what happens next, and a cutscene of the two having a romantic scene will play out. Afterwards, Meredith will bid V farewell, leaving behind a reward, and sending a text message.[N 1]
Objectives:
Go to the First floor of the No-Tell Motel.
Talk to Meredith Stout.
Spend the night at the No-Tell Motel.

The cyberpsycho, Cedric Muller, a member of the Red Ocher Nomad clan, is located at a parking lot near the fast travel point "Downtown Central" in Downtown, City Center.
Objectives:
Find the cyberpsycho.
Neutralize the threat.
