Neutralize all enemies.
Neutralize Tom Ayer.
Neutralize remaining Maelstroms.

Walkthrough:
This facility has a number of ways to enter it and 8 active cameras, so you'll need to tread carefully if you want to do stealth. Note also that you have to drive the van away, so if you don't want to deal with a firefight later on, make sure to take out the guards at the front entrance where the closed bay doors are.
You can enter the facility through one of the two gates or, for a discreet entry, through one of the openings in the fence (there's an opening near each gate). Once inside the fencing, you can enter the main building itself either through the doors on the first floor or climb up to the roof where there's a door into the stairwell or an open window to a small hallway. Note if you use the window, one of the cameras is here so make sure to take care of it before entering if doing stealth.
To get access to the van, you'll need to enter the room that the above camera was right above with a lone guard. Take them out, then access the computer to authorize you as a driver. Now you just need to get to the van downstairs and drive it to the destination.
Objectives:
Go to the Revere Courier Services facility.
Gain access to the van using the main computer.
Enter the van.
Drive the van to the indicated location.
Exit the van.

Walkthrough:
V starts out looking into the mirror while stress-vomiting in the sink of a bathroom located in the Arasaka Tower. After briefly speaking with their longtime friend Jackie Welles over the holo, V is called by their superior, Arthur Jenkins, who is upset because of a major data leak in Frankfurt that has put the corporation's operations at risk, and he orders them to his office, though V is able to freely walk into their own office and read emails located on the desk before reporting to Jenkins.
V finds Jenkins ordering a cyberattack against the European Space Agency council to delay their vote on revoking Arasaka's lunar base licenses. Jenkins is called by an angered Susan Abernathy‚Äîhis superior and rival in the Arasaka Special Operations branch‚Äîwho berates him for the attack and threatens to discipline him later. Already chafing under Abernathy due to her having smeared his name in Osaka to steal a promotion from him, Jenkins orders V to take her out, giving them a datashard containing all of Abernathy's personal information and a large sum of eurodollars.
Arthur tells V to use their underworld contacts to off her once and for all and provides them with paper eddies to pay for the work. Afterwards, V gets into an Arasaka AV that takes them to Lizzie's Bar in Watson. Landing on the roof, V is confronted by basketball players upset about the court being a landing pad for a corporate AV; V may either subdue them with a lightning attack, or simply threaten them into submission, before approaching the Mox door guard, who lets V in.
Inside the bar V meets up with Jackie, explaining the situation to him and requesting his help, but Jackie, seeing the extreme risk involved in working for Arasaka, refuses. However, before V can convince him otherwise or get an alternate plan started, the pair is interrupted by Arasaka agents. They reveal that Abernathy is already aware of the hit ordered against her and demands them to hand over the datashard given to V by Jenkins. V initially refuses, so they strip V of their corporate privileges and disables their cyberware, forcing them to hand over the shard and finalizing V's termination from the corporation. The Arasaka agents then attempt to take V into custody as well, as a "favor" to Abernathy, but Jackie intercepts them, pointing out that they are isolated from the rest of their compatriots and that a firefight in unfamiliar territory could end badly for them, which convinces the agents to leave V alone. The mission ends with V, still woozy from their disabled cybernetics, losing their balance and falling to the floor, to which Jackie helps them back on their feet, setting off to start their journey together.
Objectives:
Leave the bathroom.
Head to Jenkins' office.
Talk to your old acquaintance. [Optional]
Sit.
Watch the vote.
Talk to Jenkins.
Take the datashard.
Take the money.
Leave Jenkins' office.
Go to the AV garage.
Talk to Jackie.
Read the report on your personal terminal. [Optional]
Get in Jenkins' AV.
Deal with the locals.
Head to Lizzie's.
Talk to the bouncer.
Meet with Jackie.
Sit with Jackie.
Talk to Jackie.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
After a brief conversation with Jackie Welles at Misty's Esoterica, he tells V that he's arranged a meeting for them with a local fixer, Dexter DeShawn, about a job. V heads to Dex's limo, which is a short walk from Misty's. During the meeting, which takes place in the limo, V is told about a job to steal an experimental biochip from Arasaka.
Dex mentions that the Maelstrom gang ambushed a Militech convoy and stole the experimental Flathead drone, which will be needed for the job, and that Meredith Stout, a Militech corporate agent, could help V obtain it from the gang. He also suggests paying a visit to the client for the job, Evelyn Parker.
After Dex drops V off at Kabuki Roundabout, V calls Jackie to bring him up to speed about what went down during the meeting, and asks if V plans to visit Maelstrom or Evelyn first.
Objectives:
Talk to Jackie.
Meet with Dex.
Get into Dex's limo.
Talk to Dex.
Exit the limo.
Call Jackie.
Talk to Jackie.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
After sparing Leon Rinder's life during Gig: The Man Who Killed Jason Foreman, Leon flicks you the coordinates of his garage near Terra Cognita. He will send V a text message with the code "1975" so that they can open the door.
Inside the garage is Leon Rinder's Computer as well as a cache containing the Iconic DB-2 Testera Dezerter.
Objectives:
Go to Rinder's Stash
Enter code 1975 to open the garage.
Take Rinder's things.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìùReason: Needs a more information about what happens after each dialogue choice
Johnny will ask V to call Rogue and ask her out on his behalf, to try and make up for never taking her out properly in the past. As V calls Rogue, V asks her where she would want to go if the two went on a date, which she answers with the old drive-in movie theater named Silver Pixel Cloud in North Oak. V says they'll swing by the Afterlife to pick her up.
If the current time is not in the evening:
Rogue sends V a text message informing them that she is currently engaged with other things and asks that they come in evening.
V meets Rogue at the Afterlife during the evening, where she can be seen talking with Emmerick Bronson‚Äîwho appears to be disappointed Rogue is going out on a date with V.
If V obtained the Porsche 911 Turbo (930):
Rogue asks V how they obtained the car and will remark on having a lot of memories in the car.[Notes 2]
Rogue and V get in the car and drive to the theater. During the ride, Rogue tells V that it was originally her idea to take Johnny to the movie theater, and that Johnny's idea of a romantic night out was raiding Arasaka Towers. After a while she will ask what Johnny's motive is, to which V will reply that Johnny has changed and is a more selfless person, and wants to make up for his past.
Arriving at the Silver Pixel Cloud, they discover that the place has been shut down and locked up. V searches around and finds a usable access code on the nearby terminal and is able to open the door.[Notes 3]
Inside the cinema premises, Rogue will walk over to a nearby car wreck, while V goes up a staircase to reach the projector room. When V starts up the projector, which will play Bushid≈ç X: Fade to Black, they subsequently surrender control to Johnny by taking the Pseudoendotrizine.
Johnny heads down the stairs and sits next to Rogue on the car and reminisces about the past while they watch the movie. After a while, Johnny asks Rogue if this is how she'd imagine a date between them going, to which she replies that she'd always expected that some change was needed, just not to the current degree. She asks Johnny to pretend it is 2015, and asks if there is anything he would change since then.[Notes 4] Johnny answers her question, which causes her to become emotional and think about what ifs and all that.
If Johnny kisses Rogue:
A short romantic scene will play out between Rogue and Johnny, but Rogue interrupts it as it doesn't feel right. She confesses to Johnny that she is no longer the same person as she was before and that is just isn't going to work anymore. Rogue will promptly leave the drive-in theater, as Johnny gives back control to V by taking an Omega blocker.
If Johnny tells Rogue he doesn't have much to offer:
Johnny tells Rogue that he doesn't have much to offer right now, to which she replies that he has more to offer now than he did back then. Johnny admits that he messed up, and that he could have just been himself around her, without having to pretend or pose. Rogue responds to this by telling Johnny that it is too late now and that she's no longer the Rogue he knew back in 2015. She suggests that they just continue watching the movie, after which Rogue will leave, and Johnny will give back control to V by taking an Omega blocker.
After Rogue's departure, Johnny asks that V meet with Kerry Eurodyne.
Objectives:
Call Rogue and ask her out.
Talk to Rogue.
If it is not evening:
Go pick up Rogue at the Afterlife in the evening.
Wait until evening.
Talk to Rogue.
Get in the car.
Go to the drive-in movie theater with Rogue.
Talk to Rogue.
Find a way in the drive-in movie theater.
Use code 0000 to unlock the door.
Enter the drive-in movie theater.
Get into the projection booth.
Search the storage area.
Take the pills to give Johnny control.
Talk to Johnny.
Notes[]


‚Üë The title of this job comes from the in-universe Samurai song "Blistering Love.

‚Üë The vehicle is automatically called if it has been obtained during Chippin' In.

‚Üë The door authorization code is 0000.

‚Üë Rogue asking Johnny to pretend it is 2015 is likely an error or a test from Rogue, as Rogue and Johnny already had met at that time.

Walkthrough:
While descending on the elevator after rescuing Sandra Dorsett from the Scavengers, V calls Wakako Okada that the gig has been successfully completed. Wakako tells V that they should come by when they have to chance to do so for their reward.
Once V has recovered from their injuries sustained from Konpeki Plaza, the NCPD lockdown in Watson has been lifted, and they will be able to visit Wakako Okada at her Pachinko Parlor on Jig-Jig Street in Japantown, to discuss the reward for the rescue of Sandra Dorsett. She transfers V ‚Ç¨$3,380 and instructs them to visit Cassius Ryder's ripperdoc clinic to obtain a Tattoo: Tyger Claws Dermal Imprint for free.
Objectives:
Wait for the lockdown to end.
Collect your reward from Wakako.
Collect your free reward from Cassius Ryder's ripperdoc shop inventory.

Walkthrough:
If Johnny went on a date with Rogue during Blistering Love:
After the disastrous date with Rogue Amendiares at the Silver Pixel Cloud, Johnny Silverhand asks that V goes to the North Oak Sign in North Oak.
If V did not give Johnny a second chance during Chippin' In:
After talking with Johnny at the Northern Oilfields, he asks that V goes to the North Oak Sign in North Oak.
Johnny says that he wants V to go to Kerry Eurodyne's villa so that he can talk to his old friend, since he heard news that he is depressed and attempted suicide.
When V enters the villa, Kerry is taking a shower and V can give control to Johnny near the guitar displays.[Notes 1]
After giving control to Johnny by taking the Pseudoendotrizine, Johnny picks up a guitar and plays some of his old tunes. Alerted by the music, Kerry hastily jumps out of the shower with his revolver in hand, but almost immediately recognizes Johnny from the way that he plays the guitar. The two catch up and talk about their past lives.
Johnny asks Kerry if he'd be interested in getting the old Samurai back together to do a gig, which Kerry agrees to. Johnny is asked to get Nancy Hartley on board while Kerry arranges everyone else.
When V calls Nancy, her assistant, Steven, picks up instead and tells V that she has been missing for two days after having gone to the Totentanz to investigate a story.
Objectives:
Meet Johnny by the North Oak sign.
Talk to Johnny.
Enter Kerry's property.
Find Kerry in his villa.
Talk to Johnny.
Follow Kerry.
Sit and drink with Kerry.
Call Nancy.

Use your scanner to find traces of the cyberpsycho.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
V needs to get in touch with the local fixer Mr. Hands to get intel about Black Sapphire. To have a meeting arranged V has to do gigs for Mr. Hands and make him trust them more.
After having done at least 3 Gigs for him, he invites V to Heavy Hearts to have a chat. Hands will talk about his plan to undermine Kurt Hansen and talk about the origins of Dogtown. Later Hands will give you the plans of Black Sapphire.
After V leaves Heavy Hearts V will call Reed and he will ask V to join him and Alex over at The Moth. After reaching The Moth V will collapse due to Relic malfunction and Reed will proceed to tell his backstory to V and lead them down to Alex's hideout where he will talk about his past with his old crew including Songbird until Alex shows up.
After arriving at her hideout Alex will lay down the plan she set up to breach into Black Sapphire.[N 1]
Objectives:
Call Mr. Hands.
Talk to Mr. Hands.
If you have not yet completed three Gigs for Mr. Hands:
Complete at least three gigs for Mr. Hands.
If you have completed three or more Gigs for Mr. Hands:
Wait a few hours for Mr. Hands.
Talk to Mr. Hands.
Read the message from Mr. Hands.
Go to the Heavy Hearts club.
Enter code 2589 on the terminal.
Reach the private floor.
Talk to Mr. Hands.
Leave the club.
Call Reed and send him the data.
Meet with Reed at The Moth.
Talk to Reed.
Follow Reed.
Ride the elevator down.
Talk to Reed.
Talk to Alex and Reed.
Grab the diving suit.
Examine the contents of the box.
Talk to Reed.

Walkthrough:
This section requires expanding. Click here to add more.üìù
After escaping from Arasaka's clutches at the Redwood Market in Japantown, you are contacted by Goro Takemura. He has brought Hanako Arasaka to his safe house inside an Abandoned Apartment Building on Vine Street in Vista del Rey, Heywood, and tells you to knock four times on the door to safely get inside.
Once you arrive at the safe house, head to apartment 303 on the third floor and knock on the door four times, Takemura will open the and tell you to hurry up inside. Once inside, you talk with Takemura and sit down with Hanako, to whom you will explain the situation around her father's death.
Hanako will not answer to any word you say, and weird sounds are coming from the hallway. Takemura instructs you to check out what is happening. Shortly afterwards, Arasaka forces breach the safe house, leaving you to fight your way outside to safety once more.
Note:
After Arasaka forces breach the apartment building, it is possible to save Takemura from Arasaka's forces. You can fight your way back up to the third floor, or use the Fortified Ankles/Reinforced Tendons if you have them installed. You and Goro Takemura will then both fight your way outside. If he is not saved, he will not appear during The Devil ending if it is chosen during Nocturne Op55N1, and you won't be able to get The Devil achievement (even if you choose to side with Arasaka at the end).
After escaping the apartment building, you retreat to the Sunset Motel in Red Peaks, the Badlands and speak with Johnny Silverhand. A person arrives and knocks on your room. After letting them in, you find out it is a Proxy for Hanako. She wants to meet with you.
Objectives:
Get to the hideout.
Knock on the door.
Talk to Takemura.
Talk to Hanako Arasaka.
Check the door.
Return to Takemura.
Leave the building.
Try to save Goro Takemura [Optional].
Escape the apartment [Optional].
Leave the building.
Talk to Johnny.
Approach the door.
Talk to the stranger.
Talk to Johnny.

Go to the abandoned car.
Get the loot from the car.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Rewrite from V's perspective while using {{Condition}}. See our quest guide.]
Talk to the BuryGer diner owner and select a drink, but as you do and look around, 3 gangers show up to rob the place.
If you have enough money ($2900‚Äî$8400), you can hand over the money.
If you have at least 7‚Äî10 Body points, can scare them off.
If you have the Streetkid Lifepath, you can warn them that they're on foreign turf, scaring them off.
If you don't choose a timed reaction, you'll have to fight the 3 instead.
If you scared them off, the diner owner will be happy, saying the drinks are free. If you don't make either the Body or Streetkid Lifepath dialogue choices and end up killing the 3 gangers, the owner will demand you leave the place for taking lives just to save a few eddies.
If you got into a fight but didn't kill the gangers (e.g. using lethal weapons or lethal quickhacks), the diner owner will be glad and say that the drinks are on the house (just like if you had made the Body or Streetkid Lifepath dialogue choices).
Objectives: Talk to the diner owner.

Walkthrough:
Approximately two days after the race in Santo Domingo, V is contacted by Claire Russell with the details for the final race starting on Pardey street in Charter Hill, Westbrook.
When V arrives at the starting location of the race, they contact Claire to inform them that they are there. On the phone, Claire asks V which vehicle they'll want to use for the race, and recommends that V picks a car that is fast, as the race will be a highway race. After hanging up, V leans against the wall and waits for everyone to arrive.
As V approaches Claire, they hear heated arguing going on, as Claire and Peter Sampson are butting heads. As soon as Peter spots V, he starts to antagonize Claire even more, and suggests that V should get out while they can, since Claire gets her drivers killed. Sampson continues to verbally attack Claire, claiming that her late husband got himself killed as he took on more than he bargained for and that his ego got the better of him. V, unable to calm the situation down, can do nothing but watch. Sampson gets in his vehicle and gets one more jeer from Claire before she storms off to the vehicle she and V will be competing in.
After starting the race, Claire wants V to stick close to Sampson so they can follow him. Two thirds into the race, Peter Sampson's car will get in trouble and has to veer off from the highway. Claire urges V to follow him.
If V decides to follow Peter Sampson:
They drive off the highway only to watch Sampson collide with another car soon after. Claire and V exit their vehicle and sees Sampson crawling out.[N 1]
If V decides they want to finish the race:
Claire gets mad at V, claiming it was the one chance she had at giving Peter Sampson justice. After crossing the finish line, she will need a moment to cool off before wanting to talk to V.
Once the two talk, Claire angrily asks V if it was worth winning the race over delivering justice to Peter. After talking, Claire departs.[N 2]
If V wins the race:
V is paid 5,790 eurodollars for winning.
Objectives:
Head to the Big Race.
Call Claire to start the race.
Lean against the wall and wait for Claire.
Approach Claire.
Talk to Claire.
Get in Claire's vehicle/Get in your vehicle.
Wait for the race to start.
Stay close to Sampson.
Finish the race. [Optional]
Follow Sampson or continue the race.
If V decides to follow Sampson:
Follow Sampson.
If V decides they want to finish the race:
Finish the race.
Stop the vehicle.
Talk to Claire.

This quest becomes available after completing Just Another Story at least 7 times:
Muamar will contact V about a gig, telling them to drop all other deliveries for now (despite this, players can still continue to do courier missions as normal if so desired), and will ask to meet at his hangout by the dam. Upon arrival Muamar will be seen arguing with Ayden Daniels, before the latter leaves. Muamar will tell V about a gig to steal an Arasaka truck from the docks, with Daniels providing support, before walking off sullen. Johnny Silverhand will appear telling V to follow Muamar to ask what's wrong. Speak to Muamar about what's troubling him, then after the conversation finishes go to the Arasaka Port by the City Center in Corpo Plaza.
At the docks, find and speak to Daniels first, who will tell V what to look for: a Behemoth truck aboard the ship docked there, with several guards within the compound on watch. Regardless of whether the player gets to the truck stealthily or not, once V boards the truck an alarm will be rung with several Arasaka squads hitting the docks soon afterwards, with a firefight breaking out between Arasaka and Daniels. Players have the option of getting out of the truck to save Daniels at this point, or leaving him to his fate by driving off with the truck.
If V gets out to save Daniels, Arasaka will have more time to set up roadblocks along the escape route and some of the medical equipment in the truck will get damaged along the way. Muamar will comment on this later, Daniels will message V angrily about this.
If V leaves Daniels behind he will die, but none of the equipment will get damaged.
Drive the truck to the marked garage by Santo Domingo in Arroyo, making sure to eliminate any pursuing Arasaka enemies on the road.
Once the truck has been delivered, talk to Muamar, who will then reward V with a Herrera Outlaw "Weiler" at the garage.
Objectives:
Meet El Capitan by the dam.
Talk to El Capitan.
Go to the Arasaka docks.
Read the message from Daniels. [Optional]
Meet with Daniels at the docks.
Talk to Daniels.
Get onto the Arasaka cargo ship.
Find the Arasaka Truck on the cargo ship.
Get in Truck.
Deliver the vehicle to the garage.
Save Daniels. [Optional]
Check on Daniels. [Optional]
Deliver the vehicle to the garage.
Talk to El Capitan.
Get in the car.

Walkthrough:
V must navigate the Biotechnica Hotel, which is divided into three accessible floors (lobby, floor 19, and the roof) that are swarming with Biotechnica security guards and robots, to eliminate Joanne Koch. She is wanted by the Red Ocher, a nomad clan that lost 70 members to the effects of a virus test run for Koch's pet project, codenamed Nightingale. Koch can be killed on the spot, or incapacitated and airlifted out of the building for Red Ochre to deal with personally.
First, V must reach Koch's apartment. The lobby of the hotel is patrolled by several guards and monitored by surveillance cameras and a turret. All of this can be bypassed by entering through an unlocked side door around the side the building with the police cordon, which leads into a small staff office with a single worker inside. A computer in the room can be used to view or disable the lobby cameras. Bypass or eliminate the worker, then head out the office door and turn right to find the elevator. Alternatively, the other side of the building has a door that can be opened with sufficient Technical Ability.
The 19th floor is covered by more guards, dormant robots, and cameras. One guard patrols the atrium outside the elevator, and others are inside a security office at the end of the corridor opposite the elevator. At the intersection, head left to a cluster of apartment entrances and an access door to the roof that is covered by a single camera. Sufficient Technical Ability can unlock the door to Koch's apartment, otherwise take the door to the roof to find an alternate way in.
The roof is monitored by two surveillance cameras and four guards. Two of the guards are constantly moving around a skylight with an open window that leads into the apartment. Bypass or deal with them, then jump down through the open window to find Joanne Koch absorbed in a braindance.
V can either kill Koch and leave the way they came, or knock her out for the Red Ochre survivors. Koch can also be woken up and spoken to, which causes her to plead for the chance to upload her Nightingale project data for her colleagues to use. She reasons that the deaths of the Red Ochre members would be in vain if the test data obtained from Nightingale never sees the light of day. If V allows her to upload the data, she will move to a computer, but proceed to call for security. If V refuses her, she will run away and also call for security.
If V intends to deliver Koch to Red Ochre alive and incapacitates her, Dino Dinovic will notify them that an AV, specifically a Zetatech Canopy, is on the way to the roof. If V has not already eliminated the four guards on the roof, they will be prompted to do so at this time to allow the AV to safely land. Take Koch to the roof by exiting her apartment and using the adjacent roof access staircase, wait for the AV, then deposit her body inside it. Lastly, return to the 19th floor, take the elevator back down, and leave the hotel to complete the gig.
Objectives:
Reach the 19th floor.
Get inside Koch's apartment.
Neutralize Joanne Koch.
Neutralize the attackers on the roof before the AV arrives.
Wait for the AV outside the landing zone.
Carry Koch to the AV.
Stay clear of the landing zone.
Escape the hotel.

Walkthrough:
After being given the gig, V will be directed to to meet the Brazilian Intelligence Agency agents Steven Santos and Ana Friedman at their room in the Paradise Hotel in the Longshore Stacks, where they provide further information on the gig. They reveal the biomonitor of their mentor and colleague Mark Bana has recently reactivated after he was presumed dead in Dogtown, and he is being hunted by Scavengers led by Boris Ribakov at Organitopia in Terra Cognita. The agents do not have official permission from the BIA to investigate and have hired V to find Bana under the radar.
Upon arriving at Organitopia, scavs will be found guarding the museum's locked-down entrance. After entering through a smashed gate, opening a shuttered window with a Body check of 3, and jacking into an access point to gain further entry, Bana will contact V and indicate that he is okay and hiding deeper inside the museum past a large indoor jungle exhibit. Scavs, including netrunning Spiders, will be found patrolling the area on the ground floor and overhead glass walkways, surrounded by several deactivated landmines and security turrets. If engaging in combat with the scavs, Bana will refuse to open the door into the next area before all enemies are defeated.
In the next area, Bana directs V to a room in the back where he is hiding, but before V can enter, Ribakov jumps down from the ceiling with a smoke grenade and must be defeated first. Ribakov is equipped with optical camo and is able to charge jump to higher positions and use a Sandevistan to move quickly. Ribakov will use a sniper rifle while on the overhead catwalks, occasionally dropping a smoke grenade at his feet to disappear and reappear elsewhere. After half of his health is depleted, he will disappear into a smoke grenade, heal slightly, and deploy several Militech Griffin drones and won't return until they have been destroyed. From this point on he will fight on the ground using a Smart SMG, smoke grenades combined with flashbangs, and holographic decoys. Once defeated, Ribakov's Smart SMG Pizdets and the shard Contract Objective: Terminate Katya Karelina can be looted from his body.
Ana will contact V again and listen in after entering a hidden room where "Bana" is hiding, revealed to actually be a woman named Katya Karelina using a voice changer implant to impersonate Bana. She reveals that she interrogated the real Bana for SovOil before he died, but claims that she wasn't responsible for his death. Ana orders V to kill Katya before hanging up. V will then have the option to kill Katya outright, or make a deal with her to let her live in exchange for the location of a secret stash, starting Money For Nothing. She can still be killed after revealing the location of a secret stash. Regardless, V must now take Bana's biomonitor from Katya back to the Brazilian agents. On the way, Steven will text you to ask that you leave the biomonitor at a drop point instead, fearing that Ana will leak the circumstances of Bana's death, causing Brazil to lose out on a multibillion-eurodollar contract with SovOil and anger those involved in the deal. V can deposit the biomonitor at a marked drop point to end the gig immediately, or go back to the agents instead.
If V chooses to deliver the biomonitor to the agents:
Steven and Ana will be found packing up and preparing to leave while arguing over the fate of the biomonitor. Steven reveals that Brazil is actively holding talks with SovOil as they speak and that the agency knew that Bana was killed by SovOil, but has chosen to ignore it so as to not jeopardize the deal. Ana will state she fully intends to leak the data on the biomonitor to the media and the rest of the agency. V has the option to hand over the biomonitor or personally destroy it. The agent with whom V sided with give V their thanks, while the other will storm out and lean against a railing outside. Mr. Hands will contact V shortly afterwards to close the gig and send their payment.
If the biomonitor was delivered to the drop point or destroyed after talking to the agents:
Steven will text V after a few days, saying he is back in Night City, and asks to meet in Downtown, starting The Show Must Go On.
If the biomonitor was given to Ana:
After a few days, Steven can be found at EBM Petrochem Stadium by the Autofixer terminal, having joined BARGHEST as an analyst in order to lay low in Dogtown and is resentful of V for putting him in this situation. When asked, he reveals that Ana returned to Night City and was extradited back to Brazil where she is now imprisoned for treason, and that aside from ending the SovOil deal, the scandal resulted in a mid-level director at the agency being fired and Bana receiving a posthumous medal.
Objectives:
Go to the Paradise hotel.
Go to room 203.
Talk to the agents.
Go to Organitopia.
Find an entrance to Organitopia.
Talk to Bana.
Go to the main museum hall.
Talk to Bana.
Meet Bana in the room upstairs.
Defeat Ribakov.
Destroy the drones.
Find Bana.
Enter the secret room.
Talk to the stranger.
Talk to Katya.
Confront Katya.
Take the biomonitor.
Leave the area.
Deliver the biomonitor to the agents.
Read the message from Steven Santos. [Optional]
Deposit the biomonitor in the fixer's drop point. [Optional]
If V decides to not drop off the biomonitor:
Talk to the agents.
Leave the room.

Walkthrough:
This article requires cleanup.[Reason: Write from V's perspective]
When you enter the indicated residence, you'll notice there's nobody around. Head to the furthest back room from the entrance, go up the collapsed part of the ceiling to get to the second level, and then to the only door on the left. Just as you open it you'll be confronted by Corporal William Hare.
While there is no red timer bar, taking too long to make dialogue choices will cause him to go agro and attack. Selecting the wrong ones can also cause a fight with him instead of getting him to peacefully stand down. Having a high Body skill can help get him to stand down, but it's not the only way to get a peaceful outcome.
If you do manage to get him to stand down, he'll let you take the medicine while he goes to sit down but, as soon as you leave and get near the ramp, he'll commit suicide.
Once you have the medicine, head off to the drop point to drop it off and complete the quest.
Objectives:
Go to the indicated residence.
Find the stolen medicine.
Retrieve the stolen medicine.
Deposit the medicine in the Drop Point.
